title: China Granted RMB 900 million Economic Package to Nepal to Repair Araniko Highway (Linked to project #43970)
description: On March 25 2015, China pledged RMB 900 million economic package to Nepal for expansion and upgrade of the 114km Araniko Highway, which provides transportation between China and Nepal. Chinese President Xi Jinping announced the aid during a visit of Nepalese President Ram Baran Yadac at the Boao Forum for Asia Annual Conference. In December, 2015, A Memorandum of Understanding was signed during the Nepalese Deputy Prime Minister's visit in China. Chinese state-owned company China Railway 14th Construction Bureau started the construction on August 8, 2016, and handed over the highway after repairing it on March 3, 2017. This is one of the 25 projects promised by China after the 2015 Nepal earthquake to help with reconstruction. For details of the umbrella project, see project #43970.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=KATMPO0020150325eb3p00038&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://kathmandupost.ekantipur.com/printedition/news/2015-03-28/xi-announces-rs-14b-in-new-aid.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://kathmandupost.ekantipur.com/news/2017-03-03/china-hands-over-araniko-highway-to-nepal-after-repair.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.chinanews.com/gj/2017/03-03/8164764.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks
implementing_agency: China Railway 14th .Construction Bureau Co., Ltd (China Railway Shisiju Group Corporation), State-Owned Company

title: China Grants $32 million to fund irrigation projects
description: In January 2017, the Kyrgyz President agreed to a Chinese grant of $32 million to fund six irrigation projects in Kyrgyzstan. The project envisages the reconstruction and construction of water facilities in Issyk-Kul, Batken, Talas and Chui regions by the Kyrgyz government. 5,410 hectares of irrigated land will be put into operation, water availability will be increased on an area of ‚Äã‚Äã22,100 hectares. The Xinhua source states that in 2017 four of these irrigation projects will be completed. The current status of all six irrigation projects are currently unknown; however the Al-Olonsky Canal in the Ton District was funded and is on track to be completed by 2026.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=CEASEN0020170110ed1a00105&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.xinhuanet.com//english/2017-05/25/c_136314184.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://water.gov.kg/index.php?option=com_k2&view=item&id=644:prezident-sooronbaj-zheenbekov-v-issyk-kulskoj-oblasti-dal-start-realizatsii-proekta-rekonstruktsii-irrigatsionnoj-sistemy-kyrgyzskoj-respubliki&Itemid=1437&lang=ru, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://kabar.kg/eng/news/china-is-the-main-investor-for-kyrgyzstan/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://24.kg/english/83571__32_million_to_be_spent_on_reconstruction_of_irrigation_system_in_Kyrgyzstan/, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China Grants MVR 7 million for Male' Redevelopment Project in the Maldives
description: On November 13th, 2016, the Chinese Embassy granted MVR 7 million (approximately $454,000 USD) for Male' Redevelopment Project at a handover ceremony. The funds will be used to develop 7 pedestrian-only alleyways in Male' and a children's park in Villimale. The project is being implemented by Maldives Ministry of Housing and Infrastructure's Public Works Services department, materials have been acquired, and project will be completed by May 2017.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=MIADMD0020161114ecbd00005&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://edition.mv/news/1492, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://maldivesindependent.com/society/china-donates-mvr7-million-for-male-redevelopment-127715, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Nihaan Hussain Manik, MP for Villimale constituency ; Mr. Wang Fukang, Chinese Ambassador to Maldives (China); Dr. Muhammad Muizzu , Housing Minister

title: China Ministry of Commerce provides interest-free Loan for construction of Gwadar Eastbay Expressway
description: Currently, Gwadar Deep-Sea Port is connected through a narrow 16 feet wide thoroughfare of Gwadar town at the West-Bay. This new 6-lane expressway along with a provision of 30 meters wide railway corridor will connect the port with the Mekran Coastal Highway (N-20) through the 2300 acres Free Trade Zone of Gwadar Port. The expressway will be 19km long, connecting Gwadar Port to Mehran Coastal Highway. The project is being developed as part of the 'Early Harvest' scheme of China Pakistan Economic Corridor, and is part of a wider ‚Ç®170.667 billion (US$1.6 billion) development package for the city and Port of Gwadar. CPEC website also indicates this is a Government Interest Free Loan. In January 2017, The Pakistani government's Ports and Shipping Division contributed 100 million Pakistani rupees for the project construction and provided, an additional 15 million Pakistani rupees for the establishment of a CPEC Support Unit, and lastly 120 million Pakistani rupee for a feasibility study for the construction of break waters. In May 2017, Chinese Ministry of Commerce signed agreement to provide ‚Ç®14.7 billion (US$140 million) interest-free loan for the construction of Gwadar East Bay Expressway. In September 2017, China Communications Construction Engineering Company signed the contract agreement with Pakistani Gwadar Port Authority. In November 2017, the construction of the expressway began. As of Nov 2018, the construction work is underway, and project completion is expected to be in October, 2020. -------------------------------- Below are sources documenting differing financial amount committed in this project: Pakistani Ministry of Finance Economic Affairs Division yearbook reports the project has a total interest-free loan of US$168 million. The Shahid Javed Burki Institute of Public Policy at NetSol records a committed amount of US$141 million. The 2016 Government of Pakistan Bond Prospectus lists the estimated project cost as 140 million USD. In this project, the coder defers to the first figure suggested by the Chinese Commerce Ministry. -------------------------------- Below are sources documenting the disbursement progress of the project: Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Year Book in the fiscal year of 2016/17: Interest free loan of USD 168 million. According to the report, by June 30, 2017, disbursement had not started. Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Year Book in the fiscal year of 2015/16: This suggests that the project had been under negotiation as early as 2015, and feasibility study would be done by Chinese side before formal approval. Pakistan Ministry of Finance Estimates of Foreign Assistance for fiscal year 2017/18: 3,200 million Pakistan rupees were disbursed by China in FY 16/17. Pakistan is estimating China to lend 1,050 million Pakistan rupees for FY 17/18 for the project. Pakistani Government finance report also records that the total budget from 2016 to 2018 equals 8.45billion Pakistani Rupees.

title: China Pledges to Train 100 Indian Officials on Heavy Haul Transportation (linked to ID #42673)
description: 20 September 2014 China has agreed to train 100 officials of Indian Railway on heavy haul transportation apart from helping redevelop two railway stations and set up a railway university in India. 25 September 2014 Under the agreement, China has agreed to provide training in heavy haul for 100 Indian Railways officials, redevelopment of existing railway stations and establishment of a Railway University in India. 26 December 2014 The first batch of the 100 Indian Railway officials, who are to receive training in heavy-haul technology in China, has begun their 12-day coaching at the Jiaotong University. The inauguration ceremony for training in the heavy-haul technology for the 22 officers from the Indian Railway was held at Beijing Jiaotong University yesterday, an Indian Embassy press release issued here today said. The 12-day training programme, which is being conducted by Beijing Jiaotong University under the supervision of National Railway Administration of China, is the first step in the cooperation envisaged by India and China in the MoU and Implementation Plan on Cooperation in Railways. The training involving 100 Indian officers will lay emphasis on onsite training covering operational and maintenance facilities, monitoring systems and traffic controls. Four more batches from Indian railway officials will be trained at the Beijing Jiatong University in heavy-haul technology in the next two years, the press release said. The training was part of the MoU signed during the visit of Chinese President Xi Jinping to India in September this year. Under the MoU, China will do a free feasibility study for a high-speed train corridor. India has chosen the Delhi-Chennai route for this study.

title: China Road and Bridge Corporation grants for reconstruction and repair of road between Kurgan-Tyube and Kulob
description: On December 27, 2017, China Road and Bridge Corporation finished the Phase II of Kurgan-Tyube and Kulob reconstruction and repair project in Tajikistan. The first phase of the project was already finished by 2016, which included 12 kilometers of roads in Kurgan-Tyube and Kulob and two automobile bridges in Kulob. The second phase included 22 kilometers on 15 streets and four bridges in Kurgan-Tyube and Kulob, and on December 19, the lauching ceremony of the Phase II took place. Construction started on December 28, and finished on December 15, 2017. The government of China granted 58.4 million Yuan and 59.6 million Yuan for the first and second phase of the project respectively, totaled 118 million Yuan. The project is supervised and managed by China Railway First Survey and Design Institute Group Co.,Ltd., and implemented by China Road and Bridge Corporation. STAFF_NOTE: The start and end date of construction in this project apply to Phase II. However, the transaction amount is the sum of both phases.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=TCASIA0020161220ecck00004&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.crbc.com:8426/site/crbc/274/info/2018/46881874.html, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.mofcom.gov.cn/article/shangwubangzhu/201801/20180102701988.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://jjhzj.mofcom.gov.cn/article/y/201612/20161202319556.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
implementing_agency: China Railway First Survey and Design Institute Group Co., Ltd., State-Owned Company; China Road and Bridge Corporation, State-Owned Company

title: China agrees 250 million Nepalese rupees for Nepal Fibre-Optic Cable Construction (Linked to project #34388)
description: The network extends from Banepa [southeast of Kathmandu] to Khasa [border town in Tibet, 'Zhangmu' in Chinese (also from Tibetan as Dram or Zham, from Nepali as Khasa)] to create digital optical fibre network along the whole Araniko Highway. The network is expected to serve as a vital communication traffic transit point for Indian and Chinese telecommunication services. The single mode optical cable that will run through 120 km between Kathmandu and Khasa will have a total of 36 fibres. China has extended a grant of 250m rupees [approx. 4m US dollars] for creating this network. The exact terms of financing is unknown. According to press release by the Chinese embassy in Nepal on Sep 23, 2007, the implementation contract was signed between China Telecom and Nepal Telecom that day. The contract amount is RMB24.5 million, roughly the equivalent of 250m rupees/4m dollars. According to a BBC news report on January 23, 2008, the government began work on laying optical fibres on January 22, 2008. Minister for Information and Communications Krishna Bahadur Mahara and Chinese Ambassador to Nepal Zheng Xianglin jointly inaugurated the project. The survey and designing works have already been completed. The work was estimated to be complete in the next five months. According to the Chinese Ministry of Finance Investment Guide 2018 (p.27), the project finished construction in 2008 but the communication carrier services on both side did not establish connection, and Nepal used the fibre network for domestic communcation use. In 2016, China extended its optical fibre network from Lhasa, Tibet to Nepal via Geelong(Keyrong)-Rasuwgadhi border point and handed it over in August that year. In 2018, China Telecom and Nepal Telecom completed compatibility works and Nepal is officially connected to Internet via Chinese fibre networks. STAFF_NOTE: On December 20, 2007 China and Nepal signed an agreement for China to provide a grant assistance equivalent to 50 million RMB (428.5 million Rs) for various development projects in Nepal. Projects include the Rasuwagadi-Syafru Besi road, an optical fibre cable connecting Kathmandu and Lhasa, broadening the Khasa-Tatopani Road, and repairing the Miteri Bridge. For the umbrella project, see #34388.

title: China agrees to build an industrial zone in Osh
description: In 2017, a Chinese delegation from China's Shaanxi Province arrived in Kyrgyzstan's Osh region. An agreement was signed that allowed for the construction of an industrial zone in the Kara-Suu district. It is unknown how this project is being financed, or what Chinese firms signed this agreement to do the construction.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=CEASEN0020170929ed9t000b9&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China aids in construction of two rural primary schools in Bangladesh
description: In 2009, China and Bangladesh met for the 12th session of the Joint Commission (JC), where China expressed interest in providing assistance for building two primary schools. Bangladesh had initially sought assistance to build 5 schools. In September 2011, China Heilongjiang International Economic and Technical Cooperation Corporation and the Ministry of Primary and Mass Education of Bangladesh represented their respective governments and signed the contract to construct two rural primary schools aided by China. Construction of the schools will begin in November 2011 and is expected to be completed in 15 months. The total contract amount was 9.35 million yuan. Chongqing Meilian International Warehouse and Transport Group Co Ltd was responsible for delivering essential construction items from China to Bangladesh for the construction of the schools. The items include steel, building materials and construction equipment that weigh a total of 300 tons. The two rural primary schools are Chittagong Primary School that has a total area of ‚Äã‚Äã1,030.40 square meters, and Rangpur Primary School that covers a total area of ‚Äã‚Äã1056,69 meters. The construction was divided into two parts - teaching buildings and office buildings. Construction for Chittagong Primary School started on December 13, 2011 and was completed on August 20, 2012. Construction for Rangpur Primary School started on April 16, 2012 and was completed on September 15, 2012.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=DKCOBD0020090828e58s0000l&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/aa/?ref=BBCSAP0020090727e57r001b9&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.mltrans.net/sucCase.aspx, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://bd.mofcom.gov.cn/article/todayheader/201109/20110907752304.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.hljchic.com/qq.htm, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

title: China and Sri Lanka form Marine and Coastal Zone Joint Research Center
description: In 2016, it was reported that China and Sri Lanka had developed a Marine and Coastal Zone Joint Research Center.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ANNT000020170302ecae00ama&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China builds railway to Iran through Tajikistan and Kyrgyzstan
description: In October 2010, an agreement to conduct feasibility studies on a railroad project that would connect Iran to Afghanistan, Tajikistan, Kyrgyzstan, and China by all the involved countries was signed. In December 2014, a preliminary agreement was signed between the five countries to determine the route to connect the nations. The railway is estimated to exceed $2 billion. In January 2016, preliminary work on the railway began in Xinjiang. Each country will be handling implementation independently. As of 2018, Afghanistan was 50% complete in its feasibility study for the railway. Per the 2014 agreement, each member country had to construct 2,100km of railway within the established time frame of five years. The Asia Development Bank, Bank of China, World Bank and state governments of Afghanistan, Iran, Tajikistan, and China are all helping fund the railway.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/du/article.aspx/?accessionno=KABNEW0020160126ec1q00003&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=&cat=a, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.railwaypro.com/wp/five-asian-countries-implement-new-railway-corridor/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/china/2016-01/15/content_23096031.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.asiaplus.tj/en/news/document-defining-rail-route-china-kyrgyzstan-tajikistan-afghanistan-signed-dushanbe, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.timesca.com/index.php/news/19352-china-kyrgyzstan-tajikistan-afghanistan-iran-railway-corridor-to-boost-regional-economies, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://drive.google.com/file/d/1k6FE0mdEtIZO7Big7geocjyH1EbfSsmm/view?usp=sharing, Media Report, including Wikileaks
funding_agency: Asian Development Bank, International NGO; Bank of China (BOC), State-Owned Company; World Bank, Multilateral

title: China commits 42 million RMB for hospital construction in Osh
description: In May 2012, China and Kyrgyzstan ratified an agreement for the construction of a hospital in Osh. The Chinese originally offered 700 million USD to finance a slew of projects in Osh but ultimately granted 42 million RMB for the construction of the hospital complex, as part of an agreement in May 2012. The Kyrgyz Deputy Minister of Health at the time proposed the grant offer to a Kyrgyz Parliament subcommittee on social affairs. In 2018, the Chinese officers visited the progress of the construction of the hospital.

title: China constructs the Research Center of Nepal National Trust for Nature Conservation (NTNC)
description: In 2005, the Chinese government signed an Agreement with the government of Nepal to fully fund the cost for the construction of the Research Center of Nepal National Trust for Nature Conservation (NTNC). This is part of the grant assistance provided through the agreement on Economic and Technical and Economic Cooperation signed between the two countries on 16 August 2004. Construction will be carried out by Beijing Real Estate Company. The research centre will be a two-storey building, with a total construction area of ‚Äã‚Äã4,600 square meters consisting of research areas, offices, auditoriums, a library, and meetings spaces. During the construction period, China has arranged for 30 technical personnel to conduct maintenance for the center, and it has significantly increased the efficiency and quality of the construction. The Conservation and Research Center is the first environmental protection project among Chinese aid to Nepal. China believes that the project will protect the natural environment and biodiversity, promote eco-tourism development, help combat global climate change and achieve sustainable economic and social growth in Nepal to contribute to development. In May 2008, Former Nepal Prime Minister Pushpa Kamal Dahal ‚ÄòPrachanda‚Äô laid the foundation stone and in late December 2009 the construction was completed.

title: China constructs the Rs 260 million Tatopani Customs Inspection Station in Nepal
description: In 2009, China's assistance in building an enlarged customs inspection station at Tatopani on the northern border in Nepal was officially confirmed by the exchange of letters between the Chinese and Nepalese governments. In June 2011, China officially signed an agreement with Nepal and will spend Rs 260 million to construct the site and hand it over to Nepal after completion. The Tatopani Customs Inspection Station will have different facilities to ease customs clearance, and will have a warehouse area, diesel generator, a building, parking area and other infrastructure facilities. Construction of a retaining wall and slope protection are included in the project. The station will also have a digital truck scale to weigh goods. The completion of the project will greatly improve the border customs clearance conditions and smoothen the flow of vehicles and people in the border areas in Nepal to effectively promote the development of bilateral trade and enhance the trade flow and volume between two countries. On 20 December 2012, construction work for the Tatopani Customs Inspection Station commenced. Update: In a copy of AMP report dated December 2018, the actual commitment amount to this project is 13,637,514 USD.

title: China disburses 500 Million RMB in grant assistance to Afghanistan (link to #54451)
description: On 28 October 2014, Chinese President Xi Jinping and Afghanistan President Ashraf Ghani Ahmadzai signed the 'Agreement on Economic and Technical Cooperation between the Government of the People's Republic of China and the Government of Islamic Republic of Afghanistan' under which China would provide 500 million Chinese Yuan in grant assistance to the Afghan government in 2014 and another 1.5 billion Chinese Yuan in grant over three years from 2015 to 2017. The total amount of grant that was offered under the agreement was 2 billion Chinese Yuan. The grant is to be used to defend against Islamist militants along the border of Afghanistan and China. China will also train 3,000 Afghan professionals over the following 5 years. On 5 April 2015, Ambassador of Republic of China to Kabul, Mr. Deng Xijun, during his talks with Minister of Foreign Affairs, Mr. Salahuddin Rabbani, said that China would send a team to Afghanistan to draw up the framework for the disbursement of the 2 billion Chinese Yuan. Based on a 'Q&A' session with Professor and Director of Center for Russia and Central Asia Studies, Zhao Huasheng, China had provided the 500 million Chinese Yuan in 2014 and the 1.5 billion yuan is still in the pipeline. This project records the 500 million yuan disbursed in 2014. The project that records amounts disbursed in 2015: 53999, the project that records amounts disbursed in 2016: 54009, the project that records amounts disbursed in 2017: 54776.

title: China donates 2m RMB for schools for war orphans in Afghanistan
description: In March 2003, China donated 2,000,000 RMB for the construction of two schools for war orphans in Afghanistan. The money was given to the Chinese Embassy in Afghanistan. The fund comes from donation initiated by 'Window of the World' Magazine in November 2002. On 17 June 2003, in Kabul, Afghan Education Minister Mohammad Yunus Qanooni and Chinese Ambassador to Afghanistan Sun Yuxi signed an agreement on the construction of the 2 schools- one in Kabul and another in Parwan. The construction would be implemented and monitored by the Chinese Embassy. The two schools were completed in September and October 2003. As of 2009, the 'friendship' schools had 2400 students.

title: China donates 5 million Rufiyaa to N. Kendhi Kulhudhoo School Secondary Campus Construction
description: In January 2006, the Maldives government stated that China, along with the Japanese government under the Japanese Food Aid and Counterpart Fund, has funded 5.159 million Rufiyaa of additions to a school that are currently underway. Specifically, physical infrastructure such as a classroom hall block, administrative facilities and a wall are being constructed, with the objectives of freeing up additional classroom space. The project was scheduled to be completed in December 2009, though it is unclear whether it has since been finished.

title: China donates LKR100m to Buddhist temple in Sri Lanka
description: In 2009, the Chinese Embassy to Sri Lanka donated 100 million Sri Lanka Rupees to the Sri Dalada Maligawa in Sri Lanka to financially support the Buddhist temple in the construction of the International Buddhist Institute project.

description: On May 18, 2015, the inauguration ceremony of a Brontispa longissima (coconut leaf beetle) pest control program [‰∏≠ÂõΩÊè¥È©¨Èò≤Ê≤ªÊ§∞ÂøÉÂè∂Áî≤È°πÁõÆ] funded by China was held in the Maldives. Since 2014, the Hainan province's Academy of Tropical Agricultural Sciences has sent 7 experts to the Maldives to implement the prevention and control of the coconut leaf beetle, helping the Maldives build a coconut heart beetle natural enemy factory and a joint laboratory for coconut pests.

title: China gives interest-free loan of 127.361 million rupees to Pakistan for Advanced Technical Training Centre
description: In December 2000, The Chinese government provided an interest-free loan worth 127.361 million rupees to Pakistan for the Chinese-subsidized Advanced Technical Training Center (ATTC). The project was expected to have a total cost of 161.342 million. On July 16, 2003, the Chinese and Pakistani governments on signed a certificate for the handing over of the centre to Pakistan. Chinese Ambassador Zhang Chunxiang and Pakistani Secretary of Economic Affairs Division Waqar Masood signed the hand-over certificate on behalf of their respective side. The project was undertaken by the Chinese side on the 'Turn-key' basis including construction, supply of machinery and equipment and transfer of technology from China. The construction of the project started in January 2002. It is located in the district of Peshawar known as Hayatabad Industry Area, and is directed by Mohammad Saeed Anwar (tel. 0819217450). The centre is based in Peshawar, near the Afghanistan border, was planned as an institute to provide advance training facilities to the people of the NorthWestern Frontier Province (NWFP) in field of industrial electronics, special welding techniques, computer maintenance and other mechanical training. The two organizations involved in the project are the Chinese embassy to Pakistan and the Government of the NWFP. In particular, when the project was first proposed in December 2000, Embassador Du Qiongyao and Owais Ahmad Ghani (NWFP Minister for Industreis and Manpower at that time) were representing the two parties. At the foundation cerimony that took place on the 25th January 2002 instead, China was represented by Embassador Lu Shu Lin and Pakistan by Syed Iftikhar Hussain Shah, NWFP Governor at that time.

title: China grants 1,950 million Rs. for Sri Lankan Research Center for Water Research
description: In a 2017 Performance Report by Sri Lanka's Department of External Resources, it was reported that China and Sri Lanka would be developing a China ‚Äì Sri Lanka Joint Research and Demonstration Center for Water Technology at Peradeniya University near Kandy. The research center will have advanced analytical laboratory facilities. China Tiesiju Civil Engineering Group Co. Ltd. will complete the construction.The USD 20 million project is carried out with a Chinese grant of Rs. 1,950 million and a Rs. 880 million contribution from the Sri Lankan Government. The project is expected to be completed by May 2020. An exchange of letters was signed in March 2016 for the feasibility study for this project and for the implementation of this project.

title: China grants 1.2B Rs. for construction of National Nephrology Special Hospital in Sri Lanka
description: Based on a 2017 Report by Sri Lanka's Department of Project Management and Monitoring Ministry of Development Assignments, China and Sri Lanka are funding the construction of a new laboratory and hospital for kidney disease called the National Nephrology Special Hospital. China will provide a 1.2 billion Rs. grant. The project will be located in Polonnaruwa. This is the result of a MOU signed in 2015, in which it was established that further cooperation in the health sector, including the the CKD hospital, would be worked on. The bidding for building design plan was completed in December, 2016. The design was finalized in 2017. The foundation-laying ceremony was held on Dec 6, 2017. The project will cost a total of US$100 million. The proposed building will have a 500 bed hospital with 150 dialysis machines, 8 operating theaters, 2 ICUs each with 20 beds, a High Dependency Unit with 20 beds, a fully-fledged laboratory and various other facilities. The 25,517-square-meter hospital will include 200 inpatient beds and 100 hemodialysis beds. There will also be a 200-seat auditorium with a car park which can accommodate 300 vehicles. The hospital is supposed to be completed in 2020.

title: China grants 200 million RMB for the construction of the Nepal National Armed Police Force Academy
description: In 2013, the Government of the People's Republic of China has agreed to provide a grant assistance amounting to RMB ¬• 200,000,000 (approximately NRS 3006 million) to the Government of Nepal. The grant shall be used specially for China-aided project of Nepal National Armed Police Force Academy, specifically for the construction of the National Armed Police Force Academy. An agreement to this effect was signed and exchanged at the Office of the Prime Minister and Council of Ministers, Kathmandu, Nepal, on 25 June, 2013. The Agreement was signed by Mr. Shanta Raj Subedi, Finance Secretary and Mr. Jiang Zengwei, Vice Minister, Ministry of Commerce, Government of People's Republic of China on behalf of the Government of Nepal and the Government of the People's Republic of China, respectively. The main construction contents of the National Armed Police College of Nepal include teaching buildings, dormitory buildings, canteens, indoor and outdoor training grounds, etc. The total construction area is about 15,000 square meters. The project is undertaken by the China Railway 14th Bureau Group. 2 Construction finished in 2017, and in June 2017 the handover ceremony occurred.

title: China grants 300 million RMB for the construction of the 8th Bangladesh-China Friendship Bridge over the Kocha River
description: On March 7th, 2016, China pledged 300 million RMB towards the construction of the 8th Bangladesh-China Friendship Bridge over the Kocha River. The bridge is located in Bekutia and will be part of the Rajapur-Pirojpur expressway. It is about 1km long and costs a total of 8.3 billion BDT, 6.55 taka of which is granted by the Chinese government. The implementing company is China Railway Major Bridge Reconnaissance & Design Institute Co., Ltd. (BRDI), a subsidiary of the Chinese state-owned construction company, China Railway Group Limited. In April 2016, the deal was signed. Construction begun on November 1, 2018, and the expected completion date is June 2020. According to press release by the implementing agency, the project is under construction as of January 2019. title: China grants 500 million Yuan for the construction of the 9th Bangladesh-China Friendship Bridge over the Bogha River
description: On May 11, 2017, Ambassador Ma Mingqiang and Mr. Kazi Shofiqul Azam, Secretary of Economic Relations Division (ERD), Ministry of Finance of Bangladesh, signed the Agreement on Economic and Technical Cooperation between China and Bangladesh in Dhaka. The agreement was for the construction of the 9th Bangladesh-China Friendship Bridge and other Infrastructure Projects. China granted 500 million Yuan for the construction of the 9th friendship bridge. The Chinese state media outlet, the People's Daily, reports that the Ministry of Commerce of China has commissioned the China Communications Highway Planning and Design Institute to conduct a comprehensive investigation of the construction of the 9th bridge in October, 2015. This bridge will go over the Bogha (sometimes spelled Boga) river. title: China grants 500 million yuan to Afghanistan for 10000 residential apartments in Kabul (Linked to Project #54451)
description: On November 3, 2015, Chinese Vice President Li Yuanchao and Afghan President Ashraf Ghani met and signed economic and technical cooperation agreements for China to grant the Afghan government 500 million yuan to build 10,000 residential apartments in Kabul. The affordable housing is for civil servants, specifically the families of deceased Afghan National Army, Afghan National Police, and National Security Forces personnel. This disbursement may be part of the agreement signed in 2014, which stated that China will provide Afghanistan 500 Million RMB of grant assistance every year from 2014-2017 (#54451). On May 16th, 2016, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang and Afghan Chief Executive Officer Abdullah Abdullah signed six bilateral cooperation documents, including an exchange note for a feasibility study on the construction of affordable home for government employees in Kabul. In March 2017, officials announced that the first phase of construction would include 1400 units the Old Darulaman Palace in Kabul. The Afghan Minister of Finance and the Chinese Ambassador signed an agreement to start the project in 2017. The next two phases are dependent on the success of the first. The project will be overseen by Afghanistan's Ministry of Urban Development and Housing. It is not known which Chinese contractor has been selected to implement the project, but the news articles did suggest that Afghan subcontractors will be used. This project is linked to two other technical agreements that were also signed on November 3, 2015: a grant of 1500 scholarships for Afghan students (#54038) and aid to help Afghanistan with Taliban peace talks (#54039).

title: China grants 520 million Rs for construction of studio building and transmission tower for Nepal Television
description: In February 2000, China and Nepal exchanged letters regarding technical aid to Nepal Television, specifically the construction of the Nepal Television Metro Channel studio building and transmission tower. (Another source stated that an agreement had been reached between China and Nepal in 1998 for expansion and development of Nepal Television.) In 2002, Minister for Information and Communications Jaya Prakash Prasad Gupta laid the foundation stone of Nepal Television Metro Channel studio building and transmission tower which is to be constructed with cooperation from China. The project, with an estimated cost of about 520m rupees, is expected to be completed within a year. The entire construction works of the project will be undertaken by Chinese technicians. In October 2004, Metro Channel of Nepal Television (NTV)'s newly constructed transmission building that was funded by China's grant assistance was handed over to NTV. The building, constructed under the Nepal Television Improvement and Development project, is situated in the premises of NTV, Singhadurbar covering an area of 3876 square metres. The construction took 15 months to complete.

recipient_agencies: Nepal Television, State-Owned Company

title: China grants 62.24M yuan to Sri Lanka for extending fishery harbors
description: In 2010, China Harbour Engineering began work on the extension of fishery harbour projects in Sri Lanka at a cost of 62.24 million yuan. In 2011, the construction was finished. This project is an extension from a series of Chinese aid to Sri Lanka in response to the 2007 Sri Lanka floods.
sources: http://lk.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201106/20110607593427.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
implementing_agency: China Harbour Engineering Co., Ltd., State-Owned Company

title: China grants Bangladesh 2 billion taka to build 7th Bangladesh-China Friendship Bridge over the Arialkha River
description: On 28 July 2009, China and Bangladesh signed an agreement at the Joint Economic Commission to build the 7th Bangladesh-China Friendship Bridge (aka Kazirtek/Kazirtack), over the river Arialkha along the Dhaka-Barisal highway, along with three supportive bridges. The bridge is 700m long and 13m wide. It is located in Madaripur District over the Arial Khan River about 115km far away from the capital Dhaka. Construction was expected to run from May 2012 to June 2016, but atually began in 2011 and completed in may 2015. The handover ceremony was held on August 26, 2015. Of the entire cost (2.75 billion taka), 2 billion will be granted by China. It is unclear which organization within the Chinese government provided funding. The private Chinese firm, Anhui Construction Engineering Group is responsible for constructing the bridge.

title: China grants Bangladesh 60 million yuan to finance Bangladesh-China Friendship Exhibition Center (linked to project ID #54289 and #34069)
description: On 24 April 2008, China and Bangladesh signed a MoU on the construction of Bangladesh-China Friendship Exhibition Center in Dhaka. The center will be the permanent site of the annual Dhaka trade fair, with 806 booths of 9 square meters each, and 1500 open-air parking lots. On January 20, 2017, China State Construction Engineering Corporation won the construction bid worth 380 million Yuan. The project's expected completion date is December 2020. The Chinese government signed two different deals to finance the construction of the exhibition center. In 2008, the Chinese government pledged to provide 2.1 billion BDT of the estimated 2.75 billion BDT needed for the project. According to Bangladesh's Economic Research Division's Commitment and Disbursement of Grants for 2016/17, the Chinese government allocated 60 million RMB for the project. As of 2017, 9.7 million Yuan of the total allocation has been dispersed. According to a press release by the implementing company, on April 17, 2017, the Bangladeshi side officially handed over the land permit and coordinate control map to the Chinese side, symbolizing the formal handover of the entire project site and allowing the construction to go further. On July 10, 2018, the Bangladesh Economic Commission Executive Committee (ECNEC) officially approved a modification to the project. The total project cost increased from 2.75 billion BDT to 7.96 billion BDT, and again to 10.03 billion BDT. The government of China agreed to send additional financing, bringing the total Chinese contribution to 6.26 billion BDT. This project only captures the initial 60 million yuan grant from 2008. For the 2018 modification, see project ID #54289. This project was announced at the same time as a 0.5 million yuan unallocated 'token grant' described in project ID #34069.

title: China grants RMB 240 million for Pakistan Friendship Center
description: The China-Pakistan Frienship Centre was built in Islamabad through a grant offered by the Chinese givernment. The Government of Pakistan provided land for the Centre, while the Chinese government constructed, equipped and provided human resources for it. The expected utilization by June 2008 was Rs 275.0 million, although the cost increased up to 3 billion rupees. According to the website of Chinese embassy in Pakistan, China spent 240 million yuan. Construction started in 2005. The center has been operating since 2010.

title: China grants Tajikistan 7.5 million USD for the construction of the Tajik-Uzbek Road (linked to ID #40353)
description: As part of high-worth agreements signed between China and the SCO, China has granted Tajikistan 7.5 million USD for the construction of the Tajik-Uzbek road in 2006. The project started in 2006 and was implemented by China Road and Bridge Corporation.

title: China grants additional 50 million RMB for 6th Bangladesh-China Friendship Bridge (Linked to #33941, #39022)
description: China has granted 50 million RMB for construction of the 6th Bangladesh-China Friendship Bridge on the Dhaleswari river. This grant is in addition to a 60 million CNY grant and commitment for a 50 million CNY interest-free loan, also for the construction of the bridge. This project is linked to #33941 andÔºÉ39022.

title: China grants two-storey building to Shree Divya Deep Secondary School in Nepal
description: In 2010, the Chinese Embassy in Nepal and the People‚Äôs Government of Tibet Autonomous Region of China granted a two-storey building consisting of one meeting hall, one science lab and one computer room at Shree Divya Deep Secondary School. In October 2010, the building was completed and was inaugurated by Chinese Ambassador to Nepal Qiu Guohong.
sources: http://np.china-embassy.org/eng/ChinaNepal/t760255.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China loans $14.3 million for development of the water pipe network in the Republic of Karakalpakstan
description: China provided a government loan of $14.3 million to Uzbekistan for the development of the water pipe network in the cities and settlements of the Republic of Karakalpakstan, an autonomous region within Uzbekistan, as reported by Uzbekistan's 2008 IMF country report. Current project status and loan details are unknown. STAFF_NOTE: Project was recorded in Uzbekistan's 2008 IMF report but loan could have been committed earlier, so year is marked uncertain. This project could not be confirmed by any other sources.
sources: https://www.imf.org/en/Publications/CR/Issues/2016/12/31/Republic-of-Uzbekistan-Poverty-Reduction-Strategy-Paper-21636, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

title: China loans 100m RMB for construction of Bangabandhu International Convention Centre (Linked to project #33940)
description: China and Bangladesh signed a loan agreement in which the Chinese government is to provide a 200 million RMB interest-free loan for Bangladesh to build the Bangabandhu International Convention Centre. The total cost of the project was 2 billion takal. The multi-purpose conference center was designed by the Beijing Institute of Architectural Designs and Research and has a construction area of 19,926 square meters. Construction was completed in July 2001. In 2002, China converted a portion of the funding for this project to a grant. The project was renamed Bangabandhu International Convention Centre in 2009. According to Bangladesh's Economic Relations Division, the true loan amount was 100m RMB. 11.099m RMB of this loan was converted to a grant, and the remaining 88.901m RMB has been repaid as of 2017. This project captures the interest-free loan portion; for the grant portion, see project #33940.

title: China loans US$230m for new government buildings
description: According to the 2017 Bond Prospectus published by the Ministry of Finance of the Republic of Tajikistan, in August 2017 China agreed to loan Tajikistan 1.5 billion yuan (approx. US$230 million) to finance the building of a new parliament and government complex. On October 13 2018, Tajik President Emomali Rahmon and Premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China Li Keqiang participated in the ground breaking ceremony. The main building of the parliamentary complex will be 49.7 meters high with a total area of 42,874 square meters. The governmental complex will be on fifteen story building and two thirteen story buildings with a total area of 10.27 hectares. STAFF_NOTE: loan details could not be found.

title: China pledges business concessional loan of USD361.22 million to Pakistan for Karachi-Lahore highway (Sukkur-Multan Section) (linked projects #39013 and #54416)
description: The Karachi‚ÄìLahore Motorway (KLM) is a 1,694-kilometre-long (1,053 mi) under construction six-lane, high-speed, limited-access motorway that will connect Karachi and Peshawar through Islamabad, Lahore, Multan and Sukkur. It is now considered a major component of the China Pakistan Economic Corridor.The Sukkur-Multan Section is also known as the M5-Motorway, which is a part of the Karachi-Lahore Motorway. The 387km-long, six-lane Sukkur-Multan section includes construction of bridges, interchanges, nullahs, and so on. As of Jun 18, 2014, a revised feasibility study was done by a Chinese firm. China State Construction Engineering Corporation (CSCEC) is the project contractor, with the executing agency being the National Highway Authority (NHA). The Construction began in August 2016 and is expected to end by August 2019. The Multan-Shujabad section of the highway has been inaugurated by Prime Minister on May 2018. A Pakistani Ministry of Finance annual status report later revised the expected closure date to 30-APR-21. Pakistani news outlet reports that M-3 section from Lahore to Abdul Hakeem was completed and delivered on March 31, 2019. STAFF_NOTE: This project also has another name: Peshawar-Karachi Motorway (Multan-Sukkur Section) Project Overall Transaction Amount: The government of China, through the China Export-Import Bank, would provide 90% of the funding, as a concessional loan, amounting to 233.4177 billion rupees. The remaining 10% of the project cost would be met through Public Sector Development Programme (PSDP) of Pakistan. A later report from the Economic and Commercial Counsellor‚Äôs Office (ECCO) of the Chinese Embassy puts the contract amount at 294.3 billion rupees (US$2.89 billion). CPEC website puts the contract amount at US#2.98 billion. During January 2017, it was reported that Pakistan's Under Communication Division contributed 650 million Pakistani rupee towards the Multan-Sukkur 387 km section. Project Financing Subcomponents: According to the Pakistani Ministry of Finance annual status report, the project funding consists of three parts, a GCL (assumed to be Government Concessional Loan) of CNY4,800.00 million (the USD equivalent of 722.57 million), a BCL (assumed to be Business Concessional Loan) of USD 361.22 million, and a PBC component of USD1,790.11 million. The three components add up to around USD2.87 billion, which is fairly close to the statistics provided by CPEC and the Chinese Foreign Ministry. This project captures the BCL amount. For the other two components, please see linked projects #39013 and #54416.

title: China pledges funds for Taunsa hydropower project in Pakistan
description: The MOU for the Taunsa hydro electric project with 120 MW generation capacity was signed and the joint development agreement of the project will be signed in 2011. The project, located in Muzaffargarh, was approved by the Punjab Power Development Board (PPDB) on June 25, 2013. Construction was expected to start in 2015 and will be completed in four years. The project was expected to cost 26 billion Rupees but it is unclear how much China has helped and in what form the assistance was given. The project is currently being constructed.

title: China pledges to build USD13.8M Nepal dry port
description: In 2012, China signed an agreement with Nepal to build a dry port in Nepal's Larcha, near Tatopani customs on the northern border with China, and will cost an estimated Rs 1.2 billion (13.8 million USD, 86.2 million RMB) and funded with Chinese grant. 27.5 million square feet of land has been allocated near Tatopani for the port, parking for up to 200 trucks, agricultural quarantine, inspection house, warehouses, and a customs office. The government of Nepal has assigned the Inter-modal Transport Development Board to facilitate all the construction work which will be done by China‚Äôs Beijing Real Estate Group Company. Under the project, a border inspection building, cargo warehouse, litigation-warehouse, a parking lot with a capacity of accommodating at least 158 big containers and 33 cars and a 112-meter-long bridge over the Bhotekoshi River will be constructed. China had also agreed to upgrade a 6.5 km road connecting the dry port to the border with China. Construction began in December 2012 and was expected to be completed within 2 and a half years. The construction project is expected to ease the bottleneck for surging trade between China and Nepal. As of November 2014, the completion of the dry port will be delayed as a result of transportation problems created by a landslide in Jure, Sindhupalchok, and the sweeping away of the Bhotekoshi bridge by floods. The bridge was crucial to transporting construction materials to the dry port. The government has also failed to clear houses along the road connecting Miteri Bridge and the dry port. The road expansion and construction of a bridge over Bhotekoshi are included in the dry port contract. At this point only 60-65 percent of the construction work has been completed. Technical experts at the project say at the current pace of work, it will take another one year from the deadline to complete the project.

title: China pledges to build a joint ocean observation station
description: On December 8, 2017, China and Maldives signed an agreement to establish a Joint Ocean Observation Station between the State Oceanic Administration of China and the Ministry of Environment and Energy of Maldives. The agreement was signed by the Minister of Foreign Affairs, H.E. Dr Mohamed Asim and Administrator of State Oceanic Administration, Wang Hong. The station will be built at Makunudhoo Island in the Maldives and is purely for ocean observation and not a military application or submarine base as previously reported and believed.
sources: https://foreign.gov.mv/index.php/en/mediacentre/news/4289-key-agreements-signed-between-the-maldives-and-china, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/defence/chinas-ocean-observation-station-at-maldives-not-a-submarine-base-chinese-media/articleshow/63114532.cms, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China provided grant to Nepal for 10MW Sunkoshi hydropower project
description: In September 2010, the 11th meeting of the Nepal-China Non-Government Cooperation Forum took place. A high-level 40-member team came to Nepal to attend the forum. The power shortage in Nepal was discussed as an important opportunity for Chinese companies to be involved in hydropower development in Nepal. According to the Ministry of Energy, Sunkoshi (10MW) hydro project has been completed with Chinese grant assistance. Pictures of the completed project could be found on the websites of the implementing agencies, all of which are Chinese state-owned companies. However, no information on Chinese financing could be found. The implementing companies include Hunan Water Conservancy and Hydropower Construction Co. Ltd. and Hunan Hydropower Design Institute.

title: China provides $32.5 million grant for construction of Syaprubesi-Rasuwagadi highway in Nepal
description: China is spending over USD30 million to build just a 17-km stretch of road from the Tibetan border town of Kyirong to Syabrubensi. Syabrubensi is connected with Dhunche, the headquarters of Rasuwa district, and Trishuli Bazar, the district headquarters of Nuwakot district, by a motorable road. The highway will link Nepal with Tibet's Kyirong, which lies next to Rasuwagadi, and is also expected to shorten the distance between Nepal and Lhasa, the capital of Tibetan Autonomous Region of China. The highway will also be the shortest road link to China from Nepal. In May 2001, China and Nepal signed six agreements, one of which involved the construction of a road linking Nepal to Tibet. On 24/07/2007, the formal agreement for the road project was signed. On 17/12/2007, construction of the road began. In December 2012, construction was completed. China and Nepal signed the letter of transfer and the highway was officially handed over to Nepal. The amount of grant is updated from 20 million USD to 32,544,379 USD in January 2019, as a copy of AMP report export (December 2018) shows the actual commitment amount is so.

title: China provides $33.1m RMB for F-9 Park Solar Lighting Project
description: On December 15, Sun Weidong, the Chinese ambassador to Pakistan, attended the handover ceremony of the $33.1m RMB ($4.8m USD) solar lighting project in Islamabad F-9 Park (also called Fatima Jinnah Park). Ambassador Sun Weidong congratulated the F-9 Park solar lighting project on its successful completion and said that the project will have more than 3,400 polycrystalline silicon photovoltaic modules, which will provide lighting and electricity for more than 240 acres of parks. The project has an installed capacity of 0.85 MW. The Chinese company has built the project efficiently and completed the project two months in advance. On behalf of the Pakistani government, Finance Minister Dahl thanked the Chinese government for assisting in the construction of the Pakistani photovoltaic lighting project. STAFF_NOTE: NOV 19 2018 South and Central Asia Scrape According to a Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Year Book in the fiscal year of 2016/17, the project is listed in the category of completed projects with a grant of RMB 33.1 million. Changed the project status to completion. STAFF_NOTE: NOV 19 2018 South and Central Asia Scrape According to the Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Year Book in the fiscal year of 2015/16, the project has a transaction amount of 45millions RMB and was under implementation. This is likely to be outdated.

title: China provides $4 million for Nepal Livelihood Recovery for Peace
description: On November 17, 2017, China provided Nepal with a cash donation of $4 million to support Livelihood Recovery for Peace (LRP) project, which originally started in 2009. However, only $3,810,139 has been disbursed so far. The project constructs peace buildings at the community level and brings marked improvements in the livelihoods of vulnerable, excluded, and economically deprived households and communities. According to its descriptions, it provides support to women empowerment and allows most deprived individuals to have more assets. This project has multiple donors, but here only China is recorded. This is also a part of earthquake assistance initiative. An undated article published by the UNDP has reported that the LRP project has made an impact in the affected communities.
sources: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/xwgtc3dxlm2elu9/AAAZaPuBCh_NR4A5mOMp_W7-a?dl=0&preview=December+2018+Nepal+AMP+--+Livelihood+Recovery+for+Peace+(LRP)+Project.pdf, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; https://www.undp.org/content/undp/en/home/ourwork/ourstories/Bringing-economic-security-women-Nepal.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
implementing_agency: United Nations Development Programme (UNDP)
recipient_agencies: United Nations Development Programme (UNDP)

title: China provides 100 million yuan loan to Bangladesh for bridge construction (Linked to ID #43294)
description: In 2008, Bangladesh received an interest-free loan of 100 million yuan from China, for one of the bridges which connects the northern and southern parts of Bangladesh. Several bridges have been constructed in Bangladesh with Chinese grants, so specific details are uncertain. This is in addition to 60 million yuan grant from China for the same purpose (project ID #43294).
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BSNLNE0020101115e6bg0001m&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China provides 200 million RMB grant to Afghanistan
description: On 27 September 2013, Dr. Rangeen Dadfar Spanta, Advisor of Afghan National Security Affairs and the Chinese Commerce Minister signed an agreement, named the Government of People's Republic of China and the Government of the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreement, under which China would provide 200 million RMB (about 32 million USD) in grant to Afghanistan. The grant will be used based on consultations between the two countries in various projects and on projects that the Afghan government has prioritized. The exchange of letters for this agreement was signed previously in April 2013. The signing of the agreement was witnessed by President Hamid Karzai and Chinese President Xi Jinping. The agreement to provide the grant is one out of three documents signed on that day; another document that was signed was the MOU between Shaanxi Normal University and Kabul University (see Project ID #34671).
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BAKHNA0020131001e99u00007&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=THINDU0020130929e99t00011&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.thehindu.com/news/international/world/xi-signals-greater-role-for-china-in-afghanistan/article5180096.ece, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.jamestown.org/programs/chinabrief/single/?tx_ttnews%5Btt_news%5D=43158&cHash=cdf9d3723aea6491802a49aad8f898be#.VNk7bmTF8YI, Other Academic (Working Paper, Dissertation); http://af.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zxhz/201501/20150100879514.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://mfa.gov.af/en/news/joint-statement-between-the-islamic-republic-of-afghanistan-and-the-peoples-republic-of-china-on-deepening-strategic-and-cooperative-partnership, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://muse.jhu.edu.libproxy1.nus.edu.sg/journals/asia_policy/v017/17.huasheng.pdf, Academic Journal Article; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BAKHNA0020130930e99t00004&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.yicai.com/news/2013/09/3035542.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://news.sina.com.cn/c/2014-01-17/075929268697.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://paper.people.com.cn/rmrb/html/2013-09/28/nw.D110000renmrb_20130928_2-03.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://af.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zxhz/201501/20150100879514.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China provides 50 million RMB interest-free loan for the 6th Bangladesh-China Friendship Bridge (linked to #33941 and #41981)
description: In January 2002, China committed 110 million RMB to build the 6th Bangladesh-China friendship bridge (Muktarpur Bridge) over the Dhaleswari river. Of this funding, 60 million RMB will be provided for as a grant and 50 million RMB as an interest free loan. The bridge is 1,521 meters in length, and 10 meters in width, with one lane for each direction. China Road and Bridge Corporation undertook the construction of the bridge, and the Jamuna Multi-Purpose Bridge Authority was accountable for the project. A groundbreaking ceremony was held on January 27, 2005 and attended by Bangladeshi Prime Minister Khaleda Zia and Chinese Ambassador to Bangladesh Chai Xi. Construction works started on April 28, 2005, and the bridge was completed in January 2008, 7 months ahead of schedule, and inaugurated in February 2008.

title: China provides RMB 500 million of grant assistance to the Government of Afghanistan for housing projects in the capital and the provinces, government buildings, and other projects (linked to project #54451)
description: On May 9, it was reported that China provided RMB 500 million to the Afghanistan government in the form of grant assistance in order to fund housing projects in the capital, provinces, government buildings, and other projects.
sources: http://www.afghanistantimes.af/china-donates-72m-to-afghan-housing-projects/, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China provides US$32 million concessional loan for construction of Gwadar Port Free Zone and Export Processing Zone
description: This project involves infrastructure construction around the Gwadar Port and will aim at creating backup port industry for Gwadar Port. The focus of this zone is to restore water and power supply, machinery, and warehouse and supervision systems, as well as a functioning air facility. As of Nov 2018, following areas have been allocated as free zone and export processing zones in the industrial locations of Gwadar through either government earmark or acquisition: Gwadar port free zone: 2,280 acres GIEDA industrial zone: 3,000 acres EPZA export processing zone: 1,000 acres Within the Free Zone will be 100% private investment and the Zone is to be operated by COPHCL (China Overseas Port Holding Company). CPEC puts the estimated cost at US$32 million and indicates that there is a Chinese Government Concessional Loan provided. However, it remains unclear what portion of the cost is provided by China. The 2016 Government of Pakistan Bond Prospectus confirms the project cost and the start date. Tax exemptions for port and Free Zone were first notified in a finance bill in 2016. The 1st phase was completed and inaugurated in January 2018.
sources: http://cpec.gov.pk/project-details/36, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.cpecinfo.com/gwadar-port-city, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://www.dropbox.com/s/8csdpteq2a5b3lj/2016%20Government%20of%20Pakistan%20Bond%20Prospectus.pdf?dl=0, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.finance.gov.pk/budget/Estimates_of_Foreign_Assistance_2018_19.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://pk.chineseembassy.org/chn/zbgx/t1530349.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ASPKOB0020170427ed4r0001c&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks
implementing_agency: Gwadar Port Authority, State-Owned Company
recipient_agencies: Gwadar Port Authority, State-Owned Company

title: China provides USD1.6 million grant for CPEC Emergency Medical Center in Gwadar, Pakistan [BRI]
description: The Chinese Embassy website's introduction to CPEC projects records that China provided a 1.6 million USD government grant for the construction of an emergency medical center in Gwadar district, Balochistan. On May 7, 2017, the construction completed and the emergency medical center started operation. This project is reported by the Chinese Red Cross Foundation as part of the Belt and Road Initiative and co-building the China-Pakistan Life Rescue Corridor, which is financed by the Belt & Road Fraternity Fund. This project is the first China-Pakistan Life Rescue Corridor project. infrastructure, equipment, and personnel of the China-Pakistan Fraternity Emergency Care Centre After completion of construction, Chinese Red Cross Foundation sent the first medical team of 12 people, including medical experts from Huashan Hospital of Fudan University and Beijing Red Cross 999 Emergency Rescue Centre as well as RCSC project personnel. This medical team will take a half-year rotation, and the second medical team will go to Pakistan for rotation at the end of April 2018. The second medical team consists of nine people, including medical experts from Huashan Hospital of Fudan University, Obstetrics and Gynaecology Hospital of Fudan University, and the Beijing Red Cross Emergency Rescue Centre as well as CRCF coordinators.
sources: https://www.dropbox.com/s/k2fbw5jdczjtj5g/Introduction%20to%20CPEC%20Project%20on%20Chinese%20Embassy%20Website%20in%20Pakistan%20September%202018.pdf?dl=0, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://tribune.com.pk/story/1692588/1-gwadar-chinese-red-cross-set-emergency-care-unit-quetta/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.dawn.com/news/1331742, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://en.crcf.org.cn/sys/html/lm_13/2018-01-11/104208.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China provides USD129.25 million loan for Upper Trishuli 3A Hydroelectric Project in Nepal (linked to #34389)
description: On May 31, 2010, China Gezhouba Group announced that it had signed a commercial contract with the Nepal Electricity Authority for the construction of the Upper Trishuli 3A Hydroelectric Project (‰∏äÂ¥îÊ†ëÈáå3AÊ∞¥ÁîµÁ´ôÈ°πÁõÆ) in intersection of Rasuwa and Nuwakot, Nepal. Nepal Electricity Authority (NEA) is planning the 60MW dam, and China Gezhouba Group Company (CGGC) is the project contractor. The main building of the plant is underground, located in the right bank of the Trishuli River. It is equipped with two mixed-flow units with a total installed capacity of 60 MW. The project is part of the Nepal Hydropower Initiative. The estimated cost of the project is USD125.775 Million. According to a report by NEA in 2017, the financing agreement was signed between the Government of Nepal and China Exim Bank for a concessional loan of 120 million US Dollar in 2011. The Nepal Ministry of Finance Aid Information Management System records the project has a final committed amount by China of USD129,241,702. One media source reports that China EXIM Bank offered a concessional loan of $114.7 million, roughly corroborating the official source, with an annual interest rate of 1.75 for 25 years and a grace period of 5 years. Contract for the major construction work (Civil, Electro-mechanical & Hydro-mechanical works) was signed with China Gezhouba Group Company Ltd., China (CGGC) at a cost of 89.177 Million US$ excluding VAT. Contract for construction supervision of the project was made with Northwest Engineering Corporation Limited (previously known as Northwest HydroConsulting Engineers), China (NWH), at a cost of 3.932 Million US$ excluding VAT. Contract for the Transmission line work was awarded to China International Water & Electric Corporation (CWE) at a contract price of 22.6 million US$ excluding VAT. All three companies are subsidiaries of China Energy Construction Group. Construction started on June 1st, 2011. The project completion deadline was later extended to June 30, 2016. This grace period expired in 2016, but the NEA asked for an extension due to project delays from natural disasters, such as the 2015 earthquake, and the Chinese bank agreed. On May 16th, 2019, the first unit of the plant was successfully connected to the grid. On May 31st, 2019, the Chinese ambassador to Nepal, Hou Yanqi, visited the construction site. The second unit is now expected to complete in July, 2019. (For information from the NEA report, see p.22 of the document) STAFF_NOTE: For the slight discrepancy in transaction figures, coder deferred to the official source from Nepal AIDS. For project commitment date, coder records the signing date of the financing agreement.

title: China provides USD16,310,011 loan for 18 MW Naltar Hydropower Plant-IV (linked to #43228, #43229)
description: According to the 2006-2007 Foreign Economic Assistance Status Report on Commitments and Disbursements, the loan agreement for the 18 MW Naltar Hydropower project was signed in December 2001, with a commitment of $16,310,011. Disbursement has been completed as of 30 June 2007. The feasibility study had been completed in 2000. The project was finished in October 2007. The executing agency is KANA. China has taken up at least four other hydropower projects in these areas—Bhunji including the Naltar project and then smaller projects in places like Phendar, Harpo and Yurlbo.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=AIWINE0020100905e69500002&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://asianetpakistan.com/official-news/press-information-department/157968/prime-minister-performs-ground-breaking-of-14-4-mw-naltar-v-power-project/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.suchtv.pk/pakistan/gilgit-baltistan/item/32924-naltar-hydropower-project-to-be-completed-by-july-2016.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.ead.gov.pk/ead/userfiles1/file/Trainings/Status%20Report%20from%20July-June%2007.xls, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.dawn.com/news/597545, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.ecil.com/projects/details/Feasibility-Study-of-18-MW-Hydroelectric-Project-at-Naltar, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source

title: China provides financial assistance for construction of community buildings in Nepal
description: In November 2011, Chinese Ambassador Yang Houlan, on behalf of the Chinese Embassy to Nepal, provided financial assistance to the Nepal-China Himalayan Friendship Society for constructing community buildings in Dolakha, Rasuwa and Sindhupalchowk. The three districts are located in Nepal‚Äôs northern mountainous region, which shares the border with Tibet.
sources: http://np.china-embassy.org/eng/ChinaNepal/t876365.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Yang Houlan, Chinese Ambassador to Nepal

title: China provides technical and financial support for US$65m Havelian Dry Port (Linked to Project #52429)
description: In November 2016, a request was made for Chinese funding for the $65 million Havelian Dry Dock Port. The request came as the result of a joint feasibility study of the Main Line 1 ML1 and this project in August 2014 during the third Joint Cooperation Council (JCC) in Beijing. To meet the demand of containerized future freight traffic in connection with Pak-China Economic Corridor, the dry port will be established at Havelian by utilizing the railway land, railhead facilities, high speed / capacity stock, and potential of well established off-dock terminal for handling bonded import / export containers. The project will be funded through a Chinese Government Concessional Loan (GCL). The construction contract will be awarded through open bidding. The project is listed on CPEC website, which also suggests that the project framework agreement was signed in May 2017 (along with the reconstruction of railway ML-1 project), and that the project is to be put on fast track. Project framework agreement was signed June 2017, allowing project construction to start. According to the Pakistan Ministry of Finance, the project's groundbreaking is planned for 2018. In January 2017, the Pakistani government's Railway Division contributed 28 million Pakistani rupees for a comprehensive feasibility study for upgrading Main Line 1. According to the 2016 Government of Pakistan Bond Prospectus, project cost is $65 million. Expected completion is in 2018. STAFF_NOTE: Since no project update is found after 2017 when the governments signed the framework agreement and port design work started, coder assumed that as of June 2019, the implementation has not started yet. Project is coded as commitment for now. Chinese financing is also unclear. STAFF_NOTE: the railway utilized in conjunction with this port is also a Chinese-assisted CPEC project. Linked to Project #52429.
sources: http://cpec.gov.pk/project-details/31, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.cpecinfo.com/cpec-news-detail?id=NTEzNw==, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.finance.gov.pk/survey/chapters_18/13-Transport_and_Communications.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/8csdpteq2a5b3lj/2016%20Government%20of%20Pakistan%20Bond%20Prospectus.pdf?dl=0, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.beltroad-initiative.com/bri-factsheet-series-havelian-dry-port/, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PAKOFN0020170614ed6c0000d&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=NINTPK0020170118ed1i00035&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks
implementing_agency: Pakistan Railways, State-Owned Company
recipient_agencies: Pakistan Railways, State-Owned Company

title: China provides technical assistance to construction of technical institute in Bangladesh
description: In 2017, China announced plans to assist with the construction of a technical institute in Bangladesh. China sent advisers to provide technical support in order to establish the institute, but it is unclear which Chinese entity sent them. The technical institute, with special focus on power engineering courses, will be set up under the supervision of Bangladesh China Institute of Technology (BCIT) and Lanzhou Jiaotong University of China. Under the course, students will study first two years in Dhaka at Stamford University and last two years at Lanzhou Jiaotong University in China for getting first hand practical training with modern lab facilities. The power engineering course following Chinese curriculum started in 2018 January.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ENEPOW0020171121edbu00008&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.jagonews24.com/en/education/news/33934, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.daily-sun.com/printversion/details/267258/Chinese-university-to-launch-Power-Engineering-course-in-Bangladesh, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China signs agreement on infrastructure grants with Nepal
description: In February 2000, China and Nepal signed an agreement for China to provide grants for infrastructure projects in Nepal.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=xnews00020010818dw2g01i3y&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=bbcsap0020010804dw2g006lz&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China support construction of Afghanistan Science and Education Center
description: In 2011, China commits to construct the National Science and Educational Center in Afghanistan. The project costs 78.1 million Chinese Yuan. It is supported by the Chinese Ministry of Commerce and operated by China Railway 14th Construction Bureau Co Ltd. The detailed way of funding is unknown. The construction started on August 18, 2012, and ended on December 22, 2013, three months before the planned date. The Handover Ceremony of Afghanistan Science and Education Center was held on April 15, 2014. With a total construction area of ‚Äã‚Äã7,891 square meters, the project has laboratories, research rooms, lecture halls, libraries and other facilities. It is the window of education research and teacher training in the country.

title: China supports Afghanistan to build Vocational and Technical Institute in Kabul National Vocational Institute
description: In 2017, China supported Afghanistan to upgrade Vocational and Technical Institute in Kabul National Vocational Institute. The MoU was signed by the Afghan Education Minister and the Economic Attach√© for the Embassy of China in Kabul. The construction is designed by SIPPR Engineering Group Co., Ltd (‰∏≠ÂõΩÊú∫Ê¢∞Â∑•‰∏öÁ¨¨ÂÖ≠ËÆæËÆ°Á†îÁ©∂Èô¢ÊúâÈôêÂÖ¨Âè∏) and operated by China Railway 14th Construction Bureau Co Ltd. (‰∏≠ÈìÅÂçÅÂõõÂ±Ä). The total costs, paid by Chinese government, is estimated to be 35 million US dollar. The construction includes constructing a new general building, academic building comprising 65 classrooms, dormitory, gymnasium and upgrading existing automobile repair laboratory. It provides 300 employment to local residents and, once completed, will cater up to 1,720 students. The total construction takes 15,200 square meters. The construction starts on April 12, 2017, and is expected to be completed by January 2019. STAFF_NOTE: no reports for the completion of this project were found.
