title: ICBC Loan to Lahore Orange Line Metro Project
description: In January 2017, the state owned Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (ICBC) provided a Rs 1.36 billion short-term loan for the funding of the 27km Orange Line Metro Project in Pakistan. The terms of the loan are unclear, however the funds were provided to the Punjab Government in January 2017. Construction of the project is underway and is expected to be completed in 2019. The Orange Line Metro Project is a CPEC project.
sources: https://eproc.punjab.gov.pk/Tenders/37650_scan0329.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://cpec.gov.pk/project-details/46, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.icbc.com.cn/icbc/gxk_1/12551.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/business/2017-02/08/content_28139148.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks
funding_agency: Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (ICBC), State-Owned Company

title: China ExIm Bank Loan for Kuru-Tegerek Copper and Gold Resources Development Project in Kyrgyzstan
description: In July 2017, the China Eximbank signed a loan agreement with Kichi Chaarat gold mining company (also known as Kichi-Chaarat Closed Joint Stock Company), a subsidiary of China National Gold Group Corporation, to provide financing support for Kuru-Tegerek Copper and Gold Resources Development Project (or Kuru-Tegerek Copper and Gold Resources Development Project). This project is located in in Jalalabad, Kyrgyzstan. After completion, the mine is expected to have an annual processing capacity of about 1.8 million tons, including an annual output of 11,000 tons of copper, 600 kg of gold and 4.6 tons of silver. Estimated annual sales income from the mine is $100 million. The mine is also expected to be the largest copper-gold mine and the largest underground mine in Kyrgyzstan. No sovereign guarantee was provided by the Government of the Kyrgyz Republic for this project. The amount of the loan is unclear.
sources: http://www.eximbank.gov.cn/info/news/201810/t20181031_7991.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://en.chinagoldcons.com/products_detail/productId=41.html, Other; http://www.cnmc.com.cn/zsgj/outlineentem.jsp?outlinetype=1&column_no=091402, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://www.dropbox.com/s/nk48wa62u3casfj/Re-%20Query%20re-%20China%20Eximbank%20loan%20for%20the%20Kuru-Tegerek%20Copper%20and%20Gold%20Resources%20Development%20Project.eml?dl=0, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
funding_agency: China Export-Import Bank, State-Owned Company
implementing_agency: Kichi Chaarat Gold Mining Company, State-Owned Company
recipient_agencies: Kichi Chaarat Gold Mining Company, State-Owned Company

title: 1st U.S.-China join training program for Afghan diplomats
description: In 2012 a joint training program was developed by the government of China and the US State Department. This project was to provide four weeks of training to 15 entry-level Afghan diplomats. The training received would be divided in half with two weeks in China and two weeks in the United States. In Beijing, they will learn about China's culture, economics and foreign policy. The program began with an opening ceremony on May 17, 2012. This project has continued annually, with the most recent training visit in October, 2014.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ASNHTE0020120618e86a00006&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://mfa.gov.af/en/page/4185/4220, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://iipdigital.usembassy.gov/st/english/texttrans/2012/05/201205185931.html#axzz3Qw7dltfd, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://usa.chinadaily.com.cn/us/2014-10/21/content_18780308.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://beijing.usembassy-china.org.cn/2014ir/opening-ceremony-of-u.s.-china-joint-training-program-for-afghan-diplomats.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.state.gov/r/pa/prs/ps/2014/10/233172.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: 2nd U.S.-China joint training program for Afghan diplomats (linked to project ID#34645)
description: In September, 2013 the second U.S.-China Joint training program for Afghan diplomats began. This project was organized by the Chinese government and the U.S. Department of State. The program involved 12 entry-level diplomats who listened to lectures on diplomacy, public communication, and embassy management. Two weeks of the program took place in the United States and two weeks took place in Beijing later in the year. This is an annually recurring project with the third and most recent training visit in October, 2014.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020130909e999009c5&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://mfa.gov.af/en/page/4185/4220, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://usa.chinadaily.com.cn/us/2014-10/21/content_18780308.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://beijing.usembassy-china.org.cn/2014ir/opening-ceremony-of-u.s.-china-joint-training-program-for-afghan-diplomats.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.state.gov/r/pa/prs/ps/2014/10/233172.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Eklil Ahmad, Ambassador to the United States (Afghanistan Ministry of Foreign Affairs); Lu Kang, Minister of the Chinese Embassy to the U.S. (China Ministry of Foreign Affairs); Wang Yi, Foreign Minister (China Ministry of Foreign Affairs)

title: Assistance for dredging of riverbeds and for capacity building through training of personnel
description: In 2008, China and Bangladesh signed an MoU on sustainable cooperation on hydrological data sharing and flood control of river Yarluzangbu/Brahmaputra, in mitigating the magnitude and frequency flood disasters in Bangladesh. In 2010, this extended to strengthening cooperation on water resources management, hydrological data sharing, flood control and disaster reduction, as well as an agreement for China to dredge riverbeds and increase workforce capacity via personnel training. The two sides agreed to carry out sustainable cooperation on hydrological data sharing and flood control of river Yarluzangbu/Brahmaputra, in view of its necessity to the disaster reduction in Bangladesh. The two sides agreed to strengthen cooperation on water resources management, hydrological data sharing, flood control and disaster reduction, based on the exchange of letters between the Ministries of Water Resources of the two countries in 2005. At the request of the Bangladesh side, the Chinese side agreed to provide assistance for dredging of riverbeds and for capacity building through training of personnel.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=UNIBAG0020080916e49g00041&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.mofa.gov.bd/List.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://bd.china-embassy.org/eng/zmgx/zywj/t697175.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://bd2.mofcom.gov.cn/article/bilateralcooperation/bilateralagreement/201005/20100506913230.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.thethirdpole.net/china-to-give-brahmaputra-flow-data-to-bangladesh/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://books.google.com.sg/books?id=rPqTBwAAQBAJ&dq=china,+bangladesh,+hydrological+cooperation&source=gbs_navlinks_s, Other Academic (Working Paper, Dissertation); http://www.mrcsummit.org/presentations/Keynote7-Presentation-in-the-2nd-MRC-Summit%28China%29.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.inbo-news.org/IMG/pdf/5_CN-Hydrological_data_management_China.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China Central South University and Nepal sign MoU on medical education
description: In June 2017, China and Nepal signed a Memorandum of Understanding concerning education in Beijing. Ministry of Health and Population of Nepal and Central South University (CSU), Changsha, Hunan, Ambassador of Nepal to China Mr. Leela Mani Paudyal signed the document. According to the MoU, Central South University will begin the 'Developing Country Advanced Care and Medical Master Scholar' program and provide 25 scholarships per year Master's Level Program in Advanced Nursing Practice & Medical Technology upon recommendation of Ministry of Health of Nepal for the next five years. Both agencies will apply 'Silk Road' Clinical Medicine Scholar to trains Nepal professional on bachelors, masters, and doctors. staff_note pg 24
sources: https://mofa.gov.np/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/Annual-Report-12-Oct-final.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://mofa.gov.np/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/Annual-Report-12-Oct-final.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://iecd.csu.edu.cn/info/1016/3802.htm, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://mofa.gov.np/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/MOFA-Bulletin-Vol-2-Issue-1-Final.pdf, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China Friendship Foundation for Peace and Development (CFFPD) provides $300,000 USD for technical support for Tajikistan National University
description: On January 14, 2016, Ambassador Yue Bin of Tajikistan attended the handover ceremony of the multimedia audio-visual project of Tajikistan National University, which was built by the China Peace Development Foundation (PDP). At the ceremony, the China Friendship Foundation for Peace and Development (CFFPD) provided US$300,000 worth of technical assistance to Tajik National University. The modern audio-visual facilities established have created a good learning environment for Tajik students.
sources: http://tj.chineseembassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1331809.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.asiaplus.tj/en/news/tajikistan/society/20170310/237470, Media Report, including Wikileaks
funding_agency: China Friendship Foundation for Peace and Development, Foundation
implementing_agency: Chinese Embassy, Government Agency
contacts: Usmon Soleh, Head, PDP Public Relations Department ; Yue Bin, Ambassador (China)

title: China Funds Solar Energy Training Course for African Countries
description: June 2016, China organized a solar energy training course for countries in tropical and subtropical regions. Twenty individuals from eight countries and regions, including Ghana, Rwanda, Nepal, and Kenya were enrolled in the course in Lanzhou, capital of Northwest China's Gansu province. The training is sponsored by China's Ministry of Commerce and implemented by Gansu Natural Energy Research Institute, and it will focus on the technology of solar photovoltaic (PV) systems, solar water heaters, solar building, and solar desalination. The 28-day course will include lectures, technical exchanges, economic and trade talks, and on-site practice. China hopes to help these countries make better use of the energy with its advanced renewable energy technology. The cost of the project is unknown.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=SYRANA0020160620ec6k000dx&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://english.gov.cn/news/international_exchanges/2016/06/18/content_281475374638528.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/business/2016-06/18/content_25757645.htm, Other; http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/business/2016-06/18/content_25757645.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
funding_agency: China Ministry of Commerce, Government Agency
implementing_agency: Gansu Natural Energy Research Institute, Academic, Training and Research
contacts: n Xingcai,, deputy director of the institute

title: China Gives 131 Scholarships to Pakistani Students for 2016-17
description: In 2016, as many as 131 Pakistani students were awarded scholarships from the Chinese government for the 2016-17 school year to obtain higher-level education from bachelor to Ph.D. level from top Chinese universities. This is part of the over 2000 scholarships awarded to Pakistani students to study in China that year. Out of 131, 107 students were given scholarships on the recommendations of the Ministry of Inter-Provincial Coordination. The students will get educated in different fields in various Chinese Universities, including Computer Science and Technology, Business Administration, Finance, Physical Chemistry, Architecture, Civil Engineering, Broadcasting Communication, International Law, Journalism and so on. STAFF_NOTE: The financial amount of the scholarships is unknown.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=NBBALU0020160810ec8a0001o&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://pakwired.com/china-awards-scholarships-to-131-pakistani-students/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.merinews.com/article/chinas-long-term-public-diplomacy-in-pakistan/15919077.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.pakistanpoint.com/en/story/13843/131-pakistani-students-get-chinese-govt-scholarship.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks
funding_agency: China Scholarship Council, Government Agency
contacts: Sun Weidong, Chinese Ambassador ; Raja Muhammad Nadir Ali, Secretary of Ministry of Inter Provincial Coordination

title: China Grants $6M to Fight Poverty in Tajikistan
description: Summary: In 2004, China donated nearly 6 million dollars to neighboring Tajikistan to help fight poverty in the Central Asian nation. Mountainous Tajikistan has a 520-kilometer (325-mile) border with its huge eastern neighbor. The two countries inaugurated their first border crossing for vehicles, goods and people in May.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCCA00020040726e07q000xe&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=AFPR000020040726e07q007nb&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China Grants 1500 Scholarships for Afghan Students (Linked to projects #53999 and #54039)
description: On November 3, 2015, China pledged to grant 1500 scholarships to Afghan students in 2016. Chinese Vice President Li Yuanchao signed the education cooperation agreement with Afghan President Ashraf Ghani during his visit in Afghanistan. According to Li, the scholarships will provide Afghan students with training in health service and education in China, and will facilitate the 'people to people exchange' between the two countries. Amount of the scholarships and status of this project remain unclear. This project is linked to two other technical agreements that were also signed on November 3, 2015: a 500 million Yuan grant for the construction of 10,000 apartments for civil servants in Kabul (#53999) and aid to help Afghanistan with Taliban peace talks (#54039). In Oct 1, 2016, it was reported that 150 scholarships had been granted. As of Feb 21, 2019, the completion status is unclear.
sources: https://thediplomat.com/2015/11/chinese-vice-president-visits-afghanistan/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://prod.tolonews.com/afghanistan/afghanistan-china-sign-three-cooperation-agreements, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/world/2015-11/04/content_22364321.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://drive.google.com/file/d/1edGB9l_JI_6Zf1208o-zpxajtrmWcLvD/view?usp=sharing, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://af.china-embassy.org/eng/zagx/sbgx/t1403375.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China Grants 500 million yuan to Afghanistan for construction of Afghanistan International Exhibition Center in Kabul (linked to #54451)
description: Chief Executive of the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan Abdullah Abdullah paid an official visit to China from 15-18 May 2016. In a joint statement released during the visit, it was stated that in 2016, the Chinese Government will provide RMB500 million of grants to the Afghan Government for the mutually agreed project of Afghanistan International Exhibition Center in Kabul. On the same day, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang and Afghan Chief Executive Officer Abdullah Abdullah signed six bilateral cooperation documents. Documents signed on this date include: a trade agreement for saffron, a Memorandum of Understanding on the nature of the One Belt One Road Initiative, an exchange note on the construction of the auditorium at Kabul university (#53635), an exchange note on a grant of 50 million yuan for non-emergency humanitarian aid (#53640), and an exchange note on China creating a survey for the construction of affordable housing for civil service employees in Kabul (#53999). This disbursement may be part of the agreement signed in 2014, which stated that China will provide Afghanistan 500 Million RMB of grant assistance every year from 2014-2017.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/du/article.aspx/?accessionno=RVESEN0020160517ec5h00clg&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=&cat=a, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=HNASNI0020160517ec5h000ry&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=HNASNI0020160517ec5h000ry&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020160518ec5i00899&cat=a&ep=ASE , Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/wxzl/t1392473.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://prod.tolonews.com/afghanistan/afghanistan-china-sign-six-cooperation-agreements, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://ceo.gov.af/en/news/joint-statement-between-the-peoples-republic-of-china-and-the-islamic-republic-of-afghanistan, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://fec.mofcom.gov.cn/article/gbdqzn/upload/afuhan.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China Grants 8100 USD to Maldives Autism Association (linked to #52447)
description: In August 2016, the Chinese embassy in Maldives granted 8,100 USD (MVR 124,902) to a school run by the Maldives Autism Association. The money will be used to fund therapy, make fee settlements for children who are unable to pay, and give teachers their salary. In October 2016, the Chinese embassy donated 19 computers to the Autism Association (#52447).
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=MIADMD0020160823ec8n00002&cat=a&ep=ASE , Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://en.sun.mv/39248, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://mv.chineseembassy.org/eng/sgsd/t1391249.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Ifhaam Hussain, Managing Director, Autism Association

title: China Grants to Afghanistan Cricket Board for 'Cricket For All Program:
description: In 2016, the Chinese government wanted to grant $5 million to the Afghanistan Cricket Board to support the Cricket for All Program in the Nangarhar Province. Additional financiers are the Asian Development Bank, the Indian government, and the Afghanistan government. STAFF_NOTE: Project status unclear. Only $150,000 disbursed but not sure which donor it came from.
sources: https://www.dropbox.com/s/hbi2ki0e4t9quzq/DAD%20Afghanistan%20Project%20180003.pdf?dl=0, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/cu75mmi3ek8d6sc/Flat%20Export%20of%20Geocoded%20Afghanistan%20DAD%20from%202014.xlsx?dl=0, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China Hosts 2016 Training Course on HD Technology Management for Broadcasting and Television in Developing Countries
description: In 2016, China invited 37 highly-skilled technicians from 13 developing countries to the 2016 Training Course on HD Technology Management for Broadcasting and Television in Developing Countries. The seminar was organized by the Chinese Ministry for Commerce, will consist of four weeks at the State Administration of Press, Publication, Broadcasting and Television Programs in Beijing. The goal of the seminar is to provide information on technology related to radio and television, as well as information regarding the Chinese developing of the Chinese radio and television industry. Countries included Afghanistan, Brunei, Ghana, Kyrgyzstan, Malawi, Mozambique, Palestine, Panama, Samoa, South Africa, South Sudan, Sudan, and Zambia. 3 Samoan students met with Chinese Ambassador Wang Xuefeng to discuss their attendance at the seminar

title: China Provides Technical Cooperation Program to Jumhoriate Hospital
description: On January 22, the Chinese and Afghan government signed an agreement to provide a Technical Cooperation Program to the Jumhoriate Hospital that will last 2 years and will focus on the hospital's maintenance and will feature on-site technical guidance and personnel training for the maintenance of the hospital's main equipment and also for supplying necessary spare parts for the equipment. STAFF_NOTE: Alternatively known as Jamhuriate hospital. Can't find an article related to the program's completion but it likely occurred. China also funded the renovation of the Jumhoriate hospital in 2002 (see project ID #34502).
sources: http://af.china-embassy.org/eng/zagx/sbgx/t1121317.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://outlookafghanistan.net/topics.php?post_id=14736, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China agreed to provide additional annual 50 national scholarships to Afghanistan
description: During Afghanistan Chief Executive Abdullah Abdullah's visit in China between May 15-18, 2016, China agrees to provide an additional 50 national scholarships to Afghanistan annually for 5 years. The scholarships are for Afghan students to study in China. In 2014, China agreed on providing 500 national scholarships to Afghanistan (See project #37861 for details).
sources: http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/wxzl/t1392473.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.mfa.gov.cn/chn//pds/wjdt/zwbd/t1437807.htm , Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/china/2014-10/31/content_18835431.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China agrees to feasibility study for Municipal Solid Waste Treatment and Recycling in Maldives
description: On December 8, 2017, the Government of Maldives and the Government of China engaged in a signing ceremony at the Great Hall of People in Beijing, witnessed by President Abdulla Yameen Abdul Gayoom and President Xi Jinping. They exchanged a Letter of Feasibility Study on the China-Aid Municipal Solid Waste Treatment and Recycling Project. STAFF_NOTE: The extent to which China will support this joint project is unclear. As of March 2019, it is difficult to find additional information beyond the Maldives Ministry of Foreign Affairs article, as well as a Twitter post from the MFA.
sources: https://foreign.gov.mv/index.php/en/mediacentre/news/4289-key-agreements-signed-between-the-maldives-and-china, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://twitter.com/MDVForeign/status/938787246399832064, Social Media, including Unofficial Blogs

title: China agrees to provide 30 annual national scholarships to Afghans (Linked to #37861, #53703, #53641)
description: In 2006, China stated in the Joint Statement with Afghanistan that it will provide 30 annual scholarships for year-long training in China to Afghans. The details of the implementation of the scholarships are unclear. In 2014, China agreed on providing 500 national scholarships to Afghanistan (See project #37861 for details), an additional 50 annually in 2011 (#53703) and an additional 50 in 2016 (#53641).
sources: http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/wxzl/t852277.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.gov.cn/gongbao/content/2006/content_352476.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China agrees to train 200 professionals for Afghanistan (Linked to #54075, #54076)
description: In 2006, China agreed to help Afghanistan train 200 professionals in different fields to support 'national construction' between 2007 and 2008. The agreement was signed when Afghanistan President Hamid Karzai visited China between June 18 to June 21, 2006. According to Afghanistan DAD platform, the training will take 2,080,000 USD. It is unclear where the training will take place, but it is intended to support construction in Afghanistan.
sources: http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/wxzl/t852277.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://dadafghanistan.gov.af/de/frame.jsp?src=/de/deView.faces?sessionid=154258875818446093&MasterID=12&SubModuleID=1&Hierarchy=A12_E_Projects&UserID=13&iLanguageID=1&jsf_sequence=1&projectid=2436&beansKey=154258875818446093_1542593490059, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://news.sina.com.cn/w/2006-06-21/01269256450s.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.gov.cn:8080/zwjw/2006-06/20/content_315771.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China builds the Women's Sewing Training Production Center in Dushanbe, Tajikistan
description: „ÄÄOn January 8, 2016, Yue Bin, Ambassador of Tajikistan, attended the inauguration ceremony of the Women's Sewing Training Production Center in Dushanbe, sponsored by the Embassy. It is believed that the establishment of the training production center will definitely play a positive role in further promoting local women's employment and improving their living standards, and at the same time writing a new chapter for the friendship between the people of Tazhong.

title: China donates 100,000 yuan to Sri Lanka for second year of Chinese Ambassador Scholarship
description: In 2017, the Chinese Ambassador in Sri Lanka donated 100 thousand yuan to the Sri Lanka Ministry of Education for a 'Chinese Ambassador Scholarship'. 18 Sri Lankan students were awarded the full Chinese government scholarship this year, although 55 total students benefited. The awards ceremony was held at the Chinese Embassy on 2 August with the attendance of Ambassador Yi Xianliang, Mr. Madhawa Dewasurendra, Additional Secretary of Ministry of Higher Education and Highways and family members of the winners. This is the second year of this annual scholarship. Linked to projects #53789 (2016) and #54019 (2018). Staff Note: intent is coded as mixed because it is both development and representation.

title: China funds 2.194B rupee China Sri Lanka Research Grant Project
description: In a report published by Sri Lanka's Department of Project Management Monitoring Ministry of Development Assignments, it was stated that in 2016, China and the government of Sri Lanka began funding the China Sri Lanka Research Grant Project (CSLGRP) for 2,194 Rs.mn. It was unclear how much of this funding was provided by China versus the government of Sri Lanka. Therefore the transaction amount was not recorded. The general objectives of this project are to identify the possible causing factors to the occurrence and distribution of the Chronic Kidney Disease (CKDu) of unknown etiology in Sri Lanka, to develop groundwater treatment methods and technologies in CKDu affected regions in Sri Lanka, to develop rain water collection and use methods and technologies in dry areas of Sri Lanka, and to help the government of Sri Lanka make integrated water supply and sanitation infrastructure development plan, integrated water resource management plan, and land use plan. From March 12 to 20, 2016, a 42-member Chinese delegation from several Chinese institutes and enterprises visited Sri Lanka. The delegation visited the Ministry of City Planning and Water Supply (MCPWS), the inviting party of Sri Lanka, and National Science Foundation of Sri Lanka (NSF). From March 16 onwards, three research teams were organized and sent to conduct field investigations on CKDu Cause Study, Water Treatment Tech and Jaffna Water Resource management. The project will consist in part of the establishment of a monitoring laboratory and the installation of a groundwater treatment pilot project & rainwater harvesting project. Construction design is in progress, and the groundwater pilot project & rain water harvesting project were installed. The project was expected to be completed by the end of 2019, but was behind schedule on December 31, 2017, with only 10% physical progress completed due to the lack of adequate project staff allocation. STAFF_NOTE: The identifying report was unclear how much of this funding would be provided by each government. A report titled 'Progress of development projects and programs being implemented in 2017 (As at 30th September 2017)' lists the total cost as 1900RnMn, this was not coded as it is not as recent as the other official reports. CRS sector coded as multisector due to the health and environmental aspects of the project.
sources: http://www.pmm.gov.lk/resources/ENGLISH_FULL_2017.12.31.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.pmm.gov.lk/resources/Progress%20of%20Mega%20Projects.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.pmm.gov.lk/resources/Third_quarter_2017-new.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.cslrgp.com/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.castwas-cewe.org/Article/detail/fid/30/id/41.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks
funding_agency: China, Private Sector

title: China funds training on climate change for Maldivian officials and experts
description: According to a 2014 interview given by China's ambassador to Maldives, China on an annual basis invites Maldives officials and experts to join 'climate change training' (Ê∞îÂÄôÂèòÂåñÂüπËÆ≠Áè≠) held in China. In 2014 President Xi Jinping stated that, 'China is ready to provide human resources training and material assistance to the Maldives on adapting to climate change.' Under the Chinese commitment to the South-South Cooperation framework, China has invited foreign officials and experts to the Climate Change training seminars since 2011. From 2011 to 2014, the Chinese National Development and Reform Commission ('ÂõΩÂÆ∂ÂèëÊîπÂßî') has mobilized resources from the Ministry of Commerce to host a total of 39 seminars on climate change, training 1193 officials and experts on climate change from 119 developing countries in Asia, Africa, North America, the Oceania and Europe. From 2005 to 2010, China has committed over 1.17 billion Chinese Yuan to South-South Cooperation on Climate Change programs, and in 2016, China set aside 20 million Chinese Yuan for hosting the seminars alone. (For details, see the report by World Resources Institute in December 2016, p.8; and report by China Economic Herald)
sources: http://mv.china-embassy.org/chn/zmgx/hfyjl/t1174993.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/china/2014-09/15/c_133644910.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.ghub.org/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/SSC_201612.pdf, Other Academic (Working Paper, Dissertation); http://www.ceh.com.cn/ztbd/jnjpzk/934712.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

The event was organised by the Confucius Institute, National University of Modern Languages (NUML) of Islamabad. China is currently offering 500 scholarships for Pakistanis per year.

title: China holds seminar to help South Asian nations reduce poverty
description: In June 2007 China hosted a two week, poverty reduction course at The International Poverty Reduction Center in China for 20 officials from Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka. The course focused on rural development and poverty, strategies for regional economic integration, methods to manage poverty reduction funds, and China's experiences with poverty reduction. In addition to the course, attendees traveled to Chongqing Municipality to visit poverty reduction programs. The project is co-sponsored by the International Poverty Reduction Center in China (IPRCC). This course was provided again in the following year.

title: China provides 1M RMB cash grant for Maldives Value Addition and Agriculture Research
description: On April 10, 2014, China's ambassador to the Maldives and the Maldives Minister of Foreign Affairs signed an agreement for cooperation on an agricultural research project on behalf of the Chinese and Maldivian governments. Maldives' Ministry of Foreign Affairs stated that under the agreement, China would give Maldives a 1 million RMB grant for its agricultural sector. On March 9, 2015, an initiation ceremony was held for the China-funded Value Addition and Agriculture Research Project in the Maldives. The research under this project would promote the diversification of the agricultural industry, further increase the agricultural output value, and reduce external dependence.

title: China provides Afghanistan 50 Government Scholarships annually(Linked to #37861 and #53641)
description: Starting in 2011, China agrees to provide Afghanistan 50 government scholarships each year to allow Afghans to study in China. The number of scholarships increased to 500 in 4 years in 2014 (See project #37861) and additional 50 annually in 2016 (#53641).
sources: https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/chn//gxh/cgb/zcgmzysx/yz/1206/1206x1/t356107.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/ztgk/t1097559.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China provides agricultural training to Bangladesh (Linked to #33993)
description: In 2009, over 100 Bangladeshis participated in a training program held in China for agriculture and climate change industries. Since 2005, roughly 397 Bangladeshi officials as well as those in technical and economic positions have trained in China, as part of the 2005 MoU on Cooperation in the Field of Agriculture between the Ministry of Agriculture of China and the Ministry of Agriculture of Bangladesh. Project is linked to #33993.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=DKCOBD0020090828e58s0000l&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=UNIBAG0020050523e15l0001c&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.mofa.gov.bd/List.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://bd.china-embassy.org/eng/zmgx/zywj/t697175.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China provides anti-terrorism and anti-drug training to police officers of Afghanistan (Linked to Project ID#37849)
description: On 28 October 2014, China announced that it would hold training on anti-terrorism and anti-drugs for Afghanistan. The announcement was made during Afghan's President Mohammad Ashraf Ghani Ahmadzai visit to China. On the same date the announcement was made, China and Afghanistan signed an agreement on economic and technical cooperation, under which China would provide 2 billion Chinese Yuan in grant (See Project ID#37849). China previously had been providing small-scale security training to Afghanistan, specifically in the form of mine clearance and counter-narcotics training. In January 2015, the Xinjiang Frontier Corps and the Xinjiang Police College hosted the first Afghan anti-drug and anti-terrorism training seminar. The training was concluded on 29 January 2015 at Urumqi, Xinjiang. 50 police officers from the Afghanistan Interior Ministry Anti-drug, Anti-terrorism, and Border authorities Department participated in the training that lasted a month, and were later awarded the certificate of completion by the People's Republic of China Ministry of Public Security and the Ministry of Commerce.
sources: http://af.mofcom.gov.cn/article/tbbd/201501/20150100856996.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://global-factiva-com.libproxy1.nus.edu.sg/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=18&AID=9NAT002200&an=XNEWS00020141031eaav007bx&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.lowyinstitute.org/publications/chinas-foreign-policy-afghanistan, Academic Journal Article; http://cpc.people.com.cn/n/2014/1101/c64094-25951221.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://news.xinhuanet.com/politics/2014-10/31/c_1113065585.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.chinagabf.com/xbfjcb/html/Qnews/?ID=10812, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://difang.gmw.cn/xj/2015-02/01/content_14706457.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks
implementing_agency: Xinjiang Police College; Xinjiang Frontier Corps [Êñ∞ÁñÜËæπÈò≤ÊÄªÈòü]

title: China provides cataract operations and MVR 5.7M worth of equipment for 200 Maldivians (Linked to Project #53776)
description: In 2015, an MOU was signed between the Government of Maldives and China to provide cataract operations for 100 Maldivians. In September 2017, China sent a medical team of 13 people to provide cataract operations to more than 200 Maldivians. The team also taught local doctors how to perform the operations. Patients were often blind for many years mainly due to the inaccessibility of medical treatment. The MVR 5.7 million worth of equipment brought to the country for the surgeries was donated to the hospitals in the Maldives.The project is also named 'bright journey'. This project is linked to project #53776 where the Chinese Ambassador, H.E. Zhang Lizhong, mentioned that China will establish an eye-center in Hulhumal√© Island as a platform to give regular service to those patients with cataracts.

implementing_agency: China, Government Agency

title: China provides equipment and trains Border Police in Afghanistan
description: In 2015, Afghani MoI General Noorul Haq Uloomi signed an agreement with Chinese authorities to allow Chinese experts to train officers of the Afghanistan Border Police in order to help them combat insurgents and drug trafficking in the area. The Chinese specialists also provided new detective equipment to the border police. The disbursed amount for the project was $10,470,000.

title: China provides facilities and assistance for DNA lab in Pakistan
description: In March 2006 Pakistan established its first DNA test laboratory in Islamabad, with the assistance of China, to investigate complicated terrorism and criminal cases. The Chinese government had provided training for scientists in the facility.

The team arrived in Nepal on May 8th, and took over the work from the first Chinese Government medical team. The team returned to Chongqing on May 24th.

title: China sends Epidemics Prevention Medical Team to Nepal after the 2015 earthquake
description: On April 29 2015, a 62 person China International Search and Rescue Team that provided medical and epidemic prevention, carrying 20 tons of disease and relief supplies organized by the Health and Family Planning Commission of Yunnan Province organized an epidemics prevention team arrived in Kathmandu, including 5 CDC experts. The team treated a total of 328 patients and trained 1,018 Nepali medical personnel and donating medical equipment, the team returned to China on May 28.

title: China sends team of medical experts to render free cataract treatment in Bangladesh
description: The Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries (CPAFFC) and the Bangladesh-China People's Friendship Association jointly hosted the China-Bangladesh Friendship and Brightness (Ophthalmic) Trip. a team of Chinese medical experts from Beijing Tongren Hospital arrived at Bangladesh's capital city Dhaka on October 11, 2010 and offered free surgeries to 100 Bangladeshi cataract patients at Islamic Eye Hospital. The humanitarian mission is a part of China's 'Bright Light Tour'/'Bringing Light Tour' around the world.

title: China signs a memorandum of understanding on water conservancy with Bangladesh
description: Officials and experts from the water conservancy departments of the Chinese and Bangladeshi governments exchanged visits and signed an MOU with regards to technological cooperation on water conservancy. Specific cooperation projects included dike arrangement and sectional design for the Brahmaputra River, regulating the River's watercourses and joint research on the River's watercourses and silt movement. In 2015, China began giving Bangladesh flow data on the Brahmaputra river. This has helped Bangladesh in flood forecasting and emergency response efforts.

title: China to conduct hybrid rice technology training program for agricultural technicians in Bangladesh
description: On May 17, 2008, an opening ceremony for a hybrid rice technology training program funded by the Ministry of Science and Technology was held in Bangladesh. The one-month training program will involve technological training for over 30 Bangladesh agricultural technicians.

title: China to train 200 Afghan professionals
description: In 2006, China announced to support Afghanistan's national reconstruction. The Chinese side will train 200 Afghan professionals in 2007 and 2008. A press release from a Chinese embassy in 2008 reported that China will continue to train Afghanistan professionals in various fields, but it is likely that China fulfilled its pledge to train 200 professionals. title: China to train 300 Afghan police officers
description: On 23 September 2012 China signed an agreement to provide training to 300 Afghan police officers over the next four years; the officers will be in China for training. As of 2013, 45 Afghan police officers were receiving training in China on fighting drugs and riots. This number was expected to increase to 250 by 2015. The financial value and current status of this project are unknown.

title: China trains 400 Nepali in human resource development
description: In March 2016, China announced it would provide the opportunity for 400 Nepali to be trained in human resource development, as well as offer more government scholarships to Nepalese as part of an effort to enhance contact between their peoples. The agreement was made during an official visit of the Prime Minister of Nepal to China from March 20 to 27, 2016. staff_note: on pg 121

title: China will provide 500 scholarships over 5 years to Afghans to study in China
description: In a Joint Statement on Deepening Strategic and Cooperative Partnership between China and Afghanistan on 28 October 2014, China has agreed to provide 500 government-sponsored scholarships over the next five years to encourage more Afghan youths to study in China. China reaffirmed its pledge to provide the scholarship at the Foreign Ministerial Conference of the Istanbul Process on Afghanistan in November 2014. This is not the first time China has provided scholarship to Afghan students. During an interview with Ambassador Deng Xijun on 21 October 2013, the Ambassador mentioned that China had provided scholarship to 'hundreds of Afghan students'. On 27 September 2013, an MOU was signed under which China would provide scholarship to Afghan students from Kabul university (See Project ID#34671). STAFF_NOTE: Project reactivated as no reason is given to deactivate + this is a project + no duplicate found. STAFF_NOTE: Details on the status of the project are yet to be found. title: China's 20-person Medical Team Provides Free Medical Service in Nepal (linked to #38574)
description: On December 10, 2017, a 20-member medical team from Sichuan Province of China launched a week-long health camp in Dhulikhel of Nepal. The team claimed to be providing free medical services on orthopedics, diabetes, hypertension and respiratory diseases for the local people of Nepal. The team, led by the Deputy Inspector of Sichuan provincial foreign affairs office had 17 doctors. The team also served in the humanitarian assistance project in 2015 following an earthquake in Nepal #38574.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=XNHA000020171211edcb000ul&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://health.economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/industry/hyderabad-womens-group-pitches-for-ban-on-unsafe-abortions/68407990, Media Report, including Wikileaks
implementing_agency: Sichuan Provincal Government, Government Agency

title: Chinese Academy of Sciences opens a joint ecology and environment research center in Tajikistan
description: On 13 September 2014, Chinese Academy of Sciences (CAS) signed an agreement on scientific cooperation with Academy of Sciences of Tajikistan on the construction of Tajikistan branch of the Central Asia Ecology and Environment Research Center of Chinese Academy of Sciences (‰∏≠ÂõΩÁßëÂ≠¶Èô¢‰∏≠‰∫öÁîüÊÄÅ‰∏éÁéØÂ¢ÉÁ†îÁ©∂‰∏≠ÂøÉÂ°îÂêâÂÖãÊñØÂù¶ÂàÜ‰∏≠ÂøÉ) in Dushanbe. On August 29, 2016, the opening ceremony of the center took place. According to media report, the main objective of the center is to 'conduct fundamental and applied research in the field of natural Sciences.' This center is the first joint scientific institution between Tajikistan and China.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ASIPLU0020160831ec8v00008&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://news.sciencenet.cn/htmlnews/2016/8/354766.shtm, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source

implementing_agency: Academy of Sciences of the Republic of Tajikistan, Government Agency; Chinese Academy of Sciences (CAS)

title: Chinese Agricultural Experts Assist Bangladesh Agriculturalists
description: In 2017, Chinese Ambassador to Bangladesh Ma Mingqiang noted that eight Chinese agricultural experts were in Bangladesh. The experts were working with Bangladeshi farmers with the cultivation of hybrid rice. It is unclear which organization these experts came from. STAFF_NOTE: This project assumes that the consultants were sent by the Chinese government and that Bangladesh did not pay for their services.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020170425ed4p007y5&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Chinese Embassy establishes US$29k 'Chinese Ambassador Scholarship' at Quaid-i-Azam University
description: On December 8, the establishment ceremony of the 'Chinese Ambassador Scholarship' was held for undergraduate and MPhil Students at the School of Politics and International Relations (SPIR), Quaid-i-Azam University (QUA), Islamabad. The scholarship has a reported worth of US$29,500. In an academic year, each of the ten selected students will receive Rs 150,000 on need and merit basis. The scholarship was established to help QUA students with financial difficulties and foster Pakistan-China relations.
sources: http://pk.china-embassy.org/chn/zbgx/t1422883.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://pakobserver.net/chinese-ambassador-scholarship-established-at-qau/, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Chinese Experts Dispatched to Help Control the Spread of Poliomyelitis
description: From 2011 to 2012, China worked closely with the WHO and dispatched 15 experts to Namibia, Nigeria, Ethiopia and Pakistan to help control the spread of poliomyelitis.
sources: http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/china/2014-07/10/c_133474011.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://english.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zt_foreignaid/news/201501/20150100884018.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.scio.gov.cn/zfbps/wjbps/Document/1435360/1435360_3.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: Chinese doctors to provide free services in India
description: In January 2008, it was announced that a joint team of Chinese and Indian doctors will provide free medical services in some of the poorest regions of India in memory of an Indian doctor who died serving in China over 70 years ago. A China India Joint Medical Mission (CIJMM) has been set up during Prime Minister Manmohan Singh's visit to Beijing to serve the rural populations of the two countries. The 20 doctors will first serve in Hebei province in north China. The joint mission is also expected to visit India by the end of the year. All the medical services offered by the doctors would be free. These would include medical consultations and drugs.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=HNIANS0020080115e41f000bd&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Chinese embassy built Women's Sewing Training Production Center in Wahsh District, Tajikistan
description: On September 14, 2016, Yue Bin, Ambassador of Tajikistan, attended the inauguration ceremony of the Women's Sewing Training Production Center in Wahsh District, Tahaltun, sponsored by the Chinese Embassy.
sources: http://tj.chineseembassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1397560.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Yue Bin, Ambassador (China)

title: Chinese embassy built women sewing training and production center in Danghara, Tajikistan
description: On January 11, 2016, Ambassador Yue Bin went to Tajikistan President Rakhmon's hometown Danjiala to attend the opening ceremony of China-sponsored Danjiala women sewing training and production center.
sources: http://tj.chineseembassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1429681.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Yue Bin, Ambassador (China)

title: Chinese medical team goes to Sri Lanka for tsunami relief
description: On January 4, 2005, A 14-member Chinese medical team arrived in Hikkaduwa, Sri Lanka. The team consists of 5 surgeons and 2 nurses from Beijing Friendship Hospital, as well as 7 epidemic prevention workers from Beijing Center for Disease Control. The team was later joined by 3 medical professionals from Macau and 1 person from Beijing Municipal Commission of Population and Family Planning. The team, also known as the third international medical team for Indian Ocean Tsunami relief, returned to China on January 19. STAFF_NOTE: The four international medical teams for Indian Ocean Tsunami relief are #34816 (2 teams to Thailand), #33231 (1 team to Sri Lanka), and #35113 (1 team to Indonesia). China contributed 63 million USD for tsunami relief in total, most of the individual project are captured (see projects linked with resource #41811).

title: Chinese surgeons perform 1000 cataract operations in Pakistan
description: In December 2010 China pledged that 1,000 cataracts operations would be undertaken by Chinese surgeons. This was declared by the Pakistani Minister of Information and Broadcasting, Qamar Zaman Kaira, during a press conference on Hu Jiantao's visit to Pakistan.On December 2011 an 8-member Chinese medical team has reached for Islamabad to carry out the first 500 free cataract operations in Pakistan. The team was led by Mr. Song Xudong, Chief Physician of Beijing Tongren Hospital. The visit was organized by the 'Chinese People‚Äôs Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries'. The team stayed in Pakistan till 18 December 2011. The project was part of China's 'Bright Light Tour'/'Bringing Light Tour,' or 'ÂÖâÊòéË°å'(Guangmingxng) in Chinese. Prime Minister Syed Yusuf Raza Gilani and Chinese Ambassador to Pakistan Liu Jian visited the patients who received the treatment. In April 2012 a second team consisting in 7 eye surgeons headed by Prof Wang Jum from Beijing Tony Ran Hospital reached Pakistan. They operated operated upon 250 patients at Mayo Hospital, Lahore from April 18 to 21. Later, they operated 80 patients at the Civil Hospital of Karachi (KCH). Additional 200 patients (approximately) had been registerd. They staryed at KCH from 23 to 27 April. By April 26, Chinese surgeons successfully completed the 1008th cataract operation in Pakistan.

title: Chinese universities provide 100 Tajik students with education for Central-Asia Line-D natural gas pipeline project (Lined to project #39955)
description: On October 10, 2017, Xi'an Shiyou University of China held the launching ceremony of the 'Hundred Talents Program' that provides the 5-year training of 100 Tajikistan students for the Central-Asia Natural Gas Project (#39955). The first thirty students to receive the training were selected from the 1000 top students, with the assistance of National Testing Center of Tajikistan, and China National Natural Gas Pipeline Co., Ltd., under the approval of the Deputy Prime Minister of Tajikistan. The students will take Chinese language courses in Tianjin University for one year, and in Xi'an Shiyou University for another year. Then they will study the undergraduate major courses of oil and gas storage and transportation in Xi'an Shiyou University. After graduation, they will work as professionals for the Line D of Central-Asia Natural Gas Project. Fifteen students out of thirty received scholarships of the 'Silk Road' Program from the Chinese government. China-Central Asia natural gas pipeline Line D is an inter-governmental project signed by China, Uzbekistan, Tajikistan and Kyrghyzstan. The construction of the Tajikistan section of the 1,000-km-long line was launched in September 2014. Of all countries the pipeline travels through, Tajikistan has the longest section of about 410 km. For details on this project see #39955.
sources: http://xyl.xsyu.edu.cn/xxxw/6457.jhtml, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNHA000020171011edab000ma&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Chinese universities provide help to set up Pak-China University
description: Pakistan and China signed agreement of to set up Pak-China University (PCU) of Engineering Science and Technology (S&T) with an estimated cost of Rs 30 billion. The MoU was signed by Dr Jiang Feng on behalf of the Ministry of Education, China and Dr S. Sohail H. Naqvi, Executive Director of Higher Education Commission on behalf of the Pakistani government. May 9 2008 7 Chinese universities including Qinghua University, Beijing Univeristy of Science and Technology, Beijing Jiaotong Universities, Beijing University of Post and Telecommunication, North China Univeristy of Electric Power Univeristy, Beijing Univeristy of Aeronautic and Astronautic and Beijing Institute of Technology formed the Consortium of Chinese Universities (CCU) to provide trainings for the teachers and help with the construction of schools. STAFF: unsure whether China has funded this project.

title: Consultancy Services for Extension of Southern Expressway Project (link to projects ID #38337, #53526, #33488 and #53522)
description: On 22 December 2017, the Export-Import Bank of China signed a 577 million CNY concessional loan agreement with Sri Lanka for consultancy services for design review and construction supervision of civil works on the Extension of Southern Expressway Project (ESEP). According to the Sri Lanka Department of External Resources 2017 Annual Performance Report, the China Eximbank loan would cover the full cost of this project. The loan has an interest rate of 2% and a maturity of 20 years, including a 6 year grace period (see 2017 Annual Performance Report). The objective of ESEP is to enhance the efficiency of the transport system by linking the country's major economic centers with Colombo City and other parts of the country. Under this objective, the 577 million CNY loan from Eximbank will fund the provision of consultancy services for design review and construction supervision of civil work of the Southern Expressway from Matara to Hambantota. According to the Sri Lanka Department of External Resources, this project commenced on 22 January 2017 and is targeted for completion in the year 2022 (see 'Resource Mobilization'). As of 31 March 2018, the consultancy work for all four sections of ESEP was on schedule (see 'Progress...as of 31 March 2018' from Sri Lanka Department of Project Management). For information on the four sections of ESEP, for which the consultancy services captured in this project will be provided, see projects ID #38337 (Section 1), ID #53526 (Section 2), #33488 (Section 3), and #53522 (Section 4).
sources: http://www.erd.gov.lk/index.php?option=com_rmobilization&view=resource_project&category_id=1&sub_category_id=1&searchby=donor_type&donor_id=4&today=2018-10-23&Itemid=321&lang=en, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.erd.gov.lk/images/Publications/ERDReport2017/ERDReport2017-English.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.pmm.gov.lk/resources/ENGLISH_FULL_2017.12.31.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.pmm.gov.lk/resources/Development_Performance_YearEnd_2015.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/a/201810/03/WS5bb4a258a310eff3032809e3_1.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://dailynews.lk/2018/11/14/local/168450/southern-expressway-extension-be-ready-2019, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.erd.gov.lk/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=114:news&catid=29&Itemid=226&lang=en, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://economynext.com/US$90mn_Exim_Bank_loan_for_Sri_Lanka_expressway_extension_consultancy-3-5207-6.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.erd.gov.lk/index.php?option=com_content&view=category&layout=blog&id=29&Itemid=226&lang=en&limitstart=5, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.pmm.gov.lk/resources/Full%20Report.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.mofcom.gov.cn/dl/gbdqzn/upload/sililanka.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

description: In addition to donating materials to Kudakudhige Hiya Orphanage ( #38026), China is also purportedly helping the orphanage develop early education programs. However, specific details on this project have not yet been uncovered.

title: Loan for 'Safe City Islamabad' project
description: In December 2010, China and Pakistan signed a Government Concessional Loan Agreement on the Islamabad 'Safe City' (Âπ≥ÂÆâÂüéÂ∏Ç) project, valued at roughly $124 million USD according to media reports. A Chinese media source notes that the initial contract was signed for $233.7 million. The agreement was signed between Pakistan and EXIM Bank of China, inked by Secretary EAD Sibtain Fazal Haleem and Exim Vice President Li Jun. Prime Minister Syed Yusuf Raza Gilani and Chinese Premier Wen Jiabao witnessed the signing of documents. The agreement was one of the 13 agreements and MoU signed by China and Pakistan during PM Wen Jiabao's visit to Pakistan. The loan was reportedly to be paid back in 20 years time at a 2% interest rate. The project was to be implemented by Huawei Technologies. A Pakistani ministry of finance report - monthly disbursement report in July 2016 puts the project committed amount at CNY850 million, which is roughly the equivalent of the USD amount mentioned above. According to a Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Year Book in the fiscal year of 2016/17, the project is listed in the category of completed projects with a transaction amount of CNY850 million. Changed the project status to completion. The Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Year Book in the fiscal year of 2015/16 records the project with USD124.71 million and a fulfilled part of 108.713 million. According to the Pakistan Ministry of Finance Estimates of Foreign Assistance for 2015-2016, the revised budget estimate for 2014-2015 is 3,367.410 million Pakistani rupees. In the Estimates for 2017-2018, the revised budget estimate for 2016-2017 predicted China lending 1,307.530 million Pakistani rupees, equivalent to 9.74 million USD, in 2016-2017. The budget estimate for 2017-2018 estimated no disbursement for the project during that year.

title: Wuhan Textile University and Bangladesh's Southeast University create Joint Textile Engineering Undergraduate Program
description: In 2015, a Memorandum of Understanding was signed to develop a joint undergraduate program on textile engineering. This program would be between Southeast University in Bangladesh and Wuhan Textile University in China. Under the agreement, the two universities will exchange students and faculty members from various disciplines. This project is similar to #52668, where a similar joint programs was developed between the WTU and Bangladeshi universities.

title: China and Tajikistan complete joint investigation on climate change
description: In September 2015, the Tajikistan academy of sciences invited researchers from the Institute of Urumqi Desert Meteorology of the China Meteorological Administration. The groups carried out an 8-day scientific investigation of climate change and water resources. The investigation is expected to bolster regional cooperation among countries in Asia and act as a foundation for future research of climate change in Central Asia countries.

title: China provides grant assistance to Tajik officers for drug trafficking seminars
description: In 2011, the Chinese government provided grant assistance worth $305,810 to Tajikistan for seminars, as reported by the May 2018 Flat Export from Tajikistan AIMS. The project ID is TJK/112259. This is likely referencing the training courses and seminars provided to Tajik drug control officers entitled 'Fight against Illicit Drug Trafficking' provided by the Ministry of Public Security of China and the XUAR Department for Public Security. The training took place in China‚Äôs Xinjiang-Uyghur Autonomous Region (XUAR).

title: China Development Bank loans $49m to Sri Lanka Hatton Bank
description: Description: In June 2013 Sri Lanka's Hatton National Bank signed a deal with the China Development Bank for a 5 year long 49 million USD loan for raising capital. The agreement was signed by Dr Ranee Jayamaha, Chairperson, and Mr. Jonathan Alles, Acting CEO on behalf of Hatton National Bank PLC and Mr Bai Yingfu, general manager of CDB's Guangxi branch and HNB chairperson Ranee Jayamaha.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=ATLKBO0020130627e96r00001&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.hnb.net/data/media_centre/hnb_raises_long_term_debt_from_overseas.php, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.businesstoday.lk/article.php?article=6165, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.ft.lk/article/159403/HNB-raises---49-m-long-term-debt-from-overseas, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Chinese college sponsors vocational tranining institute Luban Workshop in Pakistan
description: During May 2017, an MoU was signed between Pakistan's Technical Education and Vocational Training Authority (TEVA) and the Tianjin Model Vocational Training College (TMVTC) in Tianjing China to construct a Luban workshop in Pakistan to help train skilled talents in honing there craft for professional quality. For the first half of 2018 the Luban workshop will provide Advanced Chinese Language and Automation Production Line, while during the second half of 2018 they will provide two more courses with one most likely being media arts. After the Luban workshop is constructed, Chinese master trainers will remain in Pakistan to supervise, in exchange for Pakistani master trainers being sent to China for training. The Luban workshop in Lahore, Pakistan, was unveiled in July 2018 according to a September 2018 Global Times news article. In March 2019, the Chinese implementing agency, Tianjin Modern Vocational Training Institute, published a press release that records, on January 16, 2019, the Luban Workshop in Pakistan was opened for operation. The first batch of 25 Pakistani students entered the Luban Workshop and began a six-month course. STAFF_NOTE: The intent has been coded as Mixed because there is Representational and Development intent, and the flow class was correspondingly coded as OOF-like.
sources: https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=1&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=2ahUKEwjhyJPwqIrhAhWHjVkKHb5hCJ8QFjAAegQIABAB&url=https%3A%2F%2Ftribune.com.pk%2Fstory%2F1593495%2F1-chinese-luban-workshop-start-classes-april%2F&usg=AOvVaw1EOkO0KnsO9v5FVHP7mFxd, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=1&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=2ahUKEwjJwNv-gY3hAhWCCDQIHYzzBZgQFjAAegQIAhAB&url=https%3A%2F%2Ftribune.com.pk%2Fstory%2F1593495%2F1-chinese-luban-workshop-start-classes-april%2F&usg=AOvVaw1EOkO0KnsO9v5FVHP7mFxd, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.xdxy.com.cn/info/1036/6393.htm, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.globaltimes.cn/content/1119517.shtml?from=timeline, Media Report, including Wikileaks
implementing_agency: Tianjin Model Vocational Training Institute, Academic, Training and Research

title: China Provides Language Training to Nepalese Tourism Professionals (linked #53705)
description: On March 23, 2016, China agreed to provide Chinese language training for 200 Nepalese tourism professionals within 5 years. The project aimed at boosting Nepal's tourism industry because based on data in 2017, China was the largest tourism source market for Nepal. The Chinese Language Training Course for Nepali Tourism Professionals was organized by the Chinese Embassy and Ministry of Culture, Tourism and Civil Aviation of Nepal. The project started in July, 2017, and as of November, 2018, the third course had been held. The project is in progress. STAFF_NOTE: This project is linked to a human resources training agreement (#53705) signed at the same time.
sources: http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2018-11/27/c_137635349_2.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020160323ec3n007kf&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://travelnewsnepal.com/10836/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2018-11/27/c_137635349.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks

recipient_agencies: Nepal Ministry of Culture, Tourism, and Civil Aviation, Government Agency

title: China supports construction of China-Kyrgyzstan-Uzbekistan railway
description: On April 17, 2012, the Ministry of Transport and Communication of Kyrgyzstan signed an agreement with the China Road and Bridge Corporation for a feasibility study of the China-Kyrgyz-Uzbek Railway project. The Ministry of Transport and Communication of Kyrgyzstan announced in 2012 that the feasibility project was almost complete. In April 2018, Uzbekistan, Kyrgyzstan, and China planned to decide the finalized route for the China-Kyrgyzstan-Uzbekistan railway, in particular the $5 billion project proposed by Kyrgyzstan that would run through the country's regions and boost the local economy. Representatives of China Development Bank were present at the second China-Kyrgyz-Uzbek Railway Tripartite group meeting in 2016, and representatives of both China Development Bank and Export-Import Bank were present at the third China-Kyrgyz-Uzbek Railway Tripartite group in 2017. It was also mentioned in articles published on Chinese Eximbank website that the bank provided financing to the railway projects. As the financing amounts and details are not known, no transaction amount has been recorded. Since the 1990s, China has been looking to expand its freight transportation routes through Central Asia as part of the New Silk Road Initiative. In 2003, a feasibility study for a 900 km China-Kyrgyzstan-Uzbekistan railway. Since then the project has been delayed and reworked multiple times because of political and financial reasons, as well as disagreements between the partners. Kyrgyzstan especially strongly opposed the initial gauge of 1435-mm proposed by China, advocating instead for a broad, 1520-mm gauge out of concern that otherwise freight trains would run through the country without stopping, resulting in a loss of transit cargo. Staff_Note: Prior information on feasibility study for project was found in deactivated project 40182. As of 2019 March, the current status of this project is unknown.
sources: https://www.timesca.com/index.php/news/26-opinion-head/19193-china-kyrgyzstan-uzbekistan-railway-to-improv, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.railfreight.com/beltandroad/2018/10/08/uzbekistan-china-one-step-closer-to-building-railway-corridor-via-kyrgyzstan/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://kg.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zxhz/201512/20151201217514.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=bbcca00020020903dy930006e&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://kg.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zxhz/201303/20130300054045.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.eximbank.gov.cn/info/circus/201806/t20180610_3503.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.gov.cn/xinwen/2016-12/26/content_5153158.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.eximbank.gov.cn/info/ztzl/shanghe/201808/t20180831_6815.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
implementing_agency: China Road & Bridge Corporation (CRBC), State-Owned Company

title: [PD] China and India Initiates Annual Sino-India Think Tank Conference
description: May 2015, China and India agree to start annual Sino-India Think Tank Conference. It will be held in each country in turn. The conference is established to enhance communication and increase mutual understanding. The India-China Think Tank Forum was established by Prime Minister Narendra Modi and President Xi Jinping during the Indian Prime Minister‚Äôs visit to China. The goal of this conference is to foster closer dialogue and mutual understanding between the two countries and to deliberate on contemporary issues of regional and international significance. The 2015 conference had two roundtable discussions: one on Indo-Chinese cooperation on global economic governance and another on how India and China could steer global financial markets. The Chinese delegation was led by Prof. Wang Weiguang, President of the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences (CASS). It is the first and the most comprehensive academic research organization in China for study in the fields of philosophy and social sciences and is central to policy-making in China. The transaction amount is unknown. Other project captures at the same source include institutionalizing Sino-India Media Summit (Code: 54021) and establishing Mahatma Gandhi (Âú£ÈõÑÁîòÂú∞) India Research Center in Fudan University. STAFF_NOTE: The flow class and flow type were marked as vague because it is unclear if China will provide any financial flow to India. The Chinese Academy of Social Sciences is affiliated with the State Council of China, so this project is listed as official finance.
sources: http://in.china-embassy.org/chn/zygx/zywx/t1264214.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.gatewayhouse.in/india-china-bilateral/, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Wang Weiguang, CASS President

title: China Development Bank gives a loan to Uzbekistan to purchase Huawei's equipments
description: In 2007, 'Aloqabank' or 'Aloqa' bank used a loan from the China Development Bank to purchase communication equipment from Huawei, an independent Chinese telecommunications company. The total contract value was US$21.28 million, and includes 70 mobile phone base stations installed in 9 regions with a total capacity of 40,000 gates; 36 data transmission systems with a total capacity of 100,000 ports; and 124,000 NGN network devices and 5.56 million ports of C&C08 type digital communication station equipment. Aloqabank is an Uzbek banking and financial services company. The purchased equipment was loaned to the Uzbek Telecom Company with principal interest. STAFF_NOTE: transaction amount was not coded since it is unclear how much of the contract value will be covered by the loan from CDB.
sources: http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zxhz/200702/20070204410859.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
funding_agency: China Development Bank (CDB), Government Agency
implementing_agency: Huawei Company, Private Sector

title: China provides grant for Pilot Project Of Digital Terrestrial Multimedia Broadcast (DTMB)
description: According to the Pakistan Ministry of Finance, China and Pakistan signed a memorandum of understanding to expand the Digital Terrestrial Multimedia Broadcast (DTMB). As of 2018, the first phase of the project, a pilot DTMB installed at Remote Backup Service (RBS) in Murree by Chinese ZTE Corporation for demonstration of the Pakistan Television Corporation (PTV) terrestrial network, is completed. The project is financed through a Chinese government grant, but it is unclear how much. The feasibility project had a reported cost of 0.70 million RMB and is completed, according to the Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Year Book for 2015/2016. According to the CPEC website, as of 2018 the total cost of the pilot project was $2 million, and the demonstration project is with funding from the Chinese side. PC-1 of the Demonstration project approved by CDWP on 2nd May 2018.

title: Chinese EXIM Bank provides 1.2 billion RMB worth of Export Credits to Bangladesh to Purchase 6 Oil Ships(linked to #52873)
description: On November 14, 2016 the signed a deal with the Bangladesh Shipping Corporation to provide 1,200,000,000 RMB of Export Credits for the purchase of 6 ships from the China National Machinery Import and Export Corporation. The export credits have a 2% interest rate, 5 year grace period, and 20 year maturity. The 3 new bulk oil tankers and 3 oil carriers are being built by the Yangzijiang Shipbuilding Co, and are expected to be delivered in 2018 to join the BSC's existing fleet of 8 ships. According to the 2016 ODA Report from the Economic Relations Division of Bangladesh, only 180m RMB of the total committed amount has been dispersed. STAFF_NOTE: CRS Sector 32262

title: Exim Bank Finances $34M in Export Credits for Huawei Tech Eqmnt for Kazakhstan
description: In 2007, the ExIm Bank of China financed a 7 year, $34 million export credit for Kazakhstan to import telecommunication equipment from Huawei Tech. It is reported as having a very flexible payment schedule, but no further details. The primary recipient is Kazakh company Mobile Telecom Service LLP.

title: Supply of 13 Diesel Multiple Units for Sri Lanka Railways
description: In 2010, China Eximbank committed 700 million RMBY (approximately 102.7 million USD) for the procurement of 13 Diesel Multiple Units (DMUs) for Sri Lanka Railways (see p. 269 of 2010 Annual Report from Sri Lanka Ministry of Finance). Based on information from Annual Reports from the Sri Lanka Ministry of Finance, the loan's first disbursement was in 2010, and the final disbursement was in 2014 (see p. 269 of 2010 Annual Report, p. 254 of 2015 Annual Report, and no further disbursements appear for this project in subsequent Annual Reports). The project will strengthen the passenger transport service of Sri Lanka Railways by adding 13 DMUs to its present fleet of rolling stock. These units specially designed for specific service sectors of Sri Lanka Railways such as 7 units will be deployed for the main line, 4 units for the Kelani Valley line and the balance 2 units will be used for tourist transportation. It is scheduled to procure 13 DMUs in four batches by September 2012. STAFF_NOTE: These 13 Diesel Multiple Units are in addition to the 15 Diesel Multiple Units committed in 2007 (see project ID #33260).
sources: http://www.erd.gov.lk/files/Parliament%20Question%20-%20Export%20Credit%2022.052014.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.erd.gov.lk/images/pdf/performance_report_2010.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.treasury.gov.lk/reports/annualreport/AnnualReport2010-eng.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.treasury.gov.lk/documents/10181/12870/2015/07e97126-41af-4d72-98ef-a0a813e83731, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
funding_agency: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
implementing_agency: China South Locomotive & Rolling Stock Corporation Limited (CSR), State-Owned Company

title: Supply of 15 Diesel Multiple Units for Sri Lanka Railways
description: According to the 2007 Annual Report from the Sri Lanka Ministry of Finance, China committed a loan of 38,683,633 USD in 2017 for the supply of 15 diesel multiple units (power train sets) to Sri Lanka (see p. 351). The power train sets would be supplied to Sri Lanka by China National Machinery Import and Export Corporation (CMC). This is part of efforts to modernize the Sri Lankan Railway system and reduce inconvenience caused to commuters travelling from Colombo to the sub urban areas and on the Kelani Valley route. According to the 2008 Annual Report from the Sri Lanka Ministry of Finance, this project was under implementation in 2008 (see p. 214). The first 3 batches were scheduled to reach Colombo by August 2008, and the other 12 train sets were to be delivered in two batches of 6 in September and December 2008. According to the 2010 Annual Report, the project was completed in 2009 (see p. 192 of 2009 Annual Report & p. 322 of 2010 Annual Report). It is worth noting that in 2007 China also committed a loan for the provision of 100 carriages to Sri Lanka (see project ID #33275), and in 2010 China committed a loan for the provision of an additional 13 diesel multiple units (see project ID #49343).

title: 5th Power Development Project
description: On December 27th, 2016, China's Export-Import Bank loaned $75,395,226 USD to the Maldives' State Electric Company (STELCO) for the 5th Power Development Project. As of the end of September 2018, the disbursed Outstanding Debt was $55,860,790 USD. The project includes the installation of six 8.9 MW diesel generators, and the plant will eventually have the capacity to generate 50 MW of power to Male', Mulule' and Hulhumale' via the Sina-Male' Bridge (the China Maldives Friendship Bridge). This will be the largest power project in Maldives, funded by a loan from EXIM Bank to STELCO and contracted to Dongfang Electric International Corporation. The project commenced implementation in February 2017. According to Dongfang's website, the first unit of the Fifth Power Development Project was successfully synchronized on January 18th, 2019, and according to STELCO the Fifth Power Project would begin functioning in April 2019. As of June 2019, it is unclear whether or not the project has been completed. The loan details are not specified in available resources.

title: CDB loans $750m to India's Reliance Communications (Facility I) (Linked to #54348, #54349, #54350)
description: On June 4, 2008, Reliance Communications (RCOM) obtained a $750 million USD (Rs 3,000 crore) loan from China Development Bank to fund its nationwide GSM foray. RCOM sources said the company has already received all necessary approvals including that of RBI for the said amount, whose tenure is for 10 years and has an interest rate of the applicable LIBOR and a margin of 1.8%, making the interest rate 4.032%. The loan would finance RCOM's GSM equipment order placed with Chinese network major Huawei. In January this year, RCOM had awarded a nationwide GSM rollout contract for electronics valued at about $500-600 million USD to Huawei. As of December 31st, 2014, $518 million USD of the loan was outstanding.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ECTIM00020080515e45g00004&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BSNLNE0020080515e45g0000m&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.domain-b.com/companies/companies_r/Reliance_infocom/20080516_anil_ambani.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://ismb-india.blogspot.com/2008/05/rcom-gets-750-m-loan-from-chinese-bank.html, Social Media, including Unofficial Blogs; http://www.financialexpress.com/archive/rcom-gets-rs-3000-cr-loan-from-chinese-bank/310311/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.pressreader.com/india/economic-times/20080516/282093452475936, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://links.sgx.com/FileOpen/Reliance%20Communications%20-%20Final%20OC.ashx?App=Prospectus&FileID=26422, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source
