title: CDB, BOC, and China Exim Bank Loan $1.1 billion USD for Reliance Power's 3,960MW coal-fired Sasan Ultra Mega Power Project (UMPP) (sub project of #43106)
description: On December 15th, 2010, the China Development Bank, Bank of China, China ExIm Bank, and the Standard Chartered Bank loaned $1.1 billion USD for the debt refinancing of Reliance Power's 3,960MW coal-fired Sasan Ultra Mega Power Project (UMPP). The loan is insured by SinoSure and has a maturity of 13 years. The loan will primarily be used to purchase power equipment from Shanghai Electric (#43107). The equipment would be delivered to Krishnapatnam ultra mega power project, Chitrangi power project and Tilaiya ultra mega power project, as well as the Rosa, Butibori and Sasan plants. The equipment will provide 30K MW of coal-based power capacity, and includes 42 power generators of 660MW power. The Sasan UMPP has 6 power towers of 660MW each and is a 'super-critical technology based pit-head coal-fired power generating plant.' In addition, four other loans with different terms contributed to the debt refinancing of Sasan UMPP for an overall total $2.181 billion USD in loans. In an International commercial bank insured loan the DBS Bank, Mizuho Financial Group, and Standard Chartered Bank each loaned $50 million USD; with a 13 year maturity and interest rates of Libor +375bp to April 2015 Libor +400bp to April 2019 Libor +415bp afterwards. This is a sub-project of the 12B dollar export credit-based MoU signed in October of 2010 (#43106). The unaccounted for funds have been coded in the original umbrella project.

title: China Commits 20 Jeeps to Kyrgyz Interior Ministry
description: On September 20, 2002, the Ministry of Public Security of China agreed to hand over 1.4 million CNY worth of Jeeps and technical assistance to the Ministry of Interior Affairs of the Kyrgyz Republic. The agreement was signed by the Minister of Public Security Jia Chunvan and Ambassador of the Kyrgyz Republic to China Erlan Abdyldaev.

title: China Commits to Give Uniforms worth US$150,000 to Uzbekistan's Police
description: In February 2015, the Ministry of Public Security of China signed an agreement to provide uniforms (summer and winter clothing) to Uzbekistan's Ministry of Internal Affairs' policemen for a total amount of USD$150,000.
sources: http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201502/20150200888013.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
funding_agency: Ministry of Public Security in China, Government Agency

title: China Development Bank loan to develop CDMA-450 mobile network, and implement FTTx fiber technology (linked to #53952)
description: In 2012, China Development Bank agreed to loan Uzbekistan's Uzbek Telecom (Uzbektelecom) $107.6 million for the purpose of network expansion, developing the CDMA-450 mobile network, and implementation of FTTx fiber technology. The funds were sent in the second quarter of 2013, with which Uzbektelecom was expected to purchase implementation technology. These funds were also earmarked for overall network expansion and infrastructure improvements This project is linked to #53952. Only the confirmed costs for developing the CDMA-450 mobile network - US$18.19 million and implementing FTTx fiber technology US$9.01 million is recorded for this project. The project is also mentioned in China EXIM Bank annual report for 2016 (see attached exim source p.52); it is unclear how or whether China EXIM is financially involved.

title: China Development Bank loans US$100 million for expanding telecom network
description: In June 2010, Axiata (Bangladesh) Ltd, a telecommunication company (operating in Bangladesh under the brand name Robi), signed an MoU with China Development Bank and Huawei Technologies (Bangladesh) Ltd., to expand its telecom network across the country. CDB would loan $100 million to Robi, who would in turn purchase machinery/infrastructure from Huawei. The current status of the project is unknown.

title: China Development Provides US$10 million for Uzbek Universities to join E-Education Network
description: In 2012, China Development Bank provided US$10 million to assist Uzbekistan's schools in joining the 'E-eduction network.' The funding was part of an overall loan of US$37.2 million for ICT projects in Uzbekistan (captured in project #53952).

title: China Donated USD 22,700 to Youth and Sports Ministry of Maldives
description: On September 19, 2017, China donated USD 22,700 to the Youth and Sports Ministry of Maldives for the development of the Maldivian sports industry. The funds will be used to procure equipment for sports associations across the Maldives islands. The Chinese ambassador to the Maldives and the Maldivian Sports Minister attended the ceremony in Male, Maldives.

title: China Donates $1,500 to Give 2870 Textbooks to Two Schools in Tajikistan
description: In August 2004, The Chinese embassy in Tajikistan donated 2,870 textbooks in Russian to two secondary schools in Dushanbe. 2,870 textbooks worth 1,500 dollars had been given to school number 51 and the presidential school.

title: China Donates Equipment to Kyrgyz Police
description: On October 13th 2003, the Ministry of Public Security in China made a donation to Kyrgyzstan police, and it is the third donation from China since 2001. This donation includes 50 Beijing jeeps and an equipment used in detective experiments. It is to help maintain social security in Kyrgyzstan and better protect Kirghiz and Chinese citizens living in the central Asian country from crime.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCAPP0020031013dzad004sa&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China Exim Bank loans 86M for The Paksat-1R ground control in Pakistan (linked to #43298)
description: The contract for the ground control segment of the satellite was signed in October 2009 during Prime Minister Yusuf Raza Gilani's visit to China. The loan agreement was later signed on Oct 29, 2010 by Ambassador Masood Khan on behalf of Economic Affairs Division with the EXIM Bank of China. Under the agreement, China would provide a concessional loan of RMB 86.5 million for the ground control project. On August 11, 2011, the satellite was launched from the Xichang Satellite Launch Center in Sichuan, China. On Nov 11, the ground control center was transferred to the Pakistani side for use. The contract for the construction and launch of the satellite was signed between Pakistan's Space and Upper Atmosphere Research Commission (SUPARCO) and China Great Wall Industry Corporation in October 2008. China's Exim Bank also provided a 1.385B RMB loan for the construction of the satellite. For further detail, see project #43298. STAFF_NOTE: A separate loan agreement was signed in 2010 for the ground control center. Therefore, the coder determined that this loan was not included in the CNY1.385 billion loan captured in project $43298.

title: China Eximbank loans $19 million for computer class equipment to 1900 schools in Uzbekistan
description: In 2007, China Eximbank provided a $19 million loan to Uzbekistan for the provision of computer class equipment to 1900 basic educational schools. As of June 2007, $10.9 million had been disbursed, with $8.1 million yet to be disbursed. Loan details are unknown. STAFF_NOTE: Project was recorded in Uzbekistan's 2008 IMF report but loan could have been committed earlier, so year is marked uncertain.

title: China Finances Telecommunication Installation at 15 Medical Facilities in Kyrgyzstan
description: In July 2017, the Chinese government granted computers for the installation of a video telecommunications network for 15 medical facilities in Kyrgyzstan. To implement this project, the Chinese government provided computers and network equipment to the Kyrgyz medical facilities. The Urumqi government of the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region agreed to the installation in accordance with the Cross-Border Remote Medical Services on the Silk Road Platform.

title: China General Administration of Sports donates 254,000 rufiyaa worth of sports equipment to Athletics Association of Maldives
description: In April 2008 the Chinese government donated athletics equipment worth 254,000 Maldivian rufiyaa to the government of the Maldives. The equipment was donated to the Athletics Association of Maldives from the China General Administration of Sports. Equipment included discus, relay batons, javelins, shot, high jump bed, high jump posts, medicine balls, starting guns, weight jackets, stopwatches and wheel measuring tapes.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCSAP0020080417e44h00231&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China Grants $2.7m Worth of Equipment to Tajik Drug Control Agency
description: In 2007, China granted the Drug Control Agency of Tajikistan funding for mobile drug testing equipment to detect illicit substances in vehicles and containers. The Flat Export of AIMS Tajikistan as of May 2018 reports a 'Mobile inspection-examination complex' project funded by Chinese government for $2,739,726 USD, which is the amount captured in this project. Other media sources list the total amount as $4 million USD.

title: China Grants 19 computers to Autism Association in Maldives (linked to #53962)

title: China Grants 31 Buses Worth 10 Million Yuan to Tajikistan
description: In July 3, 2000, on the eve of President of China Jiang Zemin's official visit to Tajikistan, 31 buses were dispatched to Dushanbe from China. The buses had been provided under free technical aid (10m yuans). An official ceremony for handing over the buses was 4th July, with the participation of the Chinese government's official delegation.

title: China Grants 50 million Yuan for Non-Emergency Humanitarian Aid to Afghanistan (Linked to #54009, #53635, and #53999)
description: On May 16th, 2016, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang and Afghan Chief Executive Officer Abdullah Abdullah signed six bilateral cooperation documents, including an exchange note granting 50 million yuan of non-emergency humanitarian aid to Afghanistan. The assistance included food and non-food items such as tents and blankets that are intended for Afghan refugees, war displaced families, and people affected by natural disasters. It was delivered in December of 2016. Other documents signed on this date include: an agreement to grant 500 million yuan (#54009), a trade agreement for saffron, a Memorandum of Understanding on the nature of the One Belt One Road Initiative, an exchange note on the construction of the auditorium at Kabul university (#53635), and an exchange note on China creating a survey for the construction of affordable housing for civil service employees in Kabul (#53999).
sources: http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/wxzl/t1392473.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=HNASNI0020160517ec5h000ry&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=HNASNI0020160517ec5h000ry&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020160518ec5i00899&cat=a&ep=ASE , Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://prod.tolonews.com/afghanistan/afghanistan-china-sign-six-cooperation-agreements, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://ceo.gov.af/en/news/joint-statement-between-the-peoples-republic-of-china-and-the-islamic-republic-of-afghanistan, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.mfa.gov.cn/chn//pds/wjdt/zwbd/t1437807.htm , Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://web.archive.org/web/20161223143823/http://usa.chinadaily.com.cn/world/2016-12/22/content_27742495.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/mfa_eng/wjdt_665385/2649_665393/t1367681.shtml, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

title: China Grants 8.5 million USD of Agricultural Equipment to Afghanistan's Ministry of Agriculture
description: On August 25th, 2015, Chinese Ambassador Deng Xijun granted 300 tractors and agricultural equipment worth 8.5 million USD to Assadullah Zamir, Minister of Agriculture, Irrigation, and Livestock, in a handover ceremony. China additionally sent 10 experts to teach Afghani how to use the machinery with the goal of improving productivity, through the mechanization of agriculture, to reach self-sufficiency. On November 8th, 2016, Afghanistan's High Economic Council decided to distribute the machinery to private seed companies, agricultural cooperatives, and mechanized agricultural stations. Distribution depends on each company's debt status and accordance to legislative standards. As of Jan 4th, 2018, all machinery has been handed over to Afghanistan as of August 2015, but it is unclear whether the machinery has been distributed internally within Afghanistan. STAFF_NOTE: Initial article indicated that these tractors may be related to International NGO ChinaAid, but further research suggested that the agricultural equipment originated from the Chinese government.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PARALL0020150902eb91000ha&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WOTMkyOapLI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sjofHAPB22I, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://bakhtarnews.com.af/eng/business/item/18763-china-donates-300-tractors-to-afghanistan.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.bakhtarnews.com.af/eng/politics/item/25894-hec-holds-session.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.afghanistantimes.af/china-donates-300-tractors-to-mail/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://af.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zxhz/201501/20150100879514.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
implementing_agency: Afghanistan Ministry of Agriculture, Government Agency
recipient_agencies: Afghanistan Ministry of Agriculture, Government Agency
contacts: Assadullah Zamir, Minister (Afghanistan Ministry of Agriculture); Deng Xijun, Ambassador (China)

title: China and Sri Lanka fund 300 RsMn MRI scanner for Colombo North Teaching Hospital
description: Based on a 2017 Report by Sri Lanka's Department of Project Management and Monitoring Ministry of Development Assignments, China and Sri Lanka are funding the provision of one MRI Scanner for Colombo North Teaching Hospital. The expected cost of this project is 300,000,000 RsMn. It is unclear how much of this total cost if being covered by each of the governments. The physical progress of this project was at 20% as of December 31st, 2017, which was behind schedule due to delays in signing agreements. The project is expected to be completed in 2019. STAFF_NOTE: since China's contribution to this project is unknown, the transaction amount was left blank.
sources: http://www.pmm.gov.lk/resources/ENGLISH_FULL_2017.12.31.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.pmm.gov.lk/resources/Third_quarter_2017-new.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China assists the Pakistani Parliament solar photovoltaic power supply project
description: Oct 29, 2014, officials from the two countries signed an agreement about the cooperation on the Pakistani parliament solar power project. On February 23, 2016, the lighting ceremony of the Pakistani Parliament Building solar photovoltaic project was held in Islamabad. Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif switched on the solar-powered building. STAFF_NOTE: NOV 19 2018 South and Central Asia Scrape According to the Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Year Book in the fiscal year of 2015/16, the project entails the installation of solar panels on the parliament house. It includes a grant assistance of RMB45 million. The project was completed and handed over to National Assembly Secretariat by the contractor on 16-03-2016. A media source, the Economic Times, reports the amount donated by China as $55 million USD, but the amount reported in an official Pakistani report is what has been recorded here.
sources: http://pk.china-embassy.org/chn/zbgx/t1206121.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://pk.china-embassy.org/chn/zbgx/t1342921.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.ead.gov.pk/userfiles1/file/EAD/2018/Website%20Year%20Book%202015-2016.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2014/jan/20/pakistan-parliament-turns-to-solar-power, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://tribune.com.pk/story/1052577/pm-nawaz-inaugurates-worlds-first-solar-parliament/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/international/world-news/pakistan-parliament-becomes-first-in-world-to-run-entirely-on-solar-power/articleshow/51107093.cms, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://fec.mofcom.gov.cn/article/gbdqzn/upload/bajisitan.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China commits to grant 30 million RMB worth of gasometers
description: In December 2001, an agreement was signed between China and Uzbekistan in which China would supply 30 million RMB worth of gasometers. The current state of this project is unknown.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=bbcca00020011206dxc50000a&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Abdulaziz Komilov, Foreign Minister of Uzbekistan ; Zhiming Zhang, Ambassador (Chinese Embassy)

title: China commits to grant of 4.15 million Chinese Yuan to Pakistan for Collaborative Hybrid Rice Breeding Project
description: China committed grant of 4.15 million Chinese Yuan to Pakistan for Hybrid Rice breeding. The agreement for the project was signed in Pakistan on April 6, 2001. The project would lead to transfer of technology and would be undertaken by the ARC. An Min, visiting Chinese vice Minister for Trade & Economic Cooperation and Nawid Ahsan, Secretary, Economic affairs division signed and exchanged letters on behalf of their respective governments for Pak-China Collaborative Hybrid Rice Breeding Project.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=paprin0020010714dx4600co2&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Nawid Ahsan, Secretary Economic affairs division ; An Min, Chinese vice Minister for Trade and Economic Cooperation

title: China commits to provide mobile inspection systems to Uzbekistan for customs procedures
description: On July 25, 2013, Uzbekistan and China signed an exchange note on implementation of the project on supply of mobile inspection complexes to equip customs posts of Uzbekistan with the grant of the Government of China. The signing ceremony was held at the Ministry of Foreign Economic Relations, Investment and Trade. Minister of Foreign Economic Relations, Investment and Trade of Uzbekistan Elyor Ganiev and Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of China Zhang Xiao signed the document. The project included supply of mobile inspection complexes, their assembly and commissioning at the border customs posts, and training of employees of the customs services.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=CEASEN0020130727e97q00003&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=UZREPE0020130726e97q000b5&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://uz.chineseembassy.org/chn/zwgx/jmhz/t1061884.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Zhang Xiao, Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of China ; Elyor Ganiev, Minister of Foreign Economic Relations, Investment and Trade

title: China delivers 5 million RMB of equipment to Kyrgyz National TV and Radio Broadcasting Corporation
description: On May 1, 2004, China delivered and installed equipment at the Krygryz National TV and Radio Broadcasting Corporation. These equipment is worth 5 million Yuan. STAFF_NOTE: linked to #39994
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCAPP0020040501e051001e2&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China donates $1 million in material aid to Afghanistan's Legislature
description: In April 2005, during the Afghan Vice President visit to China, China agreed to provide an assortment of items to Afghanistan's legislature. The aid was worth $1 million. It includes a CCTV system, 24 cameras, 20 jeeps, 20 pickup trucks, and kitchen utensils. It is not known if a specific Chinese organization or agency was responsible for procuring and giving the donation. The handover ceremony was held on November 9
sources: http://af.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/200611/20061103901530.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://reliefweb.int/report/afghanistan/aid-worth-1-mln-usd-donated-afghan, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
implementing_agency: Afghanistan National Assembly
recipient_agencies: Afghanistan National Assembly

title: China donates $1.1 million in stationery items to Afghanistan
description: In 2003 China donated 1.1 million USD worth of stationery items to Afghanistan's transitional government in order to assist with its administrative tasks. There is 80,000 items in donation in total. It includes printing paper, inks, notebook, pen. Documents for this donation were signed in August between the transitional government and China's Ambassador to Afghanistan.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020030814dz8b000cv&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Yousof Aitebar, Chief of Afghan Administrative Office ; Sun Yuxi, Ambassador to Afghanistan

title: China donates $1.5 million USD to the Defense Service College in Sri Lanka
description: On 30 August 2012 China donated $1.5 million USD to the Defense Service College in Sri Lanka, a national school established for children of defense services and police personnel. The donation included funds and materials for a fully fledged laboratory, furniture to the school, fridges, microwave ovens, etc.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=DAINSL0020120830e88v0005v&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.c3sindia.org/southasia/3052, Academic Journal Article; http://www.thehindu.com/news/international/china-funds-to-modernise-sri-lankan-military-training-establishment/article3847937.ece, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.defence.lk/new.asp?fname=Chinese_grant_of_30_m_to_Defence_Service_College_20120831_03, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://defence.pk/pdf/threads/china-gains-edge-in-sri-lanka.192793/, Social Media, including Unofficial Blogs
contacts: Liang Guanglie, Defense Minister of China

title: China donates $1m in aid to Afghan parliament
description: In 2006 China donated vehicles, security equipment and kitchenware to the Afghan Parliament. This donation was worth 1 million USD, and included 20 jeeps, 20 pickup trucks, sets of security monitoring system, and cooking supplies.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020061109e2b90066a&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.gov.cn/misc/2006-11/10/content_438349.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Ghulam Hassan Gan, eputy Secretary-general of the lower house of Afghan parliament ; Liu Jian, Chinese ambassador to Afghanistan

title: China donates $1m in office and sports equipment to Afghan government (Linked to Project ID#34515)
description: On 5 October, 2004, the Chinese government donated office equipment and recreational materials to Afghanistan's transitional government. This included 400 computers, 300 printers, TV sets, digital cameras, footballs, volleyballs and other athletic equipment. This donation was worth $1m. Chinese Ambassador to Afghanistan Sun Yuxi and Afghan Foreign Minister A. Abdulla signed the notes of exchange. This is the fourth largest donation made by China; in June 2004, China had just donated communication equipment and vehicles to the Afghan government (See Project ID#34515)
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020041005e0a50035x&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://in.china-embassy.org/eng/zgbd/t163322.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: A. Abdulla, Afghan Foreign Minister ; Sun Yuxi , Chinese Ambassador to Afghanistan

title: China donates $2m in non-military items to the Afghanistan National Army
description: On 11 January 2007, the Chinese government donated non-military items to the Afghanistan National Army. The value of this aid is US$2 million, and included 10 trucks, 12 Jeeps, 17 cars, 100 computers, 30 photocopy machines, 100 printers, 100 air conditioners, 140 TV sets, refrigerators, a diesel generator, shoes, tents, axes and shovels and electric fans.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020070111e31b002wh&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.afghanemb-canada.net/public-affairs-afghanistan-embassy-canada-ottawa/daily-news-bulletin-afghanistan-embassy-canada-ottawa/2007/news_articles/january/01132007.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://af.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/200701/20070104275457.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China donates 1.3 million USD worth of logistic materials for the constituent assembly election in Nepal
description: In July 2007, Chinese Assistant Minister of Commerce Wang Chao and Nepali Prime Minister Girija Prasad Koirala signed letters of exchange on China's logistic materials aid worth 1.3 million USD for the November 2007 constituent assembly elections. In November 2007, China handed over the logistic materials for the elections and both parties signed and exchanged the delivery and receipt certificates.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=XNEWS00020070726e37q000b7&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=PRTRIN0020070726e37p0005y&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://en.people.cn/90001/90776/6224613.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://np.china-embassy.org/eng/ChinaNepal/t380869.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Zheng Xianglin, Chinese Ambassador to Nepal

title: China donates 1.8 million USD worth of cars to Kyrgyzstan
description: The signing ceremony of an agreement was held today. According to the agreement, the Chinese government will provide as a grant cars worth 1.8 dollars to the Kyrgyz government for state protocol needs. The document was signed by Kyrgyz Foreign Minister Alikbek Dzhekshenkulov and Chinese Ambassador to Kyrgyzstan Hong Jiuyin. Staff_note: some other sources indicate that this is a loan. Need further research to figure out.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=BBCCA00020060930e29u0018h&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://books.google.com/books?id=wkyiAgAAQBAJ&pg=PT197&lpg=PT197&dq=CHina+fiber+optic+loan+turkmenistan&source=bl&ots=t-cXWhRupb&sig=yGacJ6jg9t6bylAzU1B3_SjvNsE&hl=en&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwiMtOCazrTfAhXHxlkKHaORDh4Q6AEwCHoECAYQAQ#v=onepage&q=CHina%20fiber%20optic%20loan%20turkmenistan&f=false, Academic Journal Article

title: China donates 10 million RMB worth of supplies for Nepal's General Elections
description: In 2013, the Letter of Exchange on the Logistics Materials of Office Supplies for the Constituent Assembly Election was signed and exchanged between the Chinese and Nepalese governments. The value of the materials for constituent assembly election purpose will be equivalent to 10 million RMB (approximately NRS 154.1 million). On 27 September 2013, the plane with the election materials arrived in Kathmandu, including ballot papers and office materials. Chinese Ambassador to Nepal Wu Chuntai and joint secretary of Nepal Election Commission Maheshow Neupane were present at the airport to receive the materials. These materials will be used for the conduction of the Nepal's 27th general elections on 19 November 2013.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=HTREPB0020130625e96p0008g&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020130927e99r002xm&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://np.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201309/20130900328264.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://np.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201310/20131000342292.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://amis.mof.gov.np/portal/node/9, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://np.china-embassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1082537.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://np.chineseembassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1082493.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Yang Jiechi, State Councilor of the People's Republic of China ; Khil Raj Regmi, Chairman of the Interim Election Council of Ministers ; Maheshow Neupane, Joint Secretary of Nepal Election Commission ; Wu Chuntai, Chinese Ambassador to Nepal

title: China donates 10 sets of computers to Shree Kalinag Higher Secondary School in Nepal
description: In May 2010, Chinese Ambassador to Nepal Qiu Guohong visited Dolakha district in the northern part of Nepal and offered ten sets of computers to Shree Kalinag Higher Secondary School in a remote village of the district.
sources: http://np.china-embassy.org/eng/Education/t696480.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Qiu Guohong, Chinese Ambassador to Nepal

title: China donates 10.5 million Rs of office equipment to Pakistan
description: On 11 June 2005, the Chinese government granted office equipment worth 10.5 million Rs to the Pakistani government to facilitate offices with modern facilities. A ceremony for the signing of an agreement on the handover of the equipment was held in Islamabad, with Chinese Ambassador Zhang Chunxiang and Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Secretary Khalid Saeed inking the document on behalf of their respective governments. The office equipment, including 145 computers, printers, scanners, fax machines and photocopiers, was provided under the grant assistance agreement on economic and technical cooperation between Pakistan and China signed in 2001.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCAPP0020050612e16c000p1&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020050611e16b0053d&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=NBBALU0020050616e16b0006o&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://pk.chineseembassy.org/chn/sghd/t199574.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
funding_agency: Chinese Embassy, Government Agency
contacts: khalid Saeed, Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Secretary ; Zhang Chunxiang, Chinese Ambassador (Chinese Embassy)

title: China donates 100 ambulances to Afghanistan
description: In 2011, two agreements were signed for the donation of 100 ambulances by the Chinese government to Afghanistan's Ministry of Public Health. The first agreement, which was for the first 50 batch of ambulance, was signed on 17 October 2011 by Dr. Soraya Dalil, Acting Minister of Public Health and Hogen Chen, Trade and Economic Counselor of Chinese Embassy in Kabul. The second agreement for the second batch of ambulance was signed on 14 December 2011 by Wu Gangchen, the Commercial counselor of China embassy in Afghan and Abdul Baser Sarwar, Deputy Minister of Public Health of Afghanistan. The ambulances are worth 4 million USD and were delivered to Afghanistan by China Tianjin Universal Machinery Import and Export Corporation(UMAC). Delivery of the ambulance began in 2011. Afghan Public Health Ministry released a statement regarding the donation on 20 September 2012, suggesting that the 100 ambulance had been delivered. These ambulances were to be distributed to health facilities in various provinces throughout Afghanistan.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=CHNDHK0020121007e8a800074&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.libproxy1.nus.edu.sg/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BAKHNA0020111020e7ai00001&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://moph.gov.af/en/news/4126, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://english.mofcom.gov.cn/aarticle/counselorsreport/asiareport/201112/20111207879361.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/world/2012-09/20/c_131863211.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://en.tmg.cn/comcontent_detail5/&FrontComContent_list01-1337568580834CurrentIds=2a3e7569-ff8f-46f5-92d8-1e42a1437513__3ce7b048-cc75-4907-9fbb-f3e2f59de58d&comContentId=3ce7b048-cc75-4907-9fbb-f3e2f59de58d.html, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/sbwl/t972618.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
implementing_agency: Afghanistan Ministry of Public Health, Government Agency
recipient_agencies: Afghanistan Ministry of Public Health, Government Agency
contacts: Xu Feihong, Ambassador to Afghanistan (China Ministry of Foreign Affairs); Saraya Dalil, Minister of Public Health

title: China donates 100 computers to college in Sri Lanka
description: In 2014, China donated 100 computers to the K.D. Ebert Memorial Computer Laboratory at Thurstan College, Colombo, Sri Lanka.
sources: http://lk.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201406/20140600616972.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://lk.china-embassy.org/eng/xwdt/t1164817.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://lk.china-embassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1164435.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://lk.chineseembassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1164435.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Mahinda Rajapaksa , Sri Lankan President ; Ren Faqiang, Charge d'Affaires of Chinese Embassy ; Liu Yunshan, Member of Standing Committee of Political Bureau of CPC Central Committee

title: China donates 150 police motorcycles worth 2M yuan to Maldives
description: In January 2015, the Chinese Embassy handed over 150 police motorcycles to the police service in Male, Maldives. The cost of the motorcycles is about 2 million yuan. The exchange of notes for the donation of 150 police motorcycles was signed in 2014 when the President of Maldives visited China.
sources: http://mv.china-embassy.org/chn/zmgx/hfyjl/t1229814.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://foreign.gov.mv/v2/en/media-center/news/article/925, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=MIADMD0020150121eb1l00006&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.policelife.mv/page/87875, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China donates 150 swimming boards to the Swimming Association of Maldives
description: On August 11, 2014, the Chinese Embassy announced its financial support for a program to teach children how to swim. Wang Fukang, Chinese Ambassador to Maldives, delivered 150 swimming boards to Swimming Association of Maldives.
sources: http://mv.chineseembassy.org/chn/zmgx/hfyjl/t1181940.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Wang Fukang, Chinese Ambassador to Maldives

title: China donates 16 million RMB waste handling equipments to Nepal
description: In August 2010, China donated waste handling equipment and supplies worth more than 16 million RMB (300 million Nepali Rupees) to Nepal's capital city, Kathmandu. The 138 cleaning/sanitation vehicles and equipment include sealed garbage trucks, compression garbage trucks, sweepers, sprinklers, other modern garbage processing equipment, 4000 240 liter containers and 4 ambulances. This batch of equipment and supplies will greatly improve the Kathmandu municipal management conditions and enhance the aesthetic appearance of the city. In October 2010, only several of the vehicles and containers were in use due to lack of Pollution Clearance Letters which were expected to arrive shortly.
sources: http://np.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201008/20100807106078.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/aa/?ref=ATHIMT0020100721e67k00001&pp=1&fcpil=zhcn&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/aa/?ref=HTREPB0020100827e68r0005p&pp=1&fcpil=zhcn&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China donates 18,000 USD worth of medicine and equipment to B.P. Koirala Memorial Cancer Hospital in Nepal (linked to #34393 and #38346)
description: In August 2007, Chinese Ambassador to Nepal Zheng Xianglin handed over a donation consisting of cancer treatment medicine and equipment to Secretary of Nepali Ministry of Health and Population Ram Chandra Man Singh. The donation, worth around 18,000 USD, was given to B.P. Koirala Cancer Hospital. In February 2000, both sides exchanged a letter concerning technical aid to the B. P. Koirala Memorial Cancer Hospital.

title: China donates 1million yuan worth equipment to Kazakh police
description: On February 19, 2003 China's Public Security Ministry donated police equipment to the Kazakh Interior Ministry in Almaty. The total cost was 1mil yuan. The police equipment and technology supplied by China includes night vision devices, metal detectors, microscopes, tape recorders, computers, scanners, printers, photo equipment, telephones and flashlights. The agreement on the supply of special equipment by the Chinese Public Security Ministry as technical no-strings aid to the Kazakh Interior Ministry was signed by the sides in Beijing on November 18, 2002.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=bbcca00020030220dz2j00014&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://books.google.com/books?id=AOjIWDJaYQ0C&pg=PA20&lpg=PA20&dq=china+donates+equipment+kazakhstan+police&source=bl&ots=fHWLVMgYkj&sig=nv-SySz01gJNKqbp7L6YA0w7lAU&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwii0Myj4-fKAhVKND4KHb6xDrsQ6AEIJzAC#v=onepage&q=china%20donates%20equipment%20kazakhstan%20police&f=false, Other Academic (Working Paper, Dissertation); http://china.org.cn/english/2003/Jun/65983.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Yao Peisheng, Chinese Ambassador to Kazakhstan

title: China donates 2 million Rs worth of computers and furniture to schools in Nepal
description: In April 9 2010, Chinese Ambassador to Nepal Qiu Guohong visited Ilam District of Eastern Nepal and gave some computer and furniture assistance worth 2 million Rupees to Jitpur Higher Secondary School, Janata Higher Secondary School and Bishnu Secondary School in remote villages.
sources: http://np.china-embassy.org/eng/Education/t678883.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Qiu Guohong, Chinese Ambassador to Nepal

title: China donates 2.86 million USD mobile X-ray machine to Nepal
description: In March 2005, Nepal received a mobile X-ray machine valued at 2.86 million USD for use in the Birgunj Customs office. The donation was made in accordance with an agreement signed in 2002 between China and Nepal for general technical cooperation. A six person Chinese technical team arrived in Nepal shortly after the X-ray machine to assist with set up and initial operation. The team will stay for one year to offer maintenance.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/aa/?ref=XNEWS00020050306e136003bh&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.telegraphnepal.com/views/2012-05-01/nepal-china-relations-stand-as-example-of-good-neighborliness.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://nepalembassy.org.cn/nepal-china-relations/dimensions-of-current-relations/, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China donates 20,000 USD worth of medicine to B. P. Koirala Memorial Cancer Hospital in Nepal (linked to #34386 and #38346)
description: In 2008, China donated 20,000 USD worth of medicines to Nepal's B. P. Koirala Memorial Cancer Hospital. Chinese Ambassador to Nepal Zheng Xianglin handed over the medicine to the hospital on behalf of the Chinese government. In February 2000, an exchange of letter concerning technical aid to the B. P. Koirala Memorial Cancer Hospital were exchanged.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=BBCAPP0020080927e49r002jp&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=xnews00020010818dw2g01i3y&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=bbcsap0020010804dw2g006lz&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks

contacts: Ram Baran Yadav, Nepali President ; Zheng Xianglin, Chinese Ambassador to Nepal

title: China donates 3 million yuan in food aid to Nepal (Linked to Project ID #34410 and #34426)
description: In April 2009, China announced a 3 million yuan grant to Nepal for food assistance. The aid will be disbursed over five years, which consists of sugar, salt and other basic necessities for the northern region of Nepal. Chairman to Tibet Autonomous Region Champa Phuntshok announced the aid package during Nepalese Foreign Minister Upendra Yadav's visit to China. STAFF_NOTE: Projects #34410 and #34426 are most likely donations from this pledge.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=PRTRIN0020090407e5460000q&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://np.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/200904/20090406153445.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://np.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/200911/20091106631476.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.ekantipur.com/2015/03/18/business/china-jacks-up-aid-to-nepal-five-fold/402975.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://news.qq.com/a/20090404/000877.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.mof.gov.np/uploads/document/file/DP_Profile_2014_20140918055857.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Upendra Yadav, Nepalese Foreign Minister

title: China donates 4,380 tonnes of wheat to Afghanistan
description: In May 2008, Afghanistan received a donation of 2,500 tonnes of wheat from China. The wheat was added to the country's reserves for cases of emergency. Additionally, ten trucks of wheat were given to the Kabul Municipality to be distributed to city bakers in order to reduce bread prices. The 2,500 tonnes which was handed over to the Afghan Ministry of Agriculture was the first consignment of a total donation of 4,380 tonnes of aid. In July 2008, it was reported that Afghanistan had received the rest of the donation. STAFF_NOTE: #34531 should not be duplicate for #34528 as their delivery times, contract signing times are different. This project is edited by November 2018 to add the exact transaction amount as 20 million Chinese Yuan according to the official source from Economic and Commercial Counsellor's Office of China in Afghanistan.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCSAP0020080518e45i0012y&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://ens-newswire.com/ens/jul2008/2008-07-10-01.asp, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/sbwl/t529658.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/sbwl/t529658.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/sbwl/t529658.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://af.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/200806/20080605573057.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
implementing_agency: Afghanistan Ministry of Agriculture, Government Agency
recipient_agencies: Afghanistan Ministry of Agriculture, Government Agency
contacts: Obaidollah Ramin, Minister of Agriculture

title: China donates 40000 wheel chairs to Pakistani charity Bait ul Maal
description: China donated 40,000 wheel chairs to Pakistan Bait ul Maal. It has been declared by Zamurd Khan, manager director of Pakistan Bait ul Maal in Islamabad on 10 May 2011, during a charity event.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=NBBALU0020101207e6c60001m&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=NBBALU0020110218e72i0002a&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.pbm.gov.pk/spf.html, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source
implementing_agency: Pakistan Bait-ul-Mal (PBM) , Government Agency
recipient_agencies: Pakistan Bait-ul-Mal (PBM) , Government Agency
contacts: Zamurd Khan, Managing Director (Pakistan Bait-ul-Mal (PBM) )

title: China donates 5 solar power generators to Divya Deep Secondary Boarding School in Nepal
description: In April 2011, Chinese Ambassador to Nepal Qiu Guohong, on behalf of Chinese Embassy in Nepal, donated five solar power generators to Divya Deep Secondary Boarding School in upper Mustang of Nepal to cope with the need of the school's operations.
sources: http://np.china-embassy.org/eng/ChinaNepal/t813480.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Qiu Guohong, Chinese Ambassador to Nepal

title: China donates 500,000 RMB worth of office equipment to Nepal
description: In June 2007, Chinese Ambassador H.E. Mr. Zheng Xianglin hands over 500,000 RMB worth of office equipment to the Legislature-Parliament of Nepal (LPN). The gifts include 24 laptop computers, 20 desktop computers, 10 laser jet printers and 4 multi-function printers.
sources: http://np.china-embassy.org/eng/ChinaNepal/t331310.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China donates 50M rupees worth of de-mining detectors and equipment to Sri Lanka
description: In March 2010, China donated a stock of de-mining equipment worth 50 million rupees to Sri Lanka to help de-mining activities in the Northern region. Chinese Ambassador to Sri Lanka Yang Xiuping handed over 50 de-mining detectors and 50 de-mining protective equipment kits to Sri Lanka Prime Minister Rathnasiri Wickramanayaka. The donation is expected to accelerate ongoing army de-mining operations in the north as part of resettlement, reconstruction, and rehabilitation efforts taking place under the 'Uthuru Wasanthaya' (Northern Spring) program.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=PMPLUN0020100317e633005c9&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://reliefweb.int/report/sri-lanka/china-helps-de-mining-task, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; http://www.the-monitor.org/index.php/cp/display/region_profiles/theme/3348, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; http://www.colombopage.com/archive_10/Mar1267460483CH.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://lk.china-embassy.org/chn/xwdt/t660799.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://lk.chineseembassy.org/chn/xwdt/t660799.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/chn//gxh/cgb/zcgmzysx/yz/1206_28/1206x1/t5940.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Ratnasiri Wickramanayake, Prime Minister of Sri Lanka ; Yang Xiuping, Chinese Ambassador to Sri Lanka

title: China donates 6 million Yuan police equipments to Afghanistan
description: On November 8, 2014, China delivered police equipment worths 6 million Chinese Yuan to Afghanistan. The equipment was handed to Minister of Interior. The materials handed over by the Chinese side include communication equipment, forensic cameras, police helmets and shields, and rapid detection equipment for drugs (drugs). The Chinese side also provided assistance to the Afghan in equipment operation training. In addition to these, there are some computer equipment, which is Lenovo's E49 model. The network shows that the price of such computers does not exceed RMB 4,000. There is no offensive weapon in this batch of public police materials, indicating that China has taken into consideration its stance and position when choosing assistance, and avoided transmitting information that is deeply involved in the armed conflict in Afghanistan.
sources: http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/sbwl/t1209609.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://news.sina.com.cn/c/2014-11-09/234731118901.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://hlj.ifeng.com/china/detail_2014_11/10/3128967_0.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks
implementing_agency: Afghanistan Ministry of the Interior, Government Agency
recipient_agencies: Afghanistan Ministry of the Interior, Government Agency

title: China donates 800,000 RMB worth of office equipment to the Research Center of Nepal National Trust for Nature Conservation (NTNC)
description: In 2014, China donated modern office equipment including DVD players, computers, scanners and projectors worth over 800,000 Chinese yuan to the Research Center of Nepal National Trust for Nature Conservation (NTNC). Chinese Ambassador to Nepal Wu Chuntai and secretary general of the NTNC Govinda Gajurel signed the 'Delivery and Acceptance Certificate of China-aided Office equipment' in Kathmandu in January. China wishes that the NTNC will make full use of the office equipment and will play a more positive role in protecting natural environment and biological diversity. The agreement was reached in the framework of letters exchanged in August 2012 between the Government of the People‚Äôs Republic of China and the Government of Nepal.
sources: http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/china/2014-01/09/c_133029441.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.ntnc.org.np/news/handover-ceremony-china-aided-office-equipment-ntnc, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://np.china-embassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1116462.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
recipient_agencies: Research Center of Nepal National Trust for Nature Conservation (NTNC)
contacts: Govinda Gajurel , Secretary General of the Research Center of Nepal National Trust for Nature Conservation ; Wu Chuntai [Âê¥Êò•Â§™], Chinese Ambassador to Nepal

title: China donates 9 pickup trucks to Nepal's Ministry of Home Affairs
description: In 2009, Chinese Ambassador to Nepal Qiu Guohong handed over to the Nepalese Ministry of Home Affairs 9 Great Wall Motors pickup trucks as a form of Chinese aid.
sources: http://np.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/200903/20090306132862.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Qiu Guohong [ÈÇ±ÂõΩÊ¥™], Chinese Ambassador to Nepal

title: China donates PKR 110 m to Pakistan to upgrade the Cutlery and Small Tools Industry Centre in Wazirabad (linked to #35837)
description: In 2006, China donated Rs 110 million for upgrading machinery at the Cutlery and Small Tools Industry Centre in Wazirabad, Pakistan. The agreement was signed by Mohsin Syed, the Chairman of Tevta, and Zhou Zhencheng, the Economic & Commercial Counsellor of China. First Secretary of Chinese Embassy in Pakistan Yan Jianming, Zonal Manager (North) Group Captain Muhammad Rashid (Retd), Manager Service Centres Akhtar Abbas Bharwana and Manager Public Relations Mustafa Kamal Pasha were also present. The respective parties also came to an agreement for the financing of a Light Engineering Service Center (#35837). The project has not been completed within the planned duration, due to the delayed documentation between the Government of the Punjab and China. Works started on 1 July 2007 and ended on 30 June 2009. STAFF_NOTE: There is a discrepancy in transaction amount, as some sources say China provided 110 million Rupees, but the report by the Govt. of Punjab (see resources) says the project ended up costing Rs. 76.945 million, and that the planned project cost was 83M Rs. Date is also uncertain, as some sources list 2006 but others say 2008.
sources: http://www.ead.gov.pk/gop/index.php?q=aHR0cDovLzE5Mi4xNjguNzAuMTM2L2VhZC9mcm1EZXRhaWxzLmFzcHg%2FaWQ9NTEmYW1wO29wdD1wdWJsaWNhdGlvbnM%3D, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.google.com.pk/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=1&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0CBsQFjAA&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.dgmepunjab.gov.pk%2Findex.php%3Foption%3Dcom_rubberdoc%26view%3Ddoc%26id%3D84%26format%3Draw%26Itemid%3D229&ei=DCSeVcChHIKZuQSRq4CgDA&usg=AFQjCNFVubO32DSBXGtiAFxo7l-seXJtOg&bvm=bv.96952980,d.c2E, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://app.com.pk/en_/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=58051, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PAPRIN0020081105e4b40000c&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=AIWBUR0020081104e4b500025&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China donates Rs 3 million of food to Nepal (linked to #34400 and #34426)
description: In July 2010, China donated 40,000 USD (Rs. 3 million) worth of food materials to Nepal, including salt, tea, and sugar. Chinese deputy administrator of the Kerung District Bhukung handed over the foodstuffs to local development officer of Rasuwa Ram Mani Bhattarai during a function in Syafrubesi. The food is intended to assist Nepalis living along the border area with China, specifically the locals of Timure and Thumnar Chilime in the bordering area of Rasuwa. STAFF_NOTE: possibly linked to #34400 and #34426
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/aa/?ref=BBCSAP0020100712e67c001up&pp=1&fcpil=zhcn&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.ekantipur.com/2010/07/12/top-story/china-provides-food-assistance/318311.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China donates Video Conference Systems to Afghanistan Ministry of Foreign Affairs
description: On May 10, 2017, Chinese Embassy in Afghanistan donated a Video Conference System to Afghanistan Ministry of Foreign Affair. The original source does not indicate the cost of the system.
sources: http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/sbwl/t1460490.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
funding_agency: Chinese Embassy, Government Agency
implementing_agency: Afghanistan Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Government Agency
recipient_agencies: Afghanistan Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Government Agency

title: China donates books to Sri Lankan schools
description: Exercise books were donated to Dhamma Schools of Gautama Viharaya at Green Park, Narahenpita, Sri Naga Viharaya Kotte, Royal College Colombo, Thilakerathnaramaya Borella and Sri Seewali Dhamma School of Sri Nagaviharaya at Baseline Road. The Sri Lanka-China Friendship Association has made arrangements to distribute books to needy Dhamma Schools in Sri Lanka under the patronage of the Buddhist Association of China (role unclear). This is the second phase of book donation by the Sri Lanka-China Friendship Association. The first phase of the distribution of exercise books was held on June 19, 2011.

title: China donates computer systems to Foreign Service Institute of Maldives
description: In July 2014, the Chinese government donated computer systems to the newly established Foreign Service Institute of Maldives at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. In the handing over ceremony, Minister of Foreign Affairs, Her Excellency Ms. Dunya Maumoon welcomed the Ambassador of People's Republic of China to the Republic of Maldives, His Excellency Mr. Wang Fukang and extended greetings and good wishes from the Government and the people of Maldives to the Government and the people of China.

contacts: Wang Fukang, Chinese Ambassador to Maldives ; Dunya Maumoon, Maldives Minister of Foreign Affairs

title: China donates computers and books to Pakistan
description: In 2000, the Chinese Embassy in Pakistan donated computers and books to Pakistan. Some organizations that received this aid include, All Pakistan China Friendship Association, the University of Punjab, KRL General Hospital, Pakistan National Arts Council, Baluchistan Arts Council, Economic Affairs Division, National Defense College, and the National Agricultural Research Center. The financial value of this aid is unknown.

description: In 2012, Chinese Ambassador Yang Houlan donated computers and other equipment to schools in the Baglung district in Nepal on behalf of the Chinese government.

description: On November 21, 2012, Li Jun,Chinese ambassador to Bangladesh, donated education and assistive devices for persons with disabilities through the Impact Foundation Bangladesh.

title: China donates equipment to Afghan Bakhtar Agency
description: In 2003 the Chinese Embassy in Afghanistan donated equipment to Bakhtar Information Agency. This included three computers, three printers and five bicycles.

title: China donates equipment to Kabul University
description: On February 22, 2016, the Chinese government donated teaching equipment to Kabul University. Chinese Ambassador Yao Jing and Afghanistan Minister of High Education and President of Kabul University attended the ceremony. Among the equipment were laptop and desktop computers, microscopes, UPS (uninterruptible power supply) machines, projectors, printers and stationery. This project should not be confused with the construction of a building and auditorium at Kabul University, #53635.

title: China donates heavy machinery and equipment to Sri Lanka for post-war reconstruction
description: In 2010, China signed a transfer certificate with Sri Lanka regarding the donation of heavy machinery and equipment. China donated 34 heavy machinery and equipment worth over 285.4 million Sri Lanka Rupees for infrastructure development in north and east Sri Lanka. The equipment will be used for the rehabilitation and reconstruction of war-torn areas.

title: China donates material supplies to Afghanistan presidential palace
description: In November 2011 China and Afghanistan signed a contract under which China would donate material supplies to the Afghan presidential palace. On November 23, 2011, The agreement was signed by Wu Gangchen, Commercial Counselor of China Embassy in Afghanistan and Afghanistan Presidential Chief of Staff Abdul Karim Khurram. The material supply are expected to be shipped out in December 2011. On October 1, 2012, the materials handover certificate signing ceremony was held in Afghanistan. Ambassador Xu Feihong and Afghanistan Presidential Chief of Staff Abdul Karim Khurram were present to sign on behalf of their respective governments.
sources: http://af.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zxhz/hzjj/201501/20150100879514.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://af2.mofcom.gov.cn/article/bilateralcooperation/inbrief/201112/20111207857935.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://af2.mofcom.gov.cn/article/headnews/201112/20111207887318.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://af2.mofcom.gov.cn/article/headnews/201112/20111207887102.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/sgxw/t976192.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://af.mofcom.gov.cn/article/todayheader/201111/20111107845033.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China donates medical equipment to National Ayurveda Research and Training Center in Nepal
description: In May 2016, China donated 2.26 million USD worth of medical equipment to Ayurveda Training and Research Center in Kathmandu, Nepal. The equipment included advanced machines for CT scan and X-ray, research tools and kits for basic health and emergency treatments along with training and research materials.

title: China donates medical equipment worth 20,000 USD to Civil Service Hospital in Nepal
description: In 2014, China donated equipment including advanced machines for MRI, digital radiography, mammography, and fluoroscopy worth around 20,000 USD to the Civil Service Hospital in Kathmandu, Nepal.

title: China donates meteorological equipment to Afghanistan
description: In 2003, China donated meteorological equipment to Afghanistan to improve its weather forecasting ability for better airport functioning. The donation included thermometers, psychrometers and hydrographs. The details for this donation were agreed on and committed to by Afghanistan's Civil Aviation Minister and the Chinese Ambassador to Afghanistan on 22 February 2003. This project marked the first time any country has given meteorological support for Afghanistan's aviation industry.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=xnews00020030223dz2m002h2&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://en.people.cn/200302/23/eng20030223_112099.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Sun Yuxi, Chinese Ambassador to Afghanistan ; Mir Wais Sadeq, Afghan Civil Aviation Minister (Afghanistan Ministry of Transport and Civil Aviation)

title: China donates meteorological satellite data receiver to Nepal
description: In 2007, the Chinese Embassy in Nepal donated a China FY-2D satellite data receiving and processing system from the Chinese Meteorological Administration to the Department of Hydrology and Meteorology of the Ministry of Environment, Science and Technology of the Nepali government. Chinese ambassador Zheng Xianglin formally handed over the equipment in a ceremony at the Chinese embassy in Kathmandu.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=XNEWS00020070831e38v005v5&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://nidm.gov.in/PDF/DU/2007/September/02-09-07.pdf, Other Academic (Working Paper, Dissertation)

title: China donates meteorological satellite receivers to Bangladesh (Linked to #35301)
description: In 2006, China donated Fengyun receivers to Bangladesh (among other countries) to integrate it into the Fengyun satellite system, enabling it to receive signals from weather satellites. The system receives real-time data from Chinese and international meteorological satellites and broadcasts the information to the countries. The satellite network will also serve to better integrate the recipient countries with China. This project is linked to #35301, in which China trained satellite receiver operators.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=CHNDLY0020060325e23p00008&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.nsmc.cma.gov.cn/NSMC_EN/CMACast/about.html, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; http://www.gov.cn/misc/2006-03/25/content_236443.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China donates meteorology equipment to Sri Lanka
description: In May 2006, China donated meteorology equipment to Sri Lanka to help improve the island country's weather forecast standard. The donation included temperature-humidity sensors, rainfall sensors and battery cabinets, among others.

title: China donates school supplies to Kazakhstan
description: In May 2017, China donated school supplies to the Hadong people in Kazakhstan. Ambassador Zhang Hanhui met with Anhusai, President of the Association of East Asian People in Kazakhstan in Astana. Through the association, China donated money and 500 sets of textbooks including 2,500 teaching books and 500 reading pens to the Hadong people. The books are meant to teach Chinese to schoolchildren.
sources: http://kz.china-embassy.org/chn/sgxx/sgdt/t1459151.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China donates school supplies to students in village schools in Sri Lanka
description: In 2013, China donated school bags, stationery, books, shoes and socks to students from two village schools in Kurunegala, a Northwestern Province in Sri Lanka.
sources: http://lk.china-embassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1008312.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China donates sea ambulance to Maldives
description: In 2014, during President Xi's official visit to Maldives, he pledged that China will donate rescue boats to Maldives. In 2018, the handover ceremony to Maldives National Defense Force was held. The free aid agreement was signed between the two countries in 2015. The donated sea ambulance is larger and features more medical facilities aboard, compared to Maldives' existing fleet of 25 sea ambulances. The 26-meter-long vessel is equipped with a ‚Äúmini-medical theater,‚Äù according to the MNDF, including facilities for scans, electrocardiography tests, intravenous therapy and oxygen delivery. Speaking at the ceremony, Chinese Ambassador to Maldives Zhang Lizhong stated that the fully equipped sea ambulance would be an asset to the Maldivian health sector, and vowed that China would provide the required technical assistance. Medics regularly encounter drawbacks while transferring emergency patients from the atolls to Male. The sea ambulance will be managed by the Coast Guard. STAFF_NOTE: Transaction cost is unknown.
sources: http://mv.china-embassy.org/chn/zmgx/t1577461.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://en.sun.mv/49491, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://psmnews.mv/en/36421, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://maldivesindependent.com/society/china-donates-sea-ambulance-139357, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://edition.mv/news/6505, Media Report, including Wikileaks
funding_agency: Chinese Government

title: China donates security equipment to Nepal
description: In July 2010, China agreed to donate security equipment to the police services worth 26 million RMB (3,831,135 USD) to Nepal. It appears that the grant is intended primarily to strengthen monitoring of the Tibetan community in Nepal and security along the borders with China‚Äôs Tibet Autonomous Region. In June 2013, the equipment was disbursed to Nepal. The total commitment amount is $3,831,135, and the actual disbursement amount is $4,241,228 (Updated January 2019).

title: China donates video security equipment to museum in Nepal
description: In February 2010, China donated 16 Close Circuit Television (CCTV) cameras and two Digital Video Recorder (DVR) System to Nepal's National Museum in Chhauni. Chinese Ambassador to Nepal Qiu Guohong officially signed the delivery documents of the donation and handed it over to Minendra Rijal, Nepali Minister for Federal Affairs, Parliamentary Affairs, Constituent Assembly, and Culture. The supplies are intended to help Nepal preserve and manage cultural relics in the museum.

title: China donates water quality testing equipment to Sri Lanka
description: In October 2015, the Chinese Academy of Sciences donated water quality analysis instruments worth Rs 22 million to Sri Lanka for the study of unexplained chronic kidney disease affecting the nation's farming population. The equipment was donated during a meeting of the Chinese delegation with the Sri Lankan officials in Colombo.

title: China donates wooden hand loom in support of women's employment in Sri Lanka
description: On April 11, 2013, China donated a wooden hand loom in support of the Women's Employment Project in Gampaha district in Sri Lanka.
sources: http://lk.china-embassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1030265.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China finances city security upgrade for Tajikistan
description: On May 20, 2013, the Ministry of Finance of Tajikistan and the Export-Import Bank of China (China Exim Bank) signed a $20.9 million loan agreement for implementation of the Safe City Project, which would install cameras to monitor movement and traffic across the city at busy locations. The loan is repayable over 20 years. The first stage of the three-stage project was launched on November 1, 2013. The second stage was expected to be completed by May 2014. The installation of the cameras was completed by Chinese company Huawei.

title: China gives in-kind grant of 5 drug-sniffing dogs worth 4.5 million rupees to Pakistan
description: On 9 May 2008, The Ambassador of Peoples Republic of China Luo Zhaohui handed over 5 drug-sniffing dogs, worth 4.5 million rupees, to the Director General of Anti Narcotics Force (ANF) to aid in its efforts to fight narcotics. Secretary of Foreign Affairs Salman Bashir and high officials of the ANF were present on the occasion. The provision of anti-narcotics assistance was to curb the influx of opiates. Luo said the Chinese Government has been supporting Pakistan and the ANF to combat the menace of narcotics for more than two decades. Pakistan had fallen both a victim and become a transit country in narcotic trafficking because of its proximity to Afghanistan.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCAPP0020080510e45a0002t&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Salman Bashir, Pakistani Secretary of Foreign Affairs ; Luo Zhaohi, Chinese Ambassador to Pakistan

title: China grants $1 million in material assistance for Afghan elections
description: On 31 March 2004, at the International Conference on Afghanistan, Li Zhaoxing, Foreign Minister of the People's Republic of China, announced plans to offer material assistance worth US$1 million to Afghanistan for its elections. This include tents, photocopiers, and lighting equipment. The aid is aligned with China's position to prioritize election in Afghanistan, as evidenced from Minister Li's statement at the High-level ad-hoc Meeting on Afghanistan on 19 April 2004. The aid is to arrive in Afghanistan at the end of September 2004. At the Security Council session on 25 August 2004, Ambassador Zhang Yishan mentioned in his statement that the aid material will be 'on the ground' in Afghanistan by the end of September 2004.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020040407e041001ft&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/ztgk/t1097558.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.chinaconsulatesf.org/eng/xw/t82077.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.china-un.ch/eng/gjhyfy/qqwt/t85756.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.china-un.org/eng/xw/t154261.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.china-un.org/chn/zgylhg/jjalh/alhrd/afh/t154177.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.china-un.org/chn/zgylhg/jjalh/alhrd/afh/t82689.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/chn//gxh/cgb/zcgmzysx/yz/1206/1206x1/t356107.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
funding_agency: China Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Government Agency
contacts: Kong Quan, Chinese Foreign Ministry Spokesman

title: China grants $18.3 Million Inspection Equipment for Customs of Uzbekistan
description: In May, 2017, China signed an intergovernmental agreement to grant customs inspection equipment worth $18.3 million to Uzbekistan. The equipment include four large-sized inspection and examination complexes and ten sets of scanning systems in Chukursay Railway Station. China will also carry out the installation and maintenance of the equipment and the training of the specialists. On August 3, 2018, the handover ceremony was held.
sources: https://en.trend.az/casia/uzbekistan/2760295.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://aalco-beijing.mfa.gov.cn/web/wjdt_674879/zwbd_674895/t1583914.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China grants 1 million RMB in forensic equipment
description: In November 2002, China's Ministry of Public Security committed a donation of forensic laboratory equipment worth 1 million RMB to their Uzbek counterparts. The current state of this project is unknown. According to Chinese source, the contract is signed in 2001.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=bbcapp0020021127dybr00209&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.chinanews.com/gj/zlk/2014/01-15/213_2.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China grants 396,000 USD in equipment for Kazakh Police
description: In 2007 the Chinese Ministry of Public Security provided aid worth 396,000 dollars to the Kazakh Ministry of Internal Affairs. The donation included equipment for Kazakh police.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCCA00020070720e37k000um&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China grants 5 seismological stations worth 300K USD
description: In 2003, China Seismological Bureau gave 5 seismological stations that worth 300,000 dollars to the Uzbek Academy of Sciences. This aid is based on an agreement signed between these two parties in 2001. China also sent specialists to provide the assistance with setting up and using the equipment. Four of these stations were installed in Tashkent, and one was installed in central Uzbekistan. This donation aims to modernize Uzbekistan's capacity to register and study earthquakes.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCAPP0020030910dz9a001ba&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://isas.uzsci.net/, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=2&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwixsfOY4vfKAhUKxWMKHTyHCgUQFggjMAE&url=http%3A%2F%2Fds.iris.edu%2Fmedia%2Fworkshop%2F2012%2F01%2Fmanaging-waveform-data-and-related-metadata-for-seismic-networks%2Ffiles%2Fnetwork-reports%2FUzbekistan-InstSeismology-ILKHOM-15.ppt&usg=AFQjCNGnqvUbpdOWv2Yg4dxTSU0UESysCg&sig2=Arl7xR1HLjwrDmfsljxfYg, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China grants Kyrgyz Republic 300,000 USD in technical assistance
description: In 2004, China agreed to send technical aid worth 300,000 USD to the Interior Ministry of the Republic of Kyrgyzstan. Furthermore, China also pledged to hand over 30,000 off-road vehicles.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=DEFSEC0020041129e0bt0000r&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China grants Kyrgyz Republic 5 million RMB for food and other materials
description: On April 11, 2002, China agreed to grant 5 million RMB (~600,000 USD) to the Kyrgyz Defense Ministry for material and technical facilities and foodstuff during a meeting between Kyrgyz Defence Minister Col-Gen Esen Topoyev and Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary Ambassador of the People's Republic of China (PRC) to Kyrgyzstan Hong Jiuyin.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=kabnew0020021025dyao0000e&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=bbcapp0020021026dyaq002s1&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China grants Tajikistan 10 buses and 25 tractors
description: Stipulated under earlier agreements, China granted Tajikistan 10 buses and 25 tractors. No further information regarding the value of the equipment was located.
