title: China grants Tk 354 million for medical equipment and appliances
description: In 2015, AMA Muhith, Bangladesh's Finance Minister, and Gao Hucheng, China‚Äôs commerce minister, signed two Letters of Exchange (LEs). In one letter China pledged to collect medical equipments and appliances for the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The funding came from a Chinese grant of Tk 35.4 crore (TK 354 million). The coder did follow-up research in both English and Chinese, but could not find any information relating to the progress of the project. Unsure if transaction ever occured.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=UNIBAG0020150825eb8p0000k&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.dhakatribune.com/uncategorized/2015/08/25/china-interested-to-invest-300m-in-bangladesh-textile-sector, Media Report, including Wikileaks
funding_agency: China Ministry of Commerce, Government Agency
implementing_agency: Bangladesh Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, Government Agency
recipient_agencies: Bangladesh Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, Government Agency

title: China grants Uzbekistan 3.7 million USD for customs checkpoint upgrades
description: On February 10, 2009, China and Uzbekistan governments signed off on a grant of 25 million CNY (3.7 million USD) at the Ministry of Foreign Economic Relations, Investments, and Trade (MFERIT) in Tashkent, Uzbekistan. The agreement was signed by Minister of Foreign Economic Relations, Investments and Trade, Elyor Ganiyev, and Chinese ambassador to Uzbekistan, Yu Hongjun. The grant is for equipment for customs post and mobile x-rays in order to prevent smuggling and boost trade.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=BBCCA00020090210e52a001rx&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=UZREPE0020090211e52b000gp&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=RIAORE0020090213e52d000bq&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://neurope.eu/article/uzbekistan-china-sign-exchange-notes-tashkent/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.uzbekembassy.org/e/newsletters/804/, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China loans PKR 88 million to Pakistan for fumigation chambers
description: In July 2003, China agreed to provide an Interest Free Economic aid loan worth Rs.88 Million for the supply of 10 Mobile Fumigation Chambers with 4 Truck Heads to Pakistan. The equipment would be used by the department of Plant Protection for fumigation of exportable commodities mandated by International Plant Quarantine Convention and rules. Joint Secretary, Ministry of Food and Agriculture, Mr. Zaheer Ahmed and Economic and Commercial Counsellor, Mr. Ma Changlin, signed the agreement on behalf of their respective governments. Minister of State for Food and Agriculture, Mr., Sikandar Hayat Khan Bosan and Secretary MINFAL, Salik Nazir Ahmed witnessed the signing ceremony. The Mobile Fumigation Chambers would facilitate the exporters in exporting agriculture commodities under up graded quarantine measures. This project would also help streamline and augment Pakistani exports after meeting WTO conditionalities of health, quality and standards of the products.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PAPRIN0020030725dz7n0003k&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China loans RMB860 million to digitally link Bangladeshi government offices (linked to #38335)
description: In 2013, China committed to providing a preferential concessional loan of 860 million yuan (equivalent to 133 million U.S. dollars) to consolidate and link all Bangladeshi government offices (at both district and sub-district levels) under a single network. The project's title is 'Development of National ICT Infra-Network for Bangladesh Government Phase II', and it is scheduled to begin in June 2013 and be completed by July 2015. This project is an extension of the BanglaGovNet project being implemented by Bangladesh Computer Council through Korean Exim Bank Credit where all Ministries/Divisions major Departments, Deputy Commissioner‚Äôs offices and Upazillas are to be connected under a ICT Backbone Network. Phase II of the project pursues major improvements in Bangladesh government‚Äôs efficiency, transparency, effectiveness, and quality of services through expansion of the network and other facilities established in Phase I BanglaGovNet project. According to the 2016 ODA report from the Economic Relations Division of the Bangladeshi Government, 767.325 million of this pledged amount has been dispersed as of 2017. Chinese news agency reports document that the funding for the project was provided by the Export-Import Bank of China, and China Machinery and Equipment Engineering Co., Ltd. and Huawei Company act as general contractors and major subcontractors respectively. According to the Chinese Xinhua News Agency report in June 2016, the completion ceremony of the second phase of the Bangladesh National Broadband Infrastructure Network (the second phase of the government network project) undertaken by a Chinese company was held on the 7th in Dhaka, Bangladesh.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/aa/?ref=BBCAPP0020130314e93e000jh&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.mof.gov.bd/en/budget/13_14/cdg/en/28_ict_en.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/china/2013-03/13/c_132231422.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.newstoday.com.bd/index.php?option=details&news_id=2349667&date=2013-07-03, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.bssnews.net/newsDetails.php?cat=0&id=462774&date=2015-01-15, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.google.com.sg/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=1&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0CBwQFjAA&url=http%3A%2F%2Fkaliganj.satkhira.gov.bd%2Fsites%2Fdefault%2Ffiles%2Fkaliganj.satkhira.gov.bd%2FDevelopment%2520of%2520National%2520ICT%2520Infr1.docx&ei=mTqaVaytKoa8ugSHhYHACA&usg=AFQjCNFUdq6ioY4VS_j6hOW9Se3v5GmSvw&sig2=6TIZ8OPs9szQLiD3_BchLA&bvm=bv.96952980,d.c2E, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://news.xinhuanet.com/2013-03/13/c_115015566.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://erd.portal.gov.bd/sites/default/files/files/erd.portal.gov.bd/page/b09c0301_8d15_49e1_8af9_3231f08b8ad8/Tbl-7.2.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://finance.china.com.cn/roll/20160609/3760471.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://money.163.com/13/0313/21/8PSJPDV600253B0H.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks

contacts: Zunaid Ahmed Palak, State Minister for ICT Division

title: China loans US$6 million to Pakistan for security scanners
description: An agreement on the supply of security equipment signed between China and Pakistan in December 2008. China Export-Import Bank would provide a soft loan for 24 Non-Intrusive Vehicle X-Ray Inspection System (NVIS) to Pakistan in an effort to strengthen security arrangements in the wake of ongoing war against terrorism in the country. The loan has a maturity of 25 years with a 2.5% interest.Two scanners, arrived in Karachi from China on October 23, last year, but could not be brought to Islamabad till December due to a dispute over payment of customs duty. Two scanners arrived in Karachi from China on October 23 2014, but could not be brought to Islamabad till December due to a dispute over payment of customs duty. The two mobile scanners, placed at Police Lines Headquarters, had been imported to get them installed at entry points to scan vehicles coming to and going from the city. The scanners that are designed to detect explosives and weapons cost about US$3 million each. However, as of 2010, the authorities had delayed the installation of the scanners in Islamabad after experts declared them 'a health hazard' due to high radiation levels. This project has been completed. A Pakistani Ministry of Finance Annual Status report records a CNY40.20 million (equivalent of USD6.07 million) grant. STAFF_NOTE: South and Central Asia The Government of Pakistan Estimates of Foreign Assistance for 2015-2016 place the revised budget estimate, or mid year revision of funds, for 2014-2015 to be 606.190 million Pakistani rupees lended from China.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=WDAN000020100414e64e00014&cat=a&ep=ASE, Other Academic (Working Paper, Dissertation); https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=AFPR000020100414e64e001jm&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ASBEXP0020101021e6ai00044&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PAPRIN0020101221e6cg0005l&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PMPLUN0020101221e6cl000rw&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PMPLUN0020110120e71k000qh&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.dawn.com/news/891802/senators-to-discuss-x-ray-scanners-issue-today, Media Report, including Wikileaks; javascript:__doPostBack('ctl00$HeadContent$GridView1$ctl06$lnkb',''), Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.finance.gov.pk/budget/foreign_assistance_2015_16.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China offers 50 million yuan interest-free loan to Uzbekistan in developing agriculture
description: Summary: In May 2004, The Uzbek foreign minister and the Chinese ambassador to Uzbekistan signed a credit agreement under which China would offer 50m Chinese yuan of interest-free loan. The document was signed by Uzbek Foreign Minister Sodiq Safoyev and the Chinese ambassador to Uzbekistan, Gao Yusheng. Under the document, the Chinese side will send agricultural machinery and computer equipment. The loan would be used for five-year projects to be implemented as part of bilateral relations.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCCA00020040506e056001b9&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.gasandoil.com/news/russia/56d4f454b00d574ebb57c4ca2503154f, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Sodiq Safoyev, Foreign Minister of Uzbekistan (Ministry of Foreign Affairs); Gao Yusheng, Chinese ambassador to Uzbekistan (Ministry of Foreign Affairs)

title: China pledges to aid Sri Lanka with 10th South Asian Games
description: China pledged to provide grant assistance Sri Lanka for the 10th South Asian Games. Two agreements were signed for the technical and economic cooperation to develop the country's economy and sports equipment to help Sri Lanka to hold the 10th South Asian Games. No further details could be found specifying the nature and form of aid to be offered beyond what was stated in the article. According to the Sri Lanka Ministry of Finance and Planning Annual Report, China committed $400,000 allocated for the games.

title: China provided 1205 sets of farming YTO-X904 tractors to Kyrgyzstan
description: In August 2006, China provided in total 1,205 sets of farming YTO-X904 tractors to Kyrgyzstan on a short notice. President Askar Akayew of Kyrgyzstan wrote twice to President Hu Jintao expressing his thanks. STAFF_NOTE: very little information was found during stage 2.

title: China provided 267 YTO tractors to Kyrgyzstan
description: On July 29, 2011, the handover ceremony of 267 YTO tractors from China to Kyrgyzstan was held in the square in front of the Kyrgyz government building.
sources: https://3g.163.com/news/article/7A56NCN500014JB5.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/web/gjhdq_676201/gj_676203/yz_676205/1206_676548/1206x2_676568/t843959.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China provides $1.4 million in material aid to Afghans Ministry of Interior
description: In July 2003, China and Afghanistan's Interim government signed an agreement with China. China will provide the Afghanistan Ministry of Interior with communication equipment and vehicles. It's worth 1.4 million US dollar in total, includes 22 Cherokee vehicles. The equipment and vehicles were handed over on June 30, 2004. The communication equipment came from Shandong Weifang Huaguang Communication Co., Ltd. The 22 vehicles came from Beijing Jeep Automobile Co., Ltd.
sources: http://af.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/200407/20040700243063.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
implementing_agency: Afghanistan Ministry of the Interior, Government Agency
recipient_agencies: Afghanistan Ministry of the Interior, Government Agency

title: China provides 1 million USD material aid to Afghanistan
description: On October 5, 2004, China granted official equipment and sports supplies to Afghanistan. The grant worths 1 million US dollar. It includes 400 personal computers, 300 printers, 70 copiers, television, bicycles, soccers, basketballs, sports outfits. The delivery ceremony is held in Afghanistan Ministry of Foreign Affairs. This project should not be confused with i #34514, as the delivery date and content is different.
sources: http://af.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/200411/20041100303076.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://news.sina.com.cn/w/2004-10-05/18343838808s.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China provides 20 laptops to Shree Divya Deep Secondary Boarding School in Nepal
description: SUMMARY:n 20 February 2011, Chinese Ambassador to Nepal Qiu Guohong visited Pokhara, Kaski district of Nepal and provided 20 laptops to Shree Divya Deep Secondary Boarding School which is located in Upper Mustang
sources: http://np.china-embassy.org/eng/ChinaNepal/t802344.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China provides 200 trash cans worth 500,000 MVR for waste disposal to Maldives (Linked to project #54985)
description: On 6 November 2014, the Chinese government gifted Maldives with 200 trash cans at a total value of 500,000 MVR to aid the efforts to make the waste disposal systems in Maldivian islands more efficient. The handover ceremony was held at Maldives' Ministry of Environment, and was attended by Deputy Chinese Ambassador to Maldives and Acting head of Chinese Embassy in Maldives, Liu Jiyang, as well as Deputy Environment Minister Ali Amir. STAFF_NOTE: A similar project was again donated by China to Maldives in year 2016. Linked to project #54985.
sources: http://www.haveeru.com.mv/waste_management/57391, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.vnews.mv/29173, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://en.sun.mv/25889, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://mv.chineseembassy.org/chn/sgsd/t1405226.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Liu Jiyang, Deputy Chinese Ambassador to Maldives ; Ali Amir, Deputy Environment Minister

title: China provides 500 miillion RMB grant for 1,000 fire department motorcycles
description: On October 14, 2016, China committed to grant 500 million RMB (approximately $73.29 million) for the modernization of Bangladesh's Fire Service and Civil Defence. The financial and technical cooperation agreement was signed during President Xi Jinping‚Äôs visit to Bangladesh, and is said to be part of the project of Disaster Emergency Operation Centre and Information Platform. The grant will provide for 1000 ‚Äòwater mist fire motorcycles‚Äô fitted with modern technologies. The motorcycles will be able to maneuver through Dhaka's crowded streets. title: China provides 6,004 pieces of agricultural equipment to Bangladesh
description: On April 2017, Chinese Ambassador to Bangladesh Ma Mingqiang handed over 6,004 pieces of farming equipment to the Bangladesh government. The equipment was selected with Bangladesh's tiny size in mind. The grant of equipment was said to be part of a movement to modernize Bangladesh's agricultural sector. STAFF_NOTE: No information about the commitment date could be found.

title: China provides Afghanistan 13 million Yuan for emergency assistance and uniforms
description: In 2002, China provides 13 million Chinese Yuan (equivalent to 4 million USD) to Afghanistan for emergency assistance as well as other aids. The fund was delivered in March 2002. The fund was used deliver medical supplies, stationary (80,000 pieces) and uniforms for the army (50,000 pieces) and police (20,000 pieces), 30 computers to Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Part of the medicine was utilized in the north during the crises of Nahreen Earthquake. The fund is fully disbursed and used by 2006. DAD platform referral code: DAD/000357. STAFF_NOTE: This Project is not affiliated to #34498 because the transaction amounts and currency are separate.
sources: http://dadafghanistan.gov.af/de/frame.jsp?src=/de/deView.faces?sessionid=154258875818446093&MasterID=12&SubModuleID=1&Hierarchy=A12_E_Projects&UserID=13&iLanguageID=1&jsf_sequence=1&projectid=357&beansKey=154258875818446093_1542592302998, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China provides Afghanistan President Landscaping Equipments
description: On October 1, 2012, the handover ceremony of China grant to Afghanistan was held in Afghanistan President's Office. The value of the grant is not indicated in the original source. The grant includes snow shovel machines, street cleaners, and lawn mowers. That equipment will help the cleaning and beautification of the area surrounding Afghans President Office and capital city, as well as improve the environment. As the equipment handed over is intended for landscaping, not office supplies, this is not a duplicate of #53739.

title: China provides a CNY95 million Grant of Police Pickups, Ambulances for Hospitals and Office Equipment to Pakistan
description: STAFF_NOTE: NOV 19 2018 South and Central Asia Scrape According to the Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Year Book in the fiscal year of 2015/16, China fulfilled a grant worth of 95 million Chinese Yuan for Police Pickups, Ambulances for Hospitals and Office Equipment for Capacity Building of EAD. The Hand-over certificate was signed on 09-06-2016 in Islamabad. The Letter of Exchange for this project was signed on 20-04-2015. There are two similar projects created but the commitment years were significantly earlier (Refer to 53524 and 38777).
sources: http://www.ead.gov.pk/userfiles1/file/EAD/2018/Website%20Year%20Book%202015-2016.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.ead.gov.pk/ead/userfiles1/file/Trainings/Website%20Year%20Book%202014--15.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China provides a USD 15 million loan for Procurement of Machinary for rehabilitation of Irrigation Infrastructure in Sindh Pakistan
description: The Executive Committee of National Economic Council (ECNEC) of Pakistan approved the project on 16-08-2012 and Commercial Contract has been signed by Government of Sindh with Chinese Company. The documents have been sent to Exim Bank, China for further action. According to the Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Year Book in the fiscal year of 2015/16, on a request of Government of Sindh, EAD forwarded loan application for Preferential Buyers Credit to finance the project to Exim Bank China. According to the Pakistan Ministry of Finance Estimates of Foreign Assistance for 2015-2016, and of 2016-2017, no disbursement had been made by the end of 2017.
sources: http://www.ead.gov.pk/frmDetails.aspx, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.ead.gov.pk/userfiles1/file/EAD/2018/Website%20Year%20Book%202015-2016.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.finance.gov.pk/budget/foreign_assistance_2016_17.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.finance.gov.pk/budget/foreign_assistance_2015_16.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.ead.gov.pk/ead/userfiles1/file/Trainings/Website%20Year%20Book%202014--15.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.finance.gov.pk/budget/foreign_assistance_2016_17.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China provides aids to Afghanistan Ministry of Health for H1N1
description: From September 23, 2010, to December 20, 2017, China provided 1,327,333 USD to Afghanistan to support fighting against the H1N1 virus. The fund was distributed to Afghanistan Ministry of Public Health. It is used to provide good and services, as well as the acquisition of assets. The yearly contribution is shown below: March, 22, 2013: 704,713 USD October 13, 2014: 295,287 USD October 8, 2015: 295,287 USD September 24, 2016: 32,046 USD DAD platform referral code: AFG/370623; Old referral code: AFG/0011504 STAFF_NOTE: No other details regarding the use of these aids could be found during stage 2. Project 34583 could possibly be a part of this project. However the 1 million aid in project 34583 was pledged in 2010 and the earliest distribution of this project was on 2013. Project 34581 could also have intersections with this project since the agreement reported in 34581 was made on 2010 and mentioned aids in health and medical sectors.
sources: http://dadafghanistan.gov.af/de/frame.jsp?src=/de/deView.faces?sessionid=154258875818446093&MasterID=1&SubModuleID=1&Hierarchy=A1_RT_OP_PROJECT&UserID=13&iLanguageID=1&jsf_sequence=1&projectid=11504&beansKey=154258875818446093_1542590291717, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/ttwe1lxhfyzo0c2/May%202018%20Flat%20Export%20of%20Afghanistan%20DAD%20China%20Project%20Data.xlsx?dl=0, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/cu75mmi3ek8d6sc/Flat%20Export%20of%20Geocoded%20Afghanistan%20DAD%20from%202014.xlsx?dl=0, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/qycggbgg4kj6shl/Afghanistan%20DAD%20Project%20370623.pdf?dl=0, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)
implementing_agency: Afghanistan Ministry of Public Health, Government Agency
recipient_agencies: Afghanistan Ministry of Public Health, Government Agency

title: China provides computers to Rastriya Higher Secondary School in Nepal
description: In November 2010, Chinese Ambassador to Nepal Qiu Guohong provided some computers to Nepal Rastriya Higher Secondary School in a remote village of the Rasuwa district of Nepal.
sources: http://np.china-embassy.org/eng/ChinaNepal/t771086.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China provides computers to Shree Ganeshbharati Secondary School in Nepal
description: In December 2010, Chinese Ambassador to Nepal Qiu Guohong visited Kavre district on the east of Kathmandu and provided some computers to Shree Ganeshbharati Secondary School in Mahendra Jyoti VDC of the district.
sources: http://www.fmprc.gov.cn/ce/cenp/eng/EmbassyInfo/asaa/t774910.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://np.china-embassy.org/eng/Education/t774910.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Qiu Guohong, Chinese Ambassador to Nepal

title: China provides medical equipment to B.P. Koirala Memorial Cancer Hospital in Nepal (linked to #34393 and #34386)
description: In 2012, China handed over medical equipment and medicines to Nepal as part of a grant assistance. China provided medical equipment such as Nerve Surgery Operation Microscope, Multifunctional Microwave Therapeutic Machine, Anaesthesia machine and medicines which were urgently needed in Nepal. Economic & Commercial Counsellor Ms Di Rong and Secretary of Ministry of Health and Population Mr. Praveen Mishra participated in this ceremony and delivered a speech respectively. The chairman of B.P. Koirala Memorial Cancer Hospital (BPKMCH) and members of the Chinese 7th Medical Aid Team were present at the ceremony. In February 2000, an exchange of letter concerning technical aid to the B. P. Koirala Memorial Cancer Hospital took place.
sources: http://np2.mofcom.gov.cn/article/chinanews/201206/20120608194947.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://np.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201206/20120608187118.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://english.mofcom.gov.cn/aarticle/counselorsreport/asiareport/201206/20120608194947.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Praveen Mishra, Secretary of Ministry of Health and Population ; Di Rong, Commercial Counselor

title: China provides trash cans worth for waste disposal to Maldives (Linked to project #38236)
description: On October 12, 2016, the Chinese embassy held a ceremony awarding trash cans to the Maldives government for waste management and environmental protection. The exact quantity and monetary amount involved are unclear. STAFF_NOTE: A similar project exists between China and Maldives in year 2014. Linked to project 38236.
sources: http://mv.chineseembassy.org/chn/sgsd/t1405226.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China to provide 4.3 million RMB to Afghanistan Ministry of Interior
description: On 23 September 2012, China and Afghanistan signed 3 agreements; one of them is the the 'agreement for assistance for completion of police equipment between Afghanistan and China' and it was signed between Deputy Minister of Interior Affairs and Deputy Minister of Public Security of China. Based on the report by Bakhtar News Agency, the assistance may be worth 4.3 million Chinese Yuan.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.libproxy1.nus.edu.sg/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BAKHNA0020120925e89o00002&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://af.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zxhz/hzjj/201501/20150100879514.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.asianews.it/news-en/Afghanistan,-Iran,-Chinese-aid-and-Shanghai-group-24985.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.jamestown.org/programs/chinabrief/single/?tx_ttnews%5Btt_news%5D=40070&cHash=dddb4ec37d4ad772df2281d51020ac67#.VaE82fmqqko, Academic Journal Article; http://www.bakhtarnews.com.af/eng/politics/item/4134-afghanistan-china-sign-practical-plan-for-implementing-joint-strategic-statement-two-cooperation-agreements.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks
implementing_agency: Afghanistan Ministry of the Interior, Government Agency
recipient_agencies: Afghanistan Ministry of the Interior, Government Agency

title: China trains Bangladeshi satellite receiver operators (linked to #34057)
description: In 2006, China Space Administration presented the Chinese-made Fengyun series of high-quality meteorological satellites and its services to Bangladesh and six other Asian Pacific countries for use in 'meteorological research, disaster mitigation, economic growth and prosperity.' The system receives real-time data from Chinese and international meteorological satellites and broadcasts the information to the countries. China and the seven countries signed a convention on space co-operation in October 2007 as the precursor to establishing the Asia-Pacific Space Co-operation Organization (APSCO) in Beijing, an inter-governmental organization to facilitate international alliances for the peaceful use of space. China ran training courses for staff from the APSCO member states to help them use the system and to realize the co-operation proposed by the convention. Specific details on the training are unavailable. This project is linked to #34057.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=CHNDLY0020060325e23p00008&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.gov.cn/misc/2006-03/25/content_236443.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.spacedaily.com/reports/Turkey_Signs_Up_For_Asia_Pacific_Space_Program.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Luo Ge, deputy administrator of CNSA

title: Chinese Ambassador donates 20 computers to Government College University in Pakistan
description: On 20 April 2011, China, through the Chinese Ambassador to Pakistan Liu Jian, gifted ten computers, software and other accessories to the Government College University (GCU). The computers have been used by the university to established a high-tech computer laboratory for students at the GCU Postgraduate Library for online access of electronic journals, books and other digital material. GCU Vice Chancellor Prof Dr Ikramul Haq inaugurated the laboratory, while Dean of Arts and Social Sciences Prof Dr Khalid Perviaz, Chief Librarian Abdul Waheed and heads of various departments were also present on this occasion.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PMDAIP0020110421e74k00020&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://library.gcu.edu.pk/NewsEvents.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://nation.com.pk/lahore/20-Apr-2011/Chinese-envoy-gifts-computers-to-GCU, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.pakistantoday.com.pk/2011/04/19/city/lahore/chinese-envoy-gives-te-computers-to-gcu/, Media Report, including Wikileaks
funding_agency: Chinese Embassy, Government Agency
recipient_agencies: Government College University (GCU), Lahore, Academic, Training and Research
contacts: Liu Jian, Head of Mission ; Ikramul Haq, Vice Chancellor (Government College University (GCU), Lahore); Khalid Perviaz, Dean of Arts and Social Sciences (Government College University (GCU), Lahore); Abdul Waheed, Chief Librarian (Government College University (GCU), Lahore)

title: Chinese Donation to Deaf-Mutism School
description: On November 19th 2014, the Ambassador of Kyrgyzstan, Qi Dayu, led the diplomat of the embassy to the Bishkek Deaf School to sympathize with the teachers and students of the school, and presented the children with computers, projectors, daily necessities, and books on Chinese history and culture.
sources: http://kg.china-embassy.org/chn/dssghd/t1213131.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://old.kabar.kg/eng/society/full/11484, Media Report, including Wikileaks
funding_agency: Chinese Embassy, Government Agency

title: Chinese Embassy Supports Guldasta Sewing Center in Varzob District
description: On December 10, 2014 the Chinese embassy in Tajikistan assisted in the opening of the 'Guldasta' sewing center in teh Varzob District, located 25 km north of Tajikistan's capital. Zhao Syanzhun, wife of the Chinese Ambassador participated in the opening ceremony along with the chairman of the Varzob district and a representative from the People's Democratic Party. The embassy donated 20 sewing machines, scissors sets, irons, and other necessary equipment. STAFF_NOTE: The Chinese embassy press release specified that this is the second sewing training center donated to Tajikistan. The project needs to be distinguished from the first center that was transferred in June 2014 (project 54043).
sources: http://www.avesta.tj/eng/4732-chinese-embassy-supports-to-open-sewing-center-in-varzob-district.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://tj.china-embassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1218176.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
implementing_agency: Chinese Embassy, Government Agency

title: Chinese Embassy donated computers and printers to a quake-hit city in Pakistan
description: In Pakistan's quake-hit Balakot, Ambassador Zhang Chunxiang and Pakistani Senator Mohammad Afridi attended a ceremony in a college campus and cut the ribbon together. Ambassador Zhang, on behalf of the Embassy, also donated six computers and six HP printers to the college representatives.
sources: http://pk.chineseembassy.org/chn/sghd/t231515.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Zhang Chunxiang, Ambassador

title: Chinese Embassy donates computers and printers to Pakistan's Ministry of Culture
description: On 18 January 2006, the Chinese Embassy donated nine sets of computers and nine printers to Pakistan's Ministry of Culture, Sports and Youth affairs. The Chinese Ambassador Zhang Chunxiang handed over the equipments to Cultural Secretary Jalil Abbas at the Pakistani Ministry. Present at the handing over ceremony were Chinese Cultural Counsellor Shan Baoxiang, Additional Cultural Secretary Khalid Saeed Haroon, Executive Director of the Lok Virsa museum Uxi Mufti and other senior officials from both sides.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PAPRIN0020060119e21i0006q&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020060118e21i0063h&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://pk.china-embassy.org/eng/dszl/t231865.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks
funding_agency: Chinese Embassy, Government Agency
contacts: Shan Baoxiang, Cultural Counsellor (1Malaysia Development Bhd.); Zhang Chunxiuay, Head of Mission (1Malaysia Development Bhd.); Jalil Abbas, Secretary of Culture and Sports ; Khalid Saeed Haroon, Additional Secretary Ministry of Culture and Sports ; Uxi Muft, Executive Director of the Lok Virsa museum

title: Chinese Embassy donates television and sports equipment to Afghan school (Linked to Project ID#34507)
description: 31 October, 2009, Ambassador Zheng Qingdian donated two televisions, two table tennis rackets, ten boxes of table tennis balls, and two volleyballs to the Shah Schneider Secondary School. Vice Principal of the school thanked the Chinese Embassy in Afghanistan for their concerns with regards to education. Friendship between the Chinese and the Afghans in the education sector came about with the 'See the world' magazine. In 2002, 'See the world' magazine organized a large-scale photo exhibition called 'focus on Afghanistan war orphans', and raised capital amounting to 200 million yuan for the Afghan war orphans through charities and other activities. Of the total capital collected, more than $200,000 was used for the construction of the two Afghan friendship schools (See Project ID#34507)
sources: http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/sbwl/t624925.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2003-06/17/content_923999.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks
implementing_agency: Chinese Embassy, Government Agency
contacts: Zheng Qingdian, Ambassador

title: Chinese Embassy in Pakistan donates office supplies to the Pakistani capital police department
description: On June 2, 2010, the Embassy in Pakistan donated a batch of office supplies to the Pakistani Capital Police. Chinee Ambassador Luo Zhaohui and other diplomats of the Embassy, ‚Äã‚Äãand Kalim, as well as the director of the Pakistani Police Department, attended the donation ceremony.
sources: http://pk.china-embassy.org/chn/zbgx/t705948.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: Chinese Embassy in Uzbekistan Donated Computer Equipment to Uzbekistan's University of World Economy and Diplomacy
description: On May 17, 2016, Ambassador Sun Lijie attended the Chinese Embassy in Uzbekistan to donate computer equipment to the Uzbekistan's University of World Economy and Diplomacy. Approximately 100 people attended the ceremony, including Jumanov, the president of Uzbekistan's University of World Economy and Diplomacy, directors, professors, and student representatives of the University. The transaction value of this donation is unknown.
sources: http://uz.chineseembassy.org/chn/sgxx/sgsd/t1364521.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.uwed.uz/en/, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)
funding_agency: Chinese Embassy, Government Agency

title: Chinese Government grants $5.9 million for pump equipment and reconstruction of Karakul pump station in Bukhara oblast
description: In 2008, the Chinese government provided a grant of $5.9 million to Uzbekistan for the purchasing of pump equipment for the pumping station 'Karakul' reconstruction in Bukhara oblast. In July 2011, China's IPPR International Engineering Corporation signed a contract with the Uzbekistan government for purchasing equipment for the Karakuli Pumping Station. This project will increase the water supply capacity of the pumping station to 45 cubic meters per second, and the energy consumption of the unit will be greatly reduced. The total cost of the project was $7.2 million, and the Ministry of Agriculture provided the rest of the funding for the project. In August 2012, China's IPPR International Engineering Corporation completed construction of the Karakul Pumping Station to ensure uninterrupted water supply in the area. STAFF_NOTE: Some sources have Chinese grant amount as $7.3 million, but transaction amount was recorded as $5.9 million as this is the more conservative amount and the one reported by the IMF.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=TCASIA0020120905e88t0000q&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.timesca.com/news/7242-chinas-ippr-to-reconstruct-a-pumping-station-in-uzbekistan, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201301/20130100005684.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.imf.org/en/Publications/CR/Issues/2016/12/31/Republic-of-Uzbekistan-Poverty-Reduction-Strategy-Paper-21636, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)
implementing_agency: China IPPR International Engineering Corporation, State-Owned Company

title: Chinese Ministry of Culture gave in-kind grant of 150000 Chinese Yuan worth of office equipment to Pakistan
description: On December 8, 2009, the Chinese Ministry of Culture gave an in-kind grant of 150000 Chinese Yuan worth of office equipment to its Pakistani counterpart. Chinese Cultural Counselor Yang Linhai and Pakistans Culture Secretary Moinul-Islam Bukhari signed documents for the handing-over of equipment at a ceremony at the Ministry of Culture in Pakistan.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PAPRIN0020091209e5c80001k&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://en.people.cn/90001/90776/90883/6835772.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks
funding_agency: Ministry of Culture and Tourism, Government Agency
implementing_agency: Pakistan Ministry of Culture, Government Agency
recipient_agencies: Pakistan Ministry of Culture, Government Agency
contacts: Moinul-Islam Bukhari, Pakistans Culture Secretary ; Yang Linhai, Chinese Cultural Counselor

title: Chinese embassy donates office equipment to Bangladesh
description: In 2013, the Chinese embassy donated office equipment to Impact Foundation Bangladesh, a voluntary organization. The handover occurred between Chinese ambassador Li Jun and acting director of Impact Foundation Bangladesh, Pradip Sengupta.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/aa/?ref=FNEXBD0020131113e9bb0015u&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.nsnewswire.com/2013/11/10/china-donates-computers-to-impact-foundation-bangladesh/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://bdnews24.com/bangladesh/2013/11/10/chinese-embassy-aid-for-impact-foundation, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Pradip Sengupta, acting director of Impact Foundation Bangladesh ; Li Jun, Chinese Ambassador in Bangladesh

title: Chinese government gives donation to Bangladesh police
description: In March 2006, China handed over security gear (bullet proof jackets and helmets) to the Bangladeshi police as a gesture of friendship. The handover took place between the Chinese Ambassador of Dhaka, Chai Xi, and Bangladesh State Minister for Home Affairs, Lutfozzaman Babar.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=UNIBAG0020060323e23m0000p&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Lutfozzaman Babar, State minister for home Affairs ; Chai Xi, Ambassador

title: Chinese government to assist Afghanistan's Ministry of Public Works with office supplies
description: On 9 October 2011, China's Economic and Commercial Counselor and the Afghan Minister of Public Works Ahmed signed a contract for China to assist Afghanistan's Ministry of Public Works in the form of office equipment. Based on the agreement, the office equipment will be delivered by the end of December 2011. The equipment was financed by the Chinese government. On May 15, 2012, the handover ceremony of official equipment from China to Afghanistan was held on Afghanistan Ministry of Public Work. No sources indicate the content of the donation. According to Afghan Minister of Public Work Najibullah Aoudjan, the equipment will be used to improve the working conditions of Minister of Public Work.
sources: http://af.mofcom.gov.cn/article/todayheader/201110/20111007773314.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/sbwl/t932030.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: Donation of US$1.4 million in equipment and vehicles (linked to #34500)
description: In June, 2004 China donated police communications equipment as well as off-road vehicles to Afghanistan's transitional government. This included an alarm system, computer LAN, wireless systems and a digital programmable dispatching system as well as 22 Cherokees made by Beijing Jeep Corporation. The value of this donation is US$1.4 million. This is the second donation of goods made by China to the Afghan government to promote bilateral ties. The first was in 2002 when China donated military uniforms, boots and coats to the Afghan police and army (See Project ID#34500)
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020040630e06u004ed&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://in.china-embassy.org/eng/zgbd/t163322.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Hilalludin Hilal, Afghan Deputy Interior Minister ; Sun Yuxi, Chinese ambassador to Afghanistan

title: Donation of US$1.79 million in dredging equipment
description: China donated about $1.79 million in dredging equipment to Afghanistan in March 2009. No other details are found. From China ECCO in Afghanistan: 2009Âπ¥3ÊúàÔºå‰∏≠ÊñπÂêëÈòøÊçêËµ†‰ª∑ÂÄº178.75‰∏áÁæéÂÖÉÁöÑÊ∏ÖÊ∑§ËÆæÂ§á„ÄÇ
sources: http://af.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zxhz/201501/20150100879514.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: Donation of a Table-Tennis Table to Maldives Table Tennis Association
description: On March 18, 2014 China's ambassador attended a handing over ceremony during which China gifted a table tennis table to the Maldives Table Tennis Association. Maldives' former ambassador to China attended the ceremony along with Liu Qiang, a counsellor at the Chinese embassy in Male.
crs_sector_name: Support to Non-governmental Organizations (NGOs) and Government Organizations
sources: http://mv.china-embassy.org/chn/zmgx/hfyjl/t1139875.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: Donation to Kudakudhige Hiya Orphanage
description: In 2014 the Chinese Ambassador to Maldives visited Kudakudhige Hiya Orphanage and donated food and toys. The value of the items is unknown.
crs_sector_name: Support to Non-governmental Organizations (NGOs) and Government Organizations
sources: http://mv.china-embassy.org/chn/zmgx/hfyjl/t1178347.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
recipient_agencies: Kudakudhige Hiya Orphanage, National NGO

title: EXIMbank 1.26 billion CNY in export seller's credit for telecommunications project
description: In 2000, the Export-Import Bank of China provided a loan of 1.26 billion CNY to China Machinery and Equipment Import and Export Co (CMEIE) for a telecommunications project in Bangladesh. The project will upgrade telephone exchange equipment in 58 districts of Bangladesh, which will help promote the country's telecommunications industry. This is the largest sum of export sellers credit the bank has ever granted in one package for supporting the export of telecommunications equipment. Details on the project status and loan details were not found.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=bbcape0020010804dw4s000j2&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=scmp000020010816dw7o00hjf&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.telecompaper.com/news/eximbank-finances-china-machinery-contract--243809, Media Report, including Wikileaks
funding_agency: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency

title: Eximbank loan for railway steel, Pakistan
description: On April 24, a contract of $22.152 million for the procurement of 52,000 metric tons of railway material was signed between Pakistan Railways (PR) and China Railways Materials and Supplies Corporation (CRMASC). The contract was signed by Saeeduz Zafar, Chairman of the PR Board, and Liu Guoping, Vice President of the CRMASC. 15% of the contract amount would be financed by the Pakistan government while the remaining US$18.8292 million would be financed through supplier's credit, provided by the China Export-Import Bank. The rails being procured are heavier than the existing rails of the PR. The usage of these rails would permit operation of trains at higher speed, as well as enhance load capacity. A media report in 2010 mentioned CRMASC successfully exported the railway material, so the project is complete.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=paprin0020020426dy4o000ed&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.dawn.com/news/29846/pakistan-china-sign-accord-on-railways, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://stock.sohu.com/20100927/n275297133.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks
funding_agency: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
implementing_agency: China Railways Materials and Supplies Corporation, State-Owned Company; Pakistan Railways, State-Owned Company
recipient_agencies: China Railways Materials and Supplies Corporation, State-Owned Company; Pakistan Railways, State-Owned Company
contacts: Liu Guoping, Vice President of the CRMASC ; Saeeduz Zafar, Chairman of the Railways Board ; Javed Asharf Qazi, Federal Minister for Communications and Railways

title: Grant for post-flood reconstruction effort in Pakistan (linked to #36984, #36939, #54097)
description: In October 2010, China agreed to provide $229 million for post-flood reconstruction, the provision of rice processors, and the provision of the latest technology of cold storage. This was declared by the Pakistani Minister of Information and Broadcasting, Qamar Zaman Kaira, during a press conference on Hu Jiantao's visit to Pakistan. The $229 million package was signed alongside a promised $400 million loan and a $10 million grant. This project is linked to projects #36984, #36939, and #54097.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PAPRIN0020101221e6cg0005q&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PAPRIN0020101221e6cg0005p&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PMDAIP0020101220e6cj00001&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.enterfocalpoint.com/focalpoint/?p=150, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://pk.chineseembassy.org/eng/zbgx/t779870.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.app.com.pk/en_/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=124914, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.asianews.it/news-en/Wen%E2%80%99s-successful-trip-to-Pakistan-and-the-limits-of-Chinese-diplomacy-20298.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://gb.cri.cn/27824/2010/12/19/3245s3094529.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Qamar Zaman Kaira, Minister of Information and Braodcasting (Pakistan)

title: Grant of 15 police pick-up trucks, Pakistan
description: On 14 November 2008, in a ceremony which Ambassador Luo Zhaohui, the Pakistani Prime Minister, and the Pakistani Ministry of Internal Affairs adviser attended, China donated 15 police pickup trucks worth 100 million Yuan. In his speech, Ambassador Luo expressed his appreciation for the protection and personal safety provided to the Chinese-funded institutions, provided by Pakistan, and that China supports the Pakistani government to safeguard the social stability, and the promotion of economic development efforts, emphasising the implementation of aid to Pakistan.
sources: http://pk.chineseembassy.org/chn/zbgx/t522277.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: HSBC provides US$79.8 million for diesel units for Sri Lanka railways project
description: In a 2017 Performance Report by Sri Lanka's Department of External Resources, it was reported that HSBC was providing US$79.8 million for the procurement, purchase and delivery of 9 diesel units for upcountry line operations in Sri Lanka Railways Project. The total cost of this project is US$93.9 million; the remaining US$14.1 million will be provided by HNB, which appears to be a Sri Lankan Bank. STAFF_NOTE: Flow type unknown.
sources: http://www.erd.gov.lk/images/Publications/ERDReport2017/ERDReport2017-English.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.erd.gov.lk/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=166:two-loan-facilities-for-road-and-railway-sector-development-of-the-country&catid=28:news-events&Itemid=101&lang=ta, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
funding_agency: HSBC (Hong Kong and Shanghai Banking Corporation), Private Sector

title: ICBC and FRDU provide debt financing to Uzbekistan for purchase of four Boeing aircraft
description: In 2016, the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (ICBC) and the Fund for Reconstruction and Development of Uzbekistan (FRDU) provided $552,661,846 in debt financing to Uzbekistan for the purchase of four new Boeing 787-8 aircraft. The amount of financing provided by the ICBC is unknown, so transaction amount has been left blank. The dates of implementation are 2016-2020.
sources: https://invest.gov.uz/en/invest-projects-taxonomy/realizuemye-investitsionnye-proekty/, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
funding_agency: Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (ICBC), State-Owned Company

title: Lighting Sri Lanka Eastern Province Project (Negenahira Nawodaya): Supply and Delivery of Materials
description: On 16 November 2011, China EXIM Bank signed a 32,496,000 USD loan agreement with Sri Lanka for the supply & delivery of imported materials required for the Lighting Sri Lanka Eastern Province project (Negenahira Nawodaya). The project was commenced on January 16th, 2012, with the goal of electrifying 268 villages in the Trincomalee & Batticaloa Districts. The implementing agency for this project was the Ceylon Electricity Board. The China Eximbank loan has a variable interest rate of LIBOR 06 Months for US$ + 3.00% margin, a 4 year grace period, and a 15 year maturity (see Sri Lanka Department of External Resources 2012 Annual Performance Report). The interest rate is coded based on the 6 Month LIBOR at time of signing of the agreement. The average 6 Month LIBOR rate in November 2011 was 0.681%. Total interest rate is therefore coded as 0.681% + 3.00%, or 3.681%. This project involved the procurement of materials for the construction of new electrification schemes (268 new rural electrification schemes), 106 new low voltage distribution substations, 802 Km of low voltage lines, and 273Km of medium voltage reinforcement tower lines and rehabilitation of 200 of low voltage distribution substations.
sources: http://www.erd.gov.lk/index.php?option=com_rmobilization&view=resource_project&category_id=1&sub_category_id=1&searchby=donor_type&donor_id=4&today=2018-10-23&Itemid=321&lang=en, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.cabinetoffice.gov.lk/cab/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=16&Itemid=49&lang=en&dID=4294, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://powermin.gov.lk/english/?page_id=1410, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.erd.gov.lk/images/pdf/performance_report_2012_english.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
funding_agency: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
implementing_agency: Ceylon Electricity Board, State-Owned Company
recipient_agencies: Ceylon Electricity Board, State-Owned Company

title: Lighting Sri Lanka Uva Province Project (Uva Udanaya)
description: On 19 July 2011, China Exim Bank signed a 24.9 million USD loan agreement with Sri Lanka for the Lighting Sri Lanka Uva Province Project (Uva Udanaya). The loan has an interest rate of LIBOR 06 Months for US$ +2.8% margin and a maturity of 12 years, including a 3 year grace period (see 'Public Investment' and 'Global Partnership' documents from ERD). The average 6 Month LIBOR rate in July 2011 was 0.414%. Total interest rate is therefore coded as 0.414% + 2.80%, or 3.214%. The objective of this project was to procure materials required for construction of 250 new substations, 625km new MV lines & 2250km new low voltage lines. According to the Sri Lanka Department of External Resources, this project was completed on 19 July 2013. The contractor for this project was China National Complete Plant Import & Export Corporation.
sources: http://www.erd.gov.lk/files/performance%20report%202011%20-%20english%20version.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.erd.gov.lk/files/Parliament%20Question%20-%20Export%20Credit%2022.052014.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.erd.gov.lk/files/Parliament%20Question%20-%20Export%20Credit%2022.052014.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.erd.gov.lk/index.php?option=com_rmobilization&view=resource_project&category_id=1&sub_category_id=1&searchby=donor_type&donor_id=4&today=2018-10-23&Itemid=321&lang=en, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.erd.gov.lk/images/pdf/global_partnership_towards_development_2013.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
funding_agency: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
implementing_agency: China National Complete Plant Import & Export Corporation Group (COMPLANT), State-Owned Company

title: NDRC donates 250,000 energy-saving LED lights to Maldives (link to project ID #38400)
description: In April 2013, the National Development Reform Commission (NDRC) of the People's Republic of China donated 24 million CNY worth of LED lights to Maldives. Vice Secretary of NDRC and Maldives' Minister of Energy and Environment attended a handover ceremony of China's donation of 250,000 LED energy-saving tube lights on April 1, 2013. The lights were donated by NDRC 'in order to assist in combating the negative effects of climate change.' Reportedly the lights have been distributed to over 500 institutes across the islands. Linked to #38400, an additional donation of 200,000 LED tube lights and 10 sets of solar home systems.

title: PetroChina Granted 1.2 Million Liters Petroleum to Nepal (linked to #53157)
description: On October 28, 2015, China National United Oil Corporation signed a memorandum of understanding with Nepal Oil Corporation (NOC) to grant 1.2 million liters of petroleum to Nepal. On October 31, 2015, China handed over the oil. The grant aimed at helping relieve the acute energy shortage in Nepal. 'We have received 73.5 metric tons of petrol from China in these two days,' NOC spokesperson Deepak Baral told Xinhua. In December of the same year, China provided an additional 1.4 million liters (captured in project (#53157)
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ATHIMT0020151028ebas0003o&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/international/world-news/nepal-receives-first-consignment-of-petrol-from-china/articleshow/49629852.cms, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.xinhuanet.com//world/2015-11/04/c_128392390.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Procurement of 100 Carriages for Sri Lanka Railways
description: According to the 2007 Annual Report from the Sri Lanka Ministry of Finance, China committed a loan of 27,078,543 USD in 2017 for the supply of 100 railway passenger carriages to Sri Lanka (see p. 351). The passenger carriages would be supplied to Sri Lanka by China National Machinery Import and Export Corporation (CMC). According to the 2008 Annual Report from the Sri Lanka Ministry of Finance, this project was completed in 2008 (see p. 214). It is worth noting that in 2007 China also committed a loan for the provision of 15 diesel multiple units (power train sets) to Sri Lanka (see project ID #33260), and in 2010 China committed a loan for the provision of an additional 13 diesel multiple units (see project ID #49343).
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=XNEWS00020060224e22o004ph&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=XNHA000020050831e18v000xj&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://archives.dailynews.lk/2012/09/05/news21.asp, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://archives.dailynews.lk/2012/10/18/news17.asp, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://books.google.com.sg/books?id=KQkVAgAAQBAJ&pg=PA243&lpg=PA243&dq=sri+lanka,+china,+100+railway&source=bl&ots=R3-6lB4nAZ&sig=OotjQwRtlZK3ZKEPZykyNz5e9h4&hl=en&sa=X&ei=g2qHVYjhBdO3uASGk6LQDw&ved=0CC0Q6AEwAw#v=onepage&q=sri%20lanka%2C%20china%2C%20100%20railway&f=false, Academic Journal Article; http://www.treasury.gov.lk/reports/annualreport/annualReport2007-eng.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.treasury.gov.lk/documents/10181/12870/2006/bb0d67c1-c741-4ef3-8ef2-e9afc2663839, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.treasury.gov.lk/documents/10181/12870/2008/35a66f52-d5b4-4868-b1a6-f9e2e747131d, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: Procurement of material for the Northern Province power sector development program project (Uthuru Wasanthaya)
description: On 9 September 2010 the Export-Import Bank of China signed a US$31.7 million loan agreement with Sri Lanka for the procurement of material for the Northern Province power sector development program project (Uthuru Wasanthaya). The loan has an interest rate of LIBOR 06 Month for US$ + 2.40% margin and a maturity of 15 years, including a 3 year grace period (see 'Global Partnership' document). The average 6 Month LIBOR rate in September 2010 was 0.478%. Total interest rate is therefore coded as 0.478% + 2.40%, or 2.878%. The goal of the project is to construct a low and medium voltage network in the Northern Province, to achieve 100% electricity coverage. According to the Department of External Resources, the project was completed on September 9, 2012 (see 'Resource Mobilization'). STAFF_NOTE: The Sri Lanka Department of External Resources document 'Public Investment' lists the maturity as 12 years, with a 2 year grace period, but the 'Global Partnership' document lists the maturity as 15 years with a 3 year grace period. Because the 'Global Partnership' document also lists the interest rate, the maturity and grace period from that document have been coded in the project.

funding_agency: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency

title: Protocol Vehicle Project
description: In February 2014, Afghanistan signed a letter for the Protocol Vehicle Project where China assisted Afghanistan's Ministry of Foreign Affairs with limousine vehicles. The project was completed in 2014.

title: Provision of Sporting Goods for Youth in Jaffna, Kilinochchi and Mullaitivu
description: On 4 May 2012, the Chinese government signed a 1 million CNY grant agreement with Sri Lanka for the provision of sporting goods for the youth in Jaffna, Kilinochchi and Mullaitivu (see Sri Lanka Department of External Resources 2012 Annual Performance Report). The sports equipment was delivered to Colombo in December 2012, and on 18 January 2013 Ambassador Wu Jianghao and the Sri Lanka Foreign Minister Peiris signed a handover certificate (see January 2013 article from China's Ministry of Commerce).
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=MENREP0020130121e91l0004x&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://lk.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201301/20130100006448.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.treasury.gov.lk/reports/annualreport/2012/6-FinacingBudget.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.erd.gov.lk/files/ERD%20Performance%20Report%202012%20-English.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: Supply of 02 Nos MA - 60 Aircraft Project
description: On 9 September 2010, China Exim Bank signed a 41 million USD loan agreement with Sri Lanka for the Supply of 02 Nos MA - 60 Aircraft Project through the Sri Lanka Ministry of Ports & Aviation. The loan has a maturity of 20 years, including a 5 year grace period. These two commercial aircrafts will be used for passenger transportation between domestic and regional destinations. These two aircraft were delivered to the Sri Lanka Air Force on 30 September 2011. These aircraft would be operated by ‚ÄòHelitours‚Äô, the Sri Lanka Air Force's commercial arm for domestic flights. STAFF_NOTE: The 'Public Investment' document from Sri lanka Department of External resources indicates the loan amount as 106 million USD with a maturity of 20 years and a 5 year grace period. The document also indicates that China National Aero-Technology Import & Export Co. is the contractor for the project. The Department of External Resources website (see 'Resource Mobilization') lists the transaction amount as 41 million USD, and the Department of External Resources Performance Report 2010 lists the transaction amount as 40.95 million USD on p. 46 and 41.1 million USD on p. 61, and it also refers to the financing as a concessional loan. It seems that the loan was used to purchase aircrafts from China (China National Aero-Technology Import & Export Co.), so the flow type has been coded as Export Credits.

title: Waste Collection Equipment
description: On 21 November 2006, China signed an agreement for the provision of a 41 million MVR loan through its Exim Bank to improve the efficiency of garbage disposal in the Maldives. Loan funds would be used to invest in the equipment needed to efficiently collect waste. The final disbursement of loan funds was made in 2010. Annual Disbursements: - 2009: 18.2 million MVR (MTEF Estimate, Maldives' Government Budget Report 2009) - 2010: 22.8 million MVR (MTEF Estimate, Maldives' Government Budget Report 2009)

title: Xinhua provides assistance to Maldives media sector
description: On July 9, 2014, Xinhua and Maldives National Broadcasting Station signed an agreement for Xinhua to provide news materials to Maldives' broadcasting station to broadcast better news to the Maldives. The details and status of this project are vague.

title: China Donated Inspection System to Turkmenistan
description: On June 22, China agreed to provide a mobile inspection system to the Turkmenistan government. The chairman of the State Customs Service of Turkmenistan, [Myratberdi] Annalyyew, from the Turkmen side, and Vice President of the Nuktek Company, Ms Wen Hwan, from the Chinese side, signed the contract. The mobile inspection system was handed over on April 3, 2006. STAFF_ NOTE: Neither resource indicates any terms associated with the mobile inspection system, so it is coded as a grant.

title: China granted 80 refrigerated car to Turkmenistan
description: In February 2017, the 80 refrigerated cars were given to Turkmenistan by Xi Jinpin, the Chairman of PRC, as a gift. The refrigerated cars were ordered by Ministry of Commerce of PRC, produced by Yutong Heavy Industries, and shipped by General Logistics Company.

title: China grants Turkmenistan 15 million RMB for mechanical plant (linked to project #40169)
description: On Dec. 26, 2003, State officials of China and Turkmenistan signed an agreement for a grant of 15 million RMB (1.8 million USD) and an interest-free credit of 30 million USD (see project #40169). The grant was to be used by Turkmengaz to purchase equipment and spare parts for its repair mechanical plant. Current project status is unknown.

title: China Grants $700,000 Worth of Aid to Tajik Police
description: In March 2003, Tajikistan Interior Ministry received no-strings aid totaling 700,000 dollars from Beijing, China. The aid was received under an agreement signed between the Tajik Interior Ministry and the Chinese Public Security Ministry. Twenty patrol cars (One source suggests 50 vehicles), special equipment, computers, laser printers, uniforms and footwear for the ministry's special subdivisions, special crime detection equipment, communication devices, night vision binoculars, cameras, metal detectors, shields, helmets and many others things were received. The Chinese ambassador to Tajikistan, Mr Wu Hongbin, and the first deputy interior minister, Police Lt-Gen Abdurahim Qahhorov, visited the Interior Ministry's department for the provision of materials and equipment. According to the Flat Export from Tajikistan AIMS as of May 2018 reports donation of Policemen facilities worth $483,600 funded by the Chinese government, and an additional contribution of $157,040 for 'different equipment.' These two donations together total $640,640, therefore it seems they are referencing this same project, even though transaction amounts differ slightly. The transaction amount has been coded as 640,640 USD to reflect this official source information.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=afpr000020030312dz3c003ej&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=bbcca00020030311dz3b000b7&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.rferl.org/content/article/1102748.html, Other Academic (Working Paper, Dissertation); http://reliefweb.int/report/tajikistan/china-gives-tajikistan-2-million-dollars-food-aid, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.dropbox.com/s/rl546mymjz3f15f/May%202018%20Flat%20Export%20from%20Tajikistan%20AIMS%20China%20Specific%20Projects.xlsx?dl=0, Other
contacts: Abdurahim Qahhorov, first deputy interior minister ; Wu Hongbin, Chinese ambassador to Tajikistan

title: China commits 10 million USD grant of communications equipment
description: Summary: In 2001, China sent communication equipment worth 10m dollars to Kyrgyzstan. The head of the communication and information science directorate of the Ministry of Transport and Communication, K. Talypov, said equipment [telephone station] for 10,000 subscribers would be installed in Bishkek and then in other regions. China's ZTE company, and Kyrgyztelekom, a joint-stock company, concluded a cooperation agreement to deliver and assemble the equipment.

title: China grants 105 vehicles to Tajikistan
description: In August 2008, China granted Tajikistan a total of 105 vehicles, consisting of 80 buses, 5 garbage trucks, and 20 executive cars for use during the Shanghai Cooperation Organization summit. The value of the cars is unknown. This project seems to correspond to record TJK/082181 of the Tajikistan AIMS, which captures the 'supply of buses and technical equipment for community facilities' with a total value of 2,739,726 USD.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ASIPLU0020080804e48400008&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCCA00020080801e481001b9&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://asiaplus.tj/en/news/tajikistan/power/20080731/china-donates-50-new-buses-tajik-capital, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.dropbox.com/s/rl546mymjz3f15f/May%202018%20Flat%20Export%20from%20Tajikistan%20AIMS%20China%20Specific%20Projects.xlsx?dl=0 , Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China EXIM Bank provides concessional loan of 1.385 billion yuan PAKSAT-1R Satellite for Pakistan (linked to #36953)
description: Paksat-1R, a DFH-4-type satellite, was constructed by the Pakistan Space and Upper Atmosphere Research Commisson (SUPARCO) and the China Great Wall Industry Coporation (CGWIC). On August 11, 2011, at the Chinese Xichang Satellite Launch Center, Pakistan‚Äôs first Communications Satellite PAKSAT-1R, as a part of Pakistan‚Äôs Space Programme 2040 was launched, witnessed by Pakistani Secretary Defence Lt Gen Syed Athar Ali (R), Secretary Foreign Affairs, Salman Bashir, Director General, Strategic Plans Division Lt Gen Khalid Ahmed Kidwai (R) and Ambassador of Pakistan to China, Muhammad Masood Khan, said a press release issued here. The contract for the construction and launch of the satellite was signed between Pakistan's Space and Upper Atmosphere Research Commission (SUPARCO) and China Great Wall Industry Corporation in October 2008. The loan agreement was signed on October, 15, 2009 between the Deputy Director of the China EXIM Bank and the Pakistani Ambassador to China. The Shanghai Municipal Commission of Commerce reports that the project has a total planned cost of USD220 million, with 85% of it funded through concessional loans provided through the Chinese Export-Import Bank. The Chinese official government website claims that the aggregate loan amount will not exceed CNY1.35 billion, which translates roughly to the 85% of USD220 million mentioned above. The Chinese Great Wall Corporation adds that the Chinese side had agreed that the Chinese EXIM Bank would first provide CNY8 million, with the rest of the funding being continually supplied until the project would be completed. It also mentions that, according to convention, the loans will have a 5-year grace period and a 2 percent interest rate, and the Chinese government will directly provide an interest rate subsidy. China also provided a loan of 86.5M RMB for the construction of a ground control facility, whose agreement was reached in October 2009 and finalized in November 2010 (see project #36953). The CNY1.3 billion loan is likely to be the aggregate amount for construction of both the satellite and the ground control center.

title: China Exim Bank 450 Million RMB loan to supply telecommunication equipment to Ministry of Communication
description: The China Exim Bank is providing 450 million RMB for the supply of telecommunications equipment to the Turkmenistan Ministry of Communication. As of 2012, the project was still being implemented, according to a Turkmenistan State Bank Annual Report. This project may be part of China loans worth 650 million RMB to Turkmenistan for communications in 2005 (#40214) along with 200 million RMB export credits for telecommunications in 2006 (#40332). STAFF_NOTE: The original commitment date is unclear. The umbrella project of 650 million RMB was committed in 2005 and the 200 million RMB project was committed in 2006, so it is unlikely that the commitment year is 2011. The year is marked as 2006 to better reflect the transaction amount.

STAFF_NOTE: This project was listed in the Tajikistan AIMS platform, which indicates that funds did go to Tajikistan, however the meteorological management is of the People's Republic of China, which does not seem logically consistent.

title: 17th SAARC Summit
description: The Maldives Budget in Statistics 2013 document lists 'Aid given to the 17th SAARC Summit' as a grant from China, although it provides no transaction amount. This summit was held in 2011, so that year has been coded as the commitment year. No other available Budget in Statistics documents include information on the 17th SAARC Summit, and there are no Budget in Statistics documents available for 2010-2012. It is unclear what specific kind of aid China provided. According to a 2011 Reuters article, the post-summit giveaway bag included porcelain pens and diaries from the Chinese Foreign Affairs Ministry detailing ‚ÄúFive Years of China-SAARC Cooperation.‚Äù Additionally, a box for a new 40-inch TV in the media center was labeled 'China Aid'. According to a 2015 Nepal Republic Media article, China distributed bags with the slogan 'China-SAARC friendship' at the 2011 SAARC Summit in the Maldives. The intent has been coded as Mixed, because based on media sources it appears the aid likely had at least some representational intent.
crs_sector_name: Support to Non-governmental Organizations (NGOs) and Government Organizations
sources: https://www.reuters.com/article/us-maldives-china-india-idUSTRE7AF0DT20111116, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.finance.gov.mv/public/attachments/BFdQChbFNpNL5dXAsb67yjlwEPD6FhJqwTcdtVdv.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.finance.gov.mv/public/attachments/BFdQChbFNpNL5dXAsb67yjlwEPD6FhJqwTcdtVdv.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=HTREPB0020150202eb1v000dy&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: CBD Loans $1.33 billion USD to Reliance Communications (Facility III) (Linked to #42654, #54348, #54350)
description: On March 9th, 2011, China Development Bank loaned $1.33 billion USD to Reliance Communications. Media reports suggest that the loan was used to refinance 3G spectrum fees. The interest rate of the loan is 3.458%. As of December 31st, 2014, $1.237 billion USD of the loan was outstanding. This project is linked to three other CDB loans to Reliance: $750 million USD in 2008 (Facility I) (#42654), $300 million USD in 2011 (Facility II) (#54348), and $300 million USD in 2011 (Facility IV) (#54350). STAFF_NOTE: 5 MARCH 2019. The listed interest rate was aggregate of the applicable LIBOR + 3.25% per annum. LIBOR rate was calculated off of the March 2011 average for USD, 0.208%.

title: CDB Loans $300 million USD to Reliance Communications (Facility II) (Linked to #42654, #54349, #54350)
description: On March 9th, 2011, China Development Bank loaned $300 million USD to Reliance Communications to help modernize their equipment and payoff maturing loans.. The interest rate of the loan is 2.408%. As of December 31st, 2014, $29 million USD of the loan was outstanding. This project is linked to three other CDB loans to Reliance: $750 million USD in 2008 (Facility I) (#42654), $1.33 billion in in 2011 (Facility III) (#54349), and $300 million USD in 2011 (Facility IV) (#54350). STAFF_NOTE: The listed interest rate was aggregate of the applicable LIBOR + 2.2% per annum. LIBOR rate was calculated off of the March 2011 average for USD, 0.208%. The four facilities/loans were all probably withdrawn to help primarily stave off bankruptcy, which Reliance Communications ended up filing for in 2018. Many creditors, including the CDB, are suing the RCom for their funds back. Media reports suggest that Facility 2 and 4, amounting to 600 million USD was used to import telecomm equipment from Huawei and ZTE.

title: CDB Loans $300 million USD to Reliance Telecom (Facility IV) (Linked to #42654, #54348, #54349)
description: On March 9th, 2011, China Development Bank loaned $300 million USD to Reliance Telecom Ltd through a facilities agreement. Reliance Communications guaranteed the loan. The interest rate of the loan is 2.408%. As of December 31st, 2014, $214 million USD of the loan was outstanding. This project is linked to three other CDB loans to Reliance: $750 million USD in 2008, (Facility I) (#42654), $300 million USD in 2011, (Facility II) (#54348), and $1.33 billion in 2011 (Facility III) (#54349). STAFF_NOTE: 5 MARCH 2019 The agreement details of this loan (page 149 of source) include a lot of covenants and security measures. I didn't fully comprehend what all of these items meant / it didn't seem like they were directly related to the flow from CDB to Reliance, so they were not included in the description. Stage 2 coder should review this information. The listed interest rate was aggregate of the applicable LIBOR + 2.2% per annum. LIBOR rate was calculated off of the March 2011 average for USD, 0.208%. Media reports suggest that Facility 2 and 4, amounting to 600 million USD was used to import telecomm equipment from Huawei and ZTE.

title: CDB loans 252 million to UEP 100 MW Jhimpir wind project (CPEC, IPP)
description: The UEP wind farm is located at Jhimpir, District Thatta in Sindh province of Pakistan, and has a generating capacity of 100MW. Pakistan's Alternative Energy Development Board (AEDB) had earlier in November 2011 issued a Letter of Intent to UEP Wind Power to develop the wind power project. UEP Wind Power Pvt. Ltd (UEP Wind) is a joint venture of Orient Group Investment Holdings Co. Ltd (99% ownership) and United Energy Group (1% ownership). The project achieved financial closure in March 2015, and achieved commercial operation on 15th June, 2017. UEP estimated the total cost of the project to be approximately 260 Million USD. China Gezhouba Group Company Limited was the Engineering, Procurement, Construction (EPC) Contractor for the project. Xinjiang Goldwind Science & Technology Co., Ltd, the largest manufacturer of wind turbines in China, supplied 66 Wind Turbine Generators of 1.5 MW each to the project. On April 20 2015, Hu Huaibang, President of China Development Bank and UEP President Tariq signed a loan agreement for the power project. The signing was witnessed by Chinese President Xi Jinping and Pakistani Prime Minister Sharif. According to a special report on CPEC projects from the Chinese embassy, the debt-equity ratio of the project was 75:25, with China Development Bank providing a loan of 252 USD Million. The special report also stated that the project hired 850 local Pakistani staff and employed a primarily local labor force. It also reported that the contractor paid RS. 152,598,971.00 tax to Pakistan government, as well as undertook a series of CSR projects in the community, including constructing a well for the local village as well as donating books to local schools. According to the IMF, the interest rate of the loan is 5.45%, with a repayment period of 10 years and a grace period of 2 years.

Chairman of the board of Ipoteka bank said the loan resources will be directed to developing small businesses and private entrepreneurship in Uzbekistan, and to purchase modern equipment and tools. title: China grants $500,000 USD to Tajikistan for the Ninth Meeting of the Heads of Governments of member states of SCO
description: The May 2018 Flat Export from Tajikistan AIMS reports that the Chinese government provided $500,000 in grant assistance to Tajikistan for the Ninth Meeting of the Heads of Governments of member states of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO). The AIMS project ID is TJK/112261. The ninth meeting of the heads of government of SCO was held in Russia in 2009, so it seems likely that this Tajikistan AIMS project may instead mean the eighth meeting of the heads of government of SCO, which was held in Tajikistan in 2008. The commitment year has therefore been coded as 2008 and flagged as year uncertain.
