title: China EXIM Bank offers US$153 million government concessional loan to Pakistan for RSSS-1 satellite
description: The Pakistan Remote Sensing Satellite (PRSS), also called Remote Sensing Satellite System (RSSS), will observe and gather information that would be widely used in Pakistan's land resources survey, environmental protection, disaster monitoring and management, crop yield estimation and urban planning. The project contract was signed by China Great Wall Industry Group Co., Ltd. ('Great Wall Company') of China Aerospace Science and Technology Corporation Limited and the Pakistan Space and Outer Atmosphere Research Committee (SUPARCO) on April 20, 2016. According to the contract, China Great Wall Company provided a remote sensing satellite to Pakistan in the form of on-orbit delivery, along with a ground application system, ground monitoring and control system, as well as on-orbit testing, on-site support, training, insurance and related technical support services. The press release by the China Great Wall company suggests that the satellite was successfully launched from the Jiuquan Satellite Launch Centre, China, on July 9, 2018. After successful tests in the orbit, Pakistan‚Äôs first Remote Sensing Satellite (PRSS-1) became fully operational on 14 August 2018. The control of PRSS-1 Satellite was successfully transferred to ground control stations in Pakistan, a statement issued by the Planning Commission said. The project financing support is provided by the Export-Import Bank of China. According to a press release by the China EXIM Bank, an agreement for a governmental concessional loan was signed on May 16, 2017. Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Year Book in the fiscal year of 2016/17 records the project with a Government Concessional Loan of USD153 million. According to the report, by June 30, 2017, disbursement had not started. STAFF_NOTE: another satellite called PakTES-1A was simultaneously launched with the PRSS on the same rocket. It is the scientific experimental satellite independently developed by Pakistan, which mainly carries out technical verification work on satellite platforms. Chinese side was not involved in its development except for the launch.

title: China Exim Bank loans 218 million RMB to Nepal for acquisition of 4 aircrafts (linked to #34442)
description: In 2013, Nepal signed a economic and technical cooperation agreement with China to procure and purchase six China-made airplanes. According to the deal, Nepal will acquire two aircrafts, a 19-seater Harbin Y-12E and a 58-seater Modern Ark 60 (MA60) on grant (project #34442) and three Harbin Y12E and a MA60 on concessional loan (project #34441). The Exim Bank of China will offer a concessional loan worth RMB 218 million (about Rs 3.61 billion) for the acquisition of four aircraft - 3 Harbin Y-12E and one MA60. A Nepal government source claims the loan is worth 228 million yuan. After discussions, Nepal has decided to pay an annual interest rate of 1.5% and a service charge and management expenses amounting to 0.4% of the overall loan amount. The Government of China has been considerate to permit a 7-year grace period for loan refund. This implies that Nepal will have a period of 20 years to settle the loan together with the interests. The national flag carrier aims to deploy the MA60 for mountain flights and other reachable places such as Pokhara, Bhairahawa, Biratnagar, Dhangadhi, Nepalgunj and Simara. However, NAC is willing to operate the Harbin Y-12e for mountain flights and other destinations in far-flung areas. In November 2014, Harbin Aircraft Manufacturing Corporation (now called the Harbin Aircraft Industry Group Co. Ltd.) officially handed over the first of the Y12-Es, 9N-AKS, to Nepal Airlines at a ceremony held in Kathmandu.

title: China Exim Bank loans Uzbekistan 177.6 million USD for purchase of oil rig equipment
description: In mid 2007, Uzgeoburneftegaz (Uzbekneftegaz subsidiary) signed a contract with China Petroleum Technology & Development Corp to supply 23 drilling rigs as well as with China National Machinery Industry Corporation to supply 10 cementers. In September 2009, China Petroleum Technology & Development Corporation and China National Machinery Industry Corporation (SINOMACH) delivered 23 drilling rigs, four cranes, and 10 cementing units that worth $209.1 million USD. China Exim Bank loaned 177.6 million USD with a 15-year maturity, 5 year grace period, and 3.5% interest rate to purchase the equipment. 31.5 million USD will be funded by Uzbekneftegaz.

title: China Exim bank gives loan to Pakistan for coaches purchase (linked to #35901)
description: In December 2009 Pakistan Railways signed a loan agreement in Beijing with China's EXIM Bank to purchase 205 coaches. The Pakistani delegation was led by Member Finance Pakistan Railways Jehangir Aziz and included senior officers from the Finance Ministry and Ministry of Railways. The representatives of DEC and CMC were also present at the signing ceremony. Under the loan agreement with reference to the coaches, Pakistan Railways would purchase 205 coaches from China Machinery Import and Export Corporation (CMC). EXIM Bank would loan US $ 134 million.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PAKBNK0020091215e5cf000hl&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://lahoremasstransit.blogspot.sg/2009/01/purchase-of-75-locomotives-zardaris.html, Social Media, including Unofficial Blogs; http://www.atimes.com/atimes/South_Asia/KL22Df02.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://karachi.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/200811/20081105890004.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China Eximbank loans $5.93 million to equip Akangaran Hydropower Plant in Uzbekistan (linked to #53683)
description: In 2009, China Eximbank provided a $5.93 million loan for equipment delivery to a small hydroelectric power plant (HPP) at the Akhangaran water reservoir (capacity 50 MW). The total cost of the project was US$70,000,000. The Ahangaran Hydropower Plant was started as a joint venture between China National Electric Equipment Corp (CNEEC) and the Uzbek Agriculture and Water Management Ministry in 2007. Based on this agreement, the Chinese company would provide equipment and assemble the plant. Under this same agreement, the Andijian Hydropower station was also initiated (Project ID#53683). STAFF_NOTE: Exact commitment year is uncertain. May also be known as Akhangaran hydropower plant - a source listing it with this name stated that the plant had 21MW. Defaulted to official source wattage.

title: China Export-Import Bank commits supplier's credit of US$102 million to Pakistan for white oil pipeline
description: Pak-Arab Pipeline Company (PARCO/PAPCO) and China Petroleum Engineering Construction Corporation (CPECC) signed an agreement, under which the Chinese firm would supply equipment and materials for the construction of white oil pipeline from Port Qasim, Karachi to Mahmud Kot, Multan. China Export-Import Bank will provide US$102 miillion of the total project amount in the form of suppliers‚Äô credit from CPECC. The $481 million project would provide a safer and cost-effective alternative for both crude and refined products transportation and added with the completion of the pipeline a more comprehensive, safer, cost effective, demand responsive and eco-friendly pipeline network will be available to meet the country‚Äôs growing needs for energy. The 817 km-long and 26 inch diameter pipeline has an initial capacity of transporting eight million tons refined petroleum products, and 12 million tons white oil per annum. The pipeline was earlier scheduled to be completed by June 2004, but later revised to October 2005. As of September 2004, 95% of the work had been completed. The testing of the pipeline would be conducted during October and November 2004 and was expected to become operational by end-November or early December. The project has been completed. Out of the total cost of $481 million, the foreign component stands at $120 million, while local component stands at Rs 20.657 billion. The debt part of the foreign currency cost is being financed by export credit agencies (ECAs) from China through Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) contractor. Three major banks ‚Äî HBL, UBL and NBP‚Äîwill arrange Rs12.5 billion of Rs29 billion White Oil Pipeline Project of PAPCO. Around Rs10 billion would be floated as TFCs (term finance certificates) and the remaining amount would be in the form of redeemable preference shares. The financing arrangement also includes bridge financing of Rs5 billion by the consortium banks to be made available for the project. In this regard, a meeting of the chief executives of NBP, HBL, UBL and PAPCO was held at the NBP office and memorandum of understanding (MoU) was also signed. The Rs29 billion ($480 million) white oil pipeline project is achieving financial close and the entire debt financing of $360 million including Rs12.5 billion in local currency is being arranged whereas equity financing of $120 million is in place. For this project NBP will also provide a foreign currency loan of $18 million and issue a bank guarantee of $102 million for China Exim Bank related to suppliers‚Äô credit from CPECC, which have been selected as EPC contractor for the project. The project is being materialised by a joint venture, which consists of PARCO (51 % shares), Shell (26 %), Caltex (12 %) and Pakistan State Oil (11 % shares). The contractor of the laying the pipeline is CPECC. The project is to be implemented on build, own and operate (BOO) basis, with PARCO being the executing agency. Techno Engineering is involved in the construction in cooperation with CPECC.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=bbcsap0020010710dx5b001qv&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=afpr000020010709dx5b02y72&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.dawn.com/news/30107/banks-to-fund-white-oil-pipeline-project, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20050105005528/en/American-Energy-Announces-Purchase-Working-Interest-Pakistan#.VZ1cBu2qqko, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.gasandoil.com/news/south_east_asia/ba5dcb7c34cfdf41b5e3754470e8f49f, Other; http://karachi2.mofcom.gov.cn/article/bilateralvisits/200508/20050800298350.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://dar.dargroup.com/Projects/White-Oil-Pipeline-Project-WOPP, Other
funding_agency: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
implementing_agency: China Petroleum Pipeline Engineering Corporation (CPPEC), State-Owned Company; Pak-Arab Pipeline Company (PAPCO), Private Sector
recipient_agencies: Pak-Arab Pipeline Company (PAPCO), Private Sector

title: China agrees to provide solar batteries and wind turbines samples to Kazakhstan
description: In September 2009, during a state visit by Kazakh officials to China, China agreed to provide Kazakhstan with sample equipment for solar batteries and wind turbines. The equipment will be used for renewable energy projects in the country, with the projects being carried out in the Almaty Region. A 1MW solar power plant will be built in the free economic zone 'Park IT' near Almaty and a 5MW wind power plant will be built in the Yenbekshikazakhsky district of the Almaty Region, covering an area of 25 ha.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=KAZWIR0020110927e79q0012x&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.inform.kz/eng/article/2217838, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China donates 510 books to Pakistan International Islamic University Islamabad
description: China donated 510 books on history, sports, society, calligraphy, opera, medicines, heritage and folks arts to the students of International Islamic University Islamabad (IIUI). Some books were on Chinese Culture. For the help of students, China has also donated CDs and films. Cultural Counsellor of People's Republic China handed over these books, CDs and films to IIUI's Chief Librarian.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PAKBNK0020091230e5cu0002v&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China donates 800 books to Pakistan National Library
description: In December 2009 China, represented by the Chinese Embassy to Pakistan, donated 800 books to the National Library of Pakistan (NLP). The books, covering a wide range of subjects on Chinese culture, arts, medicines, religions and other related topics, have been handed over to Mazharul Islam, Director General Department of Libraries, by Yang Linhai, Chinese Cultural Counsellor.

title: China donates books to Pakistan
description: In 2010, the Chinese Cultural Counsellor Yang Linhai presented a huge quantity of books to National University of Modern languages on behalf of the Embassy of China. The books were presented to Prof Dr Aziz Ahmad Khan, Rector NUML at a ceremony which was also attended by a large number of diplomats from the Embassy of China. The books are mostly about the Chinese culture, folk art and craft, traditional medicines etc.

title: China grants 180 million RMB to Nepal for acquisition of Harbin Y-12E and MA60 aircrafts (linked to #34441)
description: In 2013, Nepal signed an economic and technical cooperation agreement with China to procure and purchase six China-made airplanes. According to the deal, Nepal will acquire two aircrafts, a 19-seater Harbin Y-12E and a 58-seater Modern Ark 60 (MA60) on grant (project #34442) and three Harbin Y12E and a MA60 on a concessional loan (project #34441). The grant for the acquisition of the Harbin Y-12E and the MA60 is worth RMB 180 million (about Rs 2.98 billion). On 28 April 2014, the delivery ceremony of the Chinese MA60 aircraft was held in Kathmandu. title: China loans Bangladesh $240 million to buy 6 dredgers
description: The Bangladesh Shipping Corporation (BSC) will borrow $240 million to import six dredgers from China in a bid to enrich the fleet of the state-owned marine transport provider. The loan has a 2% interest rate and a 20 year repayment period. The dredgers arrived at the Mawa Site on 13 Jan 2015, and accomplished Custom Clearance on 16 Jan 2015.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/aa/?ref=FNEXBD0020130807e98700001&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.dredgingtoday.com/2014/10/09/picture-of-the-day-six-dredgers-lined-up-for-delivery/, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://bba-beta.dayspringltd.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/01/IMG2.pdf, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.dailymail.co.uk/indiahome/indianews/article-2140557/Friend-Chinas-projects-run-rough-weather-Bangladesh.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks
recipient_agencies: Bangladesh Shipping Corporation, State-Owned Company

title: China loans Sri Lanka 102.7m USD loan to purchase Chinese S12 power trains
description: 13 new Class S12 power set trains are to be imported from China by. These new power sets were built for Sri Lanka Railways by China's CSR Corporation. The trains were imported under a special loan scheme approved by the Chinese government. The first batch arrived in Sri Lanka in August 2012 and were to replace locomotive-hauled passenger trains. Seven of the S12 DMUs were ordered to strengthen long-distance travel on the Main line from Colombo to Badulla. Four of S12s will serve the Kelani Valley Line. The remaining two designed as luxury trains. In September 2012, the first units had trial runs.The first Main-Line train using the S12 began in 23 October 2012. Sources differ on exact transaction amount. Four different figures were found, all varying quite widely, $101 USD million, 9 billion rupees, 13,642 million rupees and lastly 11,900 million rupees. The figure used in the transaction amount is taken from the Sri Lankan Ministry of Internal Transport.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=DAINSL0020120803e8840003w&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://archives.dailynews.lk/2012/09/05/news21.asp, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://archives.dailynews.lk/2012/10/18/news17.asp, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.priu.gov.lk/news_update/Current_Affairs/ca201004/20100423power_sets_railway_from_china.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.transport.gov.lk/web/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=160&Itemid=109&lang=en, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
recipient_agencies: Sri Lanka Railways (SLR), Government Agency
contacts: B.A.P. Ariyarathna, Sri Lanka Railways General Manager

title: China loans Uzbekistan $70.11m for purchase of Chinese electric locomotives
description: In November, 2007, China and Uzbekistan signed MOU which pledged to offer Uzbekistan concessional loans for purchasing electric locomotives from China. The contracted was signed in May, 2009. In 2010, Uzbekistan Temir Yollari state joint stock railway company received three electric locomotives, which were made by China Zhuzhou Electrical Locomotive Works. Uzbekistan Temir Yollari received electric locomotives within the agreement with Zhuzhou Electrical Locomotive Works. In line with the document, the Chinese company would supply 15 electric locomotives. The Uzbek company received first two locomotives in June 2010. The Chinese company planned to supply other 10 by the end of 2010. The cost of the project is $75.53 million USD, which is financed due to loan of China for $70.11 million USD and own funds of the Uzbek railway company for $5.42 million USD. Loan funds are provided for 20 years, including a five-year grace period, at a rate of two percent per annum. The project speed of the electric locomotives makes up 160 km per hour, which would allow to double passenger turnover at the electrified railway roads of Uzbekistan. New equipment will be used on railway lines Samarkand - Khojidavlet and Navoi - Samarkand.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=UZBDAY0020100812e68c0008e&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=TRENDE0020100608e668004ed&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/dfpd/2010-04/22/content_9762036.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/aarticle/jmxw/200805/20080505524955.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://finance.ifeng.com/roll/20100613/2312038.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://zh.wikipedia.org/wiki/O'Z-Y%E5%9E%8B%E7%94%B5%E5%8A%9B%E6%9C%BA%E8%BD%A6, Other
implementing_agency: Zhouzhou Electrical Locomotive Works

title: China provides 37 million PKR for Establishment of Geodetic Datum of Pakistan
description: A Pakistani government project status report in May 2017-18 records the project. China provides financing of 34.374 million PKR for the project 'Establishment of Geodetic Datum of Pakistan.' The executing agency is noted as Defense. Commitment year and project status are both uncertain. According to a Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Year Book in the fiscal year of 2016/17, Letter of Exchange signed on 13th May, 2017. Implementation agreement yet to be signed. The committed amount is CNY99.9 million. This is much larger than the 34 million rupees amount mentioned above. According to the Pakistan Ministry of Finance Estimates of Foreign Assistance for 2017-2018, the revised budget predicted 0 funds for that year, indicating that likely no funds were disbursed in 2016-2017 for the project. Pakistan estimates Chinese loan to the project to be 34.374 million Pakistani rupees in 2017-2018. According to the Pakistan Ministry of Finance Estimates of Foreign Assistance for 2017-2018, the revised budget estimate for 2018/9 is 18.197 million Pakistani Rupees, meaning that the project had not started construction as of 2017. No further information has been found. The sources above all document the project amount and specify the funding type as loan, but no other source could confirm this; for now, flow type is coded as vague. STAFF_NOTE: as the purpose of the project is military, for now crs sector is coded as unallocated and intent as representational.
sources: http://www.ead.gov.pk/frmDetails.aspx, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.ead.gov.pk/userfiles1/file/EAD/2018/Final%20PCP%20Year%20Book%202016-17%20.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.finance.gov.pk/budget/Estimates_of_Foreign_Assistant_2017_18.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.finance.gov.pk/budget/Estimates_of_Foreign_Assistance_2018_19.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China provides CNY650 million in supplier's credit for China National Machinery Co to export 175 railway coaches to Pakistan (Linked to projects #56551 and #56552)
description: In 2001, China and Pakistan signed an agreement to supply 69 locomotives and 175 passenger coaches worth 100 million USD to Pakistan to modernize its railway system. Under the contract, the Exim Bank of China will meet 87.5 per cent of the financial requirements of the export supplier credit basis, while the rest will be arranged by Pakistan Railways. The repayment period for the credit is 15 years. The grace period will be three years and the interest rate will be about five per cent. China National Machinery and Equipment Import and Export Corporation will export the 175 passenger carriages. Another Chinese Company, Dongfang Electric Corporation (DEC) will provide altogether 69 modern locomotive engines worth 100 million USD to Pakistan within a period of two years. Under the agreement, 15 complete locomotives are to be manufactured in China, while the rest of 54 will be assembled in Pakistan. China will provide both spare parts and technology. According to the annual report by EXIM Bank of China of 2003, in March that year the bank agreed to provide CNY650 million (roughly the equivalent of USD100 million at the conversion rate of the time) in supplier's credits for China National Machinery, and later in July, the bank signed a similar deal with Donfang Electric Corporation for two lines of supplier's credit, one of CNY680 million and the other of USD4.6 million, to support the latter's export of 69 locomotives. This project captures the export of railway carriages. For details of the other project, see projects #56551 and #56552. These are linked together because they are signed and implemented simultaneously.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=afpr000020010709dx5a030yj&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=prn0000020011116dxbg000fc&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PAPRIN0020030714dz7c000d7&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=paprin0020010714dx5a00gew&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=bbcsap0020010710dx5b001qv&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=afpr000020010709dx5b02y72&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=paprin0020010814dx8b0009s&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PAPRIN0020030531dz5t0005l&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=HNTM000020050714e17e000h5&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=HNTM000020050714e17e000h5&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://pk.mofcom.gov.cn/article/ztdy/200803/20080305410943.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://finance.takungpao.com/q/2013/0913/1903430.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.eximbank.gov.cn/aboutExim/annals/2003/201807/P020180712541418438938.pdf, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source
funding_agency: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
implementing_agency: China National Machinery and Equipment Import & Export Corporation, State-Owned Company
contacts: Hu Cheng, China's Vice Minister for Foreign Trade and Economic Affairs ; Saeeduz Zafar, Pakistan Railways' chairman

Under the agreement, 15 complete locomotives are to be manufactured in China, while the rest of 54 will be assembled in Pakistan. China will provide both spare parts and technology. According to the annual report by EXIM Bank of China of 2003, in March that year the bank agreed to provide CNY650 million (roughly the equivalent of USD100 million at the conversion rate of the time) in supplier's credits for China National Machinery, and later in July, the bank signed a similar deal with Donfang Electric Corporation for two lines of supplier's credit, one of CNY680 million and the other of USD4.6 million, to support the latter's export of 69 locomotives. This project captures the export of locomotives, specifically the loan denominated in Chinese Yuan. For details of the loan denominated for the same project in USD, see project #56552. For details of the other project involving railway coaches, see #35120. These are linked together because they are signed and implemented simultaneously.

title: China provides USD4.6 million in supplier's credit for Dongfang Electric Co to export 69 locomotives to Pakistan (Linked to projects #35120 and #56551)
description: In 2001, China and Pakistan signed an agreement to supply 69 locomotives and 175 passenger coaches worth 100 million USD to Pakistan to modernize its railway system. Under the contract, the Exim Bank of China will meet 87.5 per cent of the financial requirements of the export supplier credit basis, while the rest will be arranged by Pakistan Railways. The repayment period for the credit is 15 years. The grace period will be three years and the interest rate will be about five per cent. China National Machinery and Equipment Import and Export Corporation will export the 175 passenger carriages. Another Chinese Company, Dongfang Electric Corporation (DEC) will provide altogether 69 modern locomotive engines worth 100 million USD to Pakistan within a period of two years. Under the agreement, 15 complete locomotives are to be manufactured in China, while the rest of 54 will be assembled in Pakistan. China will provide both spare parts and technology. According to the annual report by EXIM Bank of China of 2003, in March that year the bank agreed to provide CNY650 million (roughly the equivalent of USD100 million at the conversion rate of the time) in supplier's credits for China National Machinery, and later in July, the bank signed a similar deal with Donfang Electric Corporation for two lines of supplier's credit, one of CNY680 million and the other of USD4.6 million, to support the latter's export of 69 locomotives. This project captures the export of locomotives, specifically the loan denominated in USD. For details of the loan denominated for the same project in CNY, see project #56551. For details of the other project involving railway coaches, see #35120. These are linked together because they are signed and implemented simultaneously.

title: China's Exim Bank loans $17.3 million USD to Uzbekistan to supply housing stock with cold and hot water meters
description: On April 30, 2007, the deputy governor of the China Export-Import Bank of Uzbekistan, Li Jun, and the chairman of Ipoteka Bank, Mr. Sarah Babel, signed a loan agreement. According to the agreement, the Export-Import Bank will provide Uzbekistan with a loan of US$17.3 million under the Shanghai Cooperation Organization‚Äôs $900 million preferential export buyer‚Äôs credit for Uzbekistan‚Äôs procurement of Chinese-produced hot and cold water meters. The loan has an interest rate of 2% per year, 5-year grace period, and a 20 year maturity, and is to be paid semi-annually. The Chinese executives of the project, China National Machinery Import and Export Corporation (Group) and the ‚ÄúYiyang‚Äù Uzbekistan Branch, will provide more than 1 million hot and cold water meters to Uzbek public utilities and state local governments, and will be responsible for the installation of water meters. These water meters will all be installed in bungalows and buildings in Tashkent and other states. Staff_Note: According to ECCO, the loan amount was 17 million, but defaulted to $17.3 since this was the amount reported by more official sources.
sources: http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zxhz/200705/20070504634630.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.unece.org/fileadmin/DAM/hlm/documents/Publications/CP_Uzbekistan_withCorr.EN.pdf, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; http://www.ipotekabank.uz/upload/Ipoteka_bank_2017%20Report%20and%20Opinion_ENG%20with%20sign.pdf, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; https://www.adb.org/sites/default/files/project-document/64787/42489-uzb-rrp.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

title: Confucius Institute Donated Language Lab to the Tashkent State Institute of Oriental Studies
description: On March 29, 2016, Confucius Institute donated the language lab to the Tashkent State Institute of Oriental Studies. Ambassador Sun and President Mannarov jointly cut the ribbon for the voice lab. The lab contains 36 teaching equipment. STAFF_NOTE: Project is coded as mixed due to development and representational nature.

title: Exim Bank commits $172 million USD for locomotives in Kazakhstan
description: On December 31, 2002 the Export-Import Bank of China committed $172 million to be provided to the Kazakh railroad for 14 years at 5.3% annually without government guarantees, according to company President Yerlan Atamkulov. Kazakhstan Temir Zholy planned to buy locomotives from Chinese plants and assemble them in the city of Chou (Dzhambulsk region).

title: Exim Bank loans $42.75 million USD for the purchase of freight locomotives
description: In December 2011, Uzbekistan Railways SJSRC signed a contract with a consortium consisting of China National Technical Import & Export Corporation, CNR Dalian Locomotive and Rolling Stock Co. for the purchase of 11 freight locomotives. China's Exim Bank would fund this transaction with a loan of $42.75 million USD, with Uzbekistan Railways funding the remaining $2.2 million USD. This loan from the Exim Bank would have a 20 year maturity with a 5 year grace period and an interest rate of 2.25%. The delivery of the three electric locomotives was completed in 2013, and the rest of 8 locomotives was delivered in 2014. Staff_Note: Transaction amount was changed from 42.17 to 42.75 according to source from ECCO.

title: China Exim Bank loans 328.45 M RMB for 113 coaches to Ministry of Railway Transport
description: In 2007, the China Exim Bank provided a 328.45 million RMB loan to to Turkmenistan to purchase 113 railway passenger cars. The loan was given to the Ministry of Railway Transport of Turkmenistan. As of 2012, the loan was still be implemented, according to an annual report from Turkmenistan. STAFF_NOTE: The two book sources cite another book for the loan. However, upon looking at the book, the parent material doesn't offer any new information about the loan. The annual reports and the books record slightly different transaction amounts, however it can be assumed that these are referring to the same project.

title: ICBC Facility I to Reliance Communications (linked to #54352)
description: On February 22, 2012, Reliance Communications entered into a facility agreement with China Development Bank Corporation, Export-Import Bank of China and Industrial and Commercial Bank of China Limited for loan of US$ 925.2 million (‚ÄúICBC Facility I‚Äù). As at December 31, 2014, US$796 million of the principal amount was outstanding under this facility. The interest rate is calculated by adding the 6 Month LIBOR rate at the time of agreement, 0.757% to the margin of 4.75%. The loan was given for debt relief purposes.

title: ICBC Facility II to Reliance Communications (linked to #56456)
description: On July 21st, 2014, the Industrial & Commercial Bank of China (ICBC) loaned 1.2 billion Indian rupees in a working capital loan to Reliance Tech Services Limited for debt relief. Most of the funds will be used to repay Reliance's short term loans. Reliance Communications guaranteed the loan. The interest rate of the loan is calculated by adding the 6 Month LIBOR rate on the date of agreement 0.328% to the margin of 1.25%. The loan will be paid back over 10 years. This project is linked to ICBC and Exim's 2012 $925.2 million USD loan for the construction of ICBC Facility I (#56456).

title: China cancels $18.8 million of Afghanistan debt (linked to #34505)
description: In March 2004, China agreed to cancel $18.8 million of Afghanistan's debt, from a loan the Afghan government borrowed from China in 1965. The debt cancelled in this project is likely to make up the bulk of total debt cancelled by China between 2002 and 2009, which was worth $19.5 million. This project may be linked to #34505, in which China wrote off all of Afghanistan's debt in 2002.

title: China cancels all of Afghanistan's debt (linked to #34512)
description: In November 2002, China agreed to write off Afghanistan's debt. The exact amount of debt cancelled is estimated to be tens of millions of dollars, but the exact amount is unclear. This is separate from the $19.5 million of debt cancelled between 2002 and 2009, as this is after the agreement date of this project. Of the $19.5 million between 2002 and 2009, the $18 million of debt cancelled under the agreement in #34512 is likely to make up a large part of it.

title: China gives loans for foreign exchange reserves boost in Pakistan for 500m
description: In November 2008, following the recent visit of President Asif Ali Zardari to Beijing, China agreed to extend financial aid of 500 million USD. The South Asian nation is struggling with an acute balance of payments crisis and the government estimates the country needs around 4 billion USD in short order to pay for its imports and help repay its debt. The financial assistance, which would be distributed in 2-3 days, is in addition to the deposit of 500 million USD already placed by the Chinese government with the State Bank of Pakistan in June 2008. On Jan 23, 2009, Pakistan received soft loan of US$500 million from China to help build foreign exchange reserves. The deposit is only to build foreign reserves and cannot be used it for budgetary purposes. This amount will be repaid in one-and-a-half years, and has been provided to Pakistan under term deposit support. It has pushed up the reserves much above the $10 billion mark, a sign of moderate strength for exchange rate market. The lowest rate on the loans was 4%.

title: China reduces Kyrgyzstan's outstanding debt by 7 million USD
description: STAFF_NOTES: Unable to confirm this project in Stage 2 In May 2008, Kyrgyz Finance Minister Kalimbetova held bilateral meetings with Chinese and Indian Foreign Ministers concerning outstanding debts owed by Kyrgyzstan to these countries. During the meeting with the Chinese delegation Finance Minister Kalimbetova said all debt issues have been tackled between Kyrgyzstan and China. The Governments of China and Kyrgyzstan signed the agreement on transforming the Chinese governmental credit worth US$7 million into a grant.

title: China to write off Bangladeshi unpaid interest in a gesture of friendship

title: China Eximbank reschedules Kyrgyz Paper Mill debt
description: According to various media reports, in 2003, China Eximbank signed an agreement with the Kyrgyz Finance Ministry that allows for the restructuring of debt worth 100 million yuan. The 100 million RMB was reportedly the total value of interest-free and concessional loans given by the bank to the Kyrgyz government for the construction of a paper mill. According to the Kyrgyzstan AMP, there were two credits extended by China for the construction of the Kyrgyz-Chinese Paper Mill in Tokmok, which is located in the Chuy valley. The first credit was extended in 1996 (AMP ID 87188512380) and the second was extended in 1998 (AMP ID 87188512381). The debt has been restructured in pursuance of the resolution of the Paris Club of creditors on the consolidation of the Kyrgyz Republic's debt. In accordance with the agreement, the debt to be serviced (interest, plus the principal sum) is to be restructured. Media reported that the sum of payments deferred between 2001 and 2004 will total 1.98m yuan (about 250,000 dollars), which is to be paid within 10 years, starting from 2007. However, the value of 100 million yuan has been recorded as the restructured debt amount, because a MOFCOM source in 2015 reported that as of 2015, Kyrgyzstan still owes China 9,800,000 USD (around 40 million RMB in 2003) for the paper mill loans, and that in 2014 Kyrgyzstan had negotiated the return of 60,200,000 RMB to China by 2017. The sum of both values is close to the 100 million RMB that was reportedly loaned to Kyrgyzstan, suggesting that that was the total amount of debt that had been rescheduled in 2003. . It should also be noted that COMPLANT, the Chinese contractor for the paper mill project, reported a total project cost of 129,016,065 RMB, and People Daily report in 2002 put the total Chinese loan amount at 150,000,000 RMB.

title: China extends loan of $98m to ICICI Bank of India
description: On March 19, 2009, the Export Import Bank of China (China Exim bank) and ICICI Bank signed a loan agreement for $98 million USD under a two-step buyer credit (export credit) arrangement. The ICICI Bank signed the loan agreement through its Hong Kong branch and is the first Indian bank to have entered into this arrangement with China Exim. The cooperation between ICICI Bank and China Exim bank is likely to lead to creation of business opportunities for Chinese firms in India and is also expected to help Indian companies in tying-up long-term debt for their projects.

The Afghan government received the donation by the end of March 2002, indicating project completion. title: All-China Federation of Trade Unions donates $40,000 to flood-hit Pakistan
description: The All-China Federation of Trade Unions donated $40,000 in cash to Pakistan Workers‚Äô Federation and Pakistan Labor Federation, $20,000 each. The cash donations were handed over by Mr. Huang Xilian, Charge d‚ÄôAffaires ad Interim of the Chinese Embassy in his meetings with high-ups of these three Pakistan organizations respectively on October 14. The project is coded as ODA-like since the organization involved is state-affiliated.

title: China Donated $500,000 grant to Uzbekistan for earthquake relief
description: In July 2011 China pledged to provide Uzbekistan with aid worth 500,000 USD for emergency relief after an earthquake. In December 2011, Chinese ambassador Zhang Wei and Uzbekistan‚Äôs Deputy Minister of Finance Jorkin Tulsonov signed an intergovernmental transfer certificate for the Uzbek government‚Äôs $500,000 foreign exchange humanitarian assistance project in Tashkent.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=CEASEN0020110729e77t000xd&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://uz.chineseembassy.org/chn/zwgx/jmhz/t890436.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/200905/20090506214789.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China Gives Pakistan USD $10m for Internal Displaced Person Rehabilitation Program
description: According to the Pakistani National Assembly records, in July 2015, China signed an agreement with Pakistan to provide a special grant in cash to support the rehabilitation program for thousands of internally displaced people who were affected by the military operation in Pakistan's northwestern restive tribal region. The agreement, involving a grant of 10 million U.S. dollars, was signed by Chinese Ambassador to Pakistan Sun Weidong and Secretary of Pakistan's Economic Affairs Division Muhammad Saleem Sethi in Islamabad. The funds were used to support efforts to rehabilitate people of Federally Administered Tribal Areas and promote social development. Specific funding Chinese agency is unknown The agreement commits a total of USD129million(RMBYuan800million) to be utilized for the Temporarily Displaced Persons (TDPs) and social sector projects in terrorism affected areas of FATA region. The USD 129 million grant amount included cash grant of USD 10 million for supporting the Pakistani government in rehabilitation of residents in FATA area, while the remaining USD 119 million remained unfulfilled, as projects with FATA Secretariat were being identified for the purpose of reconstruction and rehabilitation in FATA region. These projects include reconstruction, rehabilitation, improvement of schools, irrigation system, highways, electricity, livelihood/ agriculture etc. The special assistance earmarked for rehabilitation of TDPs were recorded as fulfilled. US$ 5 million was received in September, 2015 and remaining US$ 5 million in April, 2016. China disbursed an estimated 1,541.63 million Pakistani rupees, or 11.01 million USD, to Pakistan in 2015-2016, according to the Pakistan Ministry of Finance Estimates for Foreign Assistance for 2016-2017. The funds were separated into one special grant of 509.150 million Pakistan rupees and a grant to support GoP in TDP FATA of 1,032.480 million Pakistani rupees.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020150715eb7f008et&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://tribune.com.pk/story/930979/china-to-provide-10m-to-pakistan-for-rehabilitation-of-tdps-dar/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.dawn.com/news/1194751, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.na.gov.pk/uploads/documents/questions/1472799928_543.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.ead.gov.pk/userfiles1/file/EAD/2018/Website%20Year%20Book%202015-2016.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.finance.gov.pk/budget/Estimates_of_Foreign_Assistant_2017_18.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.finance.gov.pk/budget/foreign_assistance_2016_17.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.finance.gov.pk/budget/Estimates_of_Foreign_Assistant_2017_18.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.finance.gov.pk/budget/foreign_assistance_2016_17.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.cn.undp.org/content/dam/china/docs/2018-disaster-recovery-workshop/Pakistan%20Project%20brief.pdf , Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)
contacts: Sun Weidong, Chinese Ambassador to Pakistan ; Muhammad Saleem Sethi , Secretary of Pakistan's Economic Affairs Division

title: China Grant 1.4 Million Liters of Fuel to Nepal (linked to #53155)
description: On December 29, 2015, the Chinese government signed an agreement to grant an additional 1.4 million liters of petroleum worth 10 million Yuan to Nepal. The grant aimed at helping the country cope with the fuel shortages after the devastating earthquake on April 25, 2015. Deputy Prime Minister of Nepal Kamal Thapa secured the grant during his visit in Beijing. Nepal Oil Corporation transported the fuel provided by China from Kerung in Tibet to Kathmandu. This is an additional grant, following a previous donation of 1.2 million liters in October (project 53155). STAFF_NOTE: Nepal Oil Corporation was recorded as the participating organization because its officials reported the figure of this project.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=AIWTHS0020151230ebct0004c&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.freepressjournal.in/world/china-to-give-additional-1-4-mn-litre-fuel-to-nepal/745721, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://thehimalayantimes.com/nepal/thapa-returns-with-chinas-pledge-of-another-fuel-grant/, Media Report, including Wikileaks
implementing_agency: Nepal Oil Corporation Limited, State-Owned Company
recipient_agencies: Nepal Oil Corporation Limited, State-Owned Company

title: China Granted $19,000 Worth of Aid to Tajik Emergency Ministry
description: Summary: On September 20, 2004, Chinese ambassador to Tajikistan, Wu Hongbin, presented humanitarian aid to the Tajik Ministry of Emergency Situations. The humanitarian aid consisted of tents and children's clothing. The total value of the aid is 19,000 dollars. Officials from the Tajik Ministry of Emergency Situations expressed their gratitude to embassy officials for this no-strings aid. The aid provided would be used in the event of natural disasters.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ASIPLU0020041006e09k0008g&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCCA00020040921e09l001p5&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Wu Hongbin, Chinese ambassador to Tajikistan

title: China Granted Solar Panels Worth 37 Million RMB to Nepal
description: On March 21, 2016, China signed an agreement with Nepal's Prime Minister to grant Nepal 32,000 sets of solar panels at a cost of 37 million RMB. The grant aimed at helping Nepal provide electricity for communities that had been without power after the earthquake on April 25th, 2015. On January 21, 2018, China handed over the donation, including 32,000 sets of household solar power generation system of 10Wp, 325 sets of solar power generation system of 1200Wp, battery, controller, and LED bulbs. According to government of Nepal, the donation will be distributed by the Alternative Energy Promotion Center to earthquake effected communities.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=AIWTHS0020160325ec3l0028r&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://mofa.gov.np/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/MOFA_REPORT_Nepal-Foreign-Affairs_2016.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://mofa.gov.np/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/MOFA_REPORT_Nepal-Foreign-Affairs_2016.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://thehimalayantimes.com/business/china-hands-over-1mw-solar-system-in-singha-durbar/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://indianexpress.com/article/world/china-donates-over-32000-solar-power-generators-to-nepal-5034679/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2018-01/21/c_136913167.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.chinanews.com/gn/2018/01-21/8429569.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks
funding_agency: National Development and Reform Commission (NDRC), Government Agency
implementing_agency: Alternative Energy Promotion Centre, Government Agency
recipient_agencies: Alternative Energy Promotion Centre, Government Agency

title: China Provided Humanitarian Aid Worth of 8 Million Yuan to Kyrgyzstan for Restoration of Peace after Riots
description: On June 17, 2010, in order to help the restoration of stability in Kyrgyzstan and the normalization of living and working order in the southern region, Chinese government provided emergency humanitarian aid materials worth of 5 million RMB yuan to Kyrgyzstan. On June 30, 2010, China decided to offer another batch of humanitarian aid materials worth of 3 million RMB yuan to Kyrgyzstan. The aid materials were delivered to the southern city of Osh in Kyrgyzstan by China's relevant departments on the early morning of July 28, Beijing time. The representatives from both sides signed the transfer list at the Osh Airport. The aid materials include rice, edible oil, biscuits, black tea, milk powder, blankets, clothes, stationary and daily sanitary necessities. China hopes the aid will help Kyrgyzstan to resettle the refugees.

title: China Provides Aid for Afghan Refugees through UNHCR
description: In 2001, the Chinese government pledged to provide 1 million RMB worth of aid to the office of UNHCR. This aid was to assist with the settlement of Afghan refugees. This project appears to have been completed, according to a later Chinese report of its aid to UNHCR. The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) Financial Tracking Service records a transaction amount of $96,772, differing slightly that from the other sources.

contacts: Tang Jiaxuan , China's Foreign Minister

title: China Road and Bridge Corporation sends personnel to clear the KKH after mudslide
description: The China Road and Bridge Corporation (CRBC), which is already involved in the project of expansion of the KKH, provided personnel to clear the highway following a mudslide in the Hunza Valley. The CRBC worked jointly with a team of specialists from Ministry of Water Resources of China, Chinese Academy of Chengdu Institute of Mountain Hazards and Environment. The construction work on KKH has restarted
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=AIWNAT0020100517e65e00054&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.irinnews.org/report/100342/pakistan-flood-victims-await-unfulfilled-promises, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)
implementing_agency: China Road and Bridge Corporation, State-Owned Company

title: China Sends Emergency Relief Goods to Sri Lanka (Batch 3 of 3) (linked to #33226, #33234)
description: In response to the Sri Lankan tsunami of 2005, the Chinese government sent a large package of relief aid consisting of 770 sets of gasoline generators, packages of food, and packages of medicine. The donation of relief goods stands as part of a series of Chinese aid donations to Sri Lanka in response to the tsunami. This is the third of three batches of relief supplies (see #33226, #33234).

title: China Sends International Rescue Medical Team of 50 people to Pakistan for flood relief (Linked to project #53534)
description: To assist the Pakistani people and the army in fighting the floods, an international rescue medical team of 50 sent by the Chinese People's Liberation Army arrived in Karachi, the capital of Sindh province, on the afternoon of October 20, 2011. They will go to the southern city of Kunri to carry out rescue work the next day. The 50 tons of emergency relief materials carried by the medical team were also delivered to the disaster area on the same day. Linked to project #53534
sources: http://pk.china-embassy.org/chn/zbgx/t869339.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://pk.chineseembassy.org/eng/zbgx/t869340.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://tribune.com.pk/story/277959/floods-2011-china-to-send-50-relief-workers/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://reliefweb.int/report/pakistan/chinese-army-send-medical-team-pakistan-humanitarian-relief, Media Report, including Wikileaks
implementing_agency: People's Liberation Army of China, Government Agency

title: China Sent 15 Million Yuan Worth of Food Aid to Tajikistan
description: In March 2003, China sent Tajikistan 15 million yuan (approximately two million dollars) worth of food aid as part of a humanitarian relief package. The food aid included sugar (2340 tons), rice (1200 tons) and soybean oil (320 tons). The May 2018 Flat Export from Tajikistan AIMS reports a food aid worth $1,812,000 USD funded by Chinese government. The project ID is TJK/042050.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=afpr000020030313dz3d0005r&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://tj.mofcom.gov.cn/aarticle/jmxw/200305/20030500093181.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.dropbox.com/s/rl546mymjz3f15f/May%202018%20Flat%20Export%20from%20Tajikistan%20AIMS%20China%20Specific%20Projects.xlsx?dl=0, Other

title: China aids Sri Lanka in rebuilding fishery harbours after tsunami
description: China came forward to reconstruct three fishery harbours affected by the 2004 tsunami- the Panadura, Beruwela and Kudawela fishery harbours, which are located in Sri Lanka's western and southern coasts. China funded Rs. 900 million for the Panadura, Beruwala and Kudawella harbours. Commencing in early 2005, the three projects were completed ahead of schedule by the China Harbour Engineering Company. STAFF_NOTES: China contributed 63 million USD for tsunami relief in total. Most individual projects are captured in our database, and linked to resource #41811.

title: China assists Pakistan in post-flood road rehabilitation project
description: On December 5, 2012, Chinese Ambassador Liu Jian was invited to attend the signing ceremony for the post-flood rehabilitation project of the Pakistan National Road Highway. The project was signed by the Pakistan National Highway Bureau, China Railway 17th Bureau Co., Ltd. and China Yunnan Sunshine Road Bridge Co., Ltd. to repair 460 kilometers of the north and south sections of the flood damage. STAFF_NOTE: NOV 19 2018 South and Central Asia Scrape According to a Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Year Book in the fiscal year of 2016/17, LoE signed on 26-09-2011. The committed amount is CNY1273 million. STAFF_NOTE: NOV 19 2018 South and Central Asia Scrape According to a Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Year Book in the fiscal year of 2015/16, the project was under implementation at that time and had a transaction amount of CNY1340 million.
sources: http://pk.china-embassy.org/chn/zbgx/t995794.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://pk.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201212/20121208469179.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.ead.gov.pk/userfiles1/file/EAD/2018/Final%20PCP%20Year%20Book%202016-17%20.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.ead.gov.pk/userfiles1/file/EAD/2018/Website%20Year%20Book%202015-2016.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China builds a hospital and school in Baffa, Pakistan after 2005 earthquake (Linked to project #53903)
description: After the earthquake in Pakistan in 2005, China government soon pledged to help with the reconstruction efforts. According to the assessment of the disaster after the earthquake, the Chinese government promised to build a school and a hospital without compensation. After consultations between the relevant departments of the two countries, the project was finally confirmed in the town of Bava in Mansella. The formal agreement was signed on 24-11-2006. The project includes the construction of a 6,525-square-meter high school (GHSS Baffa) that cost Rs 487.5 million and a small hospital of 4,400 square meters (THQ Baffa) which cost cost Rs 412.5 million to impart education for 720 students. At the beginning of 2011, an advance team of 6 people from the Shandong Expressway Qilu Construction Group arrived in Baval and began the project preparation work. The construction officially started on July 2, 2011. From December 16 to 22, 2011, the mid-term quality inspection team organized by the Economic Cooperation Bureau of the Ministry of Commerce inspected and accepted the main structural project of the project. After strict and careful inspection by the leaders and experts, the project passed the quality acceptance. STAFF_NOTE: In 2015, China agreed to update the buildings by installing waste management and drainage systems, etc. Details of this project is captured under 53903.
sources: http://fp.brecorder.com/2015/12/201512221257985/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.ead.gov.pk/ead/userfiles1/file/Trainings/Website%20Year%20Book%202014--15.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.sdhsg.com/main/news/page.jsp?id=3259, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://ihl.cankaoxiaoxi.com/2012/1106/115275.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China contributes 100,000 USD to comprehensive disaster risk management program in Nepal
description: China contributed 100,000 USD to Nepal's Comprehensive Disaster Risk Management Program (CDRMP). Other donors included the Department for International Development, the European Union, Japan, Korea, the International Cooperation Agency, the United Nations Development Programme, the United Nations International Strategy for Disaster Reduction, and the World Bank.

implementing_agency: United Nations Development Programme (UNDP)

title: China contributes US$1.375 million through UN Food & Agriculture Organization to Maldives for rehabilitation of marine fisheries sector and agricultural infrastructure after earthquake/tsunami
description: The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) Financial Tracking Service records that on 11/01/2005, Chinese government made a contribution of USD$1,375,000 for the rehabilitation of marine fisheries sector and agricultural infrastructure.

title: China contributes US$100,000 through United Nations Population Fund to Maldives for Protection and psychosocial support for women and adolescent girls after earthquake/tsunami
description: The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) Financial Tracking Service records that on 18/02/2005, Chinese government made a contribution of USD$100,000 for the protection and psychosocial support for women and adolescent girls.
sources: https://fts.unocha.org/flows/26390?destination=donors/2976/flows/2005%3Ff%255B0%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2521%26f%255B1%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522300%253ACHINA%2520-%2520Floods%2520-%2520June%25202005%2522%26f%255B2%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522266%253AINDIAN%2520OCEAN%2520-%2520Earthquake/Tsunami%2520-%2520December%25202004%2522%26f%255B3%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522270%253APAKISTAN%2520-%2520Rains/Snowfall%2520-%2520February%25202005%2522%26f%255B4%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522302%253ASOUTH%2520ASIA%2520-%2520Earthquake%2520-%2520October%25202005%2522, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

title: China contributes US$200,000 to Sri Lanka through the United Nations Population Fund for the restoration of reproductive health service after earthquake/tsunami
description: The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) Financial Tracking Service records that on 18/02/2005, Chinese government made a contribution of USD$200,000 for the purpose of restoring reproductive health services in Sri Lanka after earthquake and tsunami.
sources: https://fts.unocha.org/flows/26391?destination=donors/2976/flows/2005%3Ff%255B0%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2521%26f%255B1%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522300%253ACHINA%2520-%2520Floods%2520-%2520June%25202005%2522%26f%255B2%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522266%253AINDIAN%2520OCEAN%2520-%2520Earthquake/Tsunami%2520-%2520December%25202004%2522%26f%255B3%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522270%253APAKISTAN%2520-%2520Rains/Snowfall%2520-%2520February%25202005%2522%26f%255B4%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522302%253ASOUTH%2520ASIA%2520-%2520Earthquake%2520-%2520October%25202005%2522, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

title: China contributes US$250,000 through United Nations Development Programme to Sri Lanka for infrastructure recovery after earthquake/tsunami
description: The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) Financial Tracking Service records that on 21/01/2005, Chinese government made a contribution of USD$250,000 for the purpose of infrastructure early recovery after earthquake/tsunami.
sources: https://fts.unocha.org/flows/25867?destination=donors/2976/flows/2005%3Ff%255B0%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2521%26f%255B1%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522300%253ACHINA%2520-%2520Floods%2520-%2520June%25202005%2522%26f%255B2%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522266%253AINDIAN%2520OCEAN%2520-%2520Earthquake/Tsunami%2520-%2520December%25202004%2522%26f%255B3%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522270%253APAKISTAN%2520-%2520Rains/Snowfall%2520-%2520February%25202005%2522%26f%255B4%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522302%253ASOUTH%2520ASIA%2520-%2520Earthquake%2520-%2520October%25202005%2522, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

title: China dispatches 4 army helicopters for flood-relief in Sindh, Pakistan (linked to #36860)
description: In September 2010, China sent four military helicopters to Pakistan to help in the flood relief operations. The helicopters were destined to work in the flood-hit region of Sindh. The helicopters took off from northwest China's Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region on 21st Septmber and reached Pakistani capital Islamabad on the 22nd for a stopover. Chinese Ambassador to Pakistan Liu Jian has received the helicopter Benazir Bhutto International Airport, remarking that it was the very first time Chinese army helicopters have been sent overseas on a humanitarian mission.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PAKOFN0020100922e69l00009&cat=a&ep=ASE, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCAPP0020100921e69l002mi&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PMPLUN0020100922e69m000rp&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ASPKOB0020101004e6a100016&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PMDAIP0020100924e69n00008&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ASDEFJ0020110302e6cv0000d&cat=a&ep=ASE, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://news.xinhuanet.com/english2010/china/2010-09/22/c_13525000_2.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/china/2010wenindia/2010-12/18/content_11721909.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Zhao Bin, Head of chinese rescue team ; Liu Jian, Head of Mission

title: China donated 0.05 mln USD to India for earthquake relief
description: The government of western Indian state of Gujarat, reeling under the effect of the devastating earthquake which has caused a damage worth 210bn rupees to property has got commitment of 44bn rupees as international and domestic aid. China has committed 0.05m dollars to India for earthquake relief. The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) Financial Tracking Service created the project entry on 23/04/2001, so the project is likely to have been finished by then.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=bbcsap0020010710dx240029b&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://fts.unocha.org/flows/2837?destination=donors/2976/flows/2001, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

title: China donated 1 million USD humanitarian aid for Afghan Refugees
description: On March 9, 2017, China donated 1 million USD humanitarian aid to Afghanistan through Office of the UN High Commissioner for Refugees. According to the contract, UNHCR will be responsible for using that 1 million USD to purchase, transport and deliver humanitarian aids. Materials including double side blanket and gas tank were delivered. Starting from 2016 winter, the extreme weather has caused 239 casualties, 214 injured and over 520 houses destroyed. STAFF_NOTE: This project is not a duplicate of #53644 since the delivery times are different. In addition, #53644 is through the World Food Programme and #53633 is through UNHCR.
sources: http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/sbwl/t1444679.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.xinhuanet.com/world/2017-03/10/c_1120603698.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://drive.google.com/file/d/1esEhhoUmoNWpLQlnq2A8up3Dg6tOhe85/view?usp=sharing, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://fec.mofcom.gov.cn/article/gbdqzn/upload/afuhan.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://fts.unocha.org/flows/155131?destination=donors/2976/flows/2017%3Ff%255B0%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2521%26f%255B1%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522704%253ABANGLADESH%2520-%2520Rohingya%2520Refugee%2520Crisis%2520%2528from%25202017%2529%2522, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://www.mofcom.gov.cn/dl/gbdqzn/upload/afuhan.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
implementing_agency: Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Multilateral

title: China donated 1 million USD of food aid to Afghanistan through World Food Programme
description: On October 16, 2018, China donated 1 million USD for emergency food assistance to Afghanistan. The project cooperates with the United Nations World Food Program. China plans to provide food aid through WFP to refugees, homeless and natural disasters victims in Pakistan, Syria, Iran, Ethiopia, Zimbabwe, Cameroun, Afghanistan and Niger. The US$1 million contribution will be used to purchase fortified wheat flour, sunflower oil enriched with vitamins, lentils, rice and sugar for food distributions among Afghan and Iraqi refugees in Iran. The commodities will be locally purchased to ensure speedy delivery and conformity with Iranian standards. This project is not a duplicate of #53633 since the delivery times are different. In addition, #53644 is through the World Food Program and #53633 is through UNHCR.
sources: http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/wxzl/t1392473.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.xinhuanet.com//world/2016-05/18/c_1118890754.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://drive.google.com/file/d/19GDydHOE0Or3TAmQl3ikMD_jnWr_JgyH/view?usp=sharing, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://fts.unocha.org/flows/164321?destination=donors/2976/flows/2017%3Ff%255B0%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2521%26f%255B1%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522704%253ABANGLADESH%2520-%2520Rohingya%2520Refugee%2520Crisis%2520%2528from%25202017%2529%2522, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)
implementing_agency: World Food Program (WFP), Multilateral

title: China donates medical supplies worth 8 million yuan to flood-hit Pakistan (linked to #54097)
description: In September 2010 the Chinese government sent a 55-member international search and rescue team to flood-hit Pakistan. The team arrived at the Chaklala Airbase in Rawalpindi near the Pakistani capital Islamabad on Thursday 23rd. The Chinese rescue team arrived at Thatta, the worst hit area in southern Pakistan, on the evening of 27 August, where they set up a mobile hospital and provided medical assistance to the local victims. The team including 36 doctors and 19 technical support personnel brought 25 tonnes of high-tech medical equipments and medicine worth RMB 8 million. The team returned to China on 4th October 2010. This is linked to project #54097.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=CHNDHK0020100826e68r00070&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ASPTRO0020100903e68q00054&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020100828e68s004ed&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ASDEFJ0020110302e6cv0000d&cat=a&ep=ASE, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source
contacts: Zhang Liyan, Head of team

title: China donates $1.3m in goods to Afghan refugees (Linked to #34524)
description: On 31 August 2007, Chinese Ambassador to Afghanistan Yang Houlan and Afghan acting refugee minister Abdul Qader Ahadi signed an agreement under which China would donate US$1.3 million in goods to Afghanistan for poverty alleviation for refugees. The aid would cover infrastructure, education, health and so on. This is part of an aid package worth US$1.5 million; another part of the package was a US$200 000 cash aid (See Project ID#34524).
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020070709e3790048v&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://lb2.mofcom.gov.cn/aarticle/zc/chineseeconomic/200805/20080505525325.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Anwar Ul-Haq Ahady, Afghan Finance Minister ; Yang Houlan, Chinese Ambassador to Afghanistan

title: China donates $10M in earthquake aid to Nepal
description: In 2015, China announced it would donate $10 million in earthquake relief to Nepal. However, as of March 2016, only $5,093,531 had been given.
sources: http://amis.mof.gov.np/aim/viewActivityPreview.do~public=true~pageId=2~activityId=17082~language=en, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://kathmandupost.ekantipur.com/printedition/news/2015-07-23/china-to-gift-10m-for-post-quake-rebuilding.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://fts.unocha.org/flows/127958?search_results=data-search%2Fresults%2Foutgoing%3FusageYears%3D2013%252C2014%252C2015%252C2016%252C2017%26locations%3D46%26f%255B0%255D%3DdestinationLocationIdName%253A%2522156%253ANepal%2522%26search_type%3Ddirectional, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

title: China donates $200,000 to Afghan refugees (linked to #34523)
description: On 31 August 2007, Chinese Ambassador to Afghanistan Yang Houlan handed over US$200 000 in cash aid to Afghan acting refugee minister Abdul Qader Ahadi to help poverty-stricken Afghan refugees. The aid would cover infrastructure, education, health and so on. This is part of an aid package worth US$1.5 million; another part of the package was a donation of US$1.3 million in goods (See Project ID#34523).
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020070709e3790048v&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://lb2.mofcom.gov.cn/aarticle/zc/chineseeconomic/200805/20080505525325.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Anwar Ul-Haq Ahady, Afghan Finance Minister ; Yang Houlan, Chinese Ambassador to Afghanistan

title: China donates $250,000 worth of humanitarian items to Afghanistan
description: In June, 2010 China donated $250,000 worth of humanitarian goods to IDPs and repatriated refugees in Jawzjan Province. The donated goods included food, blankets, tents and other utilities.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ATAFGH0020100629e66t00002&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://reliefweb.int/report/afghanistan/afghanistan-aid-distributed-among-families-jawzjan, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China donates $500,000 in drought relief to Afghanistan
description: In July 2000, China announced that it would donate $500,000 in humanitarian aid to Afghanistan through a UN organization for drought relief. As of June 2015 and according to information compiled by the United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (UNOCHA), this project is complete.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=bbcfe00020010804dw7f00avq&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://fts.unocha.org/reports/daily/ocha_R10_E13896_asof___1506181547.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://fts.unocha.org/flows/1839?destination=donors/2976/flows/2000, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

title: China donates 1 million RMB of Malaria drugs to Pakistan (linked to #35607)
description: In July 2007, China donated 1 milion yuan of anti-Malaria drugs to Pakistan, as part of flood relief efforts.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020070703e373004br&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PAPRIN0020070705e3730005h&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=NBFSTA0020070704e37300033&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=NBBALU0020070704e3730003m&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCAPP0020070703e373004h7&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://pk.chineseembassy.org/chn/zbgx/t336525.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://news.sina.com.cn/c/2007-07-04/002813367287.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks
