title: China donates 1 million Sri Lankan Rupees in disaster relief aid
description: On October 3, 2008 China donated 1 million Sri Lanka Rupees to Sri Lanka to help those affected by recent floods and landslides. Chinese Ambassador Ye Dabo handed over the donation to Sri Lankan Disaster Management and Human Rights Minister Mahinda Samarasinghe.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=DAINSL0020081103e4a300005&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Ye Dabo, Chinese Ambassador ; Mahinda Samarasinghe, Disaster Managmement and Human Rights Minister

title: China donates 1 million USD as emergency relief to Sri Lanka for Internally Displaced Persons
description: On May 12, 2009 China donated 1 million USD to Sri Lanka as emergency relief for Internally Displaced Persons who had fled the LTTE as civilians. The donation was handed over by Chinese Ambassador Yang Xiuping to Foreign Minister Rohitha Bogollagama at the Ministry in Colombo.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=BBCSAP0020090513e55d000rt&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://reliefweb.int/report/sri-lanka/sri-lanka-rs-2-million-emergency-relief-china, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; http://yws.mofcom.gov.cn/article/b/d/200905/20090506258674.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.mea.gov.lk/index.php/media/news-archive/1726-china-donates-us-1-million-as-emergency-relief-assistance-for-idps, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/chn//gxh/cgb/zcgmzysx/yz/1206_28/1206x1/t5940.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Rohitha Bogollagama, Foreign Minister, Sri Lanka ; Yang Xiuping, Chinese Ambassador to Sri Lanka (China)

title: China donates 10 million yuan of humanitarian aid for flood relief in Sri Lanka
description: In January 2011, China donated 10 million yuan worth of humanitarian aid to flood-ravaged Sri Lanka. The 70-tonnes materials include 30,000 bags of milk powder, 30,000 bags of sugar, 10,000 pieces towel, 10,000 bed sheet, 7,200 blankets and 60 sets of water purifiers. Link to project #38917, which was donated at the same time.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=PEODEN0020110126e71p00005&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.thehindu.com/news/international/china-announces-15-million-flood-relief-for-sri-lanka/article1100019.ece, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=HTASIT0020110118e71j0008e&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=PRTRIN0020110119e71i000d6&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.dailymirror.lk/9138/china-to-offer-emergency-aid, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.ft.lk/article/15566/China-offers-over---1-5-million-emergency-aid-to-Sri-Lanka, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.srilankaembassyrome.org/en/trade/importing-pet-animals-to-sri-lanka/121-china-sends-flood-relief.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://yws.mofcom.gov.cn/article/b/d/201101/20110107378352.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://lk.china-embassy.org/chn/xwdt/t789766.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://lk.china-embassy.org/chn/xwdt/t787356.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://airchinacargo.com/index.php?section=0-0001-0003-0013-0078&id=1297228459, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.chinanews.com/gn/2011/01-25/2808767.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/chn//gxh/cgb/zcgmzysx/yz/1206_28/1206x1/t5940.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/chn//gxh/cgb/zcgmzysx/yz/1206_28/1206x1/t5940.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China donates 2 million Pakistani rupees to Pakistan for flood relief
description: On September 9, 2014, the Chinese ambassador to Pakistan, Sun Weidong, met with Pakistani foreign secretary. On behalf of the Chinese Embassy in Pakistan, he donated 2 million rupees to the Pakistani government to support the Pakistani government in carrying out flood relief work. The Pakistan Ministry of Finance Estimates of Foreign Assistance for 2015-2016 state in the revised estimate for 2014-2015 that 102.730 million Pakistani rupees are expected to be lent by China in 2014. STAFF_NOTE: same source mentions that a donation made by the Chinese Red Cross Society was transferred by the ambassador to the Pakistani Red Crescent Society at the same event. This is captured in Project 53543
sources: http://pk.china-embassy.org/chn/zbgx/t1189861.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.finance.gov.pk/budget/foreign_assistance_2015_16.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://pk.chineseembassy.org/eng/zbgx/t1190533.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China donates 2,000 tents worth 128 million Rupees to Sri Lanka (Linked to #33289)
description: In December 2009, China donated 2,000 tents, valued at 128 million Rupees, to help civilians who have been displaced from their homes by the civil war in North Sri Lanka.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=HTSLGN0020091224e5co000b9&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://ourlanka.com/srilankanews/china-donates-2000-tents-for-sri-lanka-idps.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.colombopage.com/archive_091/Dec1261583023CH.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.priu.gov.lk/news_update/Current_Affairs/ca200912/20091224china_gives_tents_idps.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://lk.china-embassy.org/chn/xwdt/t647427.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China donates 2,752 tons of rice to Sri Lanka for drought relief
description: In 2017, China agreed to donate 2,752 tons of rice to Sri Lanka drought victims. In November of 2017, the first 1000 tons of this rice were delivered. The second 1,000 tons was delivered in December 2017. The remaining 752 tons reached Colombo in late December. It was received by the Disaster Management Ministry in Colombo. The drought is considered the worst in 40 years due to delay of monsoonal rains and has affected over 1 million people in 11 districts.
sources: http://www.xinhuanet.com//english/2017-12/11/c_136817807.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.xinhuanet.com//english/2017-12/11/c_136817807.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://gain.fas.usda.gov/Recent%20GAIN%20Publications/Grain%20and%20Feed%20Update_Beijing_China%20-%20Peoples%20Republic%20of_2-1-2018.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

title: China donates 20 million yuan of supplies to Sri Lanka
description: In 2014, after the flood, China donated supplies that worth 20 million yuan to Sri Lanka. STAFF_NOTE: Official sources indicate that this project is separate from #33387.
sources: https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/chn//gxh/cgb/zcgmzysx/yz/1206_28/1206x1/t5940.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/chn//gxh/cgb/zcgmzysx/yz/1206_28/1206x1/t5940.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/chn//gxh/cgb/zcgmzysx/yz/1206_28/1206x1/t5940.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China donates 20 million yuan worth of tents to Sri Lanka
description: In May 2009, China donated 20 million yuan (2.93 million US dollars) worth of tents to Sri Lanka. The tents will be sent to Sri Lanka in four batches and is part of China's humanitarian for around 200,000 Tamil civilians displaced by the conflict between the government and the LTTE.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=BBCAPP0020090517e55h0028l&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://en.people.cn/90001/90776/90883/6659382.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://yws.mofcom.gov.cn/article/b/d/200905/20090506258674.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/chn//gxh/cgb/zcgmzysx/yz/1206_28/1206x1/t5940.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Yang Xiuping , Chinese Ambassador to Sri Lanka ; Mahinda Samarasinghe, Minister of Disaster Management and Human Rights ; Basil Rajapaksa, Senior Presidential Advisor

title: China donates 200000 USD to Pakistan for flood relief
description: In 2006, the Chinese government donated 200,000 US dollars to the Pakistani government for flood relief; the donation signing ceremony was held in Islamabad.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCAPP0020060930e29u003h1&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PAPRIN0020061003e29u0005w&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=NBBALU0020061003e29u0000u&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Khalid Saeed, Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Secretary ; Zhang Chunxiang, Chinese Ambassador to Pakistan

title: China donates 2nd batch of humanitarian aid worth of RMB 20 m to flood-hit Pakistan (linked to #36809 and #37009)
description: On 25 August 2010, China provided Pakistan with additional humanitarian aid worth 20 millions yuan, second part of the 'second batch' of aid. After having provided a 'first batch' worth 10 million yuan at the beginning of the month (see project: 36722), China offered Pakistan additional relief materials, referred to as 'second batch', meant to provide relief to the North-West region, in particular to the population of the Hunza Lake. The overall value of this second batch was 50 million dollars and it was delivered in two times. The second part of this second batch, worth 20 million-RMB, started shipping on August 25 from Kashgar, Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous region, and was delivered through Khunjerab Pass to Sost dry port designated by Pakistan. Since at the moment of the transportation the road between Kashgar and Khunjerab had been cut off, Chinese engineer troops did rush repairs on it. With its arrival, China completed the shipping of the second batch of relief supplies to flood-hit Pakistan. The supplies mainly include tents, compressed food, carpets, generators, and medicine, mineral water, and water purifiers etc. Linked to project #54097.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020100820e68k004s9&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCAPP0020100820e68k001e3&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://ict4peace.pbworks.com/f/Pakistan_Floods__Jul_2010-OCHA-88TEV6.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCAPP0020100813e68d0028l&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PMPLUN0020100814e68e000am&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCAPP0020100813e68d0028l&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=AIWNAT0020100816e68d0003g&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ASDEFJ0020110302e6cv0000d&cat=a&ep=ASE, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://pk.china-embassy.org/eng/zbgx/t727575.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://pk.china-embassy.org/chn/zbgx/t726484.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China donates 3,220,883 USD of emergency medical and epidemic prevention supplies to Nepal
description: According to Nepal's Aid Management Platform, in 2015, China donated 3,220,883 USD of emergency medical supplies and epidemic supplies to Nepal.
sources: http://amis.mof.gov.np/aim/viewActivityPreview.do~public=true~pageId=2~activityId=17081~language=en, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China donates 300,000 RMB flood relief materials to Nepal
description: In 2007, Chinese ambassador to Nepal Zheng Xianglin announced that the government of China's Tibet Autonomous Region will provide relief materials equivalent to 300,000 RMB (39,600 USD) to Nepal's flood-stricken areas, including tents, carpets, pure water and food. The relief materials were handed over to the Nepal Red Cross Society in the Nepali capital of Kathmandu on Thursday, 13 September 2007.
sources: http://np2.mofcom.gov.cn/article/chinanews/200708/20070804992150.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.tibet.ca/tibet/en/library/wtn/75, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; http://en.people.cn/90001/90776/6262356.html?06f13318, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://en.people.cn/90001/90777/6240746.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://en.people.cn/90001/90776/6262356.pdf, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://english.sina.com/china/1/2007/0815/121864.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Zheng Xianglin , Chinese Ambassador to Nepal

title: China donates 4242 tons of rice to Afghanistan
description: In 2017, China donated 4242 tons of rice to Afghanistan worths 50 million Chinese Yuan as a part of the emergency food aid. The first part of rice, total 502 ton, has arrived at Kabul on October 26, 2017. The rest of rice is supposed to arrive by March 2018. The final handover ceremony is held on June 3, 2018. This project is part of the emergency food aid project provided by the Chinese government to the Asian and African countries through the World Food Program in early September. The emergency food aid to Afghanistan will directly benefit a total of about 38,000 Afghan returning refugees and displaced people who have been displaced by the war in the south-central region of the country. The funding agency is unknown.
sources: http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/sbwl/t1505626.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://af.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zxhz/201806/20180602751928.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.xinhuanet.com//2017-10/17/c_1121814890.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ThE_5PuM4WyT6m81B91shbjWcnnMlXw_/view?usp=sharing, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://drive.google.com/file/d/1CWnLj2FkBhzxnWJyq17HSRiqb6U48CYZ/view?usp=sharing, Media Report, including Wikileaks
implementing_agency: World Food Program (WFP), Multilateral

title: China donates 5 million Pakistani Rupee for resettlement of internal displaced persons in Pakistan
description: On July 9, 2014, the Chinese Ambassador to Pakistan, Sun Weidong, presented a donation of 5 million Pakistani Rupees to a Pakistani official on behalf of the Chinese embassy for the resettlement of internal displaced persons in Pakistan. The check was accepted by Abdul Qadir Baloch, minister of Pakistan's Ministry of States and Frontier Regions (SAFRON) for the resettlement of the internally displaced persons (IDPs) from North Waziristan The surge in internally displaced population was caused by Operation Zarb-e-Azb, a military campaign launched by the Pakistani armed forces on June 15 against domestic local militant groups hiding in North Waziristan tribal regions. SAFRON officials reported that more than 833,000 people have been registered as IDPs as a result of the operation.
sources: http://pk.china-embassy.org/chn/zbgx/t1172925.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://nation.com.pk/10-Jul-2014/china-reassures-pakistan-on-economic-package, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.alamy.com/stock-photo-islamabad-pakistan-9th-july-2014-chinese-ambassador-to-pakistan-sun-71609402.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://dailyfrontierstar.com/%EF%BB%BFchinese-embassy-in-pakistan-donates-50000-to-nwa-idps/, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China donates 50 million yuan of tent, blanket and medical equipment to Afghanistan
description: On December 2016, China donated 50 million yuan of humanitarian aids to Afghanistan. The aid includes blankets, tents, and medical equipment that will be delivered to 34 provinces in Afghanistan. It will help to settle down refugees and provide support for families affected by wars or natural disasters. The handover ceremony was held on December 21, 2016. The 'natural disaster' refers to the snow disaster that hit Afghanistan in the same year. This project is linked to project #53630 that provided cash aid to the snow disaster. It is also linked to #53631 that also provided humanitarian aid at a different delivery time.
sources: http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/sbwl/t1426058.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://news.cctv.com/2016/12/22/ARTIBdLErvSRkuZewvdpcrrT161222.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://world.huanqiu.com/hot/2016-12/9847883.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.mfa.gov.cn/chn//pds/wjdt/zwbd/t1437807.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China donates 500,000 doses of H1N1 vaccine to Pakistan
description: On March 15, 2010, China donated 500,000 doses of Influenza A (H1N1) vaccine to Pakistan on an emergency basis to assist Islamabad in dealing with the influenza pandemic.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCSAP0020100126e61q001gu&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://yws.mofcom.gov.cn/article/b/d/201003/20100306830803.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://yws.mofcom.gov.cn/article/b/d/201003/20100306803872.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Makhdoom Shahabud Din, Pakistani Health Minister ; Lou Zhaohui, Chinese Ambassador to Pakistan

title: China donates 5000 USD to Kyrgyz Republic for Landslide Relief
description: On May 20 2003, the Chinese Embassy in Kyrgyz handed over 5K USD to the Red Crescent Society of Kyrgyzstan as a landslide relief. This money will be used to purchase food and other necessities to the 300 families of Sogot village, Uzgen region of Osh Oblast.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=KABNEW0020030520dz5k00003&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=OANA000020030520dz5k001mg&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks
location_details: Sogot village, Uzgen region of Osh Oblast

title: China donates 5m RMB in emergency aid to flood-stricken Sri Lanka (Linked to #33213)
description: In 2003, the Chinese government donated five million yuan (605,000 US dollars) in emergency aid to flood-stricken Sri Lanka.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=AFPR000020030527dz5q0003t&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://reliefweb.int/report/sri-lanka/china-offers-aid-flood-stricken-sri-lanka, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2003-05/27/content_889374.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.china.org.cn/english/international/65499.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China donates 7000 tents to Pakistan for flood relief (linked to project #53535)
description: The Chinese Government on 11 September 2011 pledged to provide emergency humanitarian aid worth RMB 30 million/4.7 m USD consisting of 7000 tents and a total of nine aircraft sorties to the Pakistani Government to help the flood relief efforts. The aid was delivered by nine planes in two batches. The first batch was delivered by air in Karachi on Friday 23, the second batch on the 24th. In addition, China has also provided in-cash assistance for Pakistan of US$5 million. Linked to Project #53535
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ASPKOB0020110927e79r00015&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.aaj.tv/2011/09/chinese-aid-for-flood-victims-reaches-pakistan/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.app.com.pk/en_/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=155157, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://pk.chineseembassy.org/eng/zbgx/t869340.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://tribune.com.pk/story/269170/china-to-give-5million-aid-in-cash-to-pakistan/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.brecorder.com/general-news/single/599/172/1234608/?date=2011-09-24, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://reliefweb.int/report/pakistan/chinese-army-send-medical-team-pakistan-humanitarian-relief, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://tribune.com.pk/story/277959/floods-2011-china-to-send-50-relief-workers/, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China donates RMB 30 million of humanitarian aid to flood-hit Pakistan (linked to #38551, #36722)
description: On 19 August 2010, China provided Pakistan with additional humanitarian aid worth 30 million yuan, first part of the 'second batch' of aid. After having provided a 'first batch' worth 10 million yuan, at the beginning of the month (project ID #36722), China offered Pakistan additional relief materials, referred to as a 'second batch', meant to provide relief to the North-West region, in particular to the population of the Hunza Lake. The overall value of this second batch was 50 million dollars and it was delivered in two stages. The first part of this second batch, worth 30 million-RMB, arrived in Islamabad, capital of Pakistan, on 19 and 20 of August. Liu Jian, China's ambassador to Pakistan, and Mr. Sibtain Fazal Halim, Secretary of the Ministry of Economic Affairs and Statistics, attended the handover ceremony at the airport. The materials were trasported to Pakistan by the PLA airforces and handed to to Pakistan's armed forces. The supplies mainly included tents, compressed food, carpets, generators, and medicine, mineral water, and water purifiers etc. The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) Financial Tracking Service records that the second batch of Chinese-donated in-kind emergency relief materials amount to CNY50 million, corroborating the total amount of the two parts of this second batch (the other part captured in project #38551). This project is linked to project ID #36722 and project ID #38551.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020100820e68k004s9&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCAPP0020100820e68k001e3&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://ict4peace.pbworks.com/f/Pakistan_Floods__Jul_2010-OCHA-88TEV6.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCAPP0020100813e68d0028l&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PMPLUN0020100814e68e000am&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCAPP0020100813e68d0028l&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=AIWNAT0020100816e68d0003g&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ASDEFJ0020110302e6cv0000d&cat=a&ep=ASE, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://pk.china-embassy.org/eng/zbgx/t727575.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://finance.ifeng.com/roll/20100819/2532112.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://news.sohu.com/20100825/n274462071.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://fts.unocha.org/flows/78008?destination=donors/2976/flows/2010%3Ff%255B0%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2521%26f%255B1%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522504%253ACHINA%2520-%2520Earthquake%2520-%2520April%25202010%2522%26f%255B2%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522516%253ACHINA%2520-%2520Floods%2520-%2520June%25202010%2522%26f%255B3%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522508%253AKYRGYZSTAN%2520-%2520Civil%2520unrest-%2520June%25202010%2522%26f%255B4%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522520%253APAKISTAN%2520-%2520Floods%2520-%2520July%25202010%2522, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)
implementing_agency: People's Liberation Army (PLA), Government Agency
contacts: Liu Jian, Head of Mission (1Malaysia Development Bhd.); Sibtain Fazal Halim, Secretary of the Ministry of Economic Affairs and Statistics

title: China donates US$100,000 to Bangladesh for flood rehabilitation (Linked to Project ID #34298)
description: A Chinese delegation presented the Food and Disaster Management minister, Chowdhury Kamal Ibne Yousuf, a cheque for 100,000 US dollars. They also agreed to donate corrugated iron sheets worth Tk 6 crore to help with flood relief.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=BBCSAP0020040812e08c000b5&pp=1&fcpil=zhcn&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=UNIBAG0020040812e08b0000j&pp=1&fcpil=zhcn&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=UNIBAG0020040810e0890001a&pp=1&fcpil=zhcn&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://bd2.mofcom.gov.cn/article/bilateralcooperation/inbrief/200705/20070504675608.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.epochtimes.com/gb/4/8/10/n622494.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks
funding_agency: Chinese Government
contacts: Siddiqur Rahman Chowdhury, Secretary of the Food and Disaster Management ; Zhiquan Duan, Charge d' Affairs

title: China donates US$5 million in cash to assist Pakistan in flood relief (linked to project #37183)
description: According to the report by Chinese embassy in Pakistan, by October, 2011, Chinese Ambassador to Pakistan Liu Jian said that the Chinese government will provide 5 million US dollars in cash assistance to the flood-hit country, in addition to the previously provided humanitarian assistance captured in Project #37183
sources: http://tribune.com.pk/story/269170/china-to-give-5million-aid-in-cash-to-pakistan/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://pk.china-embassy.org/chn/zbgx/t869339.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://reliefweb.int/report/pakistan/chinese-army-send-medical-team-pakistan-humanitarian-relief, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://tribune.com.pk/story/277959/floods-2011-china-to-send-50-relief-workers/, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China donates USD 1 million to Pakistan for quake relief
description: On 30 October 2008 China donated 1 million US dollars to Pakistan as a contribution to quake relief operations. Chinese ambassador to Pakistan Luo Zhaohui presented a check to Pakistani President Asif Ali Zardari in the presidential house.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCSAP0020081030e4au002bd&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020081030e4au006hf&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://pk.china-embassy.org/eng/zbgx/t520375.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://german.china.org.cn/international/2008-11/02/content_16701042.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://pk.china-embassy.org/chn/zbgx/t520454.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Luo Zhaohui, Head of Mission (1Malaysia Development Bhd.); Asif Ali Zardari, President

title: China donates USD 60,000 in medical facilities to quake-hit Pakistan
description: On 7 December 2005 China signed an agreement for the donation of medical instruments and other facilities worth 60,000 dollars to Pakistan. Present at the ceremony on behalf of their respective governments were Mao Siwei, China's charge d'affaires to Pakistan and Ahmed Jawad, Additional Secretary of Pakistan's Economic Affairs Division. The donation of the medical facilities was among the pledges made by the Chinese government at the international donors' conference held in the Pakistani capital of Islamabad on November 19.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020051207e1c7000mw&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://pk.chineseembassy.org/chn/zbgx/t222714.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.ibiblio.org/obl/docs2/NLM2005-11-22.pdf, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Ahmed Jawad, Additional Secretary of Pakistan's Economic Affairs Division ; Mao Siwei, China's charge d'affaires to Pakistan (China Ministry of Foreign Affairs)

title: China donates aid package worth $6.2 million to Pakistan as part of earthquake relief efforts
description: In October 2005, China donated a comprehensive aid package totaling US$ 6.2 million (US$ 1 million in cash and US$5.2 million in kind). It had been announced a day after the 8 October earthquake in Karachi, and had been completely disbursed by 23 October. Nine cargo planes had been sent to Pakistan delivering 9 batches of relief goods. The relief goods include 25,000 blankets, 2310 tents, 7350 cotton padded mattresses, 23,980 towel coverlets, 38,000 bed sheets, 1312 generators, 1272 emergency lamps, 6400 buckets, 12 water purifiers, 20,000 gallons of purified water, as well as 46 tons of medicine and medical equipments. According to press release by the Chinese embassy in Pakistan, the aid was delivered in batches beginning shortly after the earthquake on Oct 8 2005, and had finished at the latest by Oct 23.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=NBBALU0020051216e1am00044&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://pk.china-embassy.org/eng/nyddz/t217938.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://jang.com.pk/thenews/spedition/mkrf/p35.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://english.cri.cn/2238/2005-10-18/88@277355.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://pk.chineseembassy.org/eng/zbgx/t217936.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China donates emergency food aid to Nepal after earthquake
description: In 2015, the Tibet Frontier Corps at Nyalam Checkpoints donated 2kg of rice, 3200kg of salt and 200 boxes of instant noodles to Nepal. These items are to be distributed by the Nepali armed force and police force to areas severely affected by the April 2015 7.3 magnitude earthquake.
sources: http://np.china-embassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1272891.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China donates in-kind grant of 4 million Chinese Yuan worth of relief materials for Afghan refugees in Pakistan
description: On October 21, 2001, China donated an in-kind grant of relief materials worth 4 million Chinese Yuan for Afghan refugees in Pakistan. The aid will be sent via the Pakistani government and the Pakistan office of the UN High Commissioner for Refugees. The morning of October 21 saw over 50 trucks fully loaded with cargo-containers set out in a long queue from Urumqi, Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region for Pakistan. The aid materials, consisting mainly of tents, woolen blankets, cotton-padded quilts, and waterproof canvass, are provided by Daguang Woolen Mill of Aksu, Urumqi Carpet Making Factory in Xinjiang, Beijing Canvass-Making Factory and Beijing Shuangyang Textiles Co. Ltd. The particular job is handled by Xinjiang Corporation for International Cooperation and Xintian International Eco-tech Cooperation (Group) Co. Ltd.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=afpr000020011022dxam009q7&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://en.people.cn/english/200110/23/eng20011023_82953.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/20011023/465525.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China donates relief commodities worth of 7 million RMB to Bangladesh for flood rehabilitation (Linked to Project ID #34297)
description: Members of a four-person Chinese delegation to Bangladesh told the Secretary of Food and Disaster Management Siddiqur Rahman Chowdhury that the Chinese government would donate seven million RMB in corrugated iron sheets for the flood rehabilitation program. Chinese Ambassador to Bangladesh Chi Xi handed over the consignment to Food and Disaster Management Secretary Siddiqur Rahman on Dec 22, 2004.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=BBCSAP0020040812e08c000b5&pp=1&fcpil=zhcn&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=UNIBAG0020040812e08b0000j&pp=1&fcpil=zhcn&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=UNIBAG0020040810e0890001a&pp=1&fcpil=zhcn&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://bd2.mofcom.gov.cn/article/bilateralcooperation/inbrief/200705/20070504675608.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://newsfrombangladesh.net/view.php?hidRecord=30361, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.epochtimes.com/gb/4/8/10/n622494.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks
funding_agency: Chinese Government
contacts: Siddiqur Rahman Chowdhury, Secretary of the Food and Disaster Management ; Zhiquan Duan, Charge d' Affairs ; Chi Xi, Chinese Ambassador to Bangladesh

title: China donates relief goods worth RMB 12 million to Afghan Refugees in Pakistan
description: In November, 2001, the Chinese government donated relief goods worth 12 million RMB to be used for Afghan refugees in Pakistan. A handover ceremony took place and the goods donated included tents, blankets, quilts, tarps and other materials that were transported to Peshawar on November 5.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=xnews00020011113dxbd003ch&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://books.google.com.pk/books?id=SzOYMbLiKhYC&pg=PA114&lpg=PA114&dq=%22China%22+AND+%2212%22+AND+%22aid%22+AND+%22afghan*%22+AND+%22refugee%22+AND+%22in+pakistan%22&source=bl&ots=-KFjkFuX0I&sig=GGYO_afwbT9jMvvhKgZsT4etops&hl=it&sa=X&ei=3ruiVY3KGYiJuAS8waGIAg&ved=0CCsQ6AEwAjgK#v=onepage&q=%22China%22%20AND%20%2212%22%20AND%20%22aid%22%20AND%20%22afghan*%22%20AND%20%22refugee%22%20AND%20%22in%20pakistan%22&f=false, Other Academic (Working Paper, Dissertation)
contacts: Lu Shulin, Chinese Ambassador to Pakistan

title: China donates supplies worth 20 million yuan to Sri Lankan flood victims
description: In May 2016, China donated 1,000 tents and 3,000 folding beds to Sri Lanka to support flood victims. The donation is worth 20 million yuan. During the donation ceremony, China announced it would donate $1.5 million USD in humanitarian cash (the funds would be used to construct a friendship village, project #53659). At this same time, the China Red Cross society donated $50,000 to the Sri Lanka Red Cross Society for relief (project #53706). Staff_Note: the transaction amount was changed in October 2018 from 15 million yuan, which was found in original and factiva sources.

title: China donates the 1st batch of humanitarian aid worth of RMB 10 million to flood-hit Pakistan (Linked to projects #38551, #36809 and #36801, and #54097.)
description: In August 2010, following the flood that hit Khyber Pakhtunkhwa region, China donated 10 million yuan to Pakistan in humanitarian aid. The grant was announced on August 01 by the Chinese Ministry of Commerce. The materials were gathered by the China's People's Liberation Army (PLA) within 48 hours after the government's pledge. The PLA Air Force deployed three Il-76 carriers to transport the materials. The aircraft departed for Pakistan from Shijiazhuang and Nanjing on August 4.The aid included relief materials such as 30 tonnes of medicines and water purifiers, 1,000 tents and 50 power generators, according to China's Ministry of National Defence. The representatives of the two countries involved in the aid transfer were the Chinese Ambassador in Islamabad Liu Jian for China, and Nadeem Ahmed, Chairman of National Disaster Management Authority, for Pakistan. The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) Financial Tracking Service records that the Chinese-donated in-kind emergency relief materials amount to 80 tons, including tents, electricity generators, medicine and water purification equipments, and are worth CNY10 million. STAFF_NOTE: Two more batches of in-kind assistance were subsequently sent in late August and early September of 2010. Linked to Projects #38551, #36809 and #36801. Also linked to #54097.

title: China donates the 3rd batch of humanitarian aid worth of RMB 60 million to flood-hit Pakistan (Linked to project #36722, #38551, and #36809)
description: On 25 August 2010, China donated RMB 60 million emergency humanitarian aid to Pakistan. The measure was announced by MOC official Chong Quan after meeting with Masood Khan, Pakistani ambassador to China. Part of China‚Äôs RMB 60 million humanitarian assistance to Pakistan reached PAF Chaklala Base in Islamabad on September 7. Liu Jian, Chinese Ambassador to Pakistan and Sibtain Fazal Halim, Secretary Economic Affairs Division signed the hand-over certificate. STAFF_NOTE: This is the third and the last batch of humanitarian in-kind assistance offered by China to flood-hit regions in Pakistan. Linked to Projects #38511, #36809 and #36722. These projects are all covered under the umbrella project #54097.

title: China donates tsunami relief supplies (batch 1 of 3) (linked to #33240, #33226)
description: In December 2004, China donated tsunami relief aid in the form of blankets, tents, bedding, food, and medical equipment to Sri Lanka. This is the first of three batches of relief supplies (see #33240, #33226). The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) Financial Tracking Service records the project with a committed amount of CNY50 million.

title: China gives Sri Lanka 270 tons of canned fish worth $320,000 USD as part of its tsunami relief efforts
description: China gave 270 tons of canned fish worth $320,000 USD to Sri Lanka as part of its tsunami relief efforts. The aid was administered by the World Food Programme (WFP). It is the first of two such shipments, worth a total of US$1 million, to support WFP food-for-work schemes to help Sri Lanka after the tsunami. STAFF_NOTES: China contributed 63 million USD for tsunami relief in total, most of the individual projects are captured (see projects linked with resource #41811).

implementing_agency: World Food Program (WFP), Multilateral
contacts: James Morris, Executive Director (World Food Program (WFP))

title: China gives grant of US$200000 to Pakistan flood victims
description: In August 2008, 2003, The Chinese Ambassador Mr. Zhang Chuxiang handed over US$200000 to the Pakistan Government through Secretary Cabinet Division Mr. Nasiruddin Ahmed in a formal ceremony. The amount would be spent for the relief of flood-affected people in the country.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PAPRIN0020030830dz8s0002u&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Zhang Chuxiang, Chinese Ambassador to Pakistan

title: China gives grant of US$50000 to Pakistan for the drought victims of Sind and Baluchistan (Linked to #39087)
description: China has donated US$50000 to Pakistan for the drought victims of Sind and Baluchistan. A check was presented on 23 May 2000 to the secretary-general of Pakistan Red Crescent Society by the Chinese charge d'affaires in Pakistan, Mr Lian Cheng.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=bbcapp0020010804dw5n00gsa&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://m.reliefweb.int/report/70322, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://fts.unocha.org/flows/2113?destination=donors/2976/flows/2000, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)
implementing_agency: Red Crescent Society of Pakistan, International NGO
recipient_agencies: Red Crescent Society of Pakistan, International NGO
contacts: Lian Cheng, charge d'affaires in Pakistan

title: China grans $1m USD to WFP to assist FATA (linked to #54372)
description: In November 2017, the 'China South-South Cooperation Assistance Fund' provided $1 million USD to the World Food Program in order to support humanitarian initiatives in Pakistan's Federally Administered Tribal Area (FATA). This donation will enable food and nutrition assistance to an estimated 158,000 vulnerable and displaced people. This is the first project supported by the fund. The second is a $4m USD initiative to provide housing and commodity assistance, as well as help with the rebuilding of schools in the region.
sources: http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2018-02/02/c_136944994.htm, Social Media, including Unofficial Blogs; https://www.wfp.org/news/news-release/landmark-contribution-china-enables-wfp-assist-158000-people-pakistan, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source
implementing_agency: World Food Program (WFP), Multilateral
contacts: Finbarr Curran, WFP Pakistan Country Director Finbarr Curran

title: China grants $1 Million Aid to Nepal for Flood Response (linked to #53718)
description: On August 15, 2017, Chinese Vice-Premier Wang Yang agreed to provide $1 million humanitarian assistance aid to help repair regions affected by landslides and floods in Nepal. The agreement was signed during Wang's visit in Nepal, but it is unclear which branch of the Chinese government will provide the funding. More than 110 people were killed by landslides and flooding in Nepal. This project is now complete. In November 2017, China provided an additional grant of $4 million, described in project #53718

title: China grants $1 million for flood relief in AJK Punj Pakistan
description: On 30 October 2014, China granted $1 million for flood relief in AJK Punj, according to the Government of Pakistan Ministry of Finance, Revenue, and Economic Affairs. The donating agency is unclear.
sources: http://www.ead.gov.pk/ead/userfiles1/file/Trainings/SR%20Jul-June%202014-15%20Revised%20Version%20on%2008-Feb-2016.xls, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China grants $10 million for post-flood victims compensation (linked to #36984 and #54097)
description: China pledged $10 million grant to Pakistan, to go towards compensation for victims of the 2010 Pakistan floods. The amount, together with a 400 million loan pledged for reconstruction, forms part of a 410 million USD aid package, that was announced by Chinese Premier Wen Jiabao while speaking at the National Disaster Management Authority in Islamabad on 18 December 2010, during the second day of a 3 day long trip to Pakistan. This project is linked to project ID #36984.and #54097.

title: China grants $4 million in aid for flood damages to Nepal (linked to project #54190)
description: In November 2017, China agreed to donate $4 million to UNDP for aid to the victims of heavy rainstorms in Nepal. The aid includes blankets, cooking utensils, mosquito nets, water filters and hygiene kits, which will benefit 31,800 affected families in 7 provinces. The implementation of programs start on January 11, 2018, and all delivery completed on March 26, 2018. This project is linked to the August 2017 $1 million given by China to Nepal in response to flooding (see project #54190).
sources: http://np.china-embassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1525344.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.chinanews.com/gn/2018/03-26/8476344.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=HNTM000020170816ed8g004v5&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=SCMCOM0020170816ed8g0005x&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.livemint.com/Politics/3I7pQdjUSs3B7GUVyIvFHO/Nepal-floods-China-announces-1-million-assistance.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2018-02/04/c_136948779.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China grants 1 million USD material aid to Afghanistan
description: In November 2002, China signed an agreement to donate 1 million USD material aid to Afghanistan during Afghanistan Minister of Foreign Minister Abdullah's visit in China. The exact use of the materials is unclear. STAFF_NOTE: This is not a duplicate project for #37850 since the commitment years are different. It is neither a duplicate for #53812 because this projects reports 1 million worth of material aids and #53812 reports 1 million cash. CRS code is emergency response as it is grouped with efforts towards reconstruction in the sources.
sources: https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/chn//gxh/cgb/zcgmzysx/yz/1206/1206x1/t356107.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/mfa_eng/wjb_663304/zzjg_663340/yzs_663350/gjlb_663354/2676_663356/2678_663360/t15832.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China grants 10 million RMB for flood relief to Sri Lanka (linked to #38613)
description: In January 2015, Chinese government announced a 20 million RMB aid package for flood relief to Malaysia and Sri Lanka. The aid package delivered tents, generators, sewage pumps and water purifying equipment to the flood-stricken regions. Sri Lanka and Malaysia each received 10 million RMB and the Chinese Air Force delivered the supplies.
sources: http://yws.mofcom.gov.cn/article/b/x/201501/20150100870136.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://my.china-embassy.org/chn/sgxw/t1227163.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://chindonews.blogspot.sg/2015/01/china-bantu-korban-banjir-di-malaysia.html, Social Media, including Unofficial Blogs; http://indonesian.cri.cn/201/2015/01/11/1s153603.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://eng.mod.gov.cn/TopNews/2015-01/12/content_4564218.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China grants 2 million RMB to Afghan refugees in Pakistan
description: In April, 2001, China pledged 2 million RMB yuan to support Afghan refugees living in Peshawar, Pakistan, which was then officially donated in July of that year. On 6th April 2001, in Islamabad, An Min (visiting Chinese vice Minister for Trade & Economic Cooperation) and Nawid Ahsan (Secretary of Economic affairs division) signed and exchanged letters for donation of relief items worth RMB Yuan 2.0 million for the Afghan Refugees in Pakistan. On 5th July 2001, Lu Shulin (Chinese Ambassador to Pakistan) and Abbas Sarfaraz Khan (Minister for Kashmir Affairs, Northern Areas, States and Frontier Regions) signed and swapped the hand-over certificates for humanitarian aid worth 2 million RMB. The donations include tents, generators, cooking utensils and other necessities.

implementing_agency: UNHCR, International NGO
contacts: Lu Shulin, Head of Mission ; Abbas Sarfaraz Khan, Minister for Kashmir Affairs, Northern Areas, States and Frontier Regions ; Nawid Ahsan, Secretary of Economic affairs division ; An Min, Vice Minister (China Ministry of Commerce)

title: China grants 200,000 USD to Pakistan for flood aid (linked to #35606)
description: In July 2007, the Chinese government donated 200,000 USD to Pakistan for disaster relief efforts from the flood. The aid was intended to normalize the lives of the affected as quickly as possible.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PAPRIN0020070710e3770007o&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=NBBALU0020070710e3770000x&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCSAP0020070706e376002ut&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCAPP0020070706e376001b9&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://pk.mofcom.gov.cn/article/todayheader/200903/20090306106322.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://news.sina.com.cn/w/2007-07-06/222212159205s.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://fts.unocha.org/flows/47205?destination=donors/2976/flows/2007%3Ff%255B0%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2521%26f%255B1%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522397%253ABANGLADESH%2520-%2520Cyclone%2520Sidr%2520-%2520November%25202007%2522%26f%255B2%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522379%253APAKISTAN%2520-%2520Floods/Cyclone%2520-%2520July%25202007%2522, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

title: China grants 22 tons of humanitarian relief worth 3 million RMB
description: On June 21 2010, China delivered 22 tons of humanitarian aid to Uzbekistan, including food, blankets, generators, mobile showers, and medications. The value of this donation was 3 million RMB. This aid would ease the strain on Uzbekistan to resettle refugees fleeing unrest in Kyrgyzstan's Osh region.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=UZBDAY0020100621e66l00001&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.fmprc.gov.cn/mfa_eng/xwfw_665399/s2510_665401/2535_665405/t710645.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://china.org.cn/world/2010-06/21/content_20307239.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://uz.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201006/20100606982244.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
funding_agency: Ministry of Commerce, Government Agency
contacts: Yu Hongjun, Chinese Ambassador to Uzbekistan

title: China grants 22.5 billion Rs. to construct friendship village in Sri Lanka after landslide
description: Following a 2016 Sri Lankan landslide which destroyed a village in Aranayaka, it was decided that China would build 60 two-story houses at a cost of 22.5 billion Rs. (1.5 million USD) above the landslide as part of a friendship village for those who had been displaced by the disaster. The total cost of the project was US$1.95 million. Construction of the village has been completed, and the houses are ready to be turned over to their new owners. China‚Äôs Hunan Construction Engineering Group Sri Lanka Branch is undertaking the construction of the Aranayaka China-Sri Lanka Friendship Village.
sources: http://www.erd.gov.lk/images/Publications/ERDReport2017/ERDReport2017-English.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://global.factiva.com/du/article.aspx/?accessionno=DAFTSL0020160603ec6300008&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=&cat=a, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.business-standard.com/article/news-ians/china-sri-lanka-build-friendship-village-for-landslide-victims-117011801365_1.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.ft.lk/news/china-assists-construction-of-china-sri-lanka-friendship-village-for-landslide-victims/56-592703, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.dailymirror.lk/expose/article/Aranayaka-Victims-Left-in-the-Lurch-146854.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks
implementing_agency: Hunan Constructing Engineering Group Corporation
recipient_agencies: Hunan Constructing Engineering Group Corporation

title: China grants 7.5 million RMB in-kind grant for tsunami relief
description: In the aftermath of the 2004 Indian Ocean tsunami, Beijing donated 7,500,000 RMB in relief supplies to Maldives. The first batch of the supplies was dispatched from Tianjin at 8:50 AM on Tuesday, January 5, 2005. The total package was worth 7.5 million RMB and was scheduled to arrive in Male by the evening of January 11. STAFF_NOTE: China contributed 63 million USD for tsunami relief in total, and most individual project are captured (see projects linked with resource #41811).
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020050110e11a006pq&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://en.people.cn/200501/11/eng20050111_170329.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/du/article.aspx/?accessionno=BSWEEK0020050107e11700001&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=&cat=a, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://fts.unocha.org/flows/29990?destination=donors/2976/flows/2005%3Ff%255B0%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2521%26f%255B1%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522300%253ACHINA%2520-%2520Floods%2520-%2520June%25202005%2522%26f%255B2%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522266%253AINDIAN%2520OCEAN%2520-%2520Earthquake/Tsunami%2520-%2520December%25202004%2522%26f%255B3%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522270%253APAKISTAN%2520-%2520Rains/Snowfall%2520-%2520February%25202005%2522%26f%255B4%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522302%253ASOUTH%2520ASIA%2520-%2520Earthquake%2520-%2520October%25202005%2522, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

title: China grants Kyrgyz Republic 5 million USD for reconstruction of south
description: On Apr.7 2011, an agreement has been signed on China allocating 5m dollars in no-strings financial aid to Kyrgyzstan to restore the south of the country. On Dec.13, 2012, the Parliament of Kyrgyzstan ratified the exchange letters between the Governments of Kyrgyzstan and China on $5 million aid for Kyrgyzstan for reconstruction of southern parts of Kyrgyzstan affected during June 2010 events. The multi-storied residential building of 66 apartments was to be built from China‚Äôs funds in Osh city under the agreement.

title: China grants Kyrgyzstan 150,000 USD for earthquake relief
description: On Oct.13, 2008, Chinese government gave US$150 thousand in assistance to victims of the earthquake (happened in Oct.5) in the south of Kyrgyzstan, according to press service of the Chinese Embassy in Bishkek. 'We sincerely share pain and grief of family members of those who died in the quake and wish the soonest recovery to the injured,' said in the message of the Chinese Embassy.

title: China grants Pakistan 100 thousand USD for flood relief
description: On 15 February 2005, the Chinese government donated 100,000 USD to Pakistan as a contribution to flood relief operations. On behalf of the Chinese government, Chinese ambassador Zhang Chunxiang transferred a check to Pakistani Cabinet Secretary Ejaz Rahim in Islamabad.

title: China grants Pakistan 2.5 million USD worth of relief aid for quake victims
description: China sent relief goods worth 2.5 million dollars for the 2006 Pakistani earthquake victims. The relief goods consisted of 3,300 cotton tents and 33,000 blankets. The first consignment of the relief goods had already reached on 30th December, Radio China reported. This consignment was airlifted in 4 batches to Islamabad from Dec. 29, 2005 to Jan. 1, 2006.

title: China grants Pakistan 5 million USD for drought relief (Linked to #35075)
description: In response to a drought crisis, China granted the Pakistani government 5 million USD for drought relief effort in Sindh and Balochistan.
sources: http://m.reliefweb.int/report/70322, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://reliefweb.int/report/pakistan/drought-pakistan-update-no-12, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://fts.unocha.org/flows/2208?destination=donors/2976/flows/2000, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

title: China grants RMB 10 million emergency humanitarian relief to Tajikistan
description: On July 23, 2015, Chinese Foreign Minister of China Wang Yi pledged to provide emergency humanitarian relief to Tajikistan during the meeting with his Tajik counterpart Sirojiddin Aslov. Constant high temperature since July caused glaciers to melt, leading to severe landslides in Tajikistan and causing serious casualties. On August 5, the Department of Foreign Assistance of MOFCOM delivered Tajikistan RMB10 million relief.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=CEASEN0020150724eb7o000jk&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://sydney.chineseconsulate.org/chn//zgxw/t1283525.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://english.mofcom.gov.cn/article/newsrelease/significantnews/201508/20150801075452.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
funding_agency: China Ministry of Finance, Government Agency

title: China grants Rs 90.1 million for reconstruction of Durbar High School in Nepal (Linked to project#43970)
description: In 2017, China agreed to reconstruct Durbar High School (also known as Bhanu Secondary School) in Kathmandu, Nepal. The school, founded on 1853, was previously damaged by the 2015 earthquake. The school will be reconstructed with funding of Rs 90.1 million from the Chinese government, with Shanghai Construction Engineering Group Co., Ltd. as the contracting company. The construction project officially starts on August 3, 2018 and is expected to last 20 months. The project is part of post-earthquake 25 China-aided recovery projects. For the umbrella project, see project #43970.
sources: http://np.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201809/20180902786798.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://news.cri.cn/20180803/7aa16025-471b-db4f-78bf-861a203c773d.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://thehimalayantimes.com/kathmandu/reconstruction-of-durbar-high-school-begins-with-chinese-govts-assistance/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.mofcom.gov.cn/dl/gbdqzn/upload/niboer.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
implementing_agency: Shanghai Construction Group General Co., State-Owned Company

title: China grants US$1.5 million for emergency relief following landslide in Sri Lanka
description: Following a landslide in May 2016 in Sri Lanka, the Government of the People's Republic of China (through its embassy in Sri Lanka) donated US$1.5 million to provide for emergency assistance.
sources: http://www.erd.gov.lk/images/Publications/ERDReport2017/ERDReport2017-English.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/chn//gxh/cgb/zcgmzysx/yz/1206_28/1206x1/t5940.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
funding_agency: Chinese Embassy, Government Agency

title: China grants materials and funds for National Seismic Monitoring Network in Pakistan (Linked to #35381)
description: In 2007, following the disastrous earthquake in Kashmir, China committed to fund a seismic network for Pakistan. Wang Chao, Assistant Minister for Commerce, People's Republic of China and Akram Malik signed the Letter of Exchange on behalf of their respective governments on Wednesday 18 July 2007. The signing ceremony was witnessed by Dr Salman Shah, the Prime Minister's financial adviser. Under the agreement, the Chinese government would establish National Seismic Monitoring Network in Pakistan, which will include design of the project, survey and selection of the stations, provision of earthquake monitoring equipment and its transportation to Islamabad, dispatch of technical personnel to Pakistan for equipment installation and commissioning of technical service and training of Pakistani technical personnel. The project assistance will be in form of a grant. Concrete matters regarding implementation of this project would be stipulated in a separate contract to be signed between the agencies to be designated by the two governments. A 2013 resource states that the project to install new broadband seismic stations equipped with advance technology that was initiated following the 2005 Kashmir Earthquake to strengthen seismic monitoring system, has completed. Pakistan Meteorology Department (PMD) would officially inaugurate these stations on May 16, 2013 in Islamabad. According to press releases by China Earthquake Administration and China Earthquake Network Center, the project started construction in 2008 and had been completed at latest by the end of 2013. Previously China had already agreed to provide a grant of approximately 10 m dollar in April 2007 for the Pakistan-China Centre and Digital Seismic Network in Pakistan. The Pakistan Economic Affairs Division states the cost of the project as 32.30 million RMB. As the discrepancy between the two amounts is too large and coder could not confirm either of them from official sources, the transaction amount is not captured under the project as of now. STAFF_NOTE: Linked to #35381, the umbrella project covering several agreements between the Chinese and Pakistani governments shortly after the earthquake.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCSAP0020070719e37j001gt&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://archives.dailytimes.com.pk/karachi/06-Apr-2013/pakistan-improves-seismic-monitoring, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://iisee.kenken.go.jp/net/shiva/update/Pakistan_1_Shahid0423(2011S)_revised.pdf, Other Academic (Working Paper, Dissertation); http://www.app.com.pk/en_/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=136088, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.asiaecon.org/regions/get_news_item/pakistan/9258, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.ead.gov.pk/ead/userfiles1/file/Trainings/Website%20Year%20Book%202014--15.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PAPRIN0020051112e1bb0000g&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCSAP0020051118e1bi000p1&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.dawn.com/news/162639/china-japan-pledge-more-relief-aid, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.geo.tv/quake/english-12-11-05.asp, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.cea-igp.ac.cn/gylj/274782.html, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source
implementing_agency: China Ministry of Commerce, Government Agency
contacts: Dr Salman Shah, Pakistani Prime minister's financial advisor ; Akram Malik, ; Wang Chao, Assistant Minister for commerce China

title: China makes multiple contribution through World Health Organization to Maldives total worth of US$671,450 for health purposes after earthquake/tsunami
description: The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) Financial Tracking Service records that on 04/04/2005, Chinese government made a total of 8 contributions to the World Health Organization to help provide health services in Maldives after the earthquake/tsunami on the Indian Ocean in December 2004. The contributions total USD671,450. They include: Assessment of the damage to the overall health system in the disaster-affected areas Support to MoH coordination Provision of supplies and equipment and replenishment of assets Technical support Advocacy and capacity building Disease surveillance Project management, evaluation and reporting Environmental Health monitoring and surveillance Restoration of Water and Sanitation Systems in the Disaster Affected Area
