title: China provide 30 million Chinese Yuan Emergency Assistance to Afghanistan (Linked to #37850, #34501, #34498)
description: In January 2002, Chinese President Jiang Zemin, Prime Minister Zhu Rongji signed an agreement to provide Afghanistan emergency aid package worth 30 million Chinese Yuan during the visit of Afghan interim leader Hamid Karzai. The aid package includes medicine, medical equipment, stationery, and sports products is for support of the temporary government. In March 2002, Northern Afghanistan was hit by Hindu Kush earthquakes, so part of the aid was also used for rehabilitation. The handover ceremony was held on March 26, 2002. The agreement was signed together with #37850, another assistance of 1 million USD in cash. For other 2002 earthquake response fund that China provided for Afghanistan, see #34501 for details. This project is part of a package of 2002-2005 China assistance to Afghanistan of 150 million USD reconstruction plan (#34498).
sources: https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/web/gjhdq_676201/gj_676203/yz_676205/1206_676207/fyrygth_676215/t5488.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://news.sina.com.cn/c/2002-05-22/0616582394.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/chn//gxh/cgb/zcgmzysx/yz/1206/1206x1/t356107.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China provides $1.5m USD for earthquake relief (linked to #54186)
description: Sep 25, 2013, the Chinese government decided to provide emergency relief assistance to the Pakistani government for earthquake aftermath. The assistance includes $1.5 million USD and supplies worth 30 million yuan (captured in project #54186). According to Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Status Report July-June 2013-14, the project started on 07-OCT-13 and ended on 31-OCT-13, meaning the aid is likely delivered by that date.
sources: http://pk.china-embassy.org/chn/zbgx/t1081463.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.ead.gov.pk/ead/userfiles1/file/Trainings/SR%20Jul-June%202013-14%203rd%20Revision%20on%2003-03-15.xls, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://reliefweb.int/report/pakistan/china-offers-earthquake-assistance-pakistan, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://fts.unocha.org/flows/108986?destination=donors/2976/flows/2013%3Ff%255B0%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2521, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://www.mofcom.gov.cn/article/ae/ai/201309/20130900328301.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China provides 1 million USD in cash assistance to Afghanistan earthquake relief
description: In October 2015 in response to an earthquake, China provided 10 million Chinese yuan in emergency material aid to Afghanistan and announced that Vice Chairman Li Yuanchao would provide an additional 1 million USD in cash assistance. The material aid was delivered to Afghanistan in November 3, 2015. STAFF_NOTE: This project records the 1 million USD of cash assistance. The emergency material aid is recorded in #53817.
sources: https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/web/zyxw/t1311738.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China provides 1,771,486 USD in emergency oil products to Nepal
description: In August 2016, China provided 1,771,486 USD in emergency petroleum to Nepal.
sources: http://amis.mof.gov.np/aim/viewActivityPreview.do~public=true~pageId=2~activityId=16205~language=en, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.reuters.com/article/us-china-nepal-idUSKCN0WP1WV, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China provides 10 million RMB for anti-terror actions
description: In October 2001 China donated to the Pakistani government emergency aid worth 10 million RMB. The humanitarian aid, including tents and blankets, left on October 22, 2001, for the Pakistani city of Peshawar from Urumqi in northwest China's Xinjiang region which borders Pakistan and Afghanistan. Earlier, on October 1, President Jiang Zemin had declared that China would provide 10 million yuan in emergency aid to Pakistan, in support to the country's anti-terror actions. China had also expressed its willingness to cooperate with Pakistan in counter-terrorism efforts.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=xnews00020011022dxam003px&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.china.org.cn/english/2001/Oct/20990.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.fmprc.gov.cn/ce/cegv/eng/rqrd/jblc/t85094.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.rediff.com/us/2001/oct/01ny4.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.chinaembassy.lt/eng/zt/zgfk/t125316.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://lt.china-embassy.org/eng/zt/zgfk/t125312.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=afpr000020011022dxam009q7&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://en.people.cn/english/200110/23/eng20011023_82953.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/20011023/465525.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=bbcapp0020011018dxai008c1&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=bbcapp0020011120dxbk007pt&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.voanews.com/content/a-13-a-2001-10-01-31-china-66941147/377566.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.chinanews.com/2001-10-21/26/132391.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.fmprc.gov.cn/chn//pds/ziliao/zt/ywzt/wzzt/2297/2298/t10561.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China provides 10 million yuan in material aid to Afghanistan earthquake relief
description: In October 2015 in response to an earthquake, China provided 10 million Chinese yuan in emergency material aid to Afghanistan and announced that Vice Chairman Li Yuanchao would provide an additional 1 million USD in cash assistance. The material aid was delivered to Afghanistan in November 3, 2015. The earthquake relief materials include 300 tents, 20,000 blankets and 60 generators. STAFF_NOTE: This project records just the 10 million RMB.
sources: http://af.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201512/20151201212531.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://af.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201511/20151101154504.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://global.factiva.com/du/article.aspx/?accessionno=PHILNA0020151028ebas0000x&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=&cat=a, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.xinhuanet.com/world/2015-11/03/c_1117024902.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://af.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zxhz/201501/20150100879514.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China provides 13,000 tents to quake-hit Pakistan
description: Following the flood that hit Pakistan, China donated 13,000 tents as a contribution to flood relief operations. The materials reached Peshawar on 17 November 2005 through a convoy of 163 trucks which had been travelling via Karakoram Highway. The materials were handed over to Pakistan Army: A 13-member Chinese delegation handed over relief goods to military authorities at Besham. 7000 tents were dispatched to the quake hit areas of Azad Kashmir whereas 6000 tents will be distributed in the affected areas of NWPF.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PAPRIN0020051119e1bi00028&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://reliefweb.int/report/pakistan/pakistan-around-rs-8-billion-distributed-among-earthquake-victims-relief, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://pk.china-embassy.org/eng/nyddz/t219910.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
implementing_agency: Pakistan Army, Government Agency
recipient_agencies: Pakistan Army, Government Agency

title: China provides 15 million yuan Tsunami Relief Supplies to Sri Lanka (Batch 2 of 3) (Linked to #33234, #33240)
description: In January 2005, China donated relief good worth 15 million yuan (around $1.83 million) include blankets, tents, bed sheets, medicines, mosquito nets, generators, biscuits and other food. This donation is for Sri Lankan tsunami-hit areas. This was the second of three batches of relief supplies (see #33234, #33240). STAFF_NOTE: China contributed 63 million USD for tsunami relief in total, and most of the individual project are captured as projects linked with resource #41811.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=BBCAPP0020050104e114000p1&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=HNTM000020050104e11500076&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=XNEWS00020050106e11400261&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.humanrights.cn/zt/tsunami/..%5Ctsunami/20050200518154532.htm, NGO/Civil Society/Advocacy; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=STIMES0020050105e11600003&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/du/article.aspx/?accessionno=BSWEEK0020050107e11700001&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=&cat=a, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China provides 2 million yuan to Pakistan for Afghan refugee aid (Linked to #34490)
description: In August 2000, China donated aid worth 2 million yuan to Afghan refugees in Peshawar, Pakistan. The relief included medicine, tents, blankets, and clothes and was delivered to the UNHCR office in Peshawar. The signing ceremony was held by Chinese Ambassador to Pakistan, Lu Shulin, and Chief of the U.N. High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) Afghan Mission in Pakistan.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=xnews00020010818dw8t00je0&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks
implementing_agency: UNHCR, International NGO
contacts: Lu Shulin, Head of Mission (1Malaysia Development Bhd.)

title: China provides 30m yuan worth of supplies for earthquake relief (linked to #53542)
description: Sep 25, 2013, the Chinese government decided to provide emergency relief assistance to the Pakistani government for earthquake aftermath. The assistance includes $1.5 million USD (captured in project 53542) and supplies worth 30 million yuan. On September 29, the first batch of materials arrived in Pakistan. A 7.7 magnitude earthquake hit Pakistan's southwest province, leaving at least 348 people dead.
sources: https://reliefweb.int/report/pakistan/china-offers-earthquake-assistance-pakistan, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://news.ifeng.com/mil/2/detail_2013_09/29/29981257_0.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.gov.cn/gzdt/2013-09/26/content_2495661.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://fts.unocha.org/flows/108988?destination=donors/2976/flows/2013%3Ff%255B0%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2521, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://www.mofcom.gov.cn/article/ae/ai/201309/20130900328301.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China provides 35,000 blankets and 5,000 tents to Pakistan refugees in Afghanistan
description: On December 12, 2015, China delivered material for refugee aid to Afghanistan Ministry of Rural Rehabilitation and Development. The aids include 35,000 blankets and 5,000 tents. The aid is to help resettle Pakistan refugees in Afghanistan. The materials were handed over to Afghanistan in 2015.
sources: http://af.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201512/20151201209104.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/sgxw/t1323936.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
implementing_agency: Afghanistan Ministry of Rural Rehabilitation and Development, Government Agency
recipient_agencies: Afghanistan Ministry of Rural Rehabilitation and Development, Government Agency

title: China provides 80 million RMB in grant to Afghanistan for reconstruction
description: In August 2007, Chinese President Hu Jintao and Afghan President Hamid Karzai signed an agreement under which the Chinese Government would provide 80 million Chinese Yuan in grant to Afghanistan for reconstruction post-war. China's commitment to provide the grant was reiterated by Ambassador Wang Guangya at the UN High-level Meeting on Afghanistan on 23 September 2007. On 15 November 2007, China delivered on its promise when Chinese Minister of Foreign Affairs Yang Jiechi handed over the document for the 80 million yuan in grant to Afghan Foreign Minister. STAFF_NOTE: Project #34526 and #38572 is not duplicate. It happens that contracts are signed in different date of the year, and China gives Afghanistan 80 million every year in 2006, 2007, 2008.
sources: http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2007-08/16/content_6540767.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.libproxy1.nus.edu.sg/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCSAP0020071115e3bf0018h&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.china-un.org/eng/xw/t365868.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://af.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zxhz/hzjj/201501/20150100879514.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://china.org.cn/english/2006/Feb/156766.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.china-un.org/chn/zgylhg/jjalh/alhrd/yz/afh/t365864.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/zgzx/2007-08/21/content_7438659.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China provides 9.3mil som worth of emergency construction materials to Kyrgyzstan for emergency relief
description: Summary: On October 7, 2014 the Ministry of Emergency Situations received building materials in the amount of 9.3mil som($171.1thousand). The building materials were received through the Chinese grant in the framework of the agreement on economic and technical cooperation between the Government of Kyrgyzstan and the Government of China signed on 13 September, 2005. The Ministry of Emergency Situations was instructed to use the materials while carrying out emergency repair works and other emergency operations in the areas and settlements.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=CEASEN0020141016eaag0008h&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China provides Afghanistan 1 million Yuan grants for snow disaster in Badakhshan Province (linked to #53629 and #53630)
description: On December 27, 2016, China grants Afghanistan 1 million Chinese Yuan (approxi. 145,000 USD) as humanitarian aid in response to snow disaster hit Badakhshan Province. The grant was delivered immediately on cash. In response to the snow disaster in Afghanistan, the Chinese side also handed over 50 million yuan of humanitarian materials to the Afghan side, which is reported in project #53629. A second grant of humanitarian aid was given by China in February 2017, reported in #53631.
sources: http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/sbwl/t1427118.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.mfa.gov.cn/chn//pds/wjdt/zwbd/t1437807.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
implementing_agency: Afghanistan National Disaster Management Authority, Government Agency
recipient_agencies: Afghanistan National Disaster Management Authority, Government Agency

title: China provides USD200,000 tsunami relief aid to Sri Lanka in cash
description: In response to the tsunami disaster on the Indian Ocean in December 2004, the Chinese government provides US$200,000 in cash for disaster relief to Sri Lanka.
sources: https://fts.unocha.org/flows/24790?destination=donors/2976/flows/2004%3Ff%255B0%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522266%253AINDIAN%2520OCEAN%2520-%2520Earthquake/Tsunami%2520-%2520December%25202004%2522, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

title: China provides additional facilities to a School and Hospital in Baffa, Pakistan (Linked to project #55836)
description: In 2006, China agreed to build for Pakistan a Baffa Tehsil Headquarters Hospital (THQ Baffa) and Government Higher Secondary School Baffa (GHSS Baffa), in District Baffa, Mansehra, and started construction in 2012. In 2015, the Chinese government will provide Rs 94 million additional funds to Earthquake Reconstruction, Rehabilitation Authority to upgrade the buildings with additional facilities and equipment. The MoU was signed on 21-11-2014. The up-gradations include a Waste Water Treatment Unit, Medical Waste Burning Facility (Hospital), Drainage for the hospital, Provision for Voltage Stabiliser in hospital and provision for Voltage Stabiliser in school. The construction contract was signed on 2015-12-18. Construction began in 2015. The implementing agency is Anhui Construction Engineering Group, a Chinese company. The project has finished and the handover ceremony was held on 2017-11-02. According to a Pakistani Economic Affairs Division Year Book in the fiscal year of 2016/17, the project cost is 5.8 million RMB, which is roughly the equivalent of the Rs94 million mentioned above. STAFF_NOTE: For details of the construction of the original buildings, see project #55836.
sources: http://www.ead.gov.pk/userfiles1/file/EAD/2018/Final%20PCP%20Year%20Book%202016-17%20.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.ead.gov.pk/userfiles1/file/EAD/2018/Website%20Year%20Book%202015-2016.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.ead.gov.pk/ead/userfiles1/file/Trainings/Website%20Year%20Book%202014--15.pdf, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://fp.brecorder.com/2015/12/201512221257985/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://pk.mofcom.gov.cn/article/todayheader/201512/20151201216312.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://pk.mofcom.gov.cn/article/todayheader/201711/20171102664540.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.ztb365.cn/xm/info-27610.html, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source
implementing_agency: Anhui Construction Engineering Group, Private Sector

title: China provides aid for two middle schools damaged by earthquake in Nepal
description: In May 2017, China announced it would provide aid for two middle schools which were damaged during the 2015 earthquake in Nepal. Balawi Middle School and Ratna Middle School are set to be reconstructed, with the aid of Chinese funds. For other China aided the school reconstruction project, see #53719. The total construction area of ‚Äãthe two secondary schools in Nibalawei and Ratna is about 3,900 square meters and 5,662 square meters respectively. The two schools can accommodate 1,046 full-time students and 130 faculty members.
sources: http://np.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201705/20170502582409.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.chinanews.com/gj/2017/05-22/8230854.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China provides disaster rescue equipment to Bangladesh
description: In October 2017, the Chinese Ambassador to Bangladesh handed over rescue operation equipment to the Secretary of Disaster Management and Relief of Bangladesh in Dhaka. The equipment comes at the Bangladeshi government's request and included a hydraulic wheel excavator, forklift, air compressor, generator set, and a cutting machine. It is not known from where the Chinese government procured the equipment. STAFF_NOTE: This project is coded as emergency response as a part of CRS code 74010 (Disaster prevention and preparedness), but the donation of the equipment was not prompted by a natural disaster at the time.
sources: https://borneobulletin.com.bn/china-hands-over-high-tech-equipment-for-rescue-and-relief-operations-to-bangladesh/, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.xinhuanet.com//english/2017-10/29/c_136713408.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks
funding_agency: Chinese Embassy, Government Agency
implementing_agency: Bangladesh Ministry of Disaster Management and Relief, Government Agency
recipient_agencies: Bangladesh Ministry of Disaster Management and Relief, Government Agency

title: China provides emergency grant for desalinization plant to Maldives (link to project ID #38087)
description: China provided a USD 500,000 emergency grant to Maldives's government following a fire at a desalinization plant that threatened Male's water supply in 2014. The grant was used to 'speed up repairs in a desalination plant and restore water to the capital.' The project is linked to project #38087 where China sent in-kind assistance of water to Male.
sources: http://thebricspost.com/china-india-send-water-aid-to-maldives/#.VYpMzxOqqko, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/china/2014-12/08/c_133838551.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
funding_agency: Chinese Government

title: China provides emergency water supplies to Male, Maldives (link to project ID #38403)
description: In early December 2014, China sent water bottles on commercial airliners including 32.5 tons of water from Mega Maldives and China Southern Airlines and 5 tons of water bottles from Emirates (following urgent contact on the part of CMEC, a Chinese machinery company) to the Maldives. In addition, China had the People's Liberation Army Navy (PLAN) Changxingdao warship deliver 600 tons of drinking water to Male Port. Then the PLAAF sent two planes to deliver 40 tons of water to Male International Airport. The project is linked to project #38403 where China provided a $500,000 emergency grant to the Maldives' government to speed up repairs in a desalination plant and restore water to the capital following a fire at a desalinization plant that threatened Male's water supply in 2014.
sources: http://mv.china-embassy.org/chn/zmgx/sbgxgk/t1217479.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://thebricspost.com/china-india-send-water-aid-to-maldives/#.VYpMzxOqqko, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/china/2014-12/08/c_133838551.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://mv.chineseembassy.org/chn/sgxw/t1217416.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.fmprc.gov.cn/chn//gxh/cgb/zcgmzysx/yz/1206_19/1206x1/t5695.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
funding_agency: Chinese Government
implementing_agency: China Southern Airlines; China Machinery Engineering Corporation (CMEC) , State-Owned Company; People's Liberation Army (PLA), Government Agency

title: China provides first emergency humanitarian aid of 20 million RMB to Nepal for earthquake relief (Linked to project #38415, #38417)
description: In April 2015, the Chinese government provided 20 million yuan of emergency humanitarian aid to the Nepalese government. On April 28 at 11 a.m, 186 tonnes emergency humanitarian aid included tents, blankets, generators and other urgently needed supplies to help Nepal to carry out relief work. The emergency aid was delivered by 10 chartered planes to alleviate the urgent needs of Nepal. This was a relief response to the 8.1 earthquake that hit Nepal on April 25, 2015 which has caused casualties and significant property damage. In addition, China also sent a 170-strong team from the China's International Rescue Team, comprising of 40 rescuers, 10 medical workers and 12 seismic experts and six sniff dogs to aid rescue efforts. The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) Financial Tracking Service records a total in-kind assistance of CNY60million, corresponding to the aggregate amount in the first and second batches of assistance. The second round of aid is captured under project #38415, and the third under #38417.
sources: http://np.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201504/20150400955442.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://np.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201504/20150400955443.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2015-04/27/c_134188265.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/china/2015-04/26/content_20546160.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2015-04/26/c_134186099.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2015-04/27/c_134188698.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.china-un.org/eng/gdxw/t1264385.htm, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://np.china-embassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1264175.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://yws.mofcom.gov.cn/article/b/x/201504/20150400954612.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PHILNA0020150430eb4t0009t&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PARALL0020150429eb4s000gr&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://np.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201802/20180202712785.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://fts.unocha.org/flows/127958?destination=donors/2976/flows/2015%3Ff%255B0%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522629%253ANEPAL%2520-%2520Earthquake%2520-%2520April%25202015%2522, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

title: China provides humanitarian aid to Afghanistan for blizzard (linked to #53629 and #53630)
description: On February 2017, China provides humanitarian aid to Afghanistan government in response to blizzard. The aid includes tents, comforter, and down jackets. The first plane containing aids arrived in Afghanistan on February 19, and the second one arrived on February 25. One news reports puts the total worth of all materials at 137.1 million afghanis dollars. This project is linked to another grant of humanitarian aid of 50 million yuan for the snow disaster, #53629, and a grant of 1 million yuan as aid for the snow, #53630. STAFF_NOTE: this project is not a duplicate of #53629 since the delivery times are different.
sources: http://af.china-embassy.org/chn/zagx/sbwl/t1439707.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.mfa.gov.cn/chn//pds/gjhdq/gj/yz/1206/1206x2/t1439708.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.xinhuanet.com//world/2017-02/20/c_129485362.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://drive.google.com/file/d/1FbxDQtTIjlh_eZGSNAZDN6HP3vECv3iy/view?usp=sharing, Media Report, including Wikileaks
implementing_agency: Afghanistan National Disaster Management Authority, Government Agency
recipient_agencies: Afghanistan National Disaster Management Authority, Government Agency

title: China provides in-kind assistance for flood relief for Pakistan worth CNY200 million
description: On 6 September 2010 the Chinese government pledged 200 million yuan of humanitarian aid in kind to flood-hit Pakistan. Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Jiang Yu confirmed the 200-million-yuan aid on the 6th evening. Chinese Ambassador Liu Jian called on Pakistan Prime Minister Yousaf Raza Gilani and informed the latter about the Chinese Government's decision. Chinese Premier Wen Jiabao announced the aid at a UN summit in New York on September 22, said Huang Xilian, the embassy spokesman. The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs recorded the project on 07/09/2010 and last updated it on 09/09/2010, suggesting that the project had likely been fulfilled by then.

title: China provides in-kind grant of 30 million Chinese Yuan worth of relief material to Pakistan for internally displaced persons (Linked to project #39088)
description: To help Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) of Swat and adjoining areas, the Chinese government has announced further assistance of 30 million Chinese yuan worth of relief materials, Pakistan's Ambassador to China Masood Khan on May 23, 2009. Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Ma Zhaoxu explained that the first batch would be airlifted to Pakistan on 27 May 2009.The grant includes water purification equipment, power generator and medicine. More than 1.6 million people had fled from the Swat Valley in Pakistan's North West Frontier Province, where government forces had been battling armed Islamic militants for weeks. In addition, about 215017 internally displaced persons have been staying at 17 relief camps. More than 1.4 million affected people were registered outside the camps. STAFF_NOTE: Previously, China had already given one million U.S. dollars cash in emergency humanitarian aid to Pakistan for the PM's Special Fund for the Victims of Terrorism. For details of this project, see #39088.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCSAP0020090524e55o001rx&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://en.people.cn/90001/90776/90883/6666232.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.thenews.com.pk/TodaysPrintDetail.aspx?ID=179181&Cat=2&dt=5/23/2009, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://news.163.com/09/0527/09/5AAE2F5E000120GR.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.chinanews.com/gj/gj-yt/news/2009/05-27/1709108.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://pk.china-embassy.org/chn/zbgx/t564907.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Syed Yusuf Raza Gillani, Pakistani Prime minister ; Luo Zhao Hui, Chinese Ambassador to Pakistan (Chinese Embassy)

title: China provides natural disaster relief to Afghanistan
description: On March 9th, 2017, the Chinese government provided $1 million in cash assistance to the UNHCR. The UNHCR also distributed winter supplies such as double-sided blankets and gas tanks to more than 330 refugee families. According to the relevant agreement, the UNHCR will carry out specific work on material procurement, transportation and distribution on behalf of the Chinese government, and follow-up aid materials will be distributed to the refugees. According to local media reports, since the winter of 2016, extreme weather has caused at least 239 people in the country to be killed, 214 people were injured, and more than 520 houses were destroyed. STAFF_NOTE: Can't verify the $1 million cash assistance grant to the UNHCR, but can verify the aid items distributed by the UNHCR. Articles are unclear how the $1 million grant was used, or if it was an evaluation of the aid donated to the UNHCR.
sources: http://www.xinhuanet.com//world/2017-03/10/c_1120603698.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.xinhuanet.com//english/2017-03/10/c_136118622.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China provides second emergency humanitarian aid to Nepal of 40 million RMB for earthquake relief (Linked to projects #38414, #38417)
description: In 2015, following the first round of the 20 million yuan of emergency humanitarian aid, the Chinese government has decided to continue to provide a second round of 200 tonnes emergency relief supplies to earthquake assistance in Nepal, including 40M RMB worth of water purification equipment, trauma first aid kits, tents and blankets. The Nepalese Ministry of Commerce will help speed up the delivery of aid in conjunction with relevant departments to ensure that aid are delivered in the shortest time possible to Nepal's capital city Kathmandu. According to Chinese state news outlets, this second batch of funding had been completed by May 7, 2015, and all materials had been delivered on May 10. The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) Financial Tracking Service records a total in-kind assistance of CNY60million, corresponding to the aggregate amount in the first and second batches of assistance. The first round of funding is captured under project #38414, and the third under #38417.
sources: http://np.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201504/20150400957459.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.china-un.org/eng/gdxw/t1264385.htm, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://np.china-embassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1264175.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCSAP0020150428eb4s003e9&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.chinanews.com/gn/2015/05-12/7271031.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.xinhuanet.com//world/2015-05/07/c_1115213713.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.chinanews.com/gn/2015/05-15/7278782.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://fts.unocha.org/flows/127958?destination=donors/2976/flows/2015%3Ff%255B0%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522629%253ANEPAL%2520-%2520Earthquake%2520-%2520April%25202015%2522, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

title: China provides supplies worth 15 million yuan to Sri Lanka
description: In 2017, the Chinese embassy provided humanitarian supplies worth 15 million yuan to Sri Lanka after the flood and landslide. The supplies include 600 tents, 20 thousand blankets, 5000 sheets, 20,000 life jackets, and 1,000 pairs of rain boots.
sources: https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/chn//gxh/cgb/zcgmzysx/yz/1206_28/1206x1/t5940.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/chn//gxh/cgb/zcgmzysx/yz/1206_28/1206x1/t5940.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://lk.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201706/20170602586961.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://chinaplus.cri.cn/news/china/9/20170529/5429.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2017-06/01/c_136330994.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.lankabusinessonline.com/indian-ships-arrive-in-sri-lanka-with-flood-relief-china-pledges-usd2-2mn/, Media Report, including Wikileaks
funding_agency: Chinese Embassy, Government Agency

title: China provides third emergency humanitarian aid of 80 million RMB to Nepal for earthquake relief (Linked to projects #38414 and #38415)
description: In 2015, China's Ministry of Commerce, Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Ministry of Finance, the Chinese Civil Aviation Authority, the General Staff, General Logistics Department and other departments have come together to provide a third round of earthquake emergency humanitarian aid worth of 80million RMB. The first round involves 20 million RMB (project #38414). The second round involves 40 million RMB (#38415).
sources: http://np.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/201505/20150500978058.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://politics.people.com.cn/n/2015/0513/c70731-26995954.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://fts.unocha.org/flows/129067?destination=donors/2976/flows/2015%3Ff%255B0%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522629%253ANEPAL%2520-%2520Earthquake%2520-%2520April%25202015%2522, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)
contacts: Sun Jiwen [Â≠ôÁªßÊñá], Chinese Ministry of Commerce representative

title: China provides two rounds of assistance total worth of USD80000 for earthquake relief in Kyrgyz Republic
description: The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs records that on 26/11/2015, Chinese government provided USD50,000 for the people affected by earthquake on 17 November 2015 in Kyrgyz Republic. Later on 15/12/2015, the Guangdong province of the People's Republic of China provided another USD30,000. The source records the project as commitment. The Chinese state media Xinhua News Agency also reports that, according to the Chinese diplomat in the local region of the earthquake in Kyrgyzstan, Song Liqun, the Chinese embassy had sent emergency materials such as quilts and pillows to the affected region.
sources: http://www.xinhuanet.com/world/2015-12/01/c_128488278.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://fts.unocha.org/flows/136927?destination=donors/2976/flows/2015%3Ff%255B0%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2521, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://fts.unocha.org/flows/136926?destination=donors/2976/flows/2015%3Ff%255B0%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2521, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

title: China reconstructs Basantapur Tower in Kathmandu Durbar Square, Nepal (Linked to project #43970)
description: In 2017, China agreed to aid with the reconstruction of Basantapur Tower(‰πùÂ±ÇÁ•ûÂ∫ô) in Kathmandu Durbar Square (Âä†Âæ∑Êª°ÈÉΩÊùúÂ∑¥ÂπøÂú∫), Nepal. The program to reconstruct the tower will cost approximately 90 million yuan, paid for by the Chinese government. The temple was damaged by the 2015 earthquake. Constructions efforts began in November 2017 by the China Cultural Heritage Research Institute. The construction starts on August 15, 2017. It is expected to finish in 5 years. This is one of the 25 projects pledged by China as assistance for earthquake reconstruction. For the umbrella project, see project #43970.
sources: http://np.china-embassy.org/chn/xwdt/t1558687.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.hubpd.com/c/2017-10-30/624184.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.bjnews.com.cn/world/2017/08/15/454370.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&NS=16&AID=9VIV000400&an=CHNDHK0020170504ed550001a&cat=a&ep=ASI, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China sends 11-member expert team to help Sri Lanka with reconstruction efforts
description: An 11-member Chinese expert team from the Chinese Ministry of Commerce (MOC), Ministry of Construction, Ministry of Civil Affairs were sent to Sri Lanka to 1) evaluate local conditions in the wake of the killer tsunami, 2) help local governments in the country to resume the power supply and communications and 3) reconstruct the infrastructure facilities. The expert team, China built for international relief efforts, left China's capital Beijing for Sri Lanka on Jan 17 and left 10 days later on Jan 27. STAFF_NOTES: China contributed 63 million USD for tsunami relief in total, most of the individual project are captured in the linked resource #41811.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=BBCSAP0020050119e11j002jp&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=XNEWS00020050127e11r00461&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://reliefweb.int/report/sri-lanka/reassessment-reconstruction-expert-teams-under-way-tsunami-hit-countries, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/du/article.aspx/?accessionno=BSWEEK0020050107e11700001&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=&cat=a, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Sun Guoxiang, Chinese Ambassador to Sri Lanka (China)

title: China sends 50 tons of in-kind flood relief assistance to Pakistan (Linked to Project #53533)
description: To assist the Pakistani people and the army in fighting the floods, the Chinese People's Liberation Army sent in an international rescue medical team of 50 people, who also carried along with them 50 tons of emergency relief materials. Linked to project #53533
sources: http://pk.chineseembassy.org/eng/zbgx/t869340.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://pk.china-embassy.org/chn/zbgx/t869339.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://reliefweb.int/report/pakistan/chinese-army-send-medical-team-pakistan-humanitarian-relief, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://tribune.com.pk/story/277959/floods-2011-china-to-send-50-relief-workers/, Media Report, including Wikileaks
funding_agency: People's Liberation Army of China, Government Agency

title: China sends 64 member rescue team for flood relief in Hyderabad, Pakistan (linked to #36859 and #36861)
description: On 20 September 2010 the Chinese army 64-member rescue team with four helicopters to Hyderabad. The team completed its mission on Saturday 25. The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs confirms the project in its Financial Tracking Service database.

title: China sends 68 member medical team to Sehwan, Pakistan for flood relief (linked to #37069 and #36860)
description: In September 2010, the Chinese army (PLA) sent a 68-member medical team to Sehwan of Sindh. The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs confirms the project in its Financial Tracking Service database.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCAPP0020100923e69n001p5&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ASDEFJ0020110302e6cv0000d&cat=a&ep=ASE, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://m.reliefweb.int/report/368670/pakistan/china-pledges-its-biggest-ever-aid-to-pakistan, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/china/2010wenindia/2010-12/18/content_11721909.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://english.sina.com/china/p/2010/0925/341106.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://fts.unocha.org/flows/79528?destination=donors/2976/flows/2010%3Ff%255B0%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2521%26f%255B1%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522504%253ACHINA%2520-%2520Earthquake%2520-%2520April%25202010%2522%26f%255B2%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522516%253ACHINA%2520-%2520Floods%2520-%2520June%25202010%2522%26f%255B3%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522508%253AKYRGYZSTAN%2520-%2520Civil%2520unrest-%2520June%25202010%2522%26f%255B4%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522520%253APAKISTAN%2520-%2520Floods%2520-%2520July%25202010%2522, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)
implementing_agency: China's People's Liberation Army, Government Agency

title: China sends 7 seismology experts to quake-hit Pakistan (Linked to #35377)
description: From 7 to 21 October, 2005, a Chinese delegation of seven experts consisting of Geophysicists and seismologists conducted seismic study of devastated earthquake areas in Pakistan. The Chinese experts conducted earthquake/aftershocks observations/study and allocation surveys with the help of Pakistani experts.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=NBBALU0020051122e1b60003l&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PAPRIN0020051112e1bb0000g&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCSAP0020051118e1bi000p1&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.cea-igp.ac.cn/english/newsandviews/264708.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China sends first round of relief aid for Rohingya refugees in Bangladesh
description: On September 27th, 2018, a Chinese cargo plane carrying 57 tons of humanitarian aid arrived in Chittagong, Bangladesh. The aid is meant to assist the Rohingya refugees displaced from Myanmar. It is unknown which part of the Chinese government provided the aid. The value of the aid is unknown. The next day, China sent a second cargo plane with more aid (project #54501) to help Bangladesh and the refugees.
sources: https://www.dhakatribune.com/bangladesh/nation/2017/09/27/first-chinese-relief-rohingya-arrives-chittagong, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.xinhuanet.com//english/2017-10/13/c_136676659.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks
funding_agency: Chinese Government

title: China sends second round of relief aid for Rohingya refugees in Bangladesh (linked to project #54502)
description: On September 28, 2017, a second Chinese cargo plane arrived with humanitarian aid for displaced Rohingya refugees in the Chittagong province of Bangladesh. The aid consisted of some 2,000 tents and 3,000 blankets, but the financial value of the aid is unknown. Previously on September 27, the first batch of humanitarian aid was delivered (see project #54502). It is unknown from which body of the Chinese government this aid originated from. On October 4, Bangladeshi soldiers started to build Chinese relief tents to accommodate the Rohingyas people crossing into the country from Myanmar.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PEODEN0020170929ed9t00013&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.xinhuanet.com//english/2017-10/05/c_136658982.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://en.people.cn/n3/2017/0929/c90000-9275183.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.thedailystar.net/world/rohingya-crisis/china-india-uk-send-750-tonnes-refugee-aid-relief-materials-myanmar-violence-1468978, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.xinhuanet.com//english/2017-09/28/c_136646271.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://fts.unocha.org/flows/165008?destination=donors/2976/flows/2017%3Ff%255B0%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2521%26f%255B1%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522704%253ABANGLADESH%2520-%2520Rohingya%2520Refugee%2520Crisis%2520%2528from%25202017%2529%2522, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)
funding_agency: Chinese Government, Government Agency

title: China sends to Pakistan a 49 member medical team for quake relief
description: In October 2005 China sent a medical team to Pakistan to contribute to the quake relief operations. It reached Chaklala Airbase in Islamabad on Friday 28 Octobers, where it was received by Minister of State for Overseas Division Senator Tariq Azim and Chinese Ambassador Zhang Chunxiang. The team was made up of 49 members, including 8/9 female doctors (depending on the Chinese/Pakistani source considered). It brought along medical equipment, and was destined to Balakot area.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCSAP0020051028e1as003ea&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://pk.chineseembassy.org/eng/zbgx/t219067.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://pk.chineseembassy.org/eng/zbgx/t216836.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://en.people.cn/200511/04/eng20051104_218942.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://fts.unocha.org/flows/32136?destination=donors/2976/flows/2005%3Ff%255B0%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2521%26f%255B1%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522300%253ACHINA%2520-%2520Floods%2520-%2520June%25202005%2522%26f%255B2%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522266%253AINDIAN%2520OCEAN%2520-%2520Earthquake/Tsunami%2520-%2520December%25202004%2522%26f%255B3%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522270%253APAKISTAN%2520-%2520Rains/Snowfall%2520-%2520February%25202005%2522%26f%255B4%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522302%253ASOUTH%2520ASIA%2520-%2520Earthquake%2520-%2520October%25202005%2522, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)
contacts: Zhang Chunxiang, Head of Mission (1Malaysia Development Bhd.); Tariq Azim, Minister of State for Overseas Division

title: China sent medical team to Gujarat, India for earthquake relief
description: China is sending relief material to show the sympathy of the Chinese government and people to the Indian government and victims of the quake-stricken area. Specifically, China has decided to send a medical team to Gujarat. The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) Financial Tracking Service created the project entry on 23/04/2001 and last updated it on 16/05/2001, so the project is likely to have been finished by then.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=bbcapp0020010710dx24000oa&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://fts.unocha.org/flows/2806?destination=donors/2976/flows/2001, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

title: China sent relief materials to India for earthquake
description: China is sending relief material to show the sympathy of the Chinese government and people to the Indian government and victims of the quake-stricken areas. Specifically, China has already sent 10,700 dozens of zinc oxide adhesive plaster, 26,000 dozen bandages, 3,300 rolls of absorbent cotton wool, 20,000 pieces of acrylic blankets and 2,000 tents. The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) Financial Tracking Service created the project entry on 23/04/2001 and last updated it on 17/05/2001, so the project is likely to have been finished by then.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=bbcapp0020010710dx24000oa&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://fts.unocha.org/flows/2836?destination=donors/2976/flows/2001, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

title: China sent seismologists to India to help monitor aftershocks(linked to project #41963,#41964)
description: China sent nine seismologists to India to help monitor the frequency of aftershocks. The team consists of nine experts in earthquake forecasting and monitoring.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=afpr000020010709dx1t00uv9&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China signs ETC agreement worths US$30 million with Afghanistan
description: On May 15, 2002, Chinese Minister of Foreign Affair Tang Jiaxuan signed an Agreement on Economic and Technical Cooperation of US$30 million Chinese aid to Afghanistan. The purpose of this grant is to immediately and actively implement the commitments made by China to the reconstruction of Afghanistan. While the signing date is similar to the handover date of #53537 and they are both intended for reconstruction, they are distinct projects because they were signed at different times and have differing transaction amounts.
sources: http://news.sina.com.cn/c/2002-05-15/2131576543.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.fmprc.gov.cn/mfa_eng/wjb_663304/zzjg_663340/yzs_663350/gjlb_663354/2676_663356/2678_663360/t15832.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: China to donate $1 million USD in emergency assistance to Bangladesh following cyclone Sidr (Linked to #34165)
description: On November 9, 2007 Chinese Ambassador to Bangladesh Zheng Qingdian pledged 1 million USD for Bangladesh's relief and rehabilitation activities following cyclone Sidr. The donation was completed.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=XNEWS00020071119e3bj0063h&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://fts.unocha.org/reports/daily/ocha_R10_E15382_asof___1503030301.pdf, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); http://www.china.org.cn/opinion/2010-10/08/content_21078441.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/china/2007-11/19/content_6264609.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://en.people.cn/90001/90776/90883/6305392.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://fts.unocha.org/flows/50412?destination=donors/2976/flows/2007%3Ff%255B0%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2521%26f%255B1%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522397%253ABANGLADESH%2520-%2520Cyclone%2520Sidr%2520-%2520November%25202007%2522%26f%255B2%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522379%253APAKISTAN%2520-%2520Floods/Cyclone%2520-%2520July%25202007%2522, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)
contacts: Zheng Qindian, Ambassador (Ministry of Foreign Affairs)

title: China to provide 70 million RMB technical assistance to Tajikistan
description: In 2017, China committed to grant technical facilities worth 70 million RMB to Tajikistan to strengthen its capacity of emergency response. Committee of Emergency Situations and Civil Defense secured automobiles, munitions, and special technical equipment from China through an agreement under the United Nations Development Programme. More than 100,000 people live in danger areas in Tajikistan, and 27 people have died in natural disasters in the first half of 2017. As of July, 2017, 284 areas in Tajikistan were considered dangerous for human habitation. Along with the project, the Committee will also receive $500,000 grant from Japan and $460,000 from Russia.
sources: https://www.osce.org/programme-office-in-dushanbe/386510?download=true, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.xinhuanet.com//english/2017-07/21/c_136460396.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: China's Military Provides Earthquake Assistance in Kathmandu, Nepal
description: Following the earthquake on April 25, 2015, the Chinese military also dispatched a 215-member rescue and medical team which arrived in two batches, on Monday evening and Tuesday, according to the Chinese Foreign Ministry. The rescue team carried 40 tons of relief goods, 95 electricity generators, more than 300 tents, 4 sniffer dogs, 5 recovery vehicles, and life detectors. The team included 12 seismic experts and 58 medical workers from Chengdu People's Hospital along with the rescuers. The medical team supported the victims with surgery and trauma alleviation in downtown Kathmandu. On May 1, Chinese Ambassador to Nepal Wu Chuntai and Nepal's Minister of Industry Mahesh Basnet visited a base of the military medical team, and conveyed gratitude to efforts of the Chinese military. A 62-member International Rescue Team arrived only around 24 hours after the quake struck, reaching Kathmandu at noon on Sunday. The team comprised 40 rescuers and 10 medical experts as well as six sniffer dogs. A second 58-member team followed on Monday morning, setting up a makeshift hospital and carrying 13 tons of aid. The team [‰∏≠ÂõΩÊîøÂ∫úÂåªÁñóÈòü] was organized by the Health and Family Planning Commission of Sichuan Province. On April 27, the team arrived in Kathmandu with the 13 tonnes of medical supplies. The team returned to Sichuan on May 9 after 13 days of operation. STAFF_NOTE: There are some discrepancies regarding exact number of aid workers, because some teams providing auxiliary support to the military medical unit were included to varying degrees in total reports.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020150501eb51008sq&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.scwst.gov.cn/index.php/tpxw/11716-2015-05-11-08-09-40, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.scwst.gov.cn/index.php/tpxw/11716-2015-05-11-08-09-40, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.scwst.gov.cn/index.php/tpxw/11716-2015-05-11-08-09-40, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.china.com.cn/zhibo/zhuanti/ch-xinwen/2015-05/07/content_35513605.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://www.indiatoday.in/nepal-earthquake-2015/story/nepal-earthquake-china-to-triple-aid-rescue-efforts-250781-2015-04-29, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://fts.unocha.org/flows/127941?destination=donors/2976/flows/2015%3Ff%255B0%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522629%253ANEPAL%2520-%2520Earthquake%2520-%2520April%25202015%2522, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)
implementing_agency: People's Liberation Army of China, Government Agency

title: China's PLa donates 80 tons of medicine and other relief goods for flood relief in Pakistan (linked to #36861)
description: On 20 September 2010, a 68-member medical rescue team of the Chinese People's Liberation Army (PLA) carrying 80 tons of medicine and other relief goods reached Pakistan. The team was in the Sehwan area of Sindh Province providing medical treatment to the flood-stricken people there. 20 members of the team were females. This is the third medical rescue team China sent out to Pakistan. This project is linked to #36861.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ASDEFJ0020110302e6cv0000d&cat=a&ep=ASE, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://archive.thenews.com.pk/TodaysPrintDetail.aspx?ID=6220&Cat=6&dt=9/25/2010, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://news.rediff.com/column/2010/sep/26/how-china-is-helping-flood-hit-pak-in-gilgit-baltistan-and-sindh.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks
implementing_agency: People's Liberation Army (PLA), Government Agency
contacts: Liu Jian, Chinese Ambassador to Pakistan (Chinese Embassy)

title: Chinese Embassy donates $2 million to flood-stricken areas in Pakistan
description: On 1 August 2005, the Chinese Ambassador Zhang Chunxiang made a special trip to the provincial capital Peshawar and Lahore provinces, and contributed 2 million dollars to both governments, to go towards the reconstruction works.
sources: http://pk.chineseembassy.org/chn/zbgx/t206383.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Zhang Chunxiang, Ambassador

title: Chinese Embassy donates PKR 7 million to Pakistan for quake relief
description: Following the earthquake that hit Pakistan in October 2005, the Chinese Ambassador Zhang Chunxiang presented a donation of 7 million rupees and 2,055 US dollars (personal donation from diplomats) for the President's Earthquake Relief Fund on behalf of the Chinese companies working in and around Islamabad and personnel of the Embassy to the Foreign Secretary Riaz Mohammad Khan.

recipient_agencies: Pakistan Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Government Agency
contacts: Zhang Chunxiang, Head of Mission (1Malaysia Development Bhd.); Riaz Mohammad Khan, Secretary (Pakistan Ministry of Foreign Affairs)

title: Chinese Embassy in Afghanistan donated $5,000 for flood-related humanitarian aid (Linked to project #34522)
description: China donated $55,000 to Afghanistan for flood and avalanche relief. The Chinese Red Cross Society contributed $50,000 and the Chinese Embassy in Afghanistan contributed $5,000. The cash was handed over to Fatima Gailani, the Head of the Afghan Red Crescent Society by Chinese ambassador to Afghanistan Yang Houlan at the Chinese Embassy on April 2, 2007. The project captures the donation by Chinese embassy; for the donation by Red Cross Society of China, see project #34522.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020070402e3420063h&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.gov.cn/misc/2007-04/02/content_569501.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://af.mofcom.gov.cn/article/jmxw/200704/20070404550512.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: Chinese Embassy in Islamabad donates Rs 1.2 million for flood relief
description: In October 2010, the Embassy of China cancelled the scheduled reception in celebration of the 61st anniversary of the founding of the People‚Äôs Republic of China in order to reallocate the Rs1.2 million amount for the flood-hit people of Pakistan. The cash donation was handed over by Chinese Ambassador Liu Jian to Pakistan National Assembly Speaker Dr. Fehmida Mirza when Mr. Liu.

title: Chinese Embassy in Pakistan donates PKR 1 million for IDPs
description: The staff of Chinese Embassy in Pakistan donated three-day salaries equivalent to one million rupees to the internally displaced persons (IDPs) in the shape of relief items. This was stated by a three-member delegation, headed by Chinese Ambassador Luo Zhaohui, in a meeting with Minister of States and Frontiers Regions (SAFRON) Najamuddin Khan.

title: Chinese Ministry of Defence donates USD 100,000 to Pakistani counterpart for quake relief
description: Based on a statement of the Chinese Embassy in Islamabad dated 23 October 2005, the Ministry of Defense of China has donated US$ 100,000 in cash to the Ministry of Defense of Pakistan on October 10, as a contribution to quake-relief operations.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=NBBALU0020051216e1am00044&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://pk.china-embassy.org/eng/nyddz/t217938.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://reliefweb.int/report/pakistan/china-extending-continuous-aid-pakistan, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient); https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCSAP0020051026e1aq000m9&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://pk.china-embassy.org/eng/nyddz/t217938.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: Chinese NGO donates $10,000 USD to tsunami relief efforts in Sri Lanka (Linked to project #34817)
description: Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries (CPAFFC) has donated $40,000 to the severely tsunami-hit countries and asked some friendly organizations of the disaster countries to convey its regards, said head of the organization Chen Haosu here Saturday. Out of the $40,000 USD, $10,000 USD was given to Sri Lanka. The rest of the money was presumably distributed among the other tsunami-affected countries including India, Indonesia, Thailand, and Maldives (linked to project #34817). STAFF_NOTES: China contributed 63 million USD for tsunami relief in total, most of the individual project are captured (see projects linked with resource #41811). STAFF_NOTE: As the exact financial breakdown among the recipient countries is unclear, the project has no transaction amount for now. The details should be added if information is found in the future.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCAPP0020050101e1110035y&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.china.org.cn/english/international/116538.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/du/article.aspx/?accessionno=BSWEEK0020050107e11700001&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=&cat=a, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://news.sina.com.cn/o/2005-01-02/10194694846s.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks
funding_agency: Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries, State-Owned Company

title: Chinese Navy donates supplies to Sri Lanka for relief assistance after floods and landslides
description: On May 31, 2017, the Chinese Navy provided relief assistance and supplies to Sri Lanka after floods and landslides caused by Tropical Cyclone Mora. Three Chinese Navy ships, Changchun, Jingzhou, and Chaohu arrived in the Port of Colombo, bringing 1 metric ton of rice, 1 ton of flour, 10 inflatable rubber boats, 300 boxes of bottled water, instant noodles as well as various medical equipment and supplies. On June 1, the fleet dispatched a 16-member medical team to provide services in 2 allocations sites. The team treated 508 local people affected by the disaster. According to Shen Hao, the fleet commander, the fleet was originally on a 4-day visit to Sri Lanka. They changed the plan and did the best to gather supplies immediately after being informed of the floods.
sources: http://www.globaltimes.cn/content/1049533.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.xinhuanet.com//english/2017-06/01/c_136331636.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://www.chinadailyhk.com/articles/10/106/248/1496393463204.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://eng.mod.gov.cn/services/2017-06/05/content_4782108.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
implementing_agency: Chinese Navy, Government Agency

title: Chinese People's Armed Police Repairs Road in Nepal after the Earthquake
description: On May 3, 2015, China sent a 500 member group of Chinese People's Armed Police to help restore the transportation in Nepal after an 8.1 magnitude earthquake. The group entered Nepal from southwestern Tibet with 180 engineering machines, in order to repair the 114km road from Zham Port to Kathmandu. As of May 6, 2015, the group was working on the restoration. STAFF_NOTE: The current status is marked as completion because implementation began immediately after the earthquake as an emergency response.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020150505eb5500462&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.chinatoday.com.cn/english/columns/2015-06/02/content_690609.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks
implementing_agency: People's Armed Police of China, Government Agency

title: Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries donates USD 10,000 to All Pakistan China Friendship Association for quake relief
description: In October 2005, following the eartquake in Azad Kashmir and NWFP, the Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries donated to Pakistan US$ 10,000. Shan Bao-xiang, cultural counsellor of the Embassy of the Peoples Republic of China presented a cheque of US $10,000 to Main Habib Ullah, Acting President, All Pakistan China Friendship Association during a meeting in Islamabad. STAFF_NOTE: The project is coded ODA, as the Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries (CPAFFC) is officially affiliated.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=NBBALU0020051216e1am00044&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=AIWBUR0020051014e1ae0001z&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://pk.chineseembassy.org/chn/zbgx/t217939.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://jang.com.pk/thenews/spedition/mkrf/p35.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks

contacts: Shan Bao-Xiang, cultural counsellor (1Malaysia Development Bhd.); Chen Haosu, President (Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries (CPAFFC)); Mian Habib Ullah, Acting President (All Pakistan China Friendship Association )

title: Chinese embassy donates 1 million rupees to Pakistan to fight Dengue Fever
description: On 15 September, Embassy in Pakistan political counselor Huang, met the Chief Minister of Pakistan's Punjab province representatives, to pass a letter of sympathy and a 1 million rupee check in donation to combat Dengue Fever. The Chinese Embassy had decided to donate 1 million rupees in hopes of fighting the fever, and believes that the provincial government, with its strong leadership, would be able to be victorious in the struggle to fight the dengue epidermic.
sources: http://pk.chineseembassy.org/chn/zbgx/t859415.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
funding_agency: Chinese Embassy, Government Agency

title: Chinese embassy donates 1 million taka for Bangladeshi flood victims
description: In 2007, the Chinese ambassador to Bangladesh donated 1.01 million taka to the Bangladeshi government as part of flood relief efforts.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/aa/?ref=UNIBAG0020070815e38e0000n&pp=1&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2007-08/15/content_6538444.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Zheng Qingdian, Chinese Ambassador

title: Chinese project forms relief fund For Sri Lankan flood and landslide victims
description: The China-funded Colombo Port City Project distributed relief items to thousands of people affected by floods through a relief campaign, 'Port City Sahana,' in 2016. The types of items donated were not listed.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/du/article.aspx/?accessionno=XNEWS00020160526ec5q00eyy&fcpil=en&napc=S&sa_from=&cat=a, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://en.people.cn/n3/2016/0523/c90883-9061970.html, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.chatter.lk/category/newsdetails/1/2385/sri-lanka-hopes-to-co-build-maritime-silk-road-with-china-pm, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Donation of 30 million RMB of wheat to Afghanistan
description: On 30 December 2008, China signed an agreement to donate 30m RMB worth of wheat to Afghanistan as part of rebuilding efforts. The agreements were signed by Chinese Ambassador to Afghanistan Yang Houlan and Afghan Foreign Minister Rangin Dafar Spanta. According to online information provided by China's ECCO in Afghanistan, over 8,000 tons (or tonnes) valued at 30 million CNY were delivered during 2009: STAFF_NOTE: #34531 should not be duplicate for #34528 as their delivery times, contract signing times are different. This transaction was listed under year 2009 by the Chinese Ministry of Commerce, updated commitment year accordingly.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCAPP0020081230e4cu000p1&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://mercury.ethz.ch/serviceengine/Files/ISN/120233/ichaptersection_singledocument/7a7b6db6-6400-4793-b1ef-475da1579bd8/en/chapter+4.pdf., Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://af.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zxhz/201501/20150100879514.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://af.mofcom.gov.cn/article/zxhz/201501/20150100879514.shtml, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)
contacts: Rangin Dafar Spanta, Afghan Foreign Minister ; Yang Houlan , Chinese Ambassador to Afghanistan

title: First Chinese International Rescue Team (CIRT) to quake-hit Pakistan
description: A 49-member Chinese International Rescue Team comprising 23 rescuers, 8 medical staff, 18 seismological experts and reporters with six sniffing dogs and eight tons of search equipment reached Pakistan on Oct. 9, 2005 and had worked in Balakot for eight days. As the first team to enter the town of Balakot, it succeeded in saving three Pakistani victims and offered medical treatment to 591 local people. Entrusted by the UN relief coordination center at Muzafarabad, the Chinese team served as a UN sub-coordinator at Balakot and enjoyed very good cooperation with teams from UAE, Germany, Switzerland, Jordan, WHO, etc. The team returned to Beijing on October 20.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=TASS000020051010e1a90001a&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=APRS000020051009e1a9001by&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://pk.china-embassy.org/eng/nyddz/t217938.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://wcm.fmprc.gov.cn/pub/xws/lslm/t217751.html, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://www.gov.cn/zwhd/2005-10/10/content_83135.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); https://fts.unocha.org/flows/32135?destination=donors/2976/flows/2005%3Ff%255B0%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2521%26f%255B1%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522300%253ACHINA%2520-%2520Floods%2520-%2520June%25202005%2522%26f%255B2%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522266%253AINDIAN%2520OCEAN%2520-%2520Earthquake/Tsunami%2520-%2520December%25202004%2522%26f%255B3%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522270%253APAKISTAN%2520-%2520Rains/Snowfall%2520-%2520February%25202005%2522%26f%255B4%255D%3DdestinationEmergencyIdName%253A%2522302%253ASOUTH%2520ASIA%2520-%2520Earthquake%2520-%2520October%25202005%2522, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)

title: Grant for internally displaced persons of Malakand Division, Pakistan
description: In October 2009 the Pakistani government declared to have received $14.2 million from China for dispaced persons of the Malakand province.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PAKBNK0020091006e5a7000jn&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks

title: Grant for repatriation of Afghan refugees from Pakistan
description: In 2007, China granted 400 million USD for the repatriation of Afghan refugees in Pakistan for three years. A handing over certificate was signed in Islamabad on 18 July 2007 by Wang Chao, Assistant Minister of Commerce, Peoples Republic of China, and Akram Malik, Secretary Economic Division on behalf of their respective governments. The ceremony was witnessed by Dr Salman Shah Prime Minster's financial adviser. The amount will be used for volunteer repatriation of nearly 2.489 million Afghan Refugees still residing in Pakistan.
sources: https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCAPP0020070719e37j001ba&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global-factiva-com.proxy.wm.edu/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=BBCSAP0020070719e37j001e1&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.jstor.org/stable/pdf/41500096.pdf?_=1465411278519, Other Official Source (non-Donor, non-Recipient)
contacts: AAkram Malik, Secretary Economic Division Pakistan ; Wang Chao, Chinese asistant minister of commerce

title: Mayor of Beijing donates 50000 USD for flood relief in Pakistan
description: On 7 September 2010, the Mayor of Beijing, one of the sister cities of Islamabad, gifted Islamabad a grant of 50,000 $ for flood relief operations. The Ambassador of China in Pakistan handed over a cheque to the Chairman CDA, Imtiaz Inayat Elahi Monday at CDA Headquarters. The grant would have been submitted to the Prime Ministers Relief Fund.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=PAPRIN0020100908e6970001m&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ASDEFJ0020110302e6cv0000d&cat=a&ep=ASE, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://www.thenews.com.pk/Todays-News-2-3534-briefs, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://archives.dailytimes.com.pk/islamabad/07-Sep-2010/islamabad-s-sister-city-s-grant-for-flood-relief, Media Report, including Wikileaks

contacts: Imtiaz Inayat Elahi, Chairman of the CDA

title: Ningxia Province donates RMB 500,000 to flood-hit Pakistan (linked to #36830)
description: On Saturday 28 August 2010, Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Jiang Yu declared that the Northwest China‚Äôs Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region donated RMB 500,000 in cash to Punjab Province, as flood relief.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ASPKOB0020100914e6990001i&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=ASDEFJ0020110302e6cv0000d&cat=a&ep=ASE, Implementing/Intermediary Agency Source; http://pakobserver.net/detailnews.asp?id=51592, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://app.com.pk/en_/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=115584, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.bjreview.com.cn/quotes/txt/2010-09/21/content_299530.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://pk.chineseembassy.org/eng/zbgx/t736386.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient)

title: Second Chinese International Rescue Team (CIRT) to quake-hit Pakistan (linked to #35345)
description: On October 29, 2005, the second Chinese International Rescue Team of 38 members arrived in Balatok. The team comprised 28 medical staff, 8 rescue members and 2 seismologists. During the 20-day mission, the team set up a mobile hospital in Balatok area and provided medical care for over 2000 people. The team returned to Beijing on November 17.
sources: https://global.factiva.com/redir/default.aspx?P=sa&an=XNEWS00020051024e1ap001v4&cat=a&ep=ASE, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://pk.china-embassy.org/eng/nyddz/t217938.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://english.cri.cn/2238/2005-10-25/114@278403.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://www.rediff.com/news/2005/oct/25quake6.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://pk.china-embassy.org/chn/zbgx/t219063.htm, Government Source (Donor/Recipient); http://news.sina.com.cn/c/2005-10-28/14017294028s.shtml, Media Report, including Wikileaks; http://news.xinhuanet.com/world/2005-11/17/content_3796287.htm, Media Report, including Wikileaks
contacts: Peng Bibo, Chief Medical officer of Chinese International Rescue Team

title: Sichuan Province donates RMB 100,000 to flood-hit Pakistan (linked to #36828)
description: On Saturday 28 August 2010, Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Jiang Yu declared that the Southwest China‚Äôs Sichuan Province donated RMB 100,000 in cash to Punjab Province as part of flood relief.
